text:
One of the best sushi in town. Great location, if you want to experience the China town, great price, for $35 you get awesome, awesome food. The trouble with sushi is, once you taste the good ones, you simply can't go back!
Get in early, the place is always packed, I would say make it at 6!

Went here to get away from main Vegas traffic and prices.....this sushi place is not rated accurately. Should be $$$ because of the pricing...probably to pay for all of the staff working. Basic philly roll was $9 and small glass of plum wine was $8.50....not a good value and the portion/quality was average.

First time here and I find it ok. The soft crab is really good but 1 order per person. The calamari tempura is hard. The yakisoba taste bland and oily.  We ordered fresh oyster, again 1 order per person but never served.
The food was good and consistent. We came a few days ago and it was just as yummy. For the price -you cannot beat.

Awesome! All foods are so delicious.
AYCE is pretty reasonable price. (21$ for lunch, 26$ for dinner). Servers are nice and fast.
Favorite place to go with out coworkers after work, servers are fun and fast with our order. Have a great time and great food.

Worth two visits on latest trip to Vegas because of the value!  Feels slightly overstaffed in the service department as it felt like we were getting waited on by the entire staff all at once (not a bad thing).  All you can eat at $26 included uni, soft shell crab, oysters, lobster roll, amoebi nigiri, and all came out at à la carte quality.  Only the baby octopus skewer came out a little overcooked and rubbery, and the ice cream was on the chalky side.  Casual, happy staff, good vibe.

Wow.  I have never been treated so badly at a restaurant.  I showed up with two guests.  Half the restaurant was empty but we singed up for a waiting list and told it would be 40-45 minutes.  We went and grabbed a drink and came back 30 minutes later and when I asked about the status of our table I was told it was going to be another 40 to 50 minutes.   What a joke!

This is the first review I've ever written, my gf and I wanted to try something different than the usual sushi place we go eat and we just left from this place and it was a huge disappointment. Nigiri was more rice than fish, worst Japanese lasagna I've ever had they over added cream cheese and who knows what else. The service was HORRIBLE the whole time we were there my gf and I shared one napkin, we had to ask the busser twice to get someone to take our order and still did not show up until 10min later. The girl serving table 18 was rude and brought us the wrong order several times. Never going there again and I recommend you don't either.

This is probably the worst customer service I've ever had from any restaurant. I was just there 1 hours ago to have AYCE with my family. And this is not the first time I eat at Umiya. First, when I walked in, the waitress who works on Tuesday day shift already seem not happy about her job. Then, she sat us at the front table nearest the front entrance and it is 105 degrees outside and they have so many table available. I asked her nicely if I can sit at other table instead. Do you know what she said to me? She said you have to sit here and you can't move to another tables . WTF! The problem I have with her is her fxxking attitude and her facial expression that make me sick. If she doesn't want to be a server, quit and do something else. Then I went to the Chef and let him know what's going on. All the Chef always been great to us when we go there. Then me and my family decided to walk out because I really don't want to see her face for another 45 minutes. I believe one bad server can easily ruin up the restaurant and other people hard work. MANAGER! Please do something about this young waitress. THANK YOU!

Pretty good for an AYCE place.  The portions of rice was slightly more generous, but then again I can understand. Most everything was good and the items came really quickly. I wouldn't recommend the uni, the unfortunately it wasn't fresh on the day I visited. Some of the better items had a limit so make you try the items that have a limit.  Some of our favorite was the salmon belly and the seared salmon. I believe both of these were limited.

We came as a party of 7. Our trip was a result of a Grand Canyon aborted trip.The Google map to Umiya.Their eat all you can menu was so inviting, we all decided to do this. For 90 minutes , we did a marathon eating, round by round. My fave is the oyster, just the right size although this one is limited to oysters per person. That is why I am rating it 4 stars. I could eat only this. Luckily, 4 of my party did not eat oysters so I got their part. I like their style that  everything is in small plates except the sushi. This way we do not feel guilty leaving food unfinished.The tuna poke was very good. Over all the experience was satisfying including the service. I just wished I could have more oysters. 

Sorry, the pork belly and the crispy chicharon wasnt theirs. We were in a road trip and got the pics mixed up

This is the BEST sushi in town. BEST fish I've had in all of Nevada for sure. For people who like good nigiri and good raw fish, this is the place to go. And its all you can eat which is great. The nigiri Albacore is amazing. It rivals sushi I've had in Japan, Cali, and Caribbean. 
BUT... I gave it two stars because the service is TERRIBLE. I have been there three times now, and I never leave a bad review until its happened a few times, because some times stuff happens. But, this is bad, every time I go the service is terrible. I had to order my food multiple times, I received other peoples orders, I never received parts of my order, and even after ordering rolls and nigiri multiple times, the server came over 20 minutes later and asked "would you like to order anything more?". I HADN'T EVEN GOTTEN MY FOOD YET. WTF. so weird. They seem chaotic and unorganized. I ordered a total of 40 pieces of hamachi nigiri and ended up eating 8 pieces, my wife and I laughed about it. This place is amazing and has great potential but seriously needs work on their service. Get organized! I will definitely go back for the food but not if I am in a hurry or have anything else to do that day because who knows how long it will take to eat.

If you ever want a great all you can eat spot in Vegas check this place out... From the quick turn around on what you order to the staff... 10 out of 10 in my opinion.... Place gets packed to capacity pretty quick so if you want inside tip sit at the sushi bar and ask for Aaron, if your lucky he'll create a unique roll for ya...

This place is so awesome! We found it on Yelp and decided to try something off the strip, since we always find food on the strip is too expensive for what it is. Just ignore the a la carte menu and go straight for the all you can eat deal. It's really cool because you can order small plates of anything on that menu - we had like 12 different kinds of sushi and many different appetizers and it was only $50 for two people. We could have easily spent that on a couple of rolls and apps. The service was great. All of the servers and guys at the sushi bar were attentive and fulfilled our requests quickly. We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!!
Can you say yum! Great service and a wonderful place to try sushi for the first time. It's reasonably priced and people friendly! Love this place!
Poor service. Bad Attitudes. Waste of time. No good. Terrible ambience. Came here because of the yelp page, but it's not up to standard.

I found this place by yelping, and all these good reviews made me believe they serve good sushi. However, to be honest, I had one of the worst AYCE sushi experiences here. Their rice is not right, fish is not so fresh and over flavored with lots of sauce. They didn't tell me until I sit and placed  my order that they had run out of oyster, uni, and halibut. I was very disappointed by the quality of their food although the service was not bad...There are so many better AYCE sushi places out there. Don't choose this one!!
Best AYCE sushi! Fresh fish and lots of variety for appetizers. I love that they have cucumber wrapped rolls on their AYCE menu ^_^

Hands down the besttt all you can eat Sushi Spot in Vegas!! My bf and I are HUGE foodies. We eat out all the time and this has become our new favorite spot. We've tried 3 other ayce places and this place wins by a longshot. We come here a few times a week now. The Screaming O Tuna salad is amazing. So are their oysters. Favorite rolls are the Japanese lasagna, Vegas Lasagna, and Lobster crunch rolls.

All you can eat is the best deal in Vegas. For $26, you get your own menu and pick whatever you want. Lots of people working so the waitress was very attentive and the orders came in fast. All you can eat is not a buffet but instead you order as you wish a couple of things at a time, even 1/2 rolls if you want to try lots of stuff. Awesome. Would come back again.

Goyemon has been my favorite AYCE sushi joint in town for quite a while and I've been very hesitant to try other places because I'm always disappointed when I do. However, I was really craving uni and Goyemon was all out so we decided to give Umiya a try based on all the great reviews. Now I see what I've been missing out on. 

Pros:
Oysters, uni, amaebi
A lot of items on AYCE menu
Half rolls available
Dinner starts at 3pm

Cons:
No salmon skin
Extra 50¢ for quail egg
Only ice cream desserts
Dinner starts at 3pm

Firstly, they have quite a selection of items to order, which is great because you're likely to find a few rolls that float your boat. They also let you order half rolls, so you can try more rolls.  I mean the whole point of going to AYCE places is so you can order a lot of different things. 

I love that the dinner menu starts at 3pm, because uni and the seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce is only available for dinner. It's totally worth the extra $5 for me, but if you don't like uni, amaebi, or seared tuna sashimi, this wouldn't be a pro for you as those three items are basically the only difference between lunch and dinner. (The seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce is so good though! I'd definitely recommend everybody to try it)

The sushi chefs and serve staff are rock stars. It was packed during my first visit and everybody was hard at work. The chefs banged out orders and didn't let a plate sit for more than a few seconds before yelling out the table number again for the servers to pick it up. We came back just a few days later (this time during the day when it was super slow) and the chefs were all busy prepping for the night. We never saw any of the employees just standing around not doing anything.

Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Service was prompt, courteous, and attentive. Even when it got busy the chefs would still help and ask us if we needed anything. Can't wait to come back.

All you can eat for $25 is too good to be true. Thanks for the great night!

One of the best experiences that you will get. You are treated like a special guest there. The chef created beautiful art pieces for us from his training from over a decade. His artworks were carved with great details and the food was amazing. It is hard to believe that it is an AYCE place because the experience is actually better than most a-la-carte places.

Excellent food, friendly staff, overall impressed!  Maybe just don't charge for the use of gluten-free soy sauce... besides that I loved it!  Will definitely visit again.  The Bamboo Roll is absolutely incredible, must try.
On point staff and fast service. Food is great and will return if im craving sushi while in vegas.

I'm such a seafood lover specially for sushi/tuna... This is my new fav AYCE sushi place ! Soon as you walk in, I love the Japanese theme decors.. 
The service is just outstanding... We had 3 different servers.. They really know how to please you and take care of you! FOOD IS AMAZING!
This place was amazing. Excellent food, impeccable service and super fun environment! Price was great too! We will definitely be back.
Arrived with a party of 13 during a weekend lunch- Staff handled flawlessly even though all other tables full as well.   Nice job!

This is my absolute favorite sushi location. The Baked Salmon is delicious i always have at least two rolls. I make a visit here at least once a month sometimes more. 
And the servers are always friendly.
Yes they have mochi icecream! GREEN TEA AND RED BEAN!

I love this place!
Best AYCE sushi in Vegas so far. Highly recommended. Great service, spacious, and clean.
Food was so fresh and delicious! Service was very quick and very friendly staff. Will definitely come back when we are back in Vegas.

Food quality is good but I'll never return due to poor customer service. I go to my usual spots for AYCE sushi because the food and service are always consistently great. I only came here for a friend's going away party. Never again.

Seafood dynamite is the bomb!!! A mix up with my order of the snow corn roll, waitress brought me snow white, which was good but spicy & not for me. Finally the snow corn roll arrived and it was so worth it, the lightest, yummiest morsel on the menu imo. A few other rolls filled our bellies until we were stuffed. Had green tea ice cream for dessert then left. Yummy time!

I don't have words to describe how bad the food was here. I have to ask one question, for those of you that gave this place more than 2 stars, have you ever eaten genuine sushi prepared by someone that spent years as a commis learning the craft? It's really a rhetorical question because the obvious answer is, "No, I've never eaten real sushi prepared by someone who had to work to learn his craft." Otherwise, you'd realize that the shit they serve here in NO WAY approximates real sushi, let alone real food. Four stars for the crap they plated for us? You must be joking. The food here isn't even worthy of a single star.

Right when I walked in, it reminded me of another sushi place I've been to & it didn't click until we got the check that it is Kaizen (also in Vegas)! 

My friends & I came here about a month ago because we were craving AYCE sushi & wanted to try someplace new. The reviews looked good on Yelp, so why not? 

There were a couple of good things going for this place. It is a BIG space, which is nice compared to smaller sushi places like Goyemon or Sushi Koma. Another nice thing is that their nigiri is small, which we liked so we could have more of the other sushi.

Now, onto the bad. The biggest thing I did not like was their service. We ordered the first round of sushi & rolls - which was fine. Then a couple more. Then we decided to ask the waiter for recommendations. We ordered some of the special rolls since our first round of sushi was mainly nigiri. Well, the waiter who brought our rolls brought the wrong rolls! & the original waiter LEFT FOR THE DAY. Wait, what?! I'm used to places introducing the second waiter or at least letting us know if they are taking a break or leaving. So, of course, we're telling this new waiter that the rolls he brought us are NOT the ones we ordered. He kept saying one was the lobster roll & we had a shrimp tempura roll - which was the same thing! So we had these two baked rolls (that were the same!) which are heavy, so of course we got full faster. We didn't send one of those rolls back which was our fault, but in the end, they didn't charge us for what we didn't finish, so I guess we're even.
Great atmosphere with fantastic all you can eat sushi. Enjoyable staff bring humor and efficiency to a great dinner. Greatly recommend for good sushi and fair prices.
The AYCE menu is pretty dope. I highly recommend urchin sushi. Fresh, buttery and tasty!

One of the best AYCE in town. Lots and lots of choices. Very high quality sushi. Salad and Grilled section are awesome. Grilled squid is a must. Seared tuna with AJ sauce is too die for. Modern and upbeat environment. Service is fast and friendly. Free drink with a check in. Highly recommend.
Amazing deal for the lunch all-you-can-eat.  They don't overdue it on the fillers.  Tuna, ribeye and tempura were excellent

I can start with saying that this is by far the place I have eaten out most times for dinner over the last few years. I wouldn't do that if I didn't love it! Giving it 5 stars is a bit nice of me, and it is to be honest close to 4 stars. But I'll go with the 5 stars for now :)

I would recommend going for the "all you can eat" option. Especially if you are at least two persons since you then can order different things and share (if you don't like sharing you suck). For me sharing the different rolls and talk about them as we eat is a good experience. I will recommend starting with a Screaming O(rgasme) and some Edamame. Of the rolls there are several good ones: Orange Blossom, Sexy Roll and the Baked Salmon Roll are among my favorites. And you have to get the tuna pieces in AJ sauce. They do have things that are not typical Japanese on their menu. I wouldn't recommend those to be honest. This is a sushi restaurant!

I will keep coming back here for sure!

this place is amazing!! this is the best all you can eat sushi restaurant I've ever been to. The fish is surprisingly so fresh given that it's in the middle of Nevada. Even the uni and unagi were delicious (two dishes that come to mind that tend to be underwhelming for all you can eat sushi). The selection is HUGE and the rolls are really original. Highly recommend the banana roll, Alaska roll, bacon and scallop skewers, orange blossom roll. would come again when I'm in town. YAY!!!!!!!!!!

This was my first time come here. The restaurant looks nice, spacial and clean. The staffs are friendly. Be honestly, Here, the sushi is worst than anyplace! I ordered couple tuna, Salmon,   and yellowtail sushi, and  two of them are rot! It made me threw out! I told two of the staffs, and they just made excuses and even asked me why one piece of Tuna what you eat is alright, and the other one is bad! I never had this experience! Hope they can be more responsible for customers! No anyone want to spent money to get sick!

Very disappointing experience. Placed a pick up order through GrubHub and arrived a few minutes early. The host was extremely rude when I told him I had a pick up order and told me in an accusing tone that he did not see the order (how is that my fault??). He then demanded angrily that I show him the order confirmation, which I did (which somehow annoyed him more). They then found the order and prepared it. Got back to the hotel and was super disappointed with the sushi. Fish did not taste fresh at all, and all my rolls were overpowered by imitation crab. I did not end up finishing my food because I disliked it so much. Only reason I'm giving it two stars instead of one is because I did not get food poisoning, so kudos for that!

First of all this place has great food and quality. My family enjoyed their food a lot. But, 

They have horrible service. When we came around 6:30, they told me that it was going to take an hour and 40 minutes. But when my mom asked again around 6:50, they told us that it was only going to take 20-30 minutes. It was dinner time and we were all hungry. My mom got up to just look at the waiting list to see when our turn was and the waitress who was in front of my mom gave my mom an unpleasant look and started talking to the waiter next to her saying "That lady won't just sit down and she keeps wandering in front of us" like my mom was some annoying person who's just randomly annoying her. First of all, my mother is not just "that lady". She is your customer and despite the fact that we are in a restaurant, isn't it just straight up rude giving someone who you don't know at all a nasty look and talking about them? I was just so mad and shocked about how they treated my mother. 

It was just my mom, my brother, and I who went to eat. As I was eating, I can see and hear with my two eyes and ears that the servers were asking around "How was the food?" or "How is it going so far?",yet all we got was "Are you guys done eating?" like they wanted to kick us out and bring in new customers. I know. Dinner time is very busy and they had a lot in their minds but they were treating us like we weren't going to pay and just take off or like we've been staying there for hours which none of it is true. Those services just started to make me think "Is it because they see my mother as a single mom or something?" or because it's just two weak women and some 7 years old kid. 

Eating dinner outside with your family means having a meaningful time outside with your family by spending money. I am not sure what my mom did to deserve this kind of service but it was terrible and I was just so furious.

We wanted all you can eat sushi at 3:00 p.m. and this was the only place open on a Saturday afternoon. We took a taxi from our hotel and it was the best food we had all weekend. Off the strip but well worth the trouble. Highly recommend.

My sister and I crave sushi like every week and our normal go to spots are Goyemon or Sushi Mon on Maryland parkway depending on where we are. A friend of mine recommended this place so we checked it out. My sister said she liked it better than our regular spots. Prices are similar, we eat more nigiri than anything. It was fresh and the rice proportion is good. The atmosphere was nice-more of a restaurant feel bc it was a bigger space, had nice dim lighting. Service was awesome but we went in between lunch/dinner time so it was not busy. Their appetizers are better than most ayce sushi places and the rolls are decent. They have crab meat in a lot of the rolls, which I'm not a fan of so the choices weren't great for me but they had a couple rolls we really enjoyed! Overall it was great and we will be back!
Waitress last night was shitty ...,, left her a dollar tip for being rude ....  It's sux cuz this is one of my fav sushi spots,...  2thumbs down on service last night

Umiya is great and has a variety of AYCE options!!! My favorite is the tempura ice cream, spicy garlic edamane, orange blossom and snow white roll!
Also our waiter was hilarious and awesome.

Really enjoyed the food. Everything was great and very fresh. I had my first taste of sea Trout my new fav. The menu was very similar to Sumo Sushi II even had some of the same rolls. I must say that it was better than Sumo but that was due to our sushi chef chatting with us and explaining the rolls. All in all it was Awesome.
best ayce i have been so far.  love the grilled mackerel.     usually an after work go to hang out.  staff here is awesome and service is always on point!
Orange Blossom was a taste of heaven! The service is super attentive and extremely friendly. Price matches quality. Love this place!
Great food and service!  Can't believe all you can get on the ayce menu.  And everything is made on the spot, not pre-made.
Ayce sushi served during both lunch and dinner. Totally worth the price. They have a pretty big selection of sushi and appetizers to choose from. Definitely will visit again.

We just had the worst experience of AYCE sushi ever.
We were there for lunch today.  We planned to have sushi lunch for me and one of our group's birthday. We had been picking a sushi place for the whole week. One of my friends picked this place ad I was here last month for dinner. I told my friends I liked the interior this place. So we ended up here.

There were only 3 tables were seated when we got there. Our table had 6 asian girls with one baby. We got water all set up. Oh good. A server came right when everyone got there " are you ready to order?" well we hadn't even looked at the menu yet. We were discussing about paying dinner price to get sweet shrimp and sea urchin. then we ordered salmon nigari to start and the question we got was "so are you gonna pay lunch or dinner?" I replied "start with salmon nigari. it is in both lunch and dinner. and we will decide in a couple minutes" I got a little annoyed. We decided to just have lunch because some of us don't eat sweet shrimp and sea urchin.

Once we started ordering, one of the servers said "make sure you guys read all the rules" the rules are pretty much the same as the other AYCE sushi restaurant. No rice left, no sharing with non-AYCE, and so on. We all got annoyed. I understand the waitress was doing her job by informing us. but we all know the rules.

Food is good. We got our orders pretty fast. There were some confusion but we ignored it. There were two waitresses. on we got too many orders of grilled mackerels, and i told them "don't worry about it. I will eat them." 

Here come the worst parts. They got more customers coming. There were only two waitresses. Our water and hot tea was empty. We had to call them and asked for refills. One time my friend pulled out her dr.peppers bottle to drink, the server came right at her "no outside food or drink in here" or now they were more observant with outside drink than our glasses of water that were empty. awesome job ladies! Morever, in the middle of the meal, the server came and told us "you have to finish all the rice" We know. and we were still working on our food. We were eating and having a great conversation. Our meal started to be ruined by. Another server came and picked the spoon in my miso soup bowl and said "you have to finish rice in the soup too" oh this is so RUDE. You can talk to me but you don't touch my spoon in my food that is right in front of me! I said "I eat my soup with rice" she said "oh ok because someone tries to hide rice in soup" I got so pissed. They spoke to us with attitude. honey, let me tell you here. If we cheat about rice, we make sure you can't catch me hiding all the rice somewhere.

Our group decided to not tip them because this was so bad of dinning experience, but the server dropped the check and said gratuity had been added. We still gotta pay them without gratuity anyway.  Lucky for the server that I saw a gentleman walking in and out the restaurant for a while. I decided to call him and asked "are you a manager?" he said "I am the owner" Bingo! We told him the food was great but the service was really bad. He said "talk to me, tell me everything" We told him everything. He said "they are trying to protect me" but they didn't try to have a good service to protect you from the bad review. We asked if he could take the gratuity out because there is no law to add gratuity in vegas anymore. he said it was in the system, then he handed us $20 to be a part of the gratuity we had to pay. The owner is really nice guy. One of our friends told him to the point "we are not cheap. When we tip, we tip a lot. We are in service industrial too. We know what is good what is bad service." We gave him his $20 back. Then he gave us a couple 20% discount cards and told us to come back. We felt like we could let this go and we wouldn't review anything, but we won't come back. 

Unfortunately, the server wouldn't let us go. We put all the money in. Of course we are pain in the ass when someone is a B to us. We paid the check with all $1 bills. she said "Oh my god" why? it is the money too!!!! we tipped you! because your employer is nice to us and he protects his employees! I told her "we already talked to the owner" 

****GUESS WHAT SHE TOLD US? SHE SAID "it's ok. He is not the owner"**** 
They need to fire this girl. I feel bad for the owner or whoever he is. He could be a partner/a manager but he is her employer. He tried to protect her and took the money out of his pocket to help us pay for gratuity, but obviously she didn't protect him.

NOT done yet, we all were still sitting and eating after we gave her money. Only one of us had to stand up to hold her baby because she started crying. That server said to me "everyone has to finish the rice" more like yelled at me. I couldn't stand this anymore so I yelled back "I AM STILL WORKING ON IT!" god damn it! I didn't wanna finish my mackerel and rice anymore. We just walked out right after. 2 bites of rice left they can finish it.

This was a great find especially in Vegas. I was in Vegas on business for a week and discovered this place with a couple of coworkers. Great sushi for a great price. All you can eat sushi for $25. Can't beat that!!! Definitely check this place out when you are in town. Right across the street from the Palms Hotel.
Good sushi considering it is in the desert. The all you can eat sushi is a must try if you are a big eater and a fan of sushi
Umiya is the best sushi place in Las Vegas! It has great atmosphere and every staffs are so nice! I highly recommend this place.
This is our favorite place love it the waitress are friendly. We are here almost every week.
Horrible service. There were 7 of us and they let 3 parties cut in front of us. They were very rude and did not give us an explanation why they didn't sit us, even though there were seats available.

Food was good.   Service was horrible.  Took our AYCE orders and some items never came. Happened twice in one seating.  Some items you can only order once and they accused us of having them already.  We explained they never came and they won't believe us. Pretty crappy attitude.  Never offered an apology.  The value is there with their AYCE but you have to put up with the service.

The all you can eat is great. They have varieties of food and all the special rolls on menu are included. The food have quality too. The price was fair and i would recommend to give it a shot. 
The service was great too!
90 minutes AYCE. 5 min from the strip. Good sushi. They do charge for leftovers so just be judicial when ordering.
Good AYCE. No complaints nice variety of items on the menu.

Great tasting food. Their menu is also much better compared to most AYCE sushi places because there are more to select besides sushi. With their menu, I think they have the price to beat for AYCE sushi. 

The service, however, is very very bad (hence, just 4 stars). Their female servers would just place all of your orders in all table while whispering what they are in a way that almost no one can hear and do not even bother to place them close to the person who actually ordered that particular food.

Learned now I am allergic to soy, so it makes sushi difficult and not as fun! Soy & gluten allergies together makes for eating cardboard!, however Alex & Ryan are making me a special roll based on my allergies and some ingredients I would love to have! These guys are just amazing!!!! AMAZING! Been having them roll sushi for me for almost ten years now, and SOOOOO FITTING they have their own place!

every chefs are awesome and fun. they made beautiful and tasty rolls for me and my wife. the services are sooo good also servers are kind. It was really nice sushi place. I  had a best sushi ever in vegas. I love this place!!

Best sushi I have eaten in years!  We ordered many items.  I eat mostly veggies.  Son and DIL eat everything.   We all loved it.   Delicious, beautifully prepared food.  Busy place but great service.  Make sure you come here if you're in Las Vegas.
Ordered the AYCE. The sushi was small and so so but the rolls and extras were good. Fresh Oysters were top notch!!!  Had several specialty items not on the regular AYCE menu which was nice.

Came here for all you can eat sushi after just driving around looking for a place to eat. Left here hoping they are still in business everytime we come back to vegas.
Whenever we make the trip to vegas, we always plan on eating here at least twice. The rice to fish ratio is good and the fish is fresh. They also have side orders without rice which is a plus.

The quality and selection for AYCE at $25? Who knew there would be such a hidden gem right behind The Palms Hotel. I had it for the first time coming back from a 3 day camping/hiking trip to Zion, and let me tell you. We killed it. It was so good that I went again the very next week while I was in Vegas... But it's so good! And so close to the strip.

Honestly I would put it on same the level as Bacchanal. I know they're totally different, but on my scale of buffet/AYCE choices... Umiya is pretty up there with Bacchanal. Hands down better than Wicked Spoon. 

The UNI... So good. But sadly its limited to one order.. So is the SWEET SHRIMP, AJ SAUCE TUNA. All the ones labeled 1D. But that just means you know it's bomb! So order all them 1Ds. 

They have ramen too and it's pretty good. Pretty large selection in sushi, rolls, and appetizers. TUNA SALAD, SUNRISE ROLL, FIRST KISS ROLL, PORK BELLY, BAKED MUSSELS, ETC! They let you get half orders of rolls too so you can try as many as you want.

Oh and don't forget the green tea mochi icecream and green tea tempura for dessert. :)

They have a huge screen showing a mix of Kpop and top20s style music videos on one wall and then a TV with like some random news channel on the opposite wall. So just a warning, whichever side of the table you end up choosing on... You will have a very different scenery for the next 1.5hrs. Because that's the time limit; you'd think that's enough time, but it goes by pretty quickly! 

Anyways, the people there are all really nice too. They'll tell you what's good if you don't know what to order too. Super helpful and friendly!

A couple friends of mine came in on a slow afternoon for dinner a couple days ago. When going in, I thought it would be packed since a lot of the reviewers have said that it's a good place.

For us, our experience was just decent. Nothing amazing or great. Even though we were just the only table being served, these servers are still slow. When being asked for more food & serving them were extremely slow and they expect us to have that 90 minutes limit? No way. Unfair. 

With that being said, I would rather go to some place else. Makino was the best one for us.

So delicious
Service was fast
Super cheap all you can eat $25
The wait was about 40 min wed night 
The people there are nice even though super busy

I seldom give good reviews but I must say Umiya is great for AYCE sushi. They have both AYCE sushi and a la carte style. We did the AYCE sushi. They have a great selection of sushi rolls, appetizers and small dishes. Their sushi is pretty fresh and delicious. I like the ambience and the decor. Service was good. Jay and Krystal who serves us was accommodating and attentive. 

If you check in using Yelp or Facebook you get a free soda. =)

However you are only limit to one dessert each. =(

Overall, I would recommend them.

great service! 
very fast service and the waiters were consistently asking if everything was alright. definitely recommend!
Umiya on Flamingo is an awesome AYCE sushi buffet.  Highly recommend.  Food was awesome.  Fast service. Huge menu! Yummy!

First, I am inexperienced with sushi. I had the waiter and chef pick a sampling of things that they recommended. Every items was amazing and an adventure in itself. I usually don't like raw fish. Though, this one didn't taste fishy at all. So, I fully enjoyed it.

I went on a Wednesday evening. There was only one other couple. The staff severely outnumbered us. They were super friendly. I'm ready to go back tomorrow!

Food was like every other sushi spot nothing special. The reason why I gave it a one star is because the service was extremely bad. We literally had to wait 40min to put in a order. Waiters passed us by multiple times. Customer service hands down one of the worst I've ever had. I actually liked this spot until today.

We just left there because I told the hostess that we just wanted drinks. She told me that we'd have to stand at the bar! There were plenty of seats in the restaurant, but because we only wanted drinks, I guess bar option was only option. She took the next party after us. 

Should not matter what we are eating OR drinking - money is money! D U H....
This place is so awesome! The service is great and the food is so on point! I truly recommend this spot it's delish!

it is very great place. nice atmosphere and people. 
Food of freshness is a great too. 
people must try snow white and also a la carte special meun !!

I've found this gem for AYCE sushi in the past year and it's become my go-to place. I still have some free vouchers for the place I used to love but they got loud and too young for me. Umaya has a huge menu, seems to be no time limit, and includes dessert. Love it, love it, love it. I'm going there again tomorrow!
Best sushi place in town! And the prices are not too bad. If you are a fan of oysters and nigiri, try their lunch or dinner buffet. I love everything in this restaurant!

Excellent quality, variety, and service.  The multiple chefs and waiters kept the delicious sushi coming almost as fast as I could eat it.  Brown rice is a great option here.  Highly recommended; I can't wait to go back!

I have lived in Vegas about a year and a half and this is a wonderful AYCE sushi joint.  Huge selection and everything is fresh and served how you want it and nicely displayed by expert sushi artist chefs. I have been to this place like every couple months for a treat and to bring company visiting town.  Everyone is friendly and the price is about $25 for AYCE per person which is very reasonable.  They also seem to have a full bar and some fancy non alcoholic drinks.  With so many sushi places in Las Vegas we keep coming back here.  I won't give names but it is much better than a sushi place on the strip that if you ordered what you ate their it would be five times the price and not close to as good.  This place is close to the strip but maybe a half hour from where I live however it is well worth the trip!

Absolutely Amazing. I can't think of one thing that could possibly fault the impeccable meal my partner and myself had tonight. The staff were perfect; quick and super friendly, the food was the best I have had (Japanese) ever and the whole atmosphere was great!
 
If you are in Vegas and you want to have a perfect food experience then Umiya is the place for you. If I could, I would travel from Perth, Western Australia to Vegas more often just to have this sushi. DO NOT MISS. 

*hint: have the all you can eat. Will not disappoint.

Probably one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. Great quality of food and good service. Absolutely recommend. All you can it 20$ lunch and 25$ dinner. Sushi is amazing. The roll "kiss of fire" is the best roll I've ever had. All food was ready really fast and taste good.
Love this place!!! Best all you can eat Japanese restaurant I have ever had! Foods are really delicate and servers are friendly.

used to love this place...they changed the crab they used...which is more like a crab stick...makes the roll taste dry and flavorless. got a shrimp tempura roll not even sure if Shrimp was in it. will not return....

The all you can eat dinner was worth the price. They were able to take our large party fairly last minute on a Friday night, which was very nice. Our server Justin was absolutely great and he was very friendly and attentive. The special yuzu hamachi and salmon belly was really good. Wouldn't get the ikura again, it tasted like it was drenched in alcohol. 
Overall good experience and would go again.

I've been to Umiya a few times. The first time was outstanding. The fish was fresh and flavorful, the service attentive, and there's a decent menu selection for AYCE. Excited to have found a great new sushi place, I went back to try the lunch specials, which were also great. However, over the last few months the quality and service have taken a nosedive. 

A friend and I were in on a Sat night for AYCE dinner. We were seated promptly even though it was somewhat busy, but we hadn't even got our coats off before someone came to take our order. Clearly not ready yet. Then, when we were ready, despite the army of staff, no one came. I'll spare the extensive list of service fails throughout the evening, but it's really the service that is earning the 2 star rating here. Basically, we didn't get what we ordered the first time, were unable to get someone to take a follow up order, had food thrown down on the table by servers on their way to somewhere else, and were overcharged. To top it off, the fish was bland and the portion sizes had shrunk from previous visits. I'd rate the food about 2.5 stars. Time to scratch this one off the list. There's just so many better places in town.
What an awesome place. Everything g we ordered was delicious. Th e service was crazy fast. At one point our table was totally full of plates. A great experience. Don't miss out!

This is my second time dining here for the all you can eat sushi, AMAZING! The food is amazing, the service is fantastic, place to be for the best sushi and same bombs! :) the wait isn't too bad, but when you're hungry...come here on a weekday.

Ate here for the first time recently, and was so impressed! The food was great, and the service was amazing. Someone was constantly ready to take our next AYCE order, and everything came out super fast and yummy! 
Will definitely be back :)

Food was fresh and good but i tried to order at least 5 things that they told me were not available?? And most dished that u see in the picks are not included in the AYCE, go to Sushi kaya way better!!!!!!!!

In a city where all-you-can-eat sushi is at nearly every corner, it's hard to be the best but somehow Umiya has done it. The past two years I have eaten here at least two dozen times and have even celebrated my last two birthdays here. The atmosphere and sushi is great, and the menu offers something for everyone (even those that don't like sushi). I have never had a bad experience here and even my sushi-snob friends have become Umiya proponents. If you want the best sushi and service in town, Umiya is where to go.

My fiance and I happened to stop by this place near by Palms Casino. We did not think much about it and just wanted a quick sushi meal. The price was pretty decent (around $8-$15 per dish) but we had to go for an all you can eat deal since it would be a better deal for us and it sure was! The server was very friendly and provided us with a great service with a big smile on his face. He recommended us with all these great dishes that were on the menu. The food were incredibly awesome!! The chef is a truly master chef! Every dish that came out was a piece of art! He greatly dedicated his time and his master sushi chef skills in making our food looks to pretty and artsy. We were blown away by his creativity and his fast cooking skills.

Conclusion:
At the end I would definitely recommend all my friends and family to try out this new all you can eat sushi restaurant. It is a great bang for the buck$$!

All you can deal

$25-29.99 (forgot the price) but it is for sure under $30
add $10 more for all you can drink (sake, beers)

Wow. Had AYCE lunch today with 3 friends. We ordered a lot of food. Hard to beat this bargain. I enjoyed every single item. Delightfully delicious. Nigiri was very good quality, melt in your mouth. Service was spot-on. We were ordering like a machine gun and they didn't miss a beat. This place is a must. Incredible variety. I cannot see how anyone who enjoys Sushi would be disappointed here.

BEST SUSHI PLACE IN LAS VEGAS. Amazing variety of every cravings you'll ever need!!! Also you can substitute  everything in brown rice!!! Always fresh and my favorite oysters are included in their all you can eat menu!!!! Definitely a MUST GO place!!!
The sushi place is in sane! I think it was $25 and you got all you can eat sushi, about 30 different kinds of sushi, appetizers dessert entrées. Pretty much anything you could want

Ultra clean, great service, fresh fish, certainly in the top five best of vegas. They have a very comfortable seating arrangement and spacious tables. Plus their menu includes plenty of dishes for those friends that don't do sushi. It's a win for everyone.  One block up from  the Rio across from the from the palms. Easy to get to. They had 6 chefs working at 10pm. Awesome!
Love this place. Does get crowded nut its worth the wait. One of the best sushis in town.

This place gave me the worst food poisoning I have ever experienced. So much so that I spent the next day vomiting and making repeated trips to the bathroom and the next night at the ER with body aches and a 103 degree fever. I eat sushi often and this was the first time I got sick from it, something is not right with their fish...
I hesitated to come here for the AYCE sushi, because usually AYCE is average sushi at best. But I've got to say, the sushi here was wonderful. Service was great also.
The best susbi in  egas. The crew is AMAZIIING. They will treat you like a king. All you can eat. Ask for "oragen blossom" roll. If you go to Vegas, you must go to Umiya.

Umiya was great. The all-you-can-eat menu was killer and the fish tasted fresh, nothing was "fishy."  The Teriyaki Chicken was also delicious. The music was a little loud at the bar, but it was great other than that.
Great Japanese sushi only issue is the drinks aren't unlimited but its something stupid

Had lunch. All you can eat is only 20.95 and the quality is really good. The salmon is AWESOME here. Their other sushi is good too. Their riceless sushi have a nice refreshing flavor. They have great number of options outside of sushi too! Their appetizers are really good - it's a good place for people who want to have AYCE sushi and have friends who aren't into sushi.

Great sushi buffet! The sushi is fresh and the service is great. Nice ambience too. Love the spicy tuna salad-yum! The bacon wrapped scallop is so yummy too! All their rolls r fabulous! Would highly recommend it. This is now my regular spot whenever I'm in Vegas.

Was going pretty good. I'm always looking for healthier choices. Ordered the chicken skewer that looked fantastic in the menu but I was brought a skewer that had been deep fried. It was so fried that the veggies were indistinguishable. It was enough to turn me off but the rest of the meal was super good.

This is a very good Japanese all you can eat sushi ....you order off the menu and certain items are limited to one per person. 
It's good because they are open late.  I have gone here several times in the quality and service is always good.

Went here with my sis and got sick from the food. Should've known when we got the nigiri, It was not fresh at all. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place. Plus a lot of the workers seem to not know what they are doing(too many of them handling one table therefore there was many errors with food coming out . Shrimp skewer was overlooked and dry, tonkutsu ramen was bland(I knew that it would be because it's not a ramen place).

The food was delicious and the service was great!  We had a group of 6 and ordered 4 AYCE sushi, one a la carte and one person ordered a chicken dish.  The AYCE had a large menu to choose from!! The chicken was excellent and all the other food ordered a la carte was fantastic.  
The best part was it was off the strip, busy enough that you knew it was going to be good and the prices were great! I will definitely visit again when in Vegas!
Food was amazing!!! Great service!!! Huge menu variety on the AYCE Menu. Highly recommended. We will definitely be back.
Great food great service very friendly will definitely come back!! And so close to the Palms if you don't want casino food.

Went into umiya last night and had the worst server ever! He was so rude! Asked if I can have a side of yuzu (because I get it every time I go there) and rudely says "no you can't." I'm a server myself and I was always trained to say I'm sorry but we don't have that available. Asked we could have our edamame seared a little extra and again he said no you can't because we cook it in large batches not just for one table at a time. The food has always been great but this guy was just so rude that he really ruined our meal. Won't be coming back unfortunately.

This place is probably the worst sushi spot Ive ever been to. The rice is old, and so is their fish. I felt terrible after eating here. 
We got several rolls, appetizers and stuff the only thing that was good was the monkey brain deep fried appetizer. 
This is the reason why I stay away from uyce spots and buffets, you pretty much get what you pay for!

It is just an amazing place to it with fun! Their 20 bucks deal is just too cool! You can eat something you never try it is not gonna cost you an arm and a leg. 

From now on, i am gonna eat there every time i come to the city.

Used to come here alot. Recently however weve been sat, 6 or more tables sat after us and served and we didn't even get asked for a drink order. Food is great but service has gone to shit. Won't be making the drive across town to come here any more.
Sorry, I usually give easy 4 and 5 stars, but the rice was really hard and tasted like the sushi in the market refrigerator. Either I was really unlucky today or they bought their yelp reviews. :/

Went to Umiya Monday night with a large group of people. Upon arrival we were seated very quickly and had a table by the kitchen in the back. I don't know why they sat us by the kitchen, because the room was only half full and there was plenty of seating available. Waitresses, servers, and bussers were constantly back and forth around our section which was bothersome. The food was great! Loved the all you can eat menu. And the prices were good as well...I'll definitely go back, just don't give us the table in the back by the kitchen! 

-Joe
I absolutely love this place. The food and service is amazing. The staff is some of the best in town!!!

I find myself eating at a lot of different sushi places this one was actually surprising I was expecting one star but they deserve 5 from the experience that I have I would recommend at least give this place a try because not all the time it could be bad

Great AYCE menu for the same price as most of the sushi place in town. Great service. All the food we ordered taste great. Only thing I wish they had was some drink specials. Hot tea was a little expensive, paid $7.50 for it. Still wondering why it cost that much for 1 tea. Other than that we had a great time.

Yes!! AYCE!!! 

After a weekend of destroying my body, I usually crave for something healthy and fresh! After a few orders of nigiri, we dive in for the fried stuff. Anything soft shell crab is delicious! There are so many rolls to choose from but if you want variety, ORDER HALF ORDERS!!! HALF ORDERS!!!!! We were pretty much able to try everything on the menu! Most of the rolls can be half orders which come out with 4 cuts instead of 8! 

Save room for dessert! I was too full to try the tempura ice cream:( NEXT TIME! Definitely will be a next time.
We came ere for my wife's birthday for the first time and loved it.  What impressed us te most is the variety of food options with AYCE.  Skewers and fresh oyster to ramen.  We will be back again.

I had a great experience at Umiya. The sushi was fantastic! The food came very quick and the staff were very attentive. I walked from The MGM all the way over there and it was worth every step- although not advisable. The soft shell crab was good but the first kiss roll is out of this world. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to stop by at Umiya again.

For the price and proximity to the strip I probably should give this place 5 stars, but I'll hold that last star until they add more beers to their menu and/or soften up a bit on the "if you don't eat it, we will charge you for it"... note: this restaurant was a recommendation from our Uber driver. 

Pros: 
- All you can eat dinner for $26! We had (for apps): fried oysters, soft shell crab, pork belly and gyoza. All delicious! We ordered 4 half rolls and 1 full roll (all great!). Then 2 mochi (awesome!) and 2 tempura ice cream. Walked away pretty full and very satisfied (not stuffed and uncomfortable). In summary, the food was great as expected. 
- Food arrived timely
- Service was good 
- Noise level = good! Not too quiet but great for conversation 
- We didn't have to wait for a table at 6:30pm on a Friday in December

Cons: 
- The waitress literally warned us that they would charge us for food not eaten even if we said we "didn't like the roll" :-X I understand what they are trying to do here, but it was maybe too stern of a warning. I think instituting a "no more than x rolls every x minutes per person unless the food is gone/eaten" is perhaps a better way of getting people to not order a ton of food just because it's all you can eat.
- I'm nitpicking here, but I would like to see a larger selection of alcohol, especially beer. But this is an overall complaint of mine for most Asian cuisine restaurants so take it with a grain of salt 

Overall a great value and delicious food for Vegas. I always complain that it's hard to use Yelp in Vegas because everything is rated 3.5 stars or higher. I've been to Vegas 5 times and this place, in my opinion, is above average! Check it out if you don't mind going off the strip!
I can say best ayce sushi place. I tried every ayce sushi, but only here makes me satisfied. People are nice n fresh food always. Also free drink when u check in.

I am not sure how they get this high rating! Food was bad and they even charge for kids under 3. Horrible. Fish on top of sushi is as thin as shabu shabu meat. I thought I was eating shabu shabu. Sorry but I will never go back again.

This place is awesome! My family and I went for AYCA sushi on Mother's Day. The service was some of the best I've ever had at any restaurant. We were seated immediately with no wait. Our server Ron was awesome and took our order right away. We ordered roll by roll until we've had our fill. All the sushi came quick and was very fresh! I will for sure come back to this place, for the service alone. Ask for Ron he's a great server!

Visiting Vegas for a vacation. We were trying to find a good AYCE place and umiya came up. It got the best reviews and it did not disappoint! We are a good amount and everything was good quality. Sean and Ron were both very attentive servers!

Very good. I'm not a sushi snob. I like almost all sushi, but this place knows what they're doing. The ambiance is a little loud and decor is nothing fancy, but the sushi and service were outstanding. That's what I care about. Highly recommend.
Food was good.  Service was good. Let me put it in terms in which California's governor would state it. "I'll be back".
All you can eat sushi ! Lunch price was 20.95 per person until 3 PM. Nigiri sushi was great and filling. 90 minute time cap. Came here before and had a great experience, yet again.

Here for the third time, my favorite all-you-can-eat sushi spot in Vegas.

I highly recommend the monkey brain, the poke salad, and anything else with tuna!
You can't go wrong here!! Near the strip, the food is great, and Alex the owner is funny and entertaining!!
I found hair in ginger after couple bits it so disgusted.  Food is good they just have to be aware of cleanses...
If u want good customer services this place is for u. Really good food and really nice servers. Thy all the time checking up on you on refill. Really like this place

Best place for sushi ever! Great prices (it was 20.95 for lunch and 25.95 per person for dinner), vast menu, delicious food, and great service! Our waitress was amazing! She patiently answered all our questions and was quick to serve and come back so we could order again. Full five stars and my new favorite place to eat!
One of the few times I've returned to a restaurant while on vacation. Absolutely delicious.
This place was amazing!  Great food, prices, and got my daughter to try sushi for the first time. Yummy!

Simple the best. Awesome rolls. We had lunch special 1 normal roll & 1 special roll & soup for $12.95! 
Also all you can eat for like $23 here
Great food

Very yummy! A lot.of options to pick from. Great price especially for all you can eat. And if you check up on yelp its 1 free soda! Also the tempura green tea ice cream was delicious!! Had so many rolls of sushi lost track of which was which. MUST TRY baked mussels. Only thing is if you dont eat all you'll get charged. (Told by a friend, havent experienced it yet.)

I eat sushi allllll the time. And for ALL YOU CAN EAT, Umiya is the best! I go here at least once a month after trying so many sushi restaurants. My favorite thing about sushi is the nigiri. Umiya's nigiri is very fresh and so worth the cost of ayce. My favorite nigiri here are unagi, salmon, giant clam, yellowtail, halibut, garlic tuna, and sweet shrimp. I'm not much of a roll eater, but I highly recommend the Rattle Snake Roll and the Touchdown Roll. Best of all, mochi ice cream is included in ayce, so many sushi restaurants don't. Overall, this is my favorite sushi restaurant for ayce!

I also threw a birthday party here once and they brought out a plate with ice cream and mochi decorated with whipped cream and caramel syrup and it was so nice of them. The waiter passed around sake and beer throughout my table and all the waiters and sushi chefs joined us as well. It was just one fun experience!

I went to umiya sushi for lunch and was not let down. The selection was varied from rolls, nigiri, to ramen, and so many delicious ice creams. Wait staff was attentive and friendly. I'll be coming back!

This is by far the best sushi restaurant I've been too. I just stuck to this one & forgot the rest! I love their AYCE menu. Spicy tuna salad is my ultimate favorite, even if it's hard to pick out what's the best tasting, Everything you order from here is delicious. They are friendly & service faster than most places. Place is spacious & clean, It's not crowded packed as some places, & easy parking. Me & my husband always leave happy & satisfied with this place.

I took my friend here for his birthday and its GREAT!!

The vibe is nice, KPOP music videos projected on a big wall and nice lighting overall. Their noise level was loud but I don't personally care. They shouted a lot to each other in Japanese so if you don't like random shouting, don't come here haha

Staff was very attentive, constantly refilling drinks, taking orders often (good for AYCE, because you can keep asking for more and not worry about time!!). 

The food came out fast, tasted amazing, and they didn't even charge us for leftovers like at a usual AYCE. I had never experienced much sushi beyond a few basic Cali-rolls and I think this was a game changer on my opinion of seafood!!

My suggestion is that they get Ramune!! I was sad to see none on a Japanese menu :( also to pick up the random litter in the bathroom!!!

The food was really good and the portions are small, which is really nice when you do an AYCE. Just one thing... the uni we got didn't look or taste fresh. Also, service was good; there were several attentive servers.
I like this place good food, great service off the strip.  Parking, fresh fish, festive. No smoking.

We ordered from the all you can eat menu: 4 different types of sushi rolls, baked mussels, miso soup, fresh oysters, and shrimp and veggie skewers.

The rolls, oysters, and mussels were fresh. I prefer hot oysters but they only serve them on ice. The shrimp and veggie skewer looked and tasty over cooked.

I think the all you can eat menu is worth it if you love sushi and can arrive early enough to catch the lunch prices. 

The dining area was cafeteria styled with plenty of room for large groups.

Great AYCE sushi place, lots of fresh selections including oysters, uni and giant clams! And all the sushi came with small bite size of rice, so it doesn't fill you up easy. It's only $25.99 plus tax and tips. Can't find anything better than this. Highly recommended.
Love this place. Great food fun servers.  Fast clean. I'll be back for sure.  Thank you Taylor for the great service!

This is one of the best sushi places in town! The service is great, they work really fast and everyone is friendly. The price for AYCE lunch is about $20, AYCE dinner is about $26 per person. Food is really fresh and it's all around a wonderful dining experience! This is definitely something I recommend trying if you're in town!

We came yesterday afternoon ate all you can eat sushi, this wasnt the first time we came and that time i came with 4 yrs old daughter, i didnt ask what the server name but the server was a women, SHE WAS RUDE!!!! My daughter doesnt eat much for 4 yrs old so she ask if we want make her pay all you can eat or just regular , we decided just regular entree , she mention 3 times , she will charge extra if she see my daughter take a bite of sushi, and we said its ok, because we know she wont eat, and she took our order and guess what our order never come out correctly we missed our fried rice 4 order, yakisoba, miso soup, our sushi, and we kept asking and asking where is our foods but never came out . And the server just watching and stand around our table make sure my daughter didnt touch the sushi orders. At the end we still had 1 tray sushi . We were not done yet, we still eating and talking and she came again at our table and said she will charge us full price for what ever we dont finish it and we told her this isnt the first time we eat at all you can eat sushi and we aware about that and we arent finish. We still talking and eating. At the end we order ice cream 2 vanilla and 1 green tea, when the ice cream came my daughter touch the ice cream and she grabbed the ice cream and she said she will charge because my daughter not pay for all you can eat and we had to tell her she wont eat that ice cream because she has stomach problem thats why we dont pay for her, we just order tonkatsu soup for her. We really disappointed with the service and we disnt get the food we order. And that wasnt the first time every time we came there our food never completed

First time ever coming here with a friend's recommendation. Have to say I'm not a fan. Came in with my boyfriend and his friends. There are basically 3 rules when eating here.
1) if you have all you can eat you can ONLY share with people who eat all you can eat. 
2) if you don't finish they will charge you extra. 
3) if there is a (1) next to the food you can't share it. 

The food- not the greatest sushi I have had. It was decent. Had the caterpillar and it was complete mush. Any sushi roll we tried picking up with the chop sticks came apart instantly. 

The service- everyone seems like they are in a rush here. They sit you down and rush you to get out. When they drop off the food they say it completely fast and literally run off. The WORST of it was the MANAGER. Her name is ASHLEY! She was completely RUDE. Any time she reached over she would elbow you in the face and walk off. She hit our friend twice in the face hard. When she dropped the food off she said everything fast and tried to run off. When we stopped her to repeat thinking it wasn't out food she says it again and laughs at us in a mocking way. We asked our server who the manager was and he said that Ashely was. We were shocked and in disbelief. We couldn't believe a manager would treat us like this. 
I wanted to give this place a rating of 0 but our server TAYLOR changed my mind. He was friendly and made us all laugh and took his time with us when we were having problems deciding what we wanted to eat. We all hoped he was the manager or we want him to be promoted because he was professional and caring. 

All and all I would never come back here again. I would recommend going to Oyshi on Sahara and Tenaya instead if you want good sushi and better service.
Loved it, fresh food, great service and amazing atmosphere will reccend this to others who love fresh sushi!!
The best AYCE sushi I had in Vegas so far. Ron and Min provided us the best service we could ask for. 10 star service

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! It's one of the cheaper sushi spots here in Vegas. It's the same price as Yama Sushi for lunch, but Umiya has a wide variety of apps and rolls. Super yummy. It's definitely my go to sushi spots for lunch if I want something "cheap" yet filling.

Came here with my friend cause she was craving sushi...staff was pretty nice..I liked my salmon avocado roll, but I don't think my friend liked hers too much...but mine was fine...it was a really chill place. Close to the Las Vegas Strip

Fish are paper thin . Too much rice . Then they threatened you that will charge extra if you don't consumed the rice on their nigiri . Our Waitress is horrible. All she did is watch us if we are eating the rice. Well if you guys cut the fish a little thicker, I maybe can eat the entire rice of nigiri. They ruined our TGIF dinner .

I really wanted t like this place because the servers were working really hard but unfortunately this was our worst AYCE experience...

Food was really disappointing. Rice was not cooked well so that contributed to the poor quality of sushi. I stopped ordering nigiri after the first round because of the rice. I am sure it is probably this one time and hope other times they get the rice right. But it is quite unfortunate they didn't taste the rice...they would've stopped serving it.

Service was very very slow. There were only two waiters working there and we can see that they were really trying. But the restaurant was full and they couldn't keep up. 

Overall very bad sushi experience. I liked the atmosphere but had to fill my belly with Udon at an AYCE sushi place :-(

Excellent food and excellent staff! We went on a Friday night and had their All You Can Eat special - and believe me its worth it! Fish was fresh, great variety of sushi rolls, and the service was prompt. The staff had great personalities and funny. Looking forward to coming back!
Had a great dinner there with some sweetest people. Fresh sushi, good service, could have been better if rolls were less rice. We left happy, and glad that we tried this restaurant out.
Sushi quality is not as good as the picture. Very disappointed. The fish on the sushi is slim and thin. It is worst than other 3 star restaurant,  so I can't believe it got four star.

I am not usually a fan of all you can eat places since the quality and service usually suffer, but that is not the case here.  I was with a large group and they quickly got everything moving for us.  We had someone at the table doing all the ordering so we could sample a whole bunch of the sushi and just share.  It was very fresh and beautifully presented.  They have fresh wasabi and I will never be able to have the powdered stuff again.  The miso soup was perfect.  Some of the table saved room for the mochi ice cream, which they said was ok.  I would definitely come back here.

Well my 2nd visit here was much different than my first visit.  This time around our service was pathetic!  Extremely slow!  The employees were border line rude.  We had to ask several times, to three different employees, about where our food was.  As it was taking so long to come out.  We waited literally 20 min just to get our appetizer of edamame.

And mind you the place was almost empty.  We were there around 2pm.  The food did not taste or look fresh at all.  

I don't see myself coming back here anytime soon.

We were here on a Monday night without a reservation for 8, luckily we got seated within 5 minutes, it was still early, near 6pm.  The hostess was friendly and nice.  We ordered ala carte for the 4 kids (not worth the money having kids doing the AYCE).  They enjoyed their favorite rolls.  The 4 adults ordered AYCE and it was delicious! The menu had more than just sushi, but beef steak (very petite and juicy, which was perfect), raw oysters, baked mussels, soft shell crabs, desserts, and more.  Our waitress, young Asian lady, was efficient; we did not need to flag her down; she always know when to come by our tables to take more orders.  We will definitely come back when we are in Vegas and we have recommended this place to our friends and families.

my friend said their go to ayce sushi spot is Sushi House Goyemon. after more yelp research, i came across this place. first meal after everyone landed and we met up here around midnight. this was a good option because they are open until 2am. for the most part, every nigiri and sashimi were pretty good, i didn't like the rolls so i stayed away from those. they had a bunch of good appetizers and skewers too. some of our friends liked this place so much they came here as the last meal of their trip, unfortunately one of them got food poisoning.
The best AYCE I have experienced. Fresh, flavorful, great service, choices, and cost.  Also easy to park which is a bonus.  If you love sushi you must get here immediately!
Went there for lunch twice. Fantastic sushi. Very good service, close to the strip but far enough. Laid back.

Let me start off by my experience was pleasant until the end. 
Service and employees where attentive and prompt. Food was not the greatest but definitely delicious (4 stars when it comes to food)

My experience changed when I was treating my guest to dinner. 199 to be exact. 
I left my card with the server and waited to receive my receipt. This is when one of the employees comes back to the table and ask "who does this card belong to" capturing everyone's attention. That's when the employee said loudly "your card is declined." I was speechless and felt uneasy because of how it made me look really bad. It seemed like the employee was happy to say it was declined. 

I called my bank and they said they did not receive a decline and to have them try again. So I went up to clear up the situation and fix what happened. I saw with my eyes the card declined and had to use another card. 

Anyway, I asked for a manager which seemed like a young kid compared to the gentlemen that embarrassed me. When I explained what happened he told me in a calm not really caring voice sorry. He said he will talk to the employee. I felt like no justice was being served so I mentioned I will just leave a Yelp review about my experience. He just smiled and continued with business.

So I went back to my table to ease my guest and let them know the bill was paid. As we were leaving the young manager tried to apologize and made up an excuse to say his English was "bad" and that he will have a discussion with the staff. The employee even used broken English to say sorry.... here the crazy part. The same employee that was using broken English was pronouncing "who does this card belong to" and the word "decline" in perfect English. Maybe dropping the YELP hint changed his heart to make discipline sound more serious. It was too late after giving you the first opportunity to fix it. 

I would have given this establishment a 5 start rating until what happened at the end. 

All my friends agreed that this place was great until the employee changed the whole mood. 

I'm definitely not coming back to this establishment.

First off this is a great AYCE sushi spot after hours. I get off at 11pm and this is the spot me and my co workers go to when we are craving delicious sushi. I haven't found many late night spots like this with amazing food. The staff are awesome and the food comes within 5-10 minutes of ordering. This is the go to place for late night sushi.
Had pink lady..really tasty roll...little bummed they were out of king crab..guess have to try next time...rolls.were fresh and tasty.
My new favorite place for sushi! Can't wait till our next Vegas vacation to go back. So many choices and the servers are helpful and always ready for your next order.

I am having the worst diarrhea ever, still having health problems after I had dinner with friends! 

I heard the freshness is not good here, I did not want to go here because the reputations but friend's birthday made me eat there! However I  almost got killed here eating their bad quality sea food here.

Watch what you put in your mouse always, don't become a sick person like me!!!!!!

Atmosphere: 4.5/5
Seemed extremely lively.  Open sushi bar with an almost interactive feel. 

Service: 5/5
Servers were very attentive and quick to place orders. Friendly staff. 

Food: 3.5/5
Overall quality of sushi was pretty decent.  Highlights were tuna,  uni,  amaebi, and hamachi. Majority of rolls were variations using imitation crab and random sauces.

My husband and I decided to eat here on a Saturday for lunch before I went to work, huge mistake. We were greeted and seated quickly, but getting service wasn't happening. Two people asked us if we wanted anything to drink and that was it. A chef took notice of us and personally took our order. It took about 30 minutes for one of our orders to finally come, and at this point my husband wants to leave because I had work in a few hours. Our appetizers came last and it was difficult to get another order in. The chef was now super busy and he's the one who took our order to begin with. My husband wasn't happy so we asked for the check and that took another 15 minutes. It wasn't worth the money we paid. The food wasn't that great, we've had way better. Not looking forward to giving this place another try.

If you're tight on time, this isn't the place. As a server myself I felt like this place didn't really care if their customers were unhappy. I still left a $15 tip, and my husband said I shouldn't because we didn't even get to finish eating. But I didn't want to stiff them, I know how that feels. They need to be more organized. Other tables had multiple servers asking them if they needed anything and they were told that the other server already helped them. I've taken a liking to Sakana. Busy, but we're always taken care of.

Service and quality is as good as it gets! The wait time for out party of 2 was little to none. Also, unlike most sushi joints Umiya had more than enough servers on shift to full assist everyone dining. Our orders were taken and delivered so quickly it was unbelievable for an all you can eat.

MY FAVORITE AYCE SUSHI JOINT IN TOWN HANDS DOWN.
Food and service are amazing!!! Only reason why I gave a 4 start is because of the lack of attention to the restrooms.

Excellent quality and variety including nigiri sushi, rolls, soups (udon, ramen, etc. as well), skewers, steak and chicken.  They have the most diverse AYCE menu out of all of the sushi spots I've been to in Vegas.  However, they do have a lot of rules such as only one half-roll order per person, one dessert, and a number of menu options that are restricted to one order.  Their service was also friendly and excellent.  Overall a great place for AYCE that is clean, has plenty of seating, modern / trendy, and open late as well.
Not sure whether if they changed ownership since the last visit, the fish on the sushi's order gotten smaller otherwise, it's similar to last time.

I can't wait til my next Vegas trip so that I can come back! I loved the variety and the fact that we can get oysters, uni, soft shell crab, and ribeye!  (One serving per person under the AYCE menu).  The fish was fresh and we left very satisfied. Forget the strip's buffets, I would rather come here. Such a great price for great variety!  Absolutely gem!  Did I tell you I love this place?

I have been to Umiya a couple of times for dinner and a few times for lunch. I prefer going there for lunch since it's not as busy and the staff is a lot more attentive. The sushi and non-sushi items are always fantastic. The inside is cozy, well decorated and they have neat music videos playing which I enjoy watching. This a great place for AYCE sushi and a la carte.

Great staff!  Super attentive.  Awesome selection.  I let them order for me on the AYCE menu, food was prompt and the selection was SWEET!  I'll be back every night while I'm here at he Palms hotel.  If you are in the area don't miss this gem.

The food was good but service was terrible. Not once did they check on my table, the servers did refill our drinks but, they didn't even ask if we wanted a refill. Our server was rude and uninformative. When I was done and ready to leave I had to ask for the check three times. Then instead of having one charge for left overs they charged every single roll that had left overs.  I waited at lest 20 minutes just for my check. Everything was very slow and the atmosphere wasn't enjoyable.
fresh sushi and great service! pricing $21 for lunch, not bad! I also love their sushi rolls and grilled items. great AYCE sushi place. We've been there twice already!
Love the place. Salmon lover roll is soooooo good here - a must try. The service is good too - fast and welcoming. We get there at least once in 2 weeks and never disappointed.

This place has great taste and great portions! All you can eat available!!! Although it was mildy busy and there was a line for tables we were seated immediately at the bar :) The food came quickly and the fish was super fresh! Waiters were attentive and happy. My teriyaki chicken roll was and entire entrée in a bowl with veggies; unexpected and DELICIOUS! Being well accustomed to Koreatown Ramen, Las Vegas tonkatsu Ramen did not meet our standards but not so say someone else won't love it!

Sushi is decent.  Service could calm down a little.  As soon as I am done with a dish, a waiter jumps out of nowhere to ask if I am done with the dish.  The constant interruption of a waiter asking to take an empty plate really kills the mood.  No kidding...as I am "finishing" a plate of food, three waiters with 2 minutes asked if I was finished with my plate. NO, I am not.  Was there a shortage of plates?  Jeez.

Discovered this place ten days ago and I've already been twice for AYCE as well as ordered to-go twice. Amazing food, awesome selection, and the customer service is on point. One of the best AYCE menus in Vegas. Absolutely no complaints.

In Vegas for a vacation with family and friends. We were trying to find a good buffet and saw the reviews for umiya. It did not disappoint. We Had a great meal! Fast service from both Sean and Ron and good quality for an all you can eat! They're awesome!

Service and cleanliness is a thumbs up on this place, food i could rate as perfect for a ayce sushi. Price is fair and square! Will definitely come back for more! Hate comparison but this is my new place for ayce sushi in replacement for hikari!

The food was great. Can't deny. I couldn't stop eating.  Definitely one of my new favorite spots!!! All out servers were great except one... He wouldn't make eye contact with any of us and rolled his eyes when we were trying to order.   Then when our order came it was missing something.  but everything else was great!

This is the best all you eat Sushi in Vegas, good selection, some of the more expense item sweet shrimp (ami ebi) are limited to 2 per customer.  But good fresh sushi.  Can't beat for just $26.95 for all you can eat good sushi

Quality of sushi was ok.
I've been to very good sushi places like sushi oTa in San Diego and this place is like McDonald's compared to that.

We opted for their all you can eat option and the only thing worth it was the uni and amaebi. The other items were mediocre. They brought us yellow tail that was not fresh at all. I understand this is a desert but if fish looks like it's processed you shouldn't be serving it.

Although you can eat your hearts content the quality is sub par. If you don't care for quality then the AYCE is for you, but I wouldn't return even if I were from Vegas area.
I found my new favorite sushi spot! I've been here 3-4 time now & have not been disappointed. Awesome service & delicious food. I'm so happy I found this place.
