I've had an incurable craving for all you can eat sushi on a Vegas trip and this might be the best  place to go.

Affordable, high quality and fun. Umiya sushi ended up being a double visit the last time I visited Las Vegas.

The fish was fresh, the rice was nicely prepared, and the value for money left a great impression.

I will be back on my next visit... I might just fly down for a sushi and casino party!

Terrible customer service, they do not know how to handle busy nights. Very very bad and rude customer service, employees do not know how to handle busy nights , quoted 30 min wait time waited over an hour, no problem I get it they are busy mistakes happen, but very upsetting when they seat other parties who arrived way after us and say that " it's more convenient if we seat the smaller parties first and wait for a bigger table to open instead of combining the smaller tables ". There so called "manager " aka "jay Kim " came up and started mocking my group because we where upset. There solution was to seat a group of 7 on a table that seats 4 people until we started to complain about that, then eventually after waiting and waiting where seated on a table a table that seats 7 . ( after over an hour of waiting). So sad that there food is good but the employees are terrible and very rude !!!!! Just save yourself the headache and hassle and just go to OYSHI SUSHI OR I LOVE SUSHI INSTEAD OF THIS SHITTY AS PLACE. Trust me this place has gone down the drain, and be careful of there "manager" jay Kim what a complete asshole.

AYCE spot in Vegas, family wanted some sushi on Christmas day. Found this place online and away we went. 
Place had a modern, cozy feel with wooden decor that was like benches and not seats. We were told an hour wait, but got in at 30 in a 6 seater when we had 7. They made it work for us and we got to eating. Everything came quickly even though it was packed house, and service was great. The sushi quality was a B+ with most things fresh for an AYCE. There was  one HUGE red flag in the sushi. The Uni (sea urchin) was complete garbage. It was fishy, smelled like it was old and tasted awful. They limit certain things to one per person, and the uni was one of them. But it was thw worst thing I have ever tasted. It was the only reason this place did not get a 5 star. Other tha  that, great place.
I'd go here over and over again. Best place for AYCE! Customer service is awesome. Love the set up of the restaurant. So clean and welcoming.
All time favorite sushi spot!!! They have a wide variety of all you can eat or even single dishes. Always fresh and service is on point. I would highly recommend

Super stoked I discovered this place. My favorite sushi is Mizumi at the Wynn but sometimes its just such a hassle to get to the strip, Ive been needing a groovy lil local spot to love. So yeah visited this spot on like a Tuesday night I think? It was packed and there was a 15 min wait so my friends and I went to coffee bean to kill what little  time we had. One of my friends brought his coffee in with him and the staff told him no outside food allowed. Which is annoying, but understandable. My friend kind of threw a fit and the staff remained really calm and collected which I admired. My friend apologized later for his episode about the coffee, and to my amazement the staff was sweet and cordial with us throughout the night. Really groovy ambiance as well. Definitely a cool place to bring friends and I don't do AYCE sushi because that sounds horrifying and cheap to me but the sushi was actually good.

Service is good and fast. Nigiri is mediocre but fish portions are small. The oyster was okay. One order per person. Uni was good. The miso is good too-not too salty. Michu is included so a plus. The soft shell crab was good so was the seared ahi with AJ sauce. Overall, not bad.

The sushi here tastes fresh! One of my favorite things about coming to this sushi spot is that they don't drench their sushi (nigiri) with sauces. The fish tastes fresh and not fishy. A small dab into your soy sauce with wasabi and it's good to go!

Been a little while since the last sushi exploration.

This place wasn't too far from home and had great reviews, so it was a no brainer.

Appetizers: Baby Octupus Skewer, Bacon Scallop Skewer, Tuna Poke, Mushroom boy, and Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna.

All delicious. Highly suggest them all.

Mushroom boy is a deep fried mushroom filled with cream cheese and spicy tuna. No further explanation necessary.

On to the rolls.....

Philly Roll, Hawaiian Roll, Chicken Teriyaki Roll, and Vegas Lasagna.

Normally, there'd be another roll and 2-3 nigiri orders but. We tapped out. Today our bellies could not withstand AYCE as usual. But it's all good. We'll be back for sure to try everything else we missed!!

The service was very quick and on cue. Always ready to serve you and refill your drinks and take your plates.

Ambiance is laid back and cool. Love the bar and how big it is. Plenty of space for the 96 rolls you're gonna order.

They have some amazing sauces on their stuff, and just enough.

They have the news and sports on while playing top 40/EDM

Not my #1 place, but it's a great sushi option. And REALLY good for groups.

The service was fine but I got food poisoning. Exactly 4 hrs later I was sick and vomiting all morning. I thought I was going to die. Seriously!!! I ate the soft shell crab appetizer and it was tasty but obviously not clean.

Best sushi in town.Period...
Long list of sushi and nagiri too choose from.Always delicious and fresh.
The bad thing there always a long waiting line.In weekends evenings it could be an hour.Place is popular.
Mine and my boyfriends favorite place to go eat sushi in Vegas !! It's literally so good each time we go there to eat no matter how packed it gets at times !

The sushi is good and they offer other items with the ayce. The store is kept semi clean, they don't really clean underneath the tables. There were noodles and rice on the ground so I had to keep my feet up the whole time so my shoes wouldn't get dirty. The service is ok. Some of the servers are friendly and some are extremely rude. my experience with the server is that they never stopped by to ask if we were ready to order and then never checked up on us to order more after we finished our food we had to keep asking other servers to order. On top of that we had to hunt our server down to get our check. Overall the service was bad and the food was good. Guess you can't have both here.

I can understand a lot of the reviews here. As far as my experience is concerned, I think 3 stars is fair. But, I'm leaning more towards 2.5 stars.

This place used to be the old sushi Kaizen. Never been to that one so I would have nothing to compare it too.

Came here with a pretty large group, and suffice to say, the service was excellent. The server did a great job taking the orders and made sure that each person got the correct dish, even while she was taking care of other tables as well. I also liked how we were able to order from the runners and bussers when she was busy.

Food wise, everything was mediocre to OK. One thing I had to mention was that the rice wasn't really good, it tasted like it had been refrigerated or undercooked. It was weird. The fish quality tasted average at best. As many of people have mentioned, they make the rolls and nigiri pretty fast here, but presentation isn't really their strong suit. And, they are pretty heavy handed with the sauces. I did like the chicken katsu roll, something that I have never had before. But, don't be fooled by the miso or tonkatsu ramen that is on the menu. It isn't late night Goyemon's. I ordered the miso ramen and it was their regular miso soup with instant ramen noodles LOL.

I definitely like trying new AYCE sushi spots. But at this place, I would have to probably have to put it in my mid to lower range spots.

Best sushi place in town.   The food was excellent as well as the service we received from all the staff.   Tony was our server and he was so efficient taking our orders.    Must try items:  scallop skewer, seafood dynamite, Vegas Lasagna, rib eye steak, and many more.    There was nothing on the menu that we didn't like.  Dinner price is 25.95 per person well worth it.  

  Would definitely recommend and return to this all you can eat sushi.

What can I say but yummmmm.... :) Over all great place for AYCE.  No long waits for a table, service is quick and attentive, and food comes out fast. Everything on the menu is available for all you can eat, unlike some places that have a separate AYCE menu.  There are also the standard exceptions of a few items that you can only get one order per person.  

I usually habit Goyemon, but wanted to try something different today. I dragged a few friends along, and this place really hit the spot for everyone. Fish was really fresh. We had giant clam, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters, baked mussel, yellow tail, salmon, soft shell crab, a bunch of rolls.... And much more. They were all delicious! Definitely would recommend the Snow White roll, the spicy tuna rice cracker and the Seared tuna with AJ sauce.  The spicy garlic edamame was great too.

Only complaints are that the agedashi tofu did not have much broth - basically fried tofu with a little sauce on it, and the ahi poke had too much sesame oil that you could barely taste the fish.  Also, drinks are not included.  I had to pay extra for hot tea ($1.75).   And they were out of a few dishes like yellow tail collar and scallops.  Also limited to one dessert per person and no stamp cards.

Despite my complaints, the menu is all encompassing and I will likely be back to try more dishes.
Servers were very attentive and helpful. Great atmosphere & great selections!  New fave sushi spot!

I've done the AYCE both times here. The service is okay. Half empty and wasn't on top of their game.

I would compare the food to the company I had while eating here. It's a tease. The apps, nigiri, and rolls look great. When you taste them, some are good while some are bad. The bad makes you want to stop but the good keeps you wanting more.

Real talk.

We ate here last
Minute. This was the only place open late on a Sunday and I'm glad that we ended up
Here. The vibe is modern and comfortable. Very spacious and the food is more than bomb. The Lisa Lisa roll is a must! I would definitely eat here again esp since I visit monthly.

I found my new favorite sushi restaurant!! (once again) Most of my previous experiences in sushi places in Vegas were pretty good, but the ones with really good sushi lacked in choices for appetizers or good appetizers with bad sushi. Sometimes it would be good sushi in a run down place. 

Umiya has it all! Really good choices in appetizers, amazingly fresh sushi ( a la carte fresh!), trendy indoor decor, and friendly staff! 

It seems like there is always one person in a large group does not like sushi. No worries! With so many choices in appetizers, and a lot of non-sushi items, your group can have a pleasant dinner without someone going hungry. 

For all you sake lovers, chef Alex has many exotic sake from all over in Japan that will suffice your thirst. Chef Alex is very picky when it comes to purchasing his fish and you will be very pleased with the quality of your food.

2 stars for the simple fact that I have eaten here a couple times and the sushi is always really good, however when i ordered takeout that was not the case as the sushi got me sick. I've experienced better and won't be back for a while. disappointed.

Came here for a birthday dinner... This got so ridiculous that I wondered if they were trying to upset us. First they said we didn't have a reservation. Then they found it and apologized that it was accidentally made at 6am instead of 6pm. Then there was drama about chairs and how we weren't allowed to have as many as we needed? And the whole time the host is being so aggressive and yelling at us... this was my first time here and it will be my last.

Whenever we're in town, we love coming here to satisfy our sushi craving. This place is awesome. Everything taste so fresh and delicious. And the all you can eat sushi is a great deal. So much to choose from. And their service is great. All the servers are so nice  and they are fairly quick. Next time your in Vegas, stop by here. It's in a strip mall next to Palms Place. Highly recommend.

Umiya has always been one of my go to spots for great sushi within the area. Never really had any complaints except for my last experience. They were short staffed, didn't check in with us very often, and from time to time they would forget a couple orders. Even though these acts are forgivable due to past experiences, I feel that if you set a specific standard through each and every visit, you should always follow through with that high standard. I will in the future give Umiya another shot, but hopefully my next experience will be better than my last.

Umiya is such a great place for some sushi loving time! The fish is so good and fresh! The service is so good and the waiters are so nice! Honestly I am going to come here again whemever I visit Vegas. Totally worth it!

OMG!! So my man and I came in last night and let me tell you... Amazing!! We had AYCE dinner and came in around 9pm, the room was packed with a single table in the middle, and  we were sat down immediately, and given menus. We ordered water and got right into ordering. 

For AYCE dinner you cannot beat the price, 50$ for two and we ordered way more than 50 dollars worth!! The service 10/5 all dirty plates were picked up as soon as we got done, our table was cleared all night long and we were there for two hours! 

The servers work as a team (we think) since they were all so helpful and working together it was for sure a well oiled machine! the sushi was great size, perfect amount of rice, and cut nice we loved every thing we ordered!! My man has said it's now his new favorite spot! 

Keep this service up!! Its a rarity!

I definitely got my money's worth here for $26.95 AYCE it is totally worth it here! A couple friends and I wanted to check this place out for dinner-- and we were ALL glad we did. 

As everyone has been saying, they do have a large selection of appetizers, BUT I feel like most AYCE sushi restaurants do now-a-days, such as Oyishi

What I can say that stood out was the fact that they had skewers in their AYCE and man did we order a bunch of the bacon wrapped scallop skewers. They were A-MAAZING. They put a little too much eel sauce on it, but I got over that quickly. 

We also ordered the ** seared tuna sashimi with AJ sauce** totally recommend this. So zesty with flavor. Too bad it's only 1 order per person, but that's the reason why. womp womp womp. 

Baked mussels were alright, when they reached us, they weren't super hot. 
I didn't like the fresh oysters we got, they tasted really fishy and straight from the ocean. But hooray they are included in the AYCE. 

I really like crispy rice, the texture is so chewy and crisp, I love it. They have a crispy rice tuna appetizer, which I loved so much, that we ordered 2 orders of it. 

We ordered a TON of sushi rolls. They were all made to perfection. Baked rolls were  baked perfectly and delivered hot. While the regular rolls weren't wrapped with too much sushi and were bite size and they looked like they were delicately rolled. 

I recommend getting the **snow white roll** and the **orange blossom roll** 

I also ordered a mackerel at the end of all of our sushi roll rounds which was a mistake because it was a hearty portion. They give you the WHOLE mackerel. 

Dessert option is kinda bleh, as you only get ONE from the entire dessert list. It's your average dessert list from sushi restaurants (ie: tempura ice cream, mochi, etc)

I have been to this place for 5 times, and the recent one was just last week.  Got to give Umiya a 5-star because they never disappoint me.
The fish is always fresh, service is great, and the orders always come correct (some places give you less/more than you actually order).  Their daily special is a plus.
I tried lunch, dinner and late night supper there and always leaving with a full stomach and a big smile with my wife and kids.
One of the best AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas.

Super good food
Super cheap
How can anyone not give five stars ?  
Eel is good 
Uni is the best!
My family and me LOVE THIS PLACE! Been here many times and my son LOVE IT! Definitely come to get the all you can eat it is so worth it!!!

The waiters are fast and courteous. 

However my friend went for the AYCE sushi and got sick.  It's not amazing seafood, but what can you expect from a sushi restaurant in Las Vegas?  

I got the fried soba with seafood and felt fine. The entrée portions are large.   

The agedashi tofu was good.  Vegetarians have options here and may be delighted.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE service First waiter spilled a tray of water got us all wet. Then my son and I ordered 3 rolls and it took over hour to get them and whenever we asked why it takes so long nobody could answer us. Finally manager or owner came out and gave a sob story that they are too busy and our rolls take long time to cook BS it was busy but they should be used to it. Won't be back!

This place had 30+ people standing outside waiting for it to open, that's a good sign.
We walked in when they opened and sat down, the server said they were short staffed and that there would be an increased wait time, which I was fine with.

We ordered AYCE, only $20 at lunch. 
We ordered mussels, oysters, ahi, yellow tail, albacore, a few rolls, steak, and a ton of other stuff.

The sushi was small but fresh and good.
The rolls, you can order full or half rolls, were nice and really flavorful.
The meat was cooked well, and the service, despite the longer wait, was really quite great.

We sat and chatted while we ate for about an hour, no rush, and our drinks were always full.

The place was packed for the duration but it still felt nice and open.
Cool decor, and nice big wood tables for larger groups.

I would come back here 100%.
Really had a fine time and enjoyed the heck out of my food.

Visiting Vegas with hubby and we decided to eat sushi here because or all the reviews. We are very picky when it comes to sushi. Amazing sushi rolls, excellent customer service and very clean! Would come here again.

This place is fantastic! I usually stay on the strip when I'm in Vegas but I took a chance and relied on Yelp to guide me. Thankfully I was happy I found this spot. Great sushi, wonderful service and the all you can eat is a good price for the quality of food. If you get one thing from here you must get the spicy tuna salad!
Loved their sushis. We waited little bit long to have seated but it was worth it. Philadelphia sushi was my favorite. Very yummy!!!

One word bruh, one freaking word. GAAADAAAAMN.
This place so good I gave up veganism. Solid 3 day vegan streak down the toilet for the most delicious portion of ribeye steak, baby octopus, and King Ocean roll. My wife is staring at me with disappointment right now but with enough beer ill be able to blur out her face while eating some more sushi. Hidden gem here. Shoutout to everybody in this place.

Did the all you can eat and was able to try a bunch of things off their menu. Great selection. Service was okay, but I think it was our fault (they have a button on the end of the table and we never used it). Will go back next time we're in Vegas
I like this AYCE   It is now our must stop place in Vegas.  Service has been good every time.

Def lives up to the reviews on Yelp, they are the best AYCE sushi joint in Las Vegas.  Their wait staff are awesome, and the food quality is unlike other sushi restaurants in the valley. Pricing is fair and I've never been disappointed coming here over the past couple of years.

This is definitely my favorite AYCE sushi spot. If it were a little closer to home I would be here more often! The garlic tuna nigiri is delicious the fish to rice ratio is perfect. If there's anything you should take from this review, get the yum yum crab roll! We could order four of these in one sitting.

So if you read my previous review of Goyemon, this is where we came in place of the crowded. It was my first time and my sister thought I'd the place better. She was right as usual. Umiya was located in a small Japanese plaza right next to a starbucks. As soon as I walked in, the cool ambience and decor already began to soothe my hangry (hungry × angry) mood. Our server Jay was polite and got us our drinks quickly. He took our orders promptly and our first dish came out in less than 10mins! Every dish we tried was very good. Although, we didn't order many rolls because we thought it would fill us quickly, between the three of us, we ordered a lot of food. I felt like I was at an expensive course menu restaurant. I ended up having 5 courses in total with a tempura ice cream dessert. Jay probably refilled my diet coke 10 times which I appreciated as it was a seperate cost (even though with a check-in on yelp you get a free soda!). All in all, this is the evolution of Las Vegas buffets. All you can eat Japanese buffets have been popping up and all I could think was..how could the owner afford to keep this place? The quality of the food was outstanding, everything came out cooked-to-order, and service was 5 stars. The establishment was clean, the ambience would be great for a date, and also suitable for business meetings or hangover cures in the low light tents they have set up. Excellent Gem of a restaurant. I really don't understand why this joint wasn't busy while Goyemon was packed. Umiya is a few minutes from the strip and an absolute must eat in Las Vegas!

This is the best sushi place in Vegas! I've never had better rolls here too! Music is always good too  very great environment for young people and they're open late. If you're a local or tourist too and looking for a good place to eat sushi then come here.

Me and my friends were looking for a nice sushi place to and we ran across this restaurant on yelp . Our server Taylor was so sweet and friendly . Mad suggestions and had us try something new . The price was very reasonable for all you can eat and all of us enjoyed our food .

Dangggg it's hard to believe I didn't rate this place last time I was here! 

I love AYCE, but then again who doesn't!? They have a little bit of everything here! Rooks, nigiri, ramen, hot and cold appetizers and some entrees and dessert! But of course I didn't have any room for desserts....

This place is clean, hip and the staff is super friendly! Unfortunately at AYCE places, service is generally not that great.... but this place isn't one of those places. Our waitress was super cute and friendly and pretty much knew what we wanted lol. Then there was a male waiter that was almost too much. He was funny and was having a blast at his job which is alway awesome to see!

They have certain items that are only available with the dinner AYCE so we just decided to get that. I mean $5 more to get uni, salmon belly, tsubugai and much much more? Why wouldn't you!? The only sad part was that the amaebi didn't come with the fried head... but I can over look that the quality and variety that umiya had to offer!
This place was good.  Sushi quality was good and their menu was huge including rib eye steak and banana splits. Ayce

Wow, no complaints here!  I can't count how many times I have had the pleasure of dining here!  They stay open late, and that works for me!  They actually have options on the menu for those who don't want all sushi.  I love the bacon wrapped scallops (to die for)!  They have great fried and baked rolls!  Who's Your Daddy is a big favorite of mine!  The service is ALWAYS on point!  Everyone is ALWAYS in a great mood and everyone is willing to assist with All of the Tables!!  Love this place can't get enough!

I came here last night for the AYCE and I am giving it 2.5 stars overall. The place was not even half full and had quite a few employees working. Maybe the kitchen was low in staffing since it took them about 15 minutes to get a few small plates out. The service was poor since they never filled our drinks and kept forgetting our dishes/giving it to another table. You have to be careful and remember what limited items you order. They are not organized with the orders at all and tried to tell me that I had ordered the limited items already. I know I've ordered it but it didn't go to my table. Once or twice I will understand but 4 times and telling me it was delivered, I really think it's their fault now. For example: When I ordered the uni and the sweet shrimp together they would bring out the sweet shrimp and not the uni. So I asked about the order and was told it's out already. Same thing with the single baby octopus, amaebi head, 2 rolls were not received but ordered. The food was 3.5 stars. Nothing I would crave or come back for. It's just an average sushi spot. The reason why I decided to try thid spot was the 4.5 stars on Yelp. I should've known better and just stick to the spot I prefer. (kaya).

I come here every time I visit and it's always consistent with their quality of fish and other dishes. I was in a party of 4 and had sat right away on a Friday afternoon. 

Their AYCE menu has a really good selection of rolls, appetizers, and grilled food. They also have a good selection of alcohol from sake to soju, and to your hard liquors like Jameson and Makers Mark. 

 The service was fast and came to check on us every now and then to ask if everything was good. Would love to give my experience 5 stars but I felt a little unwelcomed when I was being served. I did not care so much for the underwhelming service because I was hungry. it was ending lunch when we had come in so I assumed they were all ending their shifts so they must have been tired. Not sure if their call button was working at the time or if was slow enough to be ignored by the staff, but they had no problem helping us when we flagged them down. 

Other than that, it was great! Quick, pretty good quality, sushi & appetizers & other options for AYCE for a good price. Definitely recommend when in town

Overall the sushi was very good. Atmosphere was nice and busy and really comfy. Fish was fresh and tasted very good. The only real thing I can complain about is the speed of service. At times it was 15-20 minutes before a server would show up. Even after pressing the call button multiple times. Other than that every thing about this place is excellent. One thing to point out is the fresh oysters and the size of the rolls. Oysters were excellent and tasted very good. As for the rolls they were all nicely sized without huge amounts of rice being put into them.

I'm an out of town visitor traveling for work craving sushi. Service was friendly and prompt, prices are reasonable, and the place very cozy. I ordered three of my sushi favorites - rainbow roll, salmon roll, and shrimp tempura roll. The shrimp tempura roll was great, but the other two rolls were so bland I couldn't even tell what fish I was eating. I barely touched the salmon roll and couldn't finish the rainbow roll either - I have my limits with bland food.

My favorite Japanese All You Can Eat sushi. 

Great service.  Portion is great.  Nice selection of limited items like sweet shrimp, urchin.

Surprisingly good for all-you-can-eat sushi.  I normally wouldn't even try it.  But a friend eats there often and swears by it.  He knew all the good things to order (monkey brains!) and we only got a couple of things that were bland or so-so.  Most was quite good.  Of course it's not the same amazingness as Nobu or anything.  But it's far and away above most mom and pop sushi, especially for all-you-can-eat.  I would go there again for sure.

I've had really terrible sushi before and coming from SF where the city prides itself on it's culinary skills I thoroughly enjoyed this place. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. I've done a couple of all you can eat places in Vegas but they're all relatively the same. This was awesome because if was purely sushi and fish. We checked in through yelp and got a free beverage (non alcoholic)! The garlic tuna nigiri was tasty. We also had the orange blossom, salmon killer and cinch lobster roll. Sooooo good. We also had the spicy seafood salad to start. Again, delicious. It also comes with dessert. I had the tempura green tea ice cream. Definitely going to come back next time I'm in LV.

excellent food excellent selections, many which do not appear even on LA menus and especially for all you can eat. the price cant be beat. 25 for dinner. even have mochi and tempura ice cream options too. It has been years since I have actually fell in love with a restaurant... quick game. test your servers memory. we oredered about 10 things at a time and with no paper and pen they all managed to remember and bring us the proper food. coming back for life.

When you go to an AYCE sushi place, its almost impossible to go to one that's horrible. In this case, this place is phenomenal. There are so many choices ranging from noodles, nigiri, special rolls, soups, appetizers and desserts. The rice to nigiri portion is A-ok! There is not much rice to it. My favorite is usually the Tamago (egg), and Masago (fish egg). 

The service is ok. They sometimes forget to give you the rest of the order in which you just order it again. The restrooms are kind of ghetto....... Yeah. Let's leave it like that. When you own a restaurant or business, best to make sure the restroom is presentable and smells good. Thats the one place we as customers need to go when nature calls. 

I do hope to make a return!!!

It's Friday, 5:43PM and I hope management sees this, and has a serious conversation with their employees. Rude and arrogant customer service coming in from a Hispanic girl at the front pushed us to leave. We were loyal customers and it is my LAST time here. came in and was not greeted properly, but simply asked "how many?", asked for a table for 3, and was told it was a 25 minute wait when there was no line and many tables available, asked if able to sit at the bar, and this pathetic woman simply shook her head no.She then proceed to say if we wanted to sit at the bar it had to be separate seats, we told her there was three seats together, she says we couldn't avoid them together. We left with a great DISGUST feeling about this place.
Went with three other sushi regulars and one newbie.  All enjoyed immensely.  $45 out the door despite several shared beers and sake.  I'll go back for sure.

AYCE or e la carts sushi with rolls drowned with toppings and/or sauces. If you want authentic and delicate style where you eat from the best fish downwards (i.e. Otoro) ... Skip it. 

What Japanese restaurant serves soft shell crab with sweet potato purée?! Oil needs a change. 

Least the Uni is good and service is fast.

Lastly, my fault for not reading the reviews, and based the choice on ratings alone (damn you law of averages). Had we known, we would've went elsewhere.

Service is normally great, but it goes down drastically with large groups. Baked rolls where cold, some rolls were sloppy & fell apart, I asked to pay my bill so I could leave & gave server a $100 who didn't return for 25 minute and I had to remind him to get my change.

What can I say, the place was perfect. I was there for the all you can eat lunch. Unlike all the big buffets in town they make the sushi as you order it, it's not sitting out on a lunch line. Great spot!!

It's Friday, 5:43PM and I hope management sees this, and has a serious conversation with their employees. Rude and arrogant customer service coming in from a Hispanic girl at the front pushed us to leave. We were loyal customers and it is my LAST time here. came in and was not greeted properly, but simply asked "how many?", asked for a table for 3, and was told it was a 25 minute wait when there was no line and many tables available, asked if able to sit at the bar, and this pathetic woman simply shook her head no. She then proceed to say if we wanted to sit at the bar it had to be separate seats, we told her there was three seats together, she says we couldn't push them together from the few feet away they were. We left with a great DISGUST feeling about this place.

Zakana is better. Friendly, welcoming service and better. AYCE sushi selection.

Excellent service and food. We have eaten here before but it's been a while. When we found out our usual place had closed, I made reservations here for a party of 6. Even though they were busy, they got us right in. Our server gave us suggestions and was quick and on the ball. We all had the all you can eat for 26 bucks a piece. Everything was fresh and delicious. 
They have several unique rolls but the banana roll has to be my favorite. It is a little sweet so we had it for dessert.
Disappointed because rolls were very average. Rice was super warm on all nigiri. Service from server and chefs was great though.
High quality, delicious sushi. Easily among the best in town, plus an optional all you can eat menu that doesn't sacrifice quality means this place cannot be beaten, in my opinion.

Haven't been here since they open couple years ago. Back then it was average and chosen other places for the last year, but I must say I'm glad I came back! This place took a turn way for the better! Service is exceptional from the servers to the Chiefs talking to me on his favorites to what's popular. The quality is top. The only flaw I felt here is that they over cooked my rib eye and was chewy but overall I'll keep coming back as it is my top favorites in town. 

Get the green tea ice cream! Legit! (:

This place is very good they have good quality food and is better than goyemon. They open til 2 am so they are reliable and the service is good and very fast. I don't have to wait long for my food to come out and it's never always busy so you don't have to wait long to be seated. I really like this place, I'd come here before anywhere else I would definitely recommend. They also have a check in and you get one free soda or drink

amazing. 

the rolls and the nigri come out fast and are delicious

they have other offerings on their AYCE menu such as bacon-scallop skewers, small cuts of ribeye, oysters (2 per person) udon noode soup, miso soup among many others

they do have an obscure waiting list.. they tell you much more time than you actually have to wait. 

it's worth it.. i consider this place much better than its competition of goyemon, kaya and jjanga

this is an elite ayce experience

Pretty good.  .  Located off of flamingo, it is convenient to that too, and right next door to a Japanese mini mart! The Ambiance is nice, welcoming and very busy. I can see why they're all you can eat sushi menu is deep, and cheap. Lots of different choices, and I believe it was only $25 for dinner. The sushi was good nothing blew my mind, to be honest my favorite part about my meal was the Yuzu lemonade. Yum! I would be back for sure, but with all the competing sushi places in town, it might not be for a while.
Best AYCE Japanese ever! Great sushi, fast service, gigantic selection. My favorite dishes were salmon egg sushi, masago egg sushi, uni sushi, ribeye steak, and grilled mackerel. Will come again!

My favorite sushi place to come to while in Vegas! Everyone is constantly checking on you and asking if you want to order anything else. It's open late night and it's all you can eat sushi for a really cheap price! The workers their are all friendly and nice, definitely someplace everyone should go to!

This was my first time here and I definitely won't be coming here again. I went here for my friend's birthday party, expected it to be a good place because of the nice ambiance. I was wrong. 
Almost everyone got AYCE. After the waiter took our order, we waited for a long time for our food to come out. Besides our table, there were about 4 other small tables. Not so busy. One of us ordered Chicken Katsu, he waited 40 minutes for it to come out while the rest of us ate our sushi. It should not take that long for them to make chicken katsu unless they had to hunt a chicken down, skin it, THEN cook it. The service was terrible, the quality of the sushi seemed like they pre cut it. I tend to stay within my usual ayce sushi places but since this was for my friend's 20th birthday we all tried it out. 
The only reason why I'm not giving it a 1 star because of this one waiter, unfortunately I didn't get his name but he looked Korean and he had a cross necklace. He was the only waiter who provided us with good service. The other workers had attitude and one female worker with red hair accidentally hit my friend on the head with a plate and he did not get an apology. This place is NOT worth going to.

We had a going away / birthday get together last night at this place and i was overly impressed with the customer service, quality of food, prompt service, and cleanliness of the establishment. I have frequented many sushi restaurants around town and nationwide and have to say this is the best I've ever been to. We were seated as soon as our party arrived. The waitress was quick to take our drink order. As she was doing this, another server came to take our food order. I really need to become better at getting the servers names. There was just such a team effort and they were all moving so fast that it was difficult to pinpoint one. 
The food began to present itself and they did not miss a beat. We had a table of 9 and not one item was missed. I have a habit of letting everyone order before me as a courtesy. That tends to get my order last and by that time, everyone has already eaten. It was a pleasant surprise to receive my food so that I could enjoy it with the rest of the party. The faster we ordered, the quicker the staff brought our food. The drinks never dried up and I was pleased with the overall experience. I will certainly become a regular here if they can keep this level of greatness. I will highly recommend this place to many other friends and family. I also work in a medical office where our patients constantly ask for new places to eat. Keep up the great work and i hope to see you all soon.

Really good food and service was great. Would definitely recommend this place to my friends that come up to Vegas from Hawaii. I really enjoyed the poke. It had a lot more flavor than some of the poke back in Hawaii

My 1 at time here and the Food was ok for AYCE, but service super suckkkkkkkkk (at least my waiter with the red hair is suck)
This place got like 5 tables when we walk in & still they're forget my order, 4 times !!!! 
We might come back and give this place another chance !!!

Hands down the best customer service I've ever received. Absolutely loved that they offered half rolls. And they have a fancy button that allowed me to summon the waiter as soon as I was ready to order more! Good for the whole family!

A place for tasty sushi under the all you can eat option. Most of the sushi that I tried was delicious. There are some rather bland options my girlfriend chose, but the rolls that I got for myself (Spicy Tuna Roll, King of the Sea, Firecracker Roll) were pretty good. I also sampled my girlfriend's Hawaiian Rolls which is definitely interesting, and that's what I'm a fan of: interesting experiences. The staff was eager to take care of us, and our seating area was totally fine. I'll be back to try some more of the non-sushi items.
This is the only place I will and can eat sushi. They have great super friendly service. This is where I take any one of my family members when they ask about sushi.

Hands down the best sushi experience I've had in Vegas. This is the place I've been looking for! The AACE was amazing. The service was SO fast - the miso soup came before we even finished our first order. They put a little buzzer on the table so you can ring them when you want more. Many times though, they'd notice us looking at the menu again and would come over before we even needed to hit the buzzer. Everyone was extremely attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back and will recommend this place to all of my friends.

This has been one of the best all you can eat sushi places i have been too. Not only they have sushi but you can also order steak, chicken teriyaki, soup, noodles and also dessert all included in the all you can eat price.

1st of all the price for lunch was not outrageous considering we opted to pay for the all you can eat sushi..
love the no rice sushi, me & hubby are a big fan of that and definitely will order it again..
the service was awesome, made us feel welcome on our 1st try of this place..
we give it a  for the overall rating..

First of all, sushi chef greeted us once we came in which is always a good sign. The waitress forwarded us to a good seating area in the back. Nice lighting. 

The shrimp tempura my gf ordered was really tasty and it was crunchy just how I like it.

I ordered the baked salmon roll and it was so good! A little too much on the sour cream though, which was alright. I had also ordered baked mussels which I can't get enough of. Definitely coming back!

This is always one of my go-to dinner spots when I come to Las Vegas. I always order from their all-you-can-eat menu and I always leave 100% satisfied. Everyone always welcomes you when you arrive and when you leave and the service is up to par. I would definitely recommend this place if you have a big appetite and are craving a variety of sushis and Japanese foods.
Everything was delicious! The place has a great ambiance and the chef/owner is really nice!  Definitely coming back!
I recently discover Umiya and its one of my favorite sushi restaurant now. Everyone is very friendly. Fast service, everything is delicious. The fresh oysters are awesome.

I initially blew off Umiya due to the location. It's so close to the Strip, I figured half the high ratings were due to tourists from landlocked midwestern cities trying AYCE sushi for the first time without any frame of reference. A friend pulled me aside and told me to check myself, and insisted I go try it ASAP.

And the reviews are right, this place is awesome. I'm happy to eat my words, along with a large assortment of apps, small plates, grilled items, skewers, nigiri, rolls, and desserts. The menu has nearly anything you could ask for, and everything was done well from the baby octopus skewers to the macaron desserts and all the sushi rolls in between. The rolls, and particularly the sauces, are where they stand above the crowd of other options in Vegas- try anything with the unique tangy sauce. Favorite rolls include the King of the Ocean and the Orange Blossom.

The tasty food comes with funky izakaya style decor and incredibly attentive service: they use a team approach, so anyone nearby will ask if you want to add any orders. Dishes were whisked away within seconds of the food atop them being consumed, drinks never got less than a two thirds full, sushi came out within a couple of minutes of being ordered, and everyone had a great attitude and a smile. 

In a city with so many sushi options that come and go or vary based on who is working behind the counter, Umiya is my new go-to. Whether you are going with traditionalists who order nigiri exclusively or those who love rolls or even one of those weirdos who don't like sushi at all, this spot will satisfy them all.

Best deal ever! Way better than any other all-you-can-eat sushi spot I have been to. Go after 3 pm to spend $5 more and get a few dinner-only items. We went on a Tuesday at 3:30 and it was empty - our orders went in and came out quickly.  We had 2 large Sapporos and kept it under $80 with tax and tip. Crazy deal in a city where a Casino hamburger in $16.

This was my first time at this place on the night of 11/29/16. And I must say this place was outstanding. The service was great and fast and staff was friendly. Our server was named RON. He was excellent. This place ended up being the best all you can eat sushi ive ever had. Ron was very friendly, courteous and knew the menu very well. I asked him some recommendations on some sushi that was spicy. He recommended several dishes, and every one was great. He kept checking in on our table to see if we needed anything or wanted to order more dishes. This guy was the best server ive ever had at a sushi restaurant. Every dish I had was good. I was not disappointed with any of my food or service that we got. I will definitely visit this place again. I think I found my favorite sushi... and that is Umiya

This sushi restaurant has such good quality food I mean it's open late and it's never that busy so you can be seated right away and get your food fast! Unlike goyemon ugh literally I'd have to wait like 30-40 mins every single time I go to goyemon and honestly their food isn't that great of quality I mean their mussels are kinda nasty. This is the first sushi restaurant in Vegas where their mussels were so delicious I finished the whole thing. Their rolls are pretty dang good too. They even have a check in that gives you one free soda and they allowed us to get lemonade for it so that was pretty amazing too. I came here just because goyemons wait was like 30-40 mins and umiya was not busy at all, their price for all you can eat is $25 and a few rolls can fill you up quickly plus their fish was so fresh so good. Plus the portions are a bit bigger too. I loved it. I mean next time I'm coming here to eat I don't know why goyemons so hyped this place is the place you should go. definitely coming back here again
Another great sitting and food at this location. Sushi is fresh and service is great! Been here many times the past 3 years and never have had a problem! Great prices for AYCE

Not the best tasting or freshest sushi I've ever had. It is in Vegas and far away from the ocean so u can't expect the catch of the day. Wasn't too expensive. I checked in and was supposed to get a free drink but I still got charged. Whatever, prob won't be going back. Might just stay in my casino n hit up a buffet n avoid the detour.

I wanted to try a new sushi spot for AYCE sushi and this place popped it. Boy did I strike gold! I am so glad that I came across this place. I usually frequent Sushi House Goyemon whenever I have that sushi craving but this one is up there with it. There are somethings that are done better here than over there and vice versa but Umiya was a pleasant surprise. They have a huge selection and have a 90 minute time limit.

Highlights:
Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna - OMG can I say that this was one of the best crispy rice and spicy tuna combos I have ever had. The rice was perfectly crispy and didn't overwhelm the spicy tuna. The Spicy tuna was perfect and had the right taste - I could taste the freshness of the fish.  I had two orders of these because they were THAT good.

Nigiri, Salmon and albacore - the fish was super fresh and exactly what I expected. They didn't overdo the rice like they do at other places so I am thankful for that. 

Agedashi Tofu - THE BEST AGEDASHI TOFU I'VE EVER HAD. Yes, I had to put that in all caps to emphasize how good it was. I had 4 orders. You heard that correctly. I know this is a sushi place but they do all of their other non-sushi dishes so well! The broth was delicious and the batter was light and crispy while the tofu was silken and melted in my mouth.

Spicy Tuna Salad - large chunks of tuna in a spicy sauce mix. Delicious! Too bad you can only order 1 of these per person.

The only negative thing I would have to say about this place is that they have more dishes that are only 1 per person (desserts, some sushi items, etc) than Goyemon and that they don't do half rolls (so I can't try as many rolls as I would if I were to go to Goyemon). Other than that, they are on par with other AYCE sushi places and I will definitely be coming back!

We came here with a party of six and ordered a huge variety from all you can eat dinner menu.  Everything was fantastic.  The servers were fast and responsive.  We ordered plate after plate of sashimi and it all tasted fresh. There was absolutely nothing on the menu we didn't like besides the Uni (but we only ordered it to gross out our non sushi eating friends.  Seriously, it would be nasty anywhere).  The place was packed which is always a good sign for sushi.  The bench and table seating was very comfortable. This place is spot on across-the-board.  I would highly recommend it to anyone.
Excellent.  Bathroom is pretty gross; no glory holes.  Sushi is delicious...very fresh, all-you-can eat for $25.99, free pint glasses.  Definitely worth stopping-in!!!!   Free ice cream too!

****WARNING food POISONING****

December 31st, 2015 at 4pm I walked in for all you can eat and absolutely did not appreciate my waitress's sassy attitude... After being seated she left us with the menus not asking if we wanted hot tea or water... 5 minutes later I wanted to leave once another customer opened the entrance door directly behind me I felt a cool breeze. I was at discomfort first the terrible greeting, no beverages, uncomfortable wooden chairs and negative feng shui. 

As I was waiting patiently and browsing through their menu my waitress came back asking if we were ready to order. Um sure how about I start off with my free drink please. I asked for green tea she said" cold "I said "hot" she said "how about cold "so I said "okay cold" assuming that the hot green tea is free refills... 

She then took down our order I got done with the first stage, went to the restroom and started throwing up. They forgot a couple of things I asked for and waited as I was receiving my second stage of order, I started to get very sore stomach ache after eating their hamachi and orange flower. I absolutely did not enjoy their sushi with any fish on it because it was NOT fresh... I should have stopped ordering knowing the fact my stomach was sore. Went to the restroom again then came back to my table and I'm not even half way done with my cold green tea she asked "would you like a refill" I said "actually may I get hot green tea I'm not feeling very well" she said "it's extra charge but I can give to you this time because you didn't know." I said "thank you".

I Drank my hot green tea as my stomach felt alittle at ease.... I finished my third stage of order because if you don't finish all of your food it is extra charge. I just felt even worse! Very sick... I spent my New Years in the hospital the entire day and night vomiting 


We all got FOOD POISONING!!!!! I am still very sick and highly do not recommend this Resturant.

We had the ayce and I thought everything was decent but I still like sushi house goyemon's ayce as they have more of a selection to choose from.  The interior of this restaurant is beautiful and modern though.

My wife and I's new favorite joint! 

This is probably our 4th/5th visit and every visit has been phenomenal. They have great variety, love their tuna, white tuna, salmon, red snapper, baked muscles, etc etc... so much yummmm in this place.

There are 2 things i really love about this place.

1- call/service/receipt button located at the end of the table.

2- friendly and fast service. Every time ive been here they are always fully manned. During my last visit, which was a saturday night.. there had to be at least 5 chiefs at the sushi bar and at least 6-8 waiters running around. 

Can't wait to go back! 

I

I really dont like trying out new sushi places especially if the group going is in the double digit numbers. For one too many people make a lot of issues with the wait staff as well as the kitchen. Sushi is a made to order type of dining experience and is best with just a handful of people. So far off the top of my head there's one place *cough*GOYEMON*cough that can handle an entire private room full of diners and not miss a single order as well as another *cough*KOMA*cough* where the waitress will go out of her way to remind and boss the sushi chefs to push the orders and correct mistakes. 

So this was Chad's UYE and he threw up a whole bunch of recommendations on what we should all try out with the AYCE menu. Sure this sounds great and all but....

Problem is i didnt receive over half of the initial order i put in the beginning, eventually one out of many came but it was so late in the game i didnt really care about it any more. As for the others such as the oysters and the baby octopus...i guess they've gone through the doorway into Narnia out to take the one ring to Mt Doom before the Death Star blows up the planet because they sure as hell weren't anywhere in front of me or anywhere near me...

Service was...typical of any Asian restaurant. For being known as a hard working people, servers are fucking lazy...When we tell you in the beginning we want SEPARATE CHECKS it doesn't mean put everything one bill and let us play the 'oh well on the back of the receipt we put our names and how much we want charged to the card. oh wait we dont know how to divide up the service charge, the tax and everyone's individual drinks...oh my god this is getting complicated'. Server offered to split everything up and brought us back SEPARATE checks with all the tax and mandatory 18% all split up. Wow thanks bro you brought us what we originally asked for after you determined what a pain in the ass it was bringing an undivided check...Stupid of us to ASK for SEPARATE checks in the BEGINNING. 

Drinks were okay, I had 3 Sakeinis which our server assured me was on the buy two get one free deal and they were. The best tasting was the Lychee one. Perfectly balanced between booze and Lychee flavor. The Peach and Pineapple were so bland and tasteless i might as well been drinking a bud lite. Not to say that both these drinks tasted like bud lite, i just mean there was no harmony no balance between the natural or artificial flavors of the fruit to match or complement the flavored sake they used.

As far as everything else food-wise i dont know i just dont know at all. Over half the things i ordered never got delivered. Most of dining experience was grabbing bits and pieces from others around me. Noticeably the spicy yellowtail hand roll was absolutely amazing when i first ordered it. They did it Goyemon style where it was chunks of yellowtail with spicy sauce drizzled all over it. It was so good or i havent had one in so long what ever it was pretty damn good so i decided to order another which was on par with the first as well as a spicy tuna hand roll. Wow the tuna was an epic fail in my opinion. Both the yellow tail and tuna were ordered as hand rolls, both were ordered spicy...yet two VERY different things were delivered other than the type of fish. As stated before the yellowtail was cubed and had sauce poured on top. The tuna was...minced into a paste with hot sauce and visible chunks of chilies in the mix. Totally not what i was expecting and was a bit spicier than i was willing to put up with. Good thing LJ was around...Big up to LJ!!

For the most part a lot of the nigiri was decently fresh especially the yellowtail.

Overall...i dont know I wanna give this place another chance by coming back with a considerably smaller group...but...i know other places that do a considerably better job. 

Oh and dont get drunk here or try to get drunk here you might die of massive liver failure. 


Yelp 100 - 012 of 100
Sorry Chad...

I haven't been here recently so my review will be based on my experienced when I brought my grand daughter and niece. I always recommend to seat at the sushi bar, because that's where all the magic happens.

Sushi chefs who assisted us before are no longer on this location which is a bummer. I've heard that they went to another location or the sister company I'm not really sure. But they are amazing and provides you an excellent service.

I will be biased because I love AYCE sushi and Umiya is one of my favorite. The quality of their food, the service and the place are great. So, if you like AYCE try this place and you will like it.

As far as AYCE sushi goes, I've never had better! I just wish this place was in the OC! 

My party of 10 seemed to really enjoy the food and the servers were nice even if they did forget a few things. The caterpillar roll, rainbow roll, crunchy rice roll, samurai roll were all decent. We enjoyed the seaweed salad a lot, along with salmon skin hand rolls, tempura, and multiple desserts of mochi and ice cream. :)

One of the best sushi restaurants in Las Vegas! The service is impeccable, our server was super friendly and quick. We ordered the "French kiss" roll, it was so good that we ordered it again! We also ordered "no money honey" which also tasty. I will definitely recommend this place to everyone! This is for sure my favorite sushi restaurant in LV.

Recommended this wonderful AYCE sushi joint by a resident friend. It's located in a small strip mall, but don't let that deter you from the quality inside. This little place ranks up there with some of the best AYCE I have encountered anywhere...and the $26/p is ridiculously cheap for the quality. 

The menu was very extensive, the quality was exceptional and the food came fast...like 3-minutes from ordering to your table fast! Plus their waiters were very attentive and would constantly check in on you if your plates were getting empty. 

I don't give 5-Stars often, but this place deserves it! Check them out!
This place is awesome!! Great price for AYCE and the sushi is delicious! Really nice staff, perfect late night joint for people who work near the strip

I honestly read all these reviews but I have to say I really enjoyed this place! I had by far the best service by I forgot his name but he has THUG tattooed on his arm. Sit with him at the sushi bar he takes amazing care of you! I hope I don't get food poisoning here next time I come but I didn't have any problems just a week ago!

My husband and I have been here so much they essentially know our order. Almost every single person on the staff has been so kind to us every visit. Their food is phenomenal and quick. There is nothing bad we could say about this place.

I decided to come here after a meeting at church with a few girlfriends.  They spoke highly of it and I can never turn down sushi so I obliged. Upon walking in we were greeted in a prompt manner and sat immediately.  Our server asked if we wanted the all you can eat option and neither of us girls wanted to grub too crazy so we just ordered a few rolls each. As a starter we got a miso soup and patiently waited for 2 rolls. One of them was a dragon roll and the other was a salmon salsa roll. 
15 minutes later we finally got our rolls. And just as I was getting ready to get my chopsticks ready, I noticed something a little off about my roll. I took a closer look and guess what was in my roll? A hair. I immediately called for my server and told him there was something in my roll and that it looked like a hair. He then took my plate, took a quick look at it and said that he didn't notice anything. I then pointed out the hair that was protruding out of the baked eel dragon roll and he said... oh I see it now and quickly took it away. He then said he was making me a new one but by that time I was pretty over it.  And didn't want one to replace it all. I ate my other salmon salsa roll thing and when I finished they had brought me a new eel roll but I asked them to take it back because I was kind of grossed out. 
Our server seemed sorry about it.  And he comped us a mochi that we had ordered towards the end of the meal. However, I was really thrown off. He also gave us a card that gives us 2 free drinks with the purchase of $35 or more but I highly doubt I would ever go back. With so many delicious options in vegas, this is a spot that is very forgettable.
Really? What is up with all these reviews? Food was below average service not really good, was super slow. I did not enjoy eating here at all. Will not be coming back.

Umiya is fantastic!!! Been here twice in one week for lunch.This has quickly become our new favorite sushi hangout in Las Vegas. We have tried several places, and Umiya is definately a step above the rest. The interior is warm and inviting. You are immediately greeted by the friendly hostess and sushi chef. There is seating either at the sushi bar, or traditional table seating for large groups, there is also tables available for couples. The AYCE option is the best value. Lunch is $22.95. The menu has a wide variety to choose from including lunch specials you can find their menu on usmenuguide.com/umiya-las-vegas.html. We have had different salads and starters such as Cucumber salad, Poke, Edamame(spicy or garlic spicy), Gyoza, Rib-eye steak, Japanese steak, paired with an excellent steak/teriyaki sauce, Bacon wrapped scallop skewers, marinated pork belly, and New Zealand green mussels. The Nigiri is very good, the fish is super fresh with just the right amount of sushi rice. The Rolls are simply the best I've had, because of how they are made. The rice they use is japanese sushi grade, and the chef uses just the right amount. They are rolled tight and never fall apart in your soy sauce as has been the case at other establishments. The sauces are a whole other story. Simply the best I've ever had. They are flavorful, not drenched just the right amount of sauce to compliments the roll, and use different sauces for each roll, complex in flavor and taste. Just makes you want to try everything on the menu. The food comes out fast and with excellent service. You also have 90 minutes to eat the AYCE. Most AYCE sushi restaurants only allow 45 minutes to an hour for lunchtime. Looking forward to also trying their AYCE dinner menu and sake and saketini cocktails which we haven't gotten around to yet. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try, you'll be glad you did.
Best all you can eat sushi in town! The staff are super nice and on point with everything. This is my new favorite spot in Vegas and deff will be back.

You gotta get here just to see the Alex/Pete/Eric Show, it's crazy! The sushi chefs are just one amazing thing about this place. You will love all of the reasons, though, I promise!

First, the menu is EX-TEN-SIVE. For an AYCE place to have this many choices (granted, some are 1X only) is mind-blowing. From the nigiri, to the appetizers, right on down to the mochi, you will be hoping for a second stomach by the time all is said and done. I certainly needed one!

I made the mistake of filling up on rolls instead of the fresh fish, I won't do that again. The albacore, salmon, oysters, filet, pork, octopus, whatever you want, it's delicious! The rolls were awesome too, but with such a huge selection you'll do better to keep those to a minimum. 

I did happen to ask for their hottest roll and they made one up that is now named after me (yeah, right). It was hot, spicy and delicious. I'm sorry, I ate so much last night I forgot what was in it, but I'm pretty sure it was basically seafood and avocado dipped in hot ass sauce. Whew!

The service was superb. I didn't wait for drinks or food for very long at all. I loved it! The place is also beautiful and big so bring a party, you'll enjoy the heck out of it!

I'm headed back in a few months once all this sushi is digested. Wow, ate so much. Enjoy!

Don't go here... RUN HERE!!! Literally and figuratively! Run to make room for all the amazing sushi, and run to get here as quickly as you can because this is truly a gem just off the strip. 

Located a block from Palms, this place is homey, contemporary, and above all really focused on your best experience! 

The staff was super attentive, the service was FAST, and the quality of fish was second to none!

Thanks for proving once again that someone can enjoy a variety of sushi in Vegas without having to take out a loan!!!

Pretty good AYCE sushi off Rainbow. In a sketch parking lot, but inside it is busy and full of yummy life. Sushi was pretty good, but my boyfriend and I got full fast. Service was quick and friendly, and we sat at the bar so the orders kept coming in nonstop. Loved how they had half-roll options so you could try a lot of rolls. I was really surprised by the quality and flavor of the actual fish that night. Great place!
Ate here for the first time a week ago. They have all you can eat sushi and their rolls are very good. It's probably my favorite all you can eat sushi spot now.

Ever since my friend introduced me to this place, I have been coming here with knowing that I'd always leave happy and content! The staff always greets you, and the food is fast and delicious! I recommend my friends who ask "where is a great place for sushi?"

Good sushi! Was in vegas last weekend to visit friends and the year before these friends took me to Goyemon Sushi and i loved it. This time around they insisted i try Umiya and compare it. Was not disappointed! The calamari tempura roll was my favorite. We tried a lot of the sushi on the menu as we were a big party, and needless to say we left pretty satisfied. I'm not saying Umiya is better than Goyemon, i think they are both great. It's just good to be able to try a new place in vegas that serves high quality sushi. Will be back!

Went on a Sunday afternoon and got seated right away. The staff was very attentive and got most if not all of my orders correctly. The food was amazing and they even do lunch prices on a weekend. So for $20 AYCE sushi, can't really complain about that :)

WOW. This place was on point! What a find. Ran like a fine tuned machine. Greeted at the door by entire staff. Place was very clean and modern. Great music playing in the back ground. Place was packed and service was phenomenal. Felt like they had 5 servers per table and not in a bad way. Oh ya, and the food was excellent!

Felt little expensive for a lunch, but when I think about the quality, it should be the way it is. If there were $10 half all you can eat, that would be even better. (It is just my idea.)
Except that, everything from the parking to the service to the taste.
#1 on my list when it comes to AYCE sushi!  Menu includes Udon and Ramen soup as well.

I went here with my family for lunch and it was awesome! My reason for coming here was for their "all you can eat" sushi.  My favorites were "rattle snake" and "shrimp killer".  We ended lunch with dessert. I love their tempura vanilla ice-cream.  It was interesting because it's different.  Service was excellent! They were very quick with bringing out our order. Also, this place is kid friendly.  There was free wifi so I was able to play a show for my daughter on her iPad.  They had small cups with lids available for toddlers.

I visited this AYCE restaurant; there were about 11 of us and we had some of the best customer service for a group this size.  We all passed around dishes of sushi family-style, so I had the opportunity to taste several types I would not have otherwise tried with a much smaller group. I will happily return soon.

I have been to almost every sushi restaurant in Las Vegas and this one wins the worst restaurant award. I initially said I wanted to get the all you can eat and then asked leaned that most of what I wanted to order was on the a la cart menu. They wouldn't allow me to switch over because they claimed they would have to pay tax on a voided transaction(which is incorrect). So I had to pay the all you can eat price plus everything else I wanted to order.  The service was terrible, food was mediocre. Never going back.

Great place, would definitely come again. AYCE can't beat it for lunch! Very fresh quality sushi! Even though they don't do half rolls, it is not one of those places they try to fill you up with rice. 

In the beginning, we waited a noticeable amount if time, but the owner made up for it by his charming and comical personality. The O salad was amazing. Eric also made us a special roll just for us with fried onions, tuna, and shrimp tempura.
Overall, very pleased. I'm surprised the place was so empty at a prime lunch hour.

I was originally planning on going to jjanga with my boyfriend for lunch but they were closed so we headed to umiya. I didn't regret it one bit. The presentation is super neat and the rolls never fall apart. The sushi is also very fresh, which is always a part of my expectations for sushi. The tuna naruto is one of my go to's. It's clean, refreshing, and a great roll to start off the meal since it has no rice. I'm not sure how long these items will be on the specials, but the yuzu yellowtail, salmon belly, and ocean trout are some of the best nigiri I've ever had. I love their appetizer menu! The fried softshell crab is soooo good! It comes with some kind of dijon sauce. You can only order one though so enjoy it while it lasts. They also have green tea tempura ice cream. I usually ask them for a green tea tempura ice cream banana split or I do it with the vanilla. I just let you in on a secret, so you better order it lol. Try this place out! They easily have some of the freshest fish in town.
Food was interdasting... Very interdasting.. Me likey Chinese food. Yum yum in my Tum Tum

The rice  is really what bothers me the most. They need to learn to cook sushi rice better. It was way too soft/too much water when they cook it. 

The fishes were overproduced. The kitchen helpers were seen cutting big chunk of salmons, put it on a cart, and from there cut into little strips. Not even a real chef is cutting these fishes carefully. Don't expect anything close of what you watch on Jiro. 

I hate to say it but the best part of my ACYE was the appetizers. And that's sad because it's a sushi restaurant. 

Their rolls were just ok. Nothing glorious. 
There are definitely better sushi places in Vegas. 

Probably will not come back here.
Great place. All you can eat and a great menu. Service outstanding. We sat at the bar and ate like there was no tomorrow.

AYCE! Every time I go out for sushi I make sure the restaurant has all you can eat. This place was actually pretty darn good. Everything I tried was amazing and the service is awesome as well. Very nice employees. Even the dessert is AYCE! Can't get any better than that. Many options from green tea tempura to mochi balls! I will definitely be a regular.
Excellent service dragon roll, orange blossom, spicy Tuna roll were the top best! Mochi is always the best...their bathroom though was gross
Love this place it's truly a hidden gem everyone is on punt and the food is great! Would recommend to anyone!

Just ate here for the 2nd time and again less than impressed... Nigiri has big chunks of rice with paper thin slices of fish. You can't really tell what you're eating because everything taste the same due to lack of freshness. I will not be coming here again. I can't believe it has such good reviews
I was thinking 2-3 stars. California roll was ok. Tuna and Salmon were ok. Everything else was off. I'd like my money back. 33 bucks for a bad lunch. I would like lunch on you guys.

I have had a lot of ayce, and boy this one hit the mark. Everything is good except the ono not fresh at all. I ate a whole rack of baked mussels though. Lol. O would come back for more when I'm in town.

I will admit that all these reviews lured me to this place. And I should've expected that ayce means that the sushi is decent not amazing. I was disappointed with the rice to fish ratio for the nigiri. Too much rice! Also the rice was hard and cold! The different pieces of fish itself were perfect, soft, room temp and delicious.  Some packed with explosions of flavors, but that rice killed it for me and my bf.

The baked mussels were yummy. Lots of mayo, the way I like it. You can still taste the mussels too. Some places make it so that the sauce drowns out the flavor.

Their other dishes that aren't sushi related were amazing though. That rib eye steak, the soft shell crab, chicken katsu and tonkotsu ramen were delicious. Service was really good and overall, my bf and I had our fill and left satisfied.

This is a great spot for AYCE the service was great and the food was great!! I tried the Uni first, whenever a sushi spot has fresh Uni, than I assume that the other items will be fresh as well, and yes all the fish was fresh. The rolls were awesome as well. Service was good, they were very attentive. They have this cool little call button attached to each table which leads to a wrist watch so hunting down a server was not difficult at all especially during a busy time.. Will definitely be back.

This is the best sushi in Las Vegas, not only for the food quality but also for the service. Quick, friendly service from everyone in the restaurant. The sushi is amazing especially the rolls without rice. I would eat here everyday if I could. Sit at the bar and order half rolls so you can eat more off their giant all you can eat menu.

I made reservations for 10 people on Easter not knowing how this place was and being here for Viva we were ready for some yummy food. We absolutely love the experience we sat in the corner table in the front which is perfect for our group most of us utilize the all-you-can-eat sushi for the $25 which was an amazing deal. It was such a huge selection and small portions which actually allowed people to try multiple things.

Couldn't stay away. Third time here and I'm even more impressed than the first time. 

The service was impeccable. Both the servers were attentive, prompt, and didn't miss a thing. Food was out quickly and no mistakes!

Do not miss getting the Screaming O or the AJ seared tuna. It's amazing. The AYCE menu can hurt you, so pace yourself and save room for dessert.

This is the most amazing AYCE Japanese restaurant I've ever been to!
The menu includes fancy items such as soft shell crabs, uni, oyster and etc. There is a limit on 1 per person which is reasonable. The quality and plating of the food was also super nice. 
Will definitely come back the next time I am in town!

AYCE sushi a little off strip but it was surprisingly not bad.  We stumbled upon this place on yelp.  The only drawback is you actually have to verbally tell your serve instead of marking it on paper which can be trouble if you want to order a lot. For my case, I am too embarrass to say I would love 10 order of unagi LOL You can have up to 3 round and they offer green tea ice cream as part of the AYCE dessert.
One of the best AYCE sushi restaurants. Loved the halibut, ebi, and fried soft shell crab. We especially liked the coffee mochi ice cream.

Umiya wasn't the best AYCE I've ever had, but it satisfied my sushi cravings! 

Nigiri: A majority of what I order at AYCE is nigiri. Most of it was pretty fresh! The yellowtail was subpar, but the ika, halibut, uni, salmon, surf clams, sweet shrimp, and tuna tasted fresh. The oysters are especially fresh! The one thing that I didn't like at all was the rice. It's overcooked and doesn't go well with the fish. I've noticed that many Korean-owned sushi places don't get the sushi rice quite right. 

Rolls: The roll that stood out was the Kiss of Fire roll, which is great if you're a fan of spice. 

Appetizers: The bacon-wrapped scallop and octopus skewers were pretty good! The poke was really underwhelming, but I did just get back from Hawaii. 

Entrees: The udon is pretty good, but the ramen and yakisoba are really disappointing. Both lacked flavor and the necessary consistency. 

Service: What bumped up my review from three to four stars! They're really attentive and friendly! They constantly check up on you and don't avoid you like they do at mos AYCE sushi places I've been to. 

Overall, I'm not ever really a fan of AYCE. I would rather just go to a good quality place and order a reasonable amount of food, but I enjoyed my experience at Umiya. I think it's worth trying out.

RUDE STAFF. FUNKY FOOD. UNORGANIZED. 

Right when I saw "Free mug for a Yelp review" I knew this place was a fake trap. 

When we came in, we were not noticed for a good 5 minutes. Just standing waiting for anyone to help us. 

When we were finally seated at the bar, we sat and waited for anybody to take orders for us. I asked the sushi chef if we order from him and he rudely told me he'll ask for the server. The staff were very RUDE and cold. Every time we tried to order, the guy would slam his notepad and say what do you want. They were so disorganized that they came up to us 5 times with food that wasn't ours. 

The nigiri was paper thin with a huge chunk of rice. The rice itself was so dry and tasted very off. The oysters were disgusting. I almost threw up trying to swallow it. With as much lemon and ponzu on the oysters, nothing can hide that foul dead ocean taste. The seafood ceviche was even weird tasting like it was old. There was random pieces of fish from idk what part of fish. The ribeye was JOKE! It was so dry and thin that it couldn't been ribeye. It had to be some cheap meat on sale at Smiths.

THE BEST PART. I ordered tuna roll and it was literally 5 percent fish and 95 percent rice. I couldn't help but laugh because I've never seen a roll like this in any sushi place in my life!! 

I also tried their ramen which was INSTANT RAMEN. I wish it said that or else I would of never ordered it. It's okay though, I used the ramen to hide my pitty tuna rolls in. 

I was so disappointed at this place that I didn't even brother with a second round of nigiri. Save your money and go else where NOW!

Great restaurant experience. The atmosphere is fun and energetic. They have tables that can accommodate large parties. When I've gone on a Friday or Saturday night, they usually give an estimation of 30-45 minute wait; however, I've never waited more than 20 minutes or so. The all you can eat is a great deal. From my experience, it has the most appetizer items available as part of the AYCE menu. The udon soup is one of my favorites! As for the sushi and nigiri, it is absolutely delicious. I love how for most of their rolls, the sauce comes on the side, allowing you to decide how much to add to your roll rather than it being served smothered in sauce.  This is our go to place. Consistent and great every time.
They serve with fresh material, fast service, small portion that I can try many dish.

It was not worth it.  We ordered Udon, Ramen noodles, Unagi Don, and pork cutlet for dinner.   The bowls of noodles took a long time to arrive, and the worst we ever had.  The meats and eels were dried.  We left feeling hungry and unhappy.
Always consistent and service friendly. If you're a local wait to go until after a holiday. Super busy.
Their AYCE price was just right and service was fast. I really enjoyed their salmon belly. I wish I could order more than two peices but I get it. I will definitely come again.

Best sushi I've had in a long while. Rule of thumb usually is that sushi from a land locked state is a no go, but this place beats most sushi places I've been to in Cali. Maybe I was lucky and I had a fresh batch but this place deserves the full 5 stars. My advice, the items listed on the menu for only one order for AYCE is there for a reason so try it out. Seared tuna with AJ sauce and the yuzu hamachi were the favorites

For regular sushi standards, the fish is not the freshest you'll ever have. But for ayce purposes, it gets the job done. This place gets PACKED during peak dinner times so I would call to make a reservation if you can. The good thing is that this place is open till 2 am every night so if you want, you can come after dinner time to avoid the crowds.
