We had a big group so it took us a while to get seated. But once we got seated, our orders came out really quickly. We pretty much ordered everything on the menu and they all tasted pretty average except for the salmon skin. The salmon skin was burnt and we had to send it back. Avoid that if you can! Other than that, the fish to rice ratio was pretty good. It's nice when the piece of sushi hides the rice underneath it. There's a limit on the more expensive items such as sweet shrimp and uni (typical for ayce sushi spots).

Umiya is serviceable for ayce sushi but there are definitely better options out there.

Servers were very prompt and responsive. Quick to refill drinks, clear plates, and take orders. A far cry from the usual service you see at AYCE places. Sushi was pretty good, but the sushi rice tasted a bit odd and was denser than normal, like it had been very compressed. Was fairly quiet around 530PM on a Wednesday night, but quickly got busy with a wait around 6PM.

Went last night for the first time and I was impressed with how quick and friendly the service was. The AYCE Sushi was very good as well as the non-sushi items we ordered too. I would definitely go again, and recommend to others.

This place is beautiful!   I loved the ambiance!  Love the long tables with benches & the sushi bar!  We came for AYCE sushi with our local friends as this is their fave spot.  It's located about 1 mile from the Strip & easy to find in the strip mall. 

The food was fresh & yummy!   I normally don't like cream cheese in my rolls,  but the Japanese Lasagna was pretty good!  The portions are good sized.  We ordered lots of different types of food, shrimp tempura, grilled squid, sushi rolls, hand rolls, nigiri & oysters. 

The Snow White roll,  soft shell crab with ono was delish. 

Yellowtail hand rolls were amazing with nigiri sized fish with minimal rice. 

It was $22.95 for lunch & $26.95 for dinner.   You only get a few extra items for the dinner menu such as 1 order of amaebi, 1 order of uni & a few other things I forgot. 

The service was great as there werent too many people when we were there. 

Music included today's pop along with the videos. 

Check in offer: free soda!

We'll be back for sure!

My old AYCE sushi house fave was Sushi Mon, but they have gone downhill since 2005. 
I was referred here by my lawyer friend, and we all know about our lawyer friends..they eat well. 
He basically said it was comparable to Kabuto, but less expensive. Boy, was he right.
The AYCE selection is better than any other place in town and the dinner was $26.95 a person. The service was happy, and not snooty or too busy, even when it was. The seating was a bit more BBQ house type, but in all honesty, this did not matter to me. The sushi was fresh, the oysters were soooo good. It made me rethink Shuck's oysters and their quality. 
The bill was not split correctly, so double check as you should anywhere else, and head to this sushi house. The orange blossom and other rolls are good to try, but the nigiri is so good. Especially for being in the desert.
Reason for the 4 stars? We had to remind them 3 times about our oysters and uni. Sorry Umiya!

Food is good & reasonably priced. I have good times & not so good times here. Sometimes service is amazing & I get my orders quickly, but others, the servers don't even come & my orders get messed up. But I will still give them four stars cause the food is good

Honestly I was so excited to come here.....then he moment me and my friend sat down it was just pushy and rushed the entire time.   It was 11:30pm when we came in on a Wednesday night.   No one was in there except two other couples.  Every time we took a bite it was " anything else?" "Check?" 


Like stop already.  I get it we have "90min" to eat but you rushed us out before 45 min.  I wanted to have a better experience but apparently that was a wrong thought to have. 

I'm giving 2 stars due to the quickness of each order and 1 to being clean.   Everything else sucked.

I love this place! What a great find. $20 all you can eat sushi during the day. I was impressed on the wide selection for the AYCE sushi.  Delicious and fresh. Not bad for the price.  Service is very quick! Definitely go here if you need a quick sushi fix.
Tonight is our second visit in Umiya. We like their all you eat menu and our server Amy is a professional server . We will definitely come back in our next Las Vegas visiting.

Typically, Umiya would be my go to spot if I know Goyemon will be crowded.  I attempted my usual Umiya trip a few nights ago and left after 15 minutes of there being open tables and not being sat down.  I realized the boys working were a bit new, as the ladies who sit people down and take their orders weren't working that night.  

The ladies working know me already and the treatment that night by the males were pretty bad.  It looks like they were overwhelmed and I saw that people were waiting to order again but weren't being taken care of.  So instead of anticipating a bad night of sushi, I left to go to Sushi Bay instead, where I know there wouldn't be a wait to order.

Take notes from the female co-workers guys..only go when the ladies are working.

The Skinny: came on a Tuesday... after having a 2 star meal experienced the bathroom Olympics with the hubs. Avoid! (1) service: slightly zealous server who wanted to know what we wanted right away(3) Value: there is no real positive value when your head is in the toilet (0)

Okay, it was my fault. After being without sushi for 3 months, I had a big craving. So after looking at the reviews online we settled at this place for lunch.

We came for lunch to check things out. We were kind of leery about making a huge commitment to ordering the AYCE option. First of all, we weren't that hungry and we had a Yelp event planned later in the evening. Secondly, the AYCE menu is $21 for lunch, consisted largely of carb heavy rolls and cooked items which didn't really appeal to us (there is no sashimi on the AYCE menu).

Our server was slightly overly attentive to the point where she was checking every 2-3 minutes of us getting seated to put in our order.

We ended up ordering 2 lunch specials. I got the sushi combo which comes with 4 pieces of nigiri and a choice of spicy tuna or California roll plus miso soup. ($10.95)The hubs got the bento box with a spicy tuna roll, tempura, salad and miso soup.($9.95)

Our food came out suspiciously fast - like definitely not in a good way kind of fast. Like literally within 5 minutes of getting our soup. 

The miso soup tasted like bilge water. The little tofu swimming in there looked like the dehydrated stuff you reconstitute from the small miso soup packets.

My sushi combo was supposed to be salmon, red snapper, tuna. The fish tasted very ummm...fishy in an unpleasant way with a slightly mushier texture than expected for sushi grade product. The rice was not seasoned well and was too firm. The maki spicy tuna roll incorporated way too much hot sauce so it suspiciously masked whatever flavor of fish that was in there. More on that later.

The hubs experience with his spicy tuna roll was the same as mine above. His tempura was overly battered and thick. The salad was a tad sweet but was otherwise okay.

Overall, at that point we were thinking 2 starred joint. Nothing too offensive, but not great either. Definitely not a repeat experience. We figured hey! it was only like a $10 meal per person and didn't set us back too much.

That is until we got home and the vomiting began. 

How I heaved into my toilet! Betwixt me and my beloved hubby, we were out for the count. We were totally bummed that we had to miss out on a Yelp event due to the the food poisoning.

At the time of writing this review, the bile is still rising in my throat from the thought of what I ate for lunch. Deep down, I think perhaps the spicy tuna is the culprit as it was the only common denominator for my hubs and I.

So for that, Umiya, you've joined my +1club.
Great food friendly service leaving happy and uncomfortably full lmao!!!! Order the kiss of fire & king of the ocean

This will be very short and to the point. 

very disappointing.
rice is terrible - would not hold together.
fish is not fresh and cut improperly.
Everything was drowned in ponzu sauce. 
Clearly their way of covering up the lack of freshness in the fish. 

staff is not equipped for large parties.
"i can't remember what 14 want so you just need to order and figure out yourself.  just share."
That's a direct quote. 

ayce menu doesn't include everything.
many items are a la carte.

I will not return.

1st time trying this place and I can say it did not disappoint went here with my girl and the service was rapid like I would blink and my sushi was in my table I went for the AYCE dinner and it was 25.96 per person at 4 and the place was not crowded it was around 4:45 when everyone started arriving so I can say at went at a perfect time
Delicious and fresh. Friendly environment and staff. The sushi, rolls and teppanyaki are top. Highly recommend.

Driving around at 3 yesterday a little hangry next to the strip, my girlfriend recommended her go to sushi place, Umiya.  Now this being the second day in a row for raw seafood, I was a little hesitant, but boy I was not disappointed.

I ordered tuna, super white tuna, fresh water eel well done, and the spicy tataki roll (inside is spicy tuna, with seared tuna, avocado, green onion and pickled onion on the outside. Dressed in hot sauce and ponzu sauce) 

I have to say for ayce the rice attached to the sushi was very small compared to most ayce sushi places in Las Vegas.  The fish was very fresh and flavorful.  And with as busy as this restaurant was the food was served very quickly.  Plenty of restaurant staff to ensure speedy delivery and quick refills.

Also when you check in you get a free soda. 

A must go to when on this side of town.

No more All You Can Drink offered. Sadness!!! 
The selection was slightly limited for AYCE. There was an extra charge for fresh wasabi. They were out of scallops and oysters. The quality was decent for all you can eat. The nigiri was on smaller side but proportional in terms of fish to rice.  Dynamite was overpowered with cheese.  Service was decent. It was an average experience, at most. Goyemon still the AYCE of choice in Vegas.
Fast service,clean and staff are attentive.    The place gets busy in usual dinner or lunch time but the stuff manage to get the food on the table as fast as they can .  Great sushi roll selection .

I came here after my friends and I realized how long the line was at Goyemon. That was no problem at all for Umiya since they had no wait!! We were seated promptly and got straight to ordering. The food was excellent but the customer service was subpar due to the fact that our orders got lost constantly. We had to keep reordering the same dishes. Also, our waitress took awhile to get back to us in between orders. Other than that, good food + no wait will keep me as a repeat customer.
All you can eat sushi better than 90% of sushi restaurants I've been to. Highly recommended.
For the price it's ok but the quality of the food is below average.  Rolls size is more like kids menu items.  More rice than anything and filled with fake crab.  Prompt service though.

In this review tried some new items that never had before because really the menu is that extensive never going too fit all in. Why would you? Each visit can be all its own going with more little side dishes plus sushi, all sushi, some ramen or udon and sushi. Endlesssss. I wanted too try the ramen on the menu. It on point tasty and delicious like everything else on the menu! The broth such nice depth of flavor unique taste unlike other true ramen restaurants. It little less salty then other places, the noodles solid, and AYCE just the right size portion have room for other stuff. 

Sushi Chef Alex is awesome. I was able too try some stuff not even on the AYCE menu. I had the black sea bass nigiri style, fresh eel (he showed me fresh eel; ever since my experience at Yummy feel sushi chef presents the fish see that quality adds personal touch) that never had before amazing, and even more AMAZING thing was the fresh Umi. Unfortunately again not on the AYCE but presented fresh UMI then he literally cut it open served order a la carte another table but kind enough make me one nigiri. Wow! If could get that kind of fresh Umi I would kill the whole population of Umi. Lol! Lunch is never that crowded really one of the best times too go. Truly one of my best sushi experience one that not only truly feel sushi chef Alex passion for sushi, the attention too service is on point (never have empty glass of soda or water), and all sushi chefs are easy too talk stories with just makes it that much more enjoyable. I can not give Chef Alex enough stars because every time I have gone in he shows passion for sushi, bringing in different fish, and makes sure you have the best sushi experience. On my last visit I took my brother and his family Umiya first time. Chef Alex came around the sushi bar say Hello, check up, and if anything else we needed or wanted too try. It that kind of service that almost lost art in this day and age of culinary scene or big names. The only bummer is they no longer do all you can drink. It buy two get the third one free. I go Umiya for the food not so much drinking. It not missed too much.
Def not as good as expected, low quality fish and weird combos in rolls. The only thing I liked was the monkey brains (fried tuna stuffed avocado)

Stopped in for all you can eat sushi for lunch. Food was amazing, and the specialty rolls were pretty inventive. Unfortunately, it took about 30 minutes after we finished eating to get and pay the check (not an exaggeration). We had to ask for the check multiple times, and it was particularly frustrating to see our waitress checking in with other customers (mid-meal) after we had asked for the check. Don't go here in any sort of rush!
Im speechless. This place is perfection. Im blown away. Quality, atmosphere and customer service are the best Ive seen in a long time. Thank you for an amazing first impression Umiya!

Umiya has one of the more exciting sushi AYCE menus compared to other highly rated sushi joints in Vegas. They have appetizers like beef skewers, steak, rice bowls, sashimi, pork belly, and many others. Their rolls are always tasty; my go-to is the Lobster Crunch roll. I'm pretty sure it's just crawfish topping but it's still delicious. Umiya is definitely on my top 3 sushi AYCE list.

I ordered to go. The sashimi platter which was $19.99, hamachi lover $12.99 and Agedashi tofu $5.49 maybe? 

The sushi value is the worst I have ever seen in my sushi eating career.

The sashimi is probably about half of the thickness of what it should be, they are so thin that they seem to be transparent. The Hamachi lover roll is super tiny.

The only good thing is probably the agedashi tofu, which has decent quality.

I never had their all you can eat, but I don't think I will be back for anything.

I come here for celebrations because they can accommodate large parties. Why isn't this place more popular? It's so pretty inside and their sushi is not bad. The only complaint I have is that they pack their rice balls so tight for the nigiri. I think they do it to make it look like there is less rice but I'd rather them not because it makes it so much harder to chew each piece. 

The appetizers and non sushi items are great here. My favorite is the crispy rice with spicy tuna! So good. Another favorite is the rib eye steak. Medium rare is the way to go. It's served as a thin slice on a wooden platter with some dipping sauce on the side. 

Service is great here. We had a party of 17 so they were prepared and took our orders by table. It was pretty organized. They were able to split the bill a couple times for our convenience. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. No complaints on customer service!

Just tried this place out last night. Sushi here is really good, but the menu is pretty simple for what it is. A lot of the rolls are renditions of the previous roll, just with the addition or removal of one ingredient.  BUT, if I asked them to change a roll to make it more interesting they did it without hesitation. AYCE pricing is the same as everywhere else in town, so I wasn't surprised at all by the price. The environment is really nice and open, doesn't feel crowded or busy like many of the other sushi restaurants, so that was a definite plus. The staff here was ON POINT, they tended to all of our needs and we're very helpful. I couldn't even finish my glass of water before the waitress came around to fill it up again haha.  I will definitely return to this place.

Solid AYCE (All You Can Eat) sushi restaurant. Two of us shared spicy tuna roll, tempura roll, salmon nigiri, and orange blossom roll. Also ordered seaweed salad, edamame, and miso ramen. Finished off with red bean ice cream. Fast, attentive service. Portions were reasonable and balanced (decent sized pieces of sushi that weren't overwhelmed by gigantic portions of rice). 

Best sushi I ever had? No. But the food was good and overall excellent value compared to the overhyped overpriced establishments on the strip. Definitely worth the trek for a $20 lunch/$25 dinner. Uber from Umiya to The Wynn was $9.

The food here is great, but the service is a little slower than I'd like.  With that said, I really like the way they decorated the interior of the restaurant.  There are cool lights that decorate the walls and a big screen that cycles through music videos while you enjoy some fresh sushi.  I'd definitely come back!

UMIYA has excellent food and a good... no... GREAT !!! diverse variety so it's not like "Todai" or a run of the mill AYCE Asian Buffet. 

This features made to order QUALITY food.

The AYCE (all you can eat) Menu features so many specialty rolls, it would be best to come with a larger party of 4 or more people so you can try a little of everything.

They serve non-Sushi items too, which makes it a great place to eat!

Parking is easy (Vegas is always easy for a metropolitan city) 

The price is around $25 for lunch.

Umiya is a great little gem of a sushi restaurant, and quite honestly my only major complaint here is that their wooden benches are super uncomfortable. It sounds like I'm being a diva, but it needs to be said! You can't happily eat your weight in AYCE sushi if your butt starts to hurt.

The food, though, is good. The sushi rice seemed to be lacking the vinegar, but it wasn't a huge deal considering this is an AYCE place. Service was quick and friendly. Nigiri is yummy but the rolls kind of all taste similar. There are a quite a few reviews on here stating that the seafood wasn't fresh, but I did not find that to be an issue on my visit. 

I think I have really high standards when it comes to sushi places, but this is a solid sushi spot and I'd be willing to come back again if I was in the area.

This place is not like your traditional AYCE sushi Resturant it not a place where you mark sushi on a paper and wait for your food. You basically order everything off a menu and anything in the menu is available. They have a lot appetizer and other options besides sushi that where great only critique about this place is the amount of rice they put on the nigiri is kind of crazy! Overall most of food was grea

When I saw a 4.5 rated AYCE sushi restaurant right across the street from our hotel, Palms, I knew my family and I had to go.

On weekends they open at 12, so my parents and I made it by 12:10. Good thing we came early, because this place gets PACKED! At 12:10, there was half of the room already full with more people flooding on in. There were only 2 servers during opening which made service really slow at first, however, once more servers started their shift, it got more consistent. One thing to keep in mind is that all the servers work together, you're not just assigned one. We totally kept trying to get the attention of the first person who took our drink orders before eventually realizing that every server attends to every table. Wooooopsss!! Don't make this mistake y'all, you'll save yourself a lot of frustration lmao.

$21 all you can eat sushi, yes plz. My parents and I ordered an assortment of items from both the sushi bar and the kitchen. There are some items that they only let each person order one of, but a majority of the stuff is free for all. Although the pieces weren't super fat, I was honestly impressed by the quality of the nigiri to the point were the slice size didn't bother me, especially since you could just order more. The salmon (sake) was extremely fatty which made it all the more delicious! DEFINITELY skip the seared albacore though. This was the one dish that I was very disappointed in. Other things I would recommend getting include the poke!! The tuna chunks were really thick and seasoned very well. I also really liked the grilled mackerel and grilled squid from the kitchen. Polished off our palettes with some yummy green tea ice cream too.

Overall, I really like Umiya. Except for the seared albacore, everything was fresh! Meats weren't as impressive (we got rib eye and pork belly), but it's always nice to have that option if you're craving a little bite of meat. There are tons of AYCE sushi options in Vegas, but I definitely feel like Umiya is one of the best, hands down. My only major comment would but that I feel like they should get at least ONE more server per lunch/dinner rush though. The servers are constantly running around and I feel bad for them!! They're working hard for sure.
The sushi is kind of out of shape. The outside and inside ingredients are okay, but, the rice is sticky, which makes the sushi tastes weird in your mouth. I like the fried soft shell crab by the way.
not a really japanese food. its more like korean food. and the food are not fresh for all you can eat.

The best spot I've found in Vegas for AYCE sushi! This place is always clean, good quality sushi, always fresh, and a price of $26.99 AYCE dinner is awesome! They give you so many options and very little restrictions as far the AYCE rules go. The servers are very friendly and quick with your order. I like that there's usually 2-3 different workers that'll assist with taking your order and refilling the drinks. 

The shrimp lover roll, dragon roll, Lisa Lisa roll, shrimp skewers and mussels here are beyond amazing! Every roll I've had here I've loved, those were just to name a few and keep the list short. This is definitely my favorite sushi spot in Vegas!

I've been to about 10 (give or take) different sushi places around Las Vegas and this is my favorite AYCE so far.

Sushi chefs are good and they are very friendly and fun to joke around with. 

They have sports playing on the tv's at the bar and on the larger screen they have asian music videos playing.

I think if this place was on Spring Mtn., they would be packed. Umiya is a hidden gem!
Rice was cold and hard. Like my overall experience last night. I have eaten at this restaurant many times, yet last night they were trying to rush you through. I will never go back

Amazing place for an all you can eat sushi joint! Was not disappointed one bit.

Arrived a bit early around 6pm on a Saturday. We were rolling deep with about 25 guys (bachelor party). They were very accommodating to that fact and I think they had extra people on shift to help us. Service was on point. Food came out no more than five minutes after ordering. As soon as plates were cleaned, they were picked up and our next orders were taken! 

Food was fantastic as well. The tuna tataki is a must. Although it is listed as a one time item, I think I had about three rounds. I tried staying away from rolls as I didn't want to fill myself up too fast. I went straight for the one order items. The poke was also pretty damn fresh. Comes with a little side of seaweed salad. All in all I would definitely come back here again when I'm in town. Good choice before the turn up.

Another sushi restaurant in a city of plenty.  Umiya is located right next to Starbucks in a plaza off of Flamingo and Arville. It's a very nicely decorated sushi spot definitely the nicest, 5 star for just that. 

They offer a large AYCE menu of sushi and non-sushi items with a few items that you can only order one order of, as many other sushi restaurants do. Order the items that you can only order one order of and on chef's special menu first, just to get them out of the way.  They have a pork belly that could maybe rival Goyemon, maybe, I don't remember how Goyemon pork belly taste like again I need to go again soon. It's 3 delicious thinly sliced pieces of pork belly in a sauce that just melts in your mouth.  I made the mistake of sharing once, never again all mine.  They serve a fried soft shelled crab which was heavily battered which wasn't my favorite but it could be with less batter. Their baby octopus are very delicious. Their nigiris and hand rolls aren't that bad too.  Their beef was very good.  Oysters fried and not fried, poke salad, specialty rolls, deep fried tempura rolls, shrimp tempura, uni, everything you usually expect from a sushi spot they probably had it.

Drinks aren't included in the AYCE sushi price you pay extra, soft drinks were extra $2 but refill are included.  Also they no longer have AYCD on for extra $10 its something like buy 2 get the 3rd free for certain drinks. Know you limits when drinking they probably won't kick you out for being a drunken mess but it annoys everyone elses who are trying to have a nice meal with family and friends, especially if there in another party.

As always when going to a sushi restaurant sit at the bar right infront of the sushi chefs, you'll get food faster and chefs are usually pretty cool guys. Customer service was great but once if got busy they had a hard time keeping up with food and drink orders. Try not going when busy but if your patient enough like I am go whenever you feel like sushi. 

Their prices are average, sushi quality and selection good, but probably won't replace any of my top 5 but top 10 in Vegas sure.
This place is AMAZING we found on yelp everything was so good can't wait to come back again.

I am very picky with my seafood and I love Umiya's quality of fish and the variety of items they have for their All You Can Eat option.

Service: For me, service is something that I cannot reiterate enough. It is the break or make it factor for me and sadly, the service can do a little bit of cleaning. I have been here a handful of times and I get the same service... rudeness. I am not sure if the servers are being purposely rude, but the last three times I have been there (less than a month), they have been rude. I was trying to order something at the bar one time and the lady who was taking care of our orders rudely said that she will come back to us and take orders from her other tables. I understand that me and my party was not ready, but she did not have to be rude and impatient. I was baffled by how she reacted to the situation with me and my party. Unfortunately, this is not the first time that has happened. I am constantly getting rude service. Also, I happen to get new servers every time I go there. I do not know who is taking care of me at the end of my experience.

Quality: The food and quality of fish is amazing. Even though I do not get service how I am used to getting, the food can help balance it. The seared tuna AJ fish is to die for! I constantly crave it and come back for it. They also have special yuzu hamachi nigiri and salmon belly. it tastes so good and so fresh I cannot have enough of it! They also have an array of sushi rolls, appetizers and other stuff that they have on the menu. They have a lot of things on their menu that a lot of other sushi restaurants set them apart.

Overall, I am very impressed with their menu. It really sets them apart from other sushi restaurants and they have their own style. However, service can be so much better. If all the servers were willing to give their 100% everyday no matter how late is or early, then this place would be my favorite places in Vegas. If they didn't have good items on their menu, I wouldn't be back because of their service.

This place is great!   Great sushi!   It seems most people get the all you can eat sushi.  They do have al a carte.   The sushi is delicious and fresh.  The grilled squid was great.  Grilled Mackerel was to die for...I like the atmosphere fun and bench seating.  Great service and all of them are helpful!   I will definitely come again!

The food is amazing just like I said before but the service is horrible they need to get all new staff or else it will close I keep coming back because of the food. Sumo sushi there second location and it so much better.

You can never go wrong with this amazing place all the staff are very friendly and food is allways as expected delicious...I absolutely love it here wouldnt go any where else, price is so worth it if I could give it a 5+  rate I would.

During our Strip stay-cation, we were on the hunt for sushi, but didn't want our eardrums blown at the same time (ahem, RA). We decided on Umiya since it was close to our hotel and very reasonably priced for AYCE.

We got there at 6 pm and the restaurant was nearly empty. The space itself is really pretty and open. We got drinks and our first orders in within a couple of minutes of being seated. Our rolls came super quickly, which continued throughout our meal, despite the restaurant getting much busier. Those familiar with AYCE know how important superfast ordering and delivery are!

The food was completely decent. The rolls themselves are on the small side, but very light on rice. I really liked the size, since each one takes up less belly real estate, so you can try more tasty things! The fish quality is average, depending on the roll (the salmon and ahi were great; the super white tuna was meh). As with a lot of sushi places with huge menus, the sauces on the rolls can be their downfall. There are many that come with spicy mayo, but they're easily avoided. 

The AYCE menu is enormous. There are lots of fresh, fried and baked rolls, plus nigiri, various non-fish items and dessert. It's $27 per person for dinner, with a HUGE 90 minute time limit. Umiya is definitely our new go-to on this side of town!

This is by far my favorite sushi joint. The all you can eat has very little limitations if any at all. The chefs are friendly and hilarious at times(when drinking sake). Yellow tail collar is sooo bombb. All you can drink was an option for 10 dollars additional but i think i forced them to stop doing that single handedly. I LOVVEEE TO DRINK. used to be called kaizen and kan. Stop changing your fucking name!

Although I don't consider myself an absolute expert on sushi, I do appreciate variety & quality coupled with decent prices. My wife and I greatly enjoyed this place. The variety of offerings in the AYCE menu was good and the freshness of the seafood was outstanding on the day we went there. My wife, not being a fan of sushi, had the the gyoza & BBQ'd short ribs and she raved about them. The servers were attentive w/o being overbearing.
The only criticisms (very minor) that I have were: the lame looking wooden picnic-styled benches and the 90 minute time limit for the AYCE, but then I was easily able to eat my fill in one hour anyway. Finally, the fact that we saw many happy Japanese patrons during our time at Umiya was quite comforting. 
I can't wait to return!

I was really looking forward to trying this place, but it was a disappointment. The fish wasn't fresh at all honestly, and the rice and fish ratio is way off. I did like the udon from the AYCE, but I'm coming here for the fish not the side dishes. 

Also our waitress left and no one checked on us for 20 minutes. When someone finally came we ordered our dessert, I got a strawberry mochi. I asked the waitress if I could have a pair scissor to cut it and she told me they don't have scissors... ok.

It was really weird but when we walked in there were a lot of servers and open tables but we were informed it would be about a 15 minute wait. About 20 minutes later when other couple started comin in, they all of the sudden starting rushing people to get seated. 

After that everything was amazing! The servers were quick and all of our food came really fast! They were constantly checking on us and making sure we had everything we wanted. 

They have a huge menu selection of yummy rolls and appetizers! The inside is very clean and has a nice modern warehouse look. Great all you can eat pricing especially for being near the strip.

I would defiantly come back here again!
Hidden gem!! Will definitely be back. Service was great and the all you can eat was off the charts.

Found this sushi place on Yelp, went there with Uber and found the restaurant tastes like crap. I ordered a kings ocean roll and couple sushi. It turns out the bill is 38 dollars. Most importantly,  it tasted so bad.... I was amazed how bad and smelly the fish are(salmon and red snapper). Don't go, save your money.

Trying another AUCE sushi joint cuz damnit, I'm hungry and this spot is right by my credit union that I stopped at and because SOMETHING is going on with Woo Che! Second day I've rolled by there and they've been closed! AND I almost went to go try Korean Garden BBQ cuz they have a pretty cheap AUCE BBQ price but I quickly pulled up some reviews and they were weird. ANYHOO. This is what I stuffed into the fat girl stuck inside of my body:

Spicy Garlic Edamame - a little overcooked, some of the shells were downright MUSHY. The flavor was OK. A little spicy, but not much and the garlic flavor was rather mild. I LOVE garlic.

Marinated Pork Belly - I have been CRAVING pork belly lately! This didnt necessarily satisfy my craving either. The pork belly itself was melt in your mouth tender and the marination was aiight. Not bad at all - I am just personally craving some samgyupsol!

Grilled Shishito Peppers - served with Bonito flakes on the side. I always love shishito peppers but these could have use some togarashi!

Crispy SS Crab - I highly DON'T recommend this. Too much breading and not enough flavor. I even tried dipping it in some spicy mayo but ended up just leaving the other half, untouched. 

Baked New Zealand Mussel in Dynamite Sauce - these were good. Nothing stuck out about them but they werent bad at all.

Seafood Dynamite - good as well. Typically these taste the same wherever I get them. Not bad at all.

Tuna Poke - this was REALLY good! A little seaweed salad on the side and just enough seasoning and spiciness to leave me wanting more!

Jalapeno Popper - spicy tuna and cream cheese inside the jalapeno and deep fried. Um. No. I ate one out of the four. Just not a good combination and really not much flavor. They probably deseeded the jalapeno taking all of it's delicious spiciness with and the half way cooked spicy tuna inside wasn't cuttin it. Besides, COOKED spicy tuna is NOT something I EVER look forward to.

The Nigiri I tried was: 
Tuna, Albacore, Super White Tuna, Salmon and Yellowtail. ALL of it was VERY good. Very fresh tasting and fatty and melt in your mouth. The Albacore was kind of fishy but that just might be how the fish is suppose to be. I'm not a fan of really fishy tasting fish, but some people are! 

Anyway I finished off my meal with a salmon and avocado hand roll and a banana split!!!! I love handrolls and this one did not disappoint! Really good quality fish! 
And my banana split was a nice small personal size - just a scoop of vanilla with a banana and some chocolate syrup. Simple and tasty. 

Four stars for the NIGIRI. Three stars for the rest of the menu.
Great AYCE Japanese food. Note I didn't say sushi because there's so much more available than sushi.  Great friendly service too.

I must say, the service is terrible. We were a party of 7 but one of us was a baby. So we bought 6 ayce lunches. The quality of the food is average but the service fell far below average. We would wait 15-20 minutes in between each order and they only refilled our drinks once throughout the whole meal. At the end, they included the tip for our 6 meals. I was alright with the included tip, but usually included tips for casual dining places like this establishment only charge like 12%. 18% included tip for fine dining. But this place had an included tip of 20% for 6 people! I believe they counted the baby. And they didn't specify it anywhere, or not anywhere convenient. I left feeling ripped off, especially for the service. Highly doubt I would return and I wouldn't recommend.

Love their food however it's impossible to reach them and when I finally got through, got put on hold for quite some time just to place a to go order. Not sure if they forgot about me being on the phone or what but this is something they'll have to be a bit more organized about

Excellent quality sushi for an unbelievable price. Bring your appetite because you will want to have one of everything. I had a smattering of their offerings and was truly impressed. Very attentive waitstaff and personable sushi chefs. I always sit at the bar to get a feel of a sushi joint. I felt like a regular by the time I left! A must go if in Vegas.

Favorite sushi roll place of all time! Wow! So many sauces and beautifully prepared rolls with wonderful concoctions. The roll with baked lobster is out if this world and the tuna salad was amazing. They also serve half rolls on the all you can menu...so very worth it!

We tried this place for lunch, we are from Arizona but try to get to Vegas a few times a year, mainly for the sushi! This place is our new favorite! Great atmosphere and nice and roomy. The menu is huge and easy to read, so many options! Their rolls are all delicious and appetizers and salads rock! They have awesome sauces that aren't too overpowering but still really delicious! You don't find these great sauces at a lot of other places! Nigiri is on the smaller side but we decided that might be a good thing so you can try more stuff and eat less rice! Their white tuna was to die for! Overall this place is a 10!! We will be back, and dream about this sushi for the next 6 months!

Great find! My boyfriend and I were looking for some sushi spots around that weren't over priced and then we found this hidden gem! We got soooo many rolls, they have an all you can eat for 27 bucks and all you can drink for$10 more. Let's just say that just because it was all you can eat, it doesn't mean the food sucks. food is fresh, owner Alex is so fun to talk to and everyone is so attentive to you without sour attitudes. Menu has many options so I was happy, just don't order more than you can eat! Will defintely be back!
Amazing food! Usual sushi places quality finished as time passes, but this place is doing good and maintaining their high quality food! Love them! Must try!

Yesterday was my third time visiting Umiya, and I enjoy it every time. The servers are really attentive whether I sit at the table or the bar. 

I love the Lobster Crunch roll, vegetable tempura, soft shell crab, and so much more!

For two people, the bill came out to 68 bucks including tax and tip for all you can eat. 

Orders come very fast as you order them. Some special items you can order only once. Besides rolls and nigiri there is a selection of hot and cold apps, skewers, entrees, and noodles.

Overall I really enjoy this place and would come back if I'm super hungry and craving sushi.

My friend and I went here for lunch. Their all you can eat menu is extremely large with many options. 

The sushi was very fresh and everything we had was up to par. I would recommend the all you can eat because it's worth your money, just don't order more then you can eat because they will charge you for what you do not finish. 

Service was a little slow but I think that is to make you eat less, very nice people though.

This place use to be KAIZEN... changed owners and one of the chefs from kaizen took over. He goes by AJ. this is my first time trying AYCE sushi at this place, i usually dont like AYCE, but this place was outstanding! the quality of the fish and presentation was EXCEPTIONAL compared to most AYCE sushi.. 
i ordered almost everything on the AYCE menu. LOL jk. just about tho..
my favorite rolls were the SALMON KILLER, SNOW WHITE, 
and u must try the seared ahi tuna with AJ special sauce... that was bomb! 
there wasnt one thing that i ordered that wasnt good.... i give this place an A+!! so far... AYCE restaurants usually start off REALLY good then they start to get cheap on you... so i hope this place stays good and doesnt crash..

I decided to do all you can eat.. I ordered sake (salmon) and maguro (tuna) The quality was horrible it smelled like it was on the verge of being spoiled (fishy smell) ... The tuna looked dull and almost brownish yuck!!!
Knowing I had "all you can eat" I decided I was going to order my money's worth 
However everything I wanted that looked fresh from their picture menu was a la carte basically it made me think that the good quality fish was only for a la carte and "all you can eat" were the left overs "let's make some money on this before we throw it out"
I was so disappointed because I found this place on yelp and the reviews looked great;(

Busy place around dinner. Suggestion is to make a reservation and even then the wait time can be horribly long. They have so muvh going on that orders are wrong. Servers dropping and spilling things. But for the buck.. Good sushi, good service.
If you want bad service, this place is for you. So many other choices within an one mile radius so why would you come here?

My favorite sushi place in Vegas. Good price, wide variety of items for all you can eat. I usually order, Nigiri (2 piece) salmon, tuna, garlic tuna, super white tuna, pepper seared tuna, yellowtail; and 3-4 rolls. They also have an entire menu for snack items for AYCE, get the AJ, it's seared tuna sashimi that is marinated, very good. 25$ AYCE dinner price. They also have deep fried ice cream for AYCE. love this place, and the friendly staff.

The sushi was delicious but service was non attentive. Host was on the phone and pointed to our seats after a 10 min wait inside with a fairly light amount of guests in the restaurant. They left out a roll of sushi from my order and never came back for our bill. My guest and I walked to the front to pay. Due to lack of attention is why I'd recommend somewhere else. Time in Vegas is valuable and fast service is appreciated but the least any restaurant can do is be attentive. 3 stars for this Japanese crew. Good sushi but there are other places nearby just as good. So much for the bellman recommendation.
My favorite sushi place hands down!! Their menu is so creative & delicious. Service is great & food comes right away. Always looking forward to eating there!!

Best sushi i ever had, this place really set the bar for my future sushi endavours! They use some really good ingredients, including lobsters, scallops, and oyster. Everything was sooo tasty, ice cream is also included with the buffet, its a must try. Get the volanic roll as well, its awesome.
The best place to get your sushi fix! definitely check this place out. The AYCE is worth it.

First time here and I have to say it's one of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas. The workers are friendly and attentive which is plus. Definitely plan on bringing friends here who are visiting out of state.

I was visiting Vegas and craved for Sushi, my friend who moved to Vegas had been going to this other place but I had seen ok reviews. This place had an overall of 4 stars so we decided to go here. 

This is an AYCE Sushi place, you order off the menu and some items like UNI can only be ordered once per person. Sad face. They have daily special items that you can also order in the AYCE. Other then that, I thought most of the items were pretty good. The last items we ordered were crab and I didn't like it, took a bite gave it to my friend. He didn't like it but finished it. (The best thing about dining with my friend is he'll finish everything.. yay to me for sampling everything. Makes me enjoy eating out way more.) 

If you order tea they charge you for it but comes in this clear mug with their logo. The service here is wonderful. They communicate with each other over mics/walkie talkies and if one checked on a table stating they are good on water, they will announce that so you don't get checked again and again with repeating yourself. Good job on that!
Great selection of sushi and other Japanese food ;) great music and the service staff is attentive and courteous.

Wonderful! The service is very good here. They are very attentive and are very accommodating. The food is pretty good but not the greatest. The fish could be fresher and prepared better, but for the price, it's very good. 
It's a little loud here but the atmosphere is good. It gets busy but you can also make reservations.
The only problem here is there are too many options. Will need to study the menu before returning. Definitely a high-end sushi buffet for a reasonable price.

Good Food BUT BAD Service!!!! It's called unlimited so let me finish my order however long it maybe...don't interrupt me and give me attitude! Very rude and unprofessional! Also, slow service for a busy place!!! Need to learn to keep up with the flow and don't freaking be all flustered! Meaning wrong place to work at!!! Also when I'm following up on my order nicely...don't give me attitude and tell me that it's coming in a freaking rude way! Again ppl here gets flustered on a busy night!!!!!

Jessica, the hostess sat my party (there were 3 of us) with another party of 7 people while there were at least 5 other tables open. My aunt and I asked if we could sit at another table and the hostess and server seemed annoyed that we asked to move. 

We asked if the other tables were reserved but they weren't. I was wondering why there were couples seated at tables for at least 4 people and even one guy had a table to himself and they wanted to put us with a group of strangers. I'd understand if the place were packed and that was the only place to sit was with another party and both parties would be fine sitting together. It was just so bewildering why they'd even have us sit with strangers when there are tables open. 

I love the food here and their prices are really good but just having them try to make us sit with others is just so mind boggling.

Take your chances, service was disrespectful.

I saw that this place is rated pretty high on yelp, but I didn't even get a chance to eat there. I called in for a party of 5 at 5:00pm, and the host said that there were a few open tables if we came now.

My party arrived within 15 minutes and we had to wait over 35 minutes due to the place being full already. They have a bar there and the bar seating was completely open, yet they sat 1 and 1-2 people parties at the 6 seater tables.

Since the NBA game was on, I went to the bar to order a beer and the guy asked if I'm waiting for a table. I replied yes and he said I can't sit at the bar. Really? Why not? I told him I would stand or get up when the 1st customer arrives, but he said in a Korean accent no.

Japanese food is not only the taste, but the top-notch service that goes with it. Avoid this place if you want authentic Japanese food.  

I could only imagine the sushi is low grade that cats wouldn't eat.

Down side ... wait time for a larger party. .. we called in but was told no ... waited over 30 min when was told it was going to 15 min ... the 3 smaller parties behind us got in before our group.

Food was good ... OK choices ... good service
Excellent sushi bar. Fresh fish, frendly & great employees. I highly recommend this place.

This place has terrible managerial service. They do not know how to accommodate guests on a first come first serve basis. We called to put our names on their wait list at 9:00pm with a quoted 20-30 minute wait time but did not get seated until 9:55pm. They seated guests that came in after us simply because It benefited them more to do so to make more revenue rather than doing the right thing. This place does not care about doing the right thing. Instead of trying to arrange seating to your favor just get a bigger place. This is the last time I come to this place.

An average AYCE (all you can eat) sushi restaurant, but I fear that we won't be returning any time soon. The price for AYCE dinner is competitive, at $25.95, but we just weren't satisfied with their appetizer selection and quality of their nigiri. 

My boyfriend and I enjoy eating fresh fish, nigiri and trying a few appetizers when we dine at AYCE sushi restaurants, unfortunately the nigiri and appetizers here do not shine. The fish to rice ratio is inconsistent. The sushi rice was undercooked and compacted under paper thin slivers of raw fish. After a couple nigiri my stomach felt dense and full. That's not a good feeling or a good value. 

There were a few fish we tried that were extremely enjoyable and sweet such as the albacore and salmon; but the paper thin sliver made it difficult to really enjoy the quality of fish. We actually sent back the salmon belly because it was offensively fishy and old.  

I also felt very limited with the appetizer selection, some items were sized too large for us to feel comfortable ordering and the others were just not desirable. 

Here are some appetizers that were enjoyable: 
Miso Soup
Baked Mussels
Tuna poke
...that's it?

Pass on these:
Jalapeño popper (super dense and crazy filling with ok flavor)
Fried soft shell crab (all soggy batter)
Most nigiri...

I suggest going to Sakana (on Maryland) for fresh fatty cuts of fish on their nigiri with a generous fish to rice ratio, a big flavorful selection of appetizers and also creative, juicy rolls.

I'm in love!! AYCE sushi for $25?! I'm there! Their selection is huge as well, couldn't believe it when I saw that I could get uni and fresh oysters as part of the AYCE. However, it is limited to one order per person. Totally fine. Back home in Hawai'i, uni is super expensive. Two orders of uni would've probably costed $15 or more. The rest of the dishes were delicious as well! The fish was so unexpectedly fresh! 

Service was on point too. They were very attentive! When I called to ask for the check, the Asian male server reminded me about dessert! I totally forgot that it was also included in the AYCE!! I really appreciated that he reminded me about it. 

Overall, the food is 5/5 and the service is 5/5 too. Would definitely come back again during my stay in Vegas.

Went in for lunch on a Monday afternoon and got the All You Can Eat special for $20.95. Service was fast and polite and the sushi chefs were especially nice. They allow you to order multiple orders of nigiri at once and their Miso Ramen soup was perfect. Would definitely return.

I was told about the place by a friend and I was so disappointed because it did not live up to the hype.  One sentence sums this place up Quantity not quality. We ordered sushi alacart  and the price was reasonable. All the sushi came in a heavy Sriracha sauce or a vinegar sauce.   The fish wasn't super fresh tasting. The California roll was made from a crab salad mixture with a lot of mayo in it very disappointing. If I ordered all you can eat my expectations would have been way lower. The few pluses are the family style seating was fun, service was good, and if you don't know a lot about sushi you can get all you can eat and try a bunch of different rolls.

If this place was judged solely on the value of their $25 all you can eat lunch offering, it would receive 5 stars.  The portions and choices are all ample and solid flavors abound.  None of the dishes I tried knocked my socks off and that's the only reason I wear socks to restaurants but I would go back.  They have a local cult following as this restaurant was recommended by a die hard "Umiyaer" that visits weekly.  There's a hashtag so I believe they exist.  I have never heard of this restaurant prior to last week but I'm glad I got to enjoy their offerings.  If I lived or worked closer to their location (right by the Palms Casino) I would go back as it's priced well but since I don't engorge myself during lunch (2 rolls are filling) I would feel that I'm not getting the full experience.  I guess that just means I will have to visit on numerous occasions which my belly would be OK with.

For all you can eat sushi it's not bad at all, but I wouldn't say it's the best. There are other all you can eat sushi joints in Las Vegas that are just as good or even better. I came here Monday night around midnight, and it was dead. Service was very attentive since there wasn't anyone else there. We ordered some nigiri and the fish pieces were skimpy. It's okay since it's all you can eat I guess. Uni was actually good and not weird, goopy, and off colored. I've paid for uni that's far worst in quality from a regular sushi restaurant. Thumbs up for that.

The value sucks here for to-go.

Do not come here unless you are coming for AYCE sushi (All you can eat)

We got a few things togo since we were too tired to eat AYCE
- 10 Piece Sashimi $19.99 - These were the slimmest "sashimi" pieces of fish I have ever had and the worst value.
- Yellowtail Lower $12.99 - This was the smallest saddest looking roll I have ever had in the $10+ range rolls

On a friday night, they had plenty of seats open (half the restaurant was open), but weren't seating the people waiting probably due to not having enough sushi chefs.

Do not order togo from this place.  The value is horrible and I can't believe we drove off the strip for this.

Best AYCE sushi in Vegas. Sushi is super fresh and the portions are perfect. Excellent service. Great ambiance. Great for small groups and romantic dinners. Try their king of the ocean roll with lobster on top!

Great sushi, great prices, great service what else could you ask for.
Definitely should try the orange blossom roll and the crazy boy roll.

I'm in love with their oysters it's so good and fresh must try them if you're a seafood person they add some kind of sauce with a bit of siracha which made the oyster flavorful also their teriyaki beef is delicious the sauce is just right it's not too sweet or bland the plate comes with salad and miso soup. Pricing is not bad at all. 

The place looks pretty hip and modern all the servers seems to always be occupied or so it looks. But servicing wise could be better since I don't know who was serving us the ones that did assist us were helpful. 

They have an all you can eat special which I have yet to try but definitely will next time.

Overall my experience here has been good so far until next time !!
My favorite AYCE sushi spot and hands down the best in Vegas for AYCE. They have the nicest servers and the restaurant is always clean.

All you can eat in ninety minutes, oh the choices!!! 
The portions are amazing for under $26!!! The hours are amazing too especially since you may not realize how late it is!!!
Our server was very pleasant and offered up delicious choices!
The entire crew worked constantly without overwhelming you with their presence.
Best Sushi spot I've ever tried. Nowhere else in Las Vegas is better. Thank you Umiya.

Food is acceptable but the Japanese steak tastes like the dinner box I can purchase at Walmart with 2 bucks and the service is bad. One waitress barely speak English, and the whole staff spoke in Korean at the bar where I was sitting during my whole visit made me kinda uncomfortable. 

The bright side is one waiter was really attentive so I tipped him but not sure that he would get the tip.

First timer here! Came with a friend who was in town, decided to try this place out. I had the ungai bowl which was really good and fresh. The eel was made perfectly! Very delicious! Also a side of california rolls. which was made freshly as well. Definitely will be coming back to try the other items that have on the menu!
love love this place, great and fresh sushi, great Service. Never disappointed at thud restaurant!!!

Umiya sushi is a moderately sized restaurant with a dark and gloomy interior. There is a sushi menu for all you can eat and a regular menu. I will post photos for both menus later... 

Outside, it is on a barren road. There is a parking lot and several other Japanese restaurants nearby. Parking should not be a problem. There are plenty of spaces to park.

 Inside, it is dark. It feels like it is nighttime once you enter. There is a bar to the right and sushi station. The tables are wooden in the middle and have wooden benches. On the sides are small regular tables and chairs surrounded by willow, tree-like strands. To the left of the entrance is an Asahi alcoholic station. I'm not much into alcoholic drinks, but people would probably like it. There are restrooms in the back and no free wifi. 

 The service was pretty bad to be honest. The servers were bored and never smiled while serving me. But, the service came by at about the 5-10 minute mark. 

 The food is very good,  high quality and fresh. I felt it was one of the best I have ever eaten. We happened to order the all you can eat. I felt it was expensive but, you get what you pay for here. The all you can eat for adults at dinner time which is after 3pm-2am everyday costs us $25.95 a person. The lunch was cheaper at about $20.95, this option is only open from 11am-3pm. The rules are: no leftovers or you pay extra, you only get 90 minutes to eat and no sharing. I found this out the hard way at another sushi restaurant. This is standard for most, if not all sushi places. 

 The prices are high for majority of their items on the regular menu. At least for the good entrée items, it ranges from $12 and up. Overall, my experience here was great. I felt that the service let me down and all you can eat prices were a little on the rough side, but felt it was worth the try.I

Decor and service was good but the sushi didn't blow me away. Rice was a bit too hard and cold. Bummer. Also super tiny rolls and nigiri.

Also another bummer was that a lot of the good pieces on the menu were only one per person on the all you can eat... Kind of defeats the purpose.


DONT USE THE SAUCE THAT COMES WITH THE STEAK! Very ill tasting... Up to you if you want to try it but man... That did not sit well in my mouth.

Place is open till 2am which is great for me I usually like a late snack  

The service kind of sucks they run around with there heads cut off at times and I have had to ask
For the check a few times!!! 

The sushi guys are super nice and friendly  and they don't have a negative crowd in there like kaizen

Lunch with my sis. She had All You Can Eat and that she did While I had some of the best sashimi sampler plate and an Eel Hand Roll - amazing! Service was great. Simple decor with wide roomy wood tables with long benches. 
I would go there again!

Came here for AYCE sushi on a Sunday afternoon after finding it on Yelp, and was more than pleased with my meal. 

The tables are big wooden picnic style tables, so not the most comfortable, but they fit the atmosphere of the restaurant. There were a lot of servers and sushi chefs working so service was quick and efficient. Everything we ordered came out so quick it was great! 

The fish was fresh and the presentation great. Everything we ordered was fantastic. My only gripe is that we came shortly after 3pm so I assumed it was lunch and did not order any dinner only items. Then realized after ordering dessert that their dinner pricing starts at 3pm! What a bummer because there were specials and items that I really wanted too. Also I fee like 3pm is so early to be considered dinner :/
The menu is not as good as say Hachi or Izigaya, but the place is much less expensive, especially if you opt for the All You Can Eat.

We stopped by with a party of 6 and was told it would be a rough 30-60 min wait, the employees worked fast and got us our table within 10mins! Their all you can eat sushi was great, true taste and elegance. Would I recommend you coming here? Absolutely!

I've eaten here many times and this has to be my favorite All You Can Eat Sushi restaurant.  The sushi chefs are always super friendly and greet you when you walk in the door. The wait staff is always attentive and pays close attention to detail - and the FOOD. Omg the sushi is delicious. I tend to stick to cut rolls and nigiri - which are always FANTASTIC. But the rest of the menu is amazing as well. I keep coming back, again, and again, and again.  And, this certainly won't be my last time either.

First time eating AYCE sushi in Las Vegas. Foods here are very fresh especially the grilled mackerel and squid.  Service is very good and very friendly hostess. Will dine here when I come to Las Vegas. If you are a sushi lover, you will like the food here

The first time YELP has let me down. How does this place have so many good reviews? The sushi rice was hard, almost like it was uncooked. The shrimp tempura was cold. And the service - THE SERVICE! Was horrible! Please train your employees to be kind to people that are paying customers, that are helping you get a paycheck, that are eating the food you're making.

Went to Vegas for my birthday and lucked up on this wonderful cuisine. My friends and I decided on the all you can eat and boy it did not fail us. They have a wide variety of things to choose from and to this day my friends and I talk about going back to Vegas just to eat here.

I'm not a big fan of sushi buffets but this place isn't that. They just give you the option to do all you can eat. My girlfriend came here a few months ago so she wanted to bring me here on our trip. We went with a couple friends and did the all you can eat option. We got so much food and the food was definitely worth the all you can eat price. My favorite was the yum yum roll. It had delicious baked crab with yummy sauce on top of the sushi. We were in food coma after all the stuff we ordered. Come try this place if you love sushi as much as I do!

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!!
super service, had lunch with the family, sat at the sushi bar & the kids loved watching the chef do his magic.  they even made special kid friendly options for the kids!!!  super fresh, very creative presentation & cool atmosphere.  
will be back for sure!!!

Todays visit was really good.
Service was prompt and the food came out quick.
Order whats on the special board.
Yuzu hamachi is ayce.

Check in for free soda :)
2.5 per cup of hot green tea.  Most places would serve it as complementary.  Food portion is small. Service is lacking.

I like the varieties offered here, because 50% of the menu come from salads, skewers and other special appetizers, especially my favorite fresh oysters. Do come down and give them a try ! And remember to check in for free soda or green tea.
Bomb! Soooooo good! And all you can eat? Wow. I loved it here. Definitely will come again next time I'm out that way! So yummy and fresh!
Great place for some sushi! Only 26$ per person for all you can eat! The vibe here is great! Highly recommended
This is hands down the best Sushi Buffet place I have ever been to in my life.  My wife agrees.  They have a wide variety of different items on the menu, and their service is awesome!

Restaurant is located near flamingo and arville.
All you can eat or a la carte. they open from 11am till 2am i believe
$20 per person for all you can eat lunch time and $30 or less per person for dinner time
if you come for dinner time you might have to wait a little...
here are my favorite dish
the salmon screaming salad, the mini octopus skewer (1 per person), philadelphia roll, soft shell crab (so crunchy), jalapeño poppers, Nigiri sushi,
monkey brain and the list goes on
staff is friendly, the orders are coming quite fast.
they have large table so sometime they sit you with some other guests, it's fun!
when the restaurant is crowded it happens that it could be very noisy.
dessert is included in the all you can eat pricing
bon appétit
sorry we ate it all before i realized i had to take pics lol

one of my favorite All you can eat sushi place. My husband loves raw fishes but I don't eat anything raw. This place have plenty of both. Many selections and they have specials often. Today I have a free soda and they're also giving free mug with Yelp review. Yippee! We're ordering Oysters, soft shell crabs, yummy pork belly, mini octopus and so much more. They also have ribeye steak (small portion) as part of all you can and we haven't even got to dessert. Nom nom nom $25.95 for AYCE dinner. hubby is going for super white tuna and sweet shrimp.

The set up to this restaurant is pretty cool. I like how the decor is and how there's TVs set up around the place. I like how to the left when you enter theres a bunch of lights draping. It gives the place a romantic vibe. 

I came on a Friday around 4:00pm and it was dead. Which I liked because from the reviews I really thought it was going to be a busy. 

I ordered a few of the popular rolls such as: King of the ocean, Kiss of fire, First kiss, sunset, sunrise, rainbow, firecracker, etc. also ordered a bunch of nigiri. 

I honestly wasn't too impressed with the fish. It wasn't as fresh as I would have hoped. And the flavors didn't go as well either. There was one roll I got called Seafood Volcano Roll and it was a bit of a mess. There was a lot of things going on with it. It had mushrooms which I thought was a bit out of the ordinary but didn't go very well with the fish. 

I ordered a spicy seafood salad, which I thought was really good. It had a lot of fish in it and the dressing was just right. They have a variety of mochi ice cream flavors which was appreciated but of course it is just 1 order per person. I tried their plum wine flavored ice cream which I really thought was delicious! 

Service was great. Staff was nice and attentive. Goyemon is still my #1 AYCE.

All you can eat $26. Came in at 8 on Monday night. Waited 15 minutes and was seated at a nice table to ourselves. There are big tables where they seat 2 parties of 2 people and separate ends though. So call ahead if you do not want this to happen. Seared tuna sashimi is a must. Oysters, baby octopus skewer and crispy rice were okay. Salmon belly sashimi is great. Uni wasn't my favorite. We got half orders on all our rolls, which is an awesome option! King of the ocean and kiss of fire were my partners favorite. I liked the salsa dancing and salmon lover rolls. Dessert was tempura green tea ice cream and coffee/red bean  mochi, delicious! 

Overall it was a decent dinner. For the price and the quality of the food I liked it and would recommend to people that are staying at Rio, Palms or if you are looking for sushi off the strip to avoid strip prices.

My boyfriend and I always come here for sushi. It is hands down the best sushi place in all of Vegas.  The AYCE is a must, and for under $30, it is a steal. Everything is so good, but my favorite rolls are the ORANGE BLOSSOM, RED ROCK, and SNOW WHITE. You MUST try these.  Alex (the owner) came up with all of the sauces for the rolls by himself so the sushi is different than all other places. Umiya serves such high quality fresh fish. Just try the sashimi salads and seared ahi tuna with AJ sauce to see what I mean. 

We went last night for a birthday, and Alex and his crew made it an amazing night. They went out of their way to make a special roll and carved fruit sculptures for the birthday boy.  Not only is the food beyond delicious, the people are just so genuine. They make you feel like family right when you walk in. Give it a shot and I guarantee it'll be your new sushi spot.

Food is GREAT!! But SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!! We specifically asked for udon noodles without anything just noodles and broth, and we got just broth. I think the lady that took the order doesn't seem to understand English very much, and after we told her it was the wrong order she had a bad attitude like it was our fault that she didn't understand english! I love this place but that lady with attitude is ruining this restaurant reputation. Other servers are great! But except for her. She had long hair with bangs, didn't catch her name but I wish I did.

Great sushi to go with the price. Also service was amazing with the sushi coming out quickly and efficiently. The servers also were very attentive. The all you can eat includes all you can eat dessert (minus mochi limited to one per person.

We did the AYCE and every single thing we ordered was amazing! I'm just upset we got full and couldn't try more things! Lol To start off with some recommendations; we started with the seared tuna with AJ sauce, it was very fresh and had great flavor. The baked muscles are probably the best I've ever had! We ordered monkey brains which is avocado and spicy tuna fried which was seriously AMAZING. All the rolls we ordered (first kiss, kiss of fire, Japanese lasagna, seafood volcano, & the  green chili one) the one that stood out the most was the seafood volcano. Although all rolls were very fresh and flavorful, this one was my favorite! Another cool thing is that you get dessert with the AYCE which is always a plus :) There are other items on the menu I wish we could of tried like the skewers and jalapeño poppers, but that's for next time! The staff was extremely friendly and the place looks very clean and such a nice vibe. Love the little button at your table where you can alert them if you need a refill, your check, or just to order more food. Highly recommend this place. My husband and I have been looking for a new sushi place with some quality fish & this place is just that and more!

Went here for dinner with wife and kids.  Both of us got food poisoning (kids are fine because they didn't eat raw fish).  Even before getting sick the food was not very good.  Everything tasted weird and unappetizing.  We stopped short of ordering our fill and left with a larger than expected bill.  Wish we had just ate at the hotel.

If no star was an option, I would defiantly put that instead. The ordering was very unorganized. The staff was pretty friendly and tried to help out as much as they could but still only seemed to be trainees. One female staff with black hair and chubby cheeks was extremely rude and neglected every request that was made. Even after the total negative vibe from chubby, she had the nerve to ask us to tip her even though it's an option. An older woman who seemed to be the manager was very friendly but all in all, I'll never come back.

My husband and I love this place! We come pretty regularly because the food is delicious and reasonably priced. We typically order a la carte, but the all you can eat menu is definitely worth a try if you're coming with a big appetite.

I will not be returning to this restaurant. I came in with a friend after his date ditched him. I said lets go to where his date wanted to go. We tried the all you can eat dinner menu. 
First off, their menu is highly incorrect. I asked for seared salmon. Both times it was taken out and guess what...???? It wasn't even seared. Seared salmon is torched and becomes a light pink. Each time the "seared salmon" came out it was raw. After explaining to the waiter that this is not seared for the third time, he never returned to the table. I don't believe that's how the customer service industry works. It took over 30 mins for someone to bring us our bill. My date had to get up 2x to ask for the check. If he didn't get up, how long would it have taken? Hmmm....
The food was so so. Tempura calamari, I would not recommend. Crispy rice with spicy tuna was alright, not the best. Chicken skewer tasted like a McDonald's chicken nugget. Enjoyed my miso soup, and cucumber salad, which explains the sushi was not good or fresh tasting. 
I was so hungry after leaving this place I went to another restaurant to get to-go. I highly regret going here. 1 star!!!

We went here for the All You Can Eat (AYCE) Sushi and it was delicious. They were uber attentive to us, but it wasn't packed that night so I can't judge if this is how it is every night.  The rolls were delicious, we also had some hot garlic edamame and nigiri. Very fresh.

The rolls were quite intricate and I wish I had a bigger stomach to try more, but alas, AYCE sushi always ends.  I did check in on Yelp for the free sake, totally worth it.

The ambiance was great, fun music with the music videos but they also had the football game on.  I loved the interior and it felt more modern than some of the other AYCE places and also more open. Although I wasn't a large group this time, this place is a much better fit for a large group than other places I've eaten at.

This place is deals!!! AYCE and the prices for ala carte was just as cheap. The quality of the rolls and a few of the dishes were simple and tasty. They don't pack in a lot of rice for the nigiri which is good! 90 minute time limit goes up pretty fast, but they still offer you desserts in the end even though your time is up which I thought was nice. 
-This place gets super packed, and there was a few tables filled up as soon as they opened.
-There is a lot of large tables, great for large groups!
*Fresh Oysters, and Grilled Octopus were great, fresh and tasty! 
-Don't bother with the ribeye, it sucked. Dry, overcooked and puny.

I have gone to almost all sushi spots. When it comes to a la carts and also AYCE sushi. This is by far my favorite. From the taste, presentation and overall service of the food. Amazing! Always come here, and I recommend the lobster roll. I love the speedy service, the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. The sushi is even better! Come here when your in Vegas for the best sushi in town.

The food here is great! Got the all you can eat for about 25 dollars and i was not disappointed with the selection.  The only thing i did not like was that the servers were a little pushy about us ordering fast and would stand there until we did.  Overall it was a good place to get sushi.  The place was not packed at all when we went (around 11 pm) so we got to eat as soon as we got there unlike the 40 minute to an hour wait at sushi kaya.

Orange blossom is a dope as they say. A must try when you come in. Don't forget your free soda with check in. Also, right off the bat, don't get the tempura ice cream. Not a tasty treat. Just get a scoop of ice cream and/or some mochi. 

I like AYCE sushi for variety and this place has it. 

I went in specifically intending to eat a bunch of non sushi. 

I'm gonna skip most of the obvious good stuff

The ramen isn't as bad as the other reviews suggest. I got the tonkotsu. I enjoy good ramen. Ramen sora is my go-to. This isn't amazing ramen but given the choice between plain miso and this porky treat, I'm going porky treat every time, babe. 

The house salad is so good. Always get two orders. Quality dressing and ingredients. Comes with a slice of avocado. I haven't had a house salad this dope at any other restaurant I've been to. 

Fish Katsu is some choice, moist, crunchy goodness. I'm typically not a fan of mayo. I'd still recommend getting it on the side but it goes well with the fish. Sprinkle some of that shichimi on that mayo and *muah*(is that the kissy noise?) I was in love. 

So obvious stuff, pork belly, sushi, skewers are a good time. I'm not very refined when it comes to these things but this was definitely worth the price. 

I had to give it five cuz I was so happy with the my orders but the service ain't necessarily top notch. It's a common complaint with sushi places. I don't know if I was being unreasonable but it took a really long time to get another house salad after asking for it. Maybe this is a quality takes time situation, but I just expect an order of salad to have a pretty quick turnaround time. Easy fix. Just request two orders right off the bat. I don't think I've ever regretted ordering more salad ever.

So I've been essentially going to "I love Sushi", for 13 years. I do go some other places but "I Love Sushi" has been my go to place. I just started using "Bite Squad" for food delivery and I Love Sushi isn't a part of it. So based on good reviews I tried Umiya. I am very satisfied with the quality and taste of their food. It is excellent. It is much better than most sushi places around. They are obviously professionals and they know what they are doing. Looks like I have a new Sushi place when ordering delivery. Everything was very good. I ordered $150 worth of sushi and every dish was well prepared even for carry out. I knew nothing of this restaurant until seeing them on the Bite Squad app. I'm sure they do a good business there. I've been a sushi connoisseur for 30 years and this Umiya definitely passes the test. 

Update. I ordered a second and third. I wasn't as impressed. The food was good. I did go to another sushi place called SAI in Anthem Vilage. The food at SAI was excellent. I will give Umiya a rest. I don't believe the food was consistently excellent.

Sushi Fix and GO!

I've been to a few sushi places here in Vegas and this place is the best so far!

Staff is on top of tables,they fill water and drinks without having to be asked or looked for!  There is nothing worse then being a thirsty guest, especially in Las Vegas. Our staff was also friendly and continued to check on us throughout our meal.

Most places I've been to wont allow someone in a group of  AYCE menu goers to just order off the the regular menu.  Umiya Sushi does and it was great.  Everyone got exactly what they wanted and the food just kept coming.  Full of flavor, sweet rice, fresh ingredients and all of the staff were in complete harmony with each other.  No hiccups, no worries and an overall great dinning experience.  

 We will all be back!  Thank you for a wonderful time and feeding the bodybuilders in our group!  

- Cara

Good stuff. Great place for a date.  They have rib eye steak as well-small portion, but great for an AYCE. Seems good quality and has a variety of choices.  The service is as quick as a blink of an eye hahah.  I don't have anything bad to say about it, i just actually want smaller portions for the sushi because i want to try everything, but that's no big deal, I won't remove a star.

I was hesitant to try this place because I'm used to going to my regular spots..reason for, is because everytime I go out and try something new, it just never appeals to me, for example, bad service and terrible food even with awesome reviews about those places. So I took a risk and tried this joint out..the place was very subtle and the ambience was relaxing. The server was very attentive and always came to our table at the right time we needed him. Now to the food. The nigiri was super fresh, with the right amount of rice and the appetizers were incredible. The must have are the salmon cheese stick, sizzling pork belly on a skillet, and soft shell crab just to name a few..the rolls were very delicious, great texture and flavors..oh! And you can order half rolls as well so that really got me loving this place even more! So in conclusion, I highly recommend this place and I will definitely be back soon!! Peeeeace!!
The menu was great!  A lot of options for all!  I liked the fact that you could order 1/2 rolls so you could try a lot of different rolls!  Very nice staff!
