I absolutely love Umiya!!!! There are so many different dishes to satisfy all of the different people in your party. Personally My favorite dish is the Baked New Zealand mussel in dynamite sauce, I crave it!!! I cannot wait to come back!!

Can't express how impressed I was with the tiny amount of rice, amazing service and the quality of fish. I was expecting just another sushi restaurant but boy, was I wrong. The chef gave us some special sushi that wasn't on the menu, which was simply amazing. We were the few people there so I think the chef felt trigger-happy to shoot us a few special dishes. I'm not complaining.

Also, I'm not a huge roll fan but I have to say they use very little sauce and it actually compliments the sushi nicely. The ribeye steak was great. The nigiri is fresh and served with very little rice. I would like to revisit Umiya again and focus more on the nigiri but the rolls and special dishes were simply too good for me to leave room for anything else. But from the tuna, yellowtail and shrimp nigiri I ate I could say it was great. Cheers that Kaizen is out and Umiya is in. Looking forward to my next visit.

so we pay the Bill and I leave. a bit tip because they were nice. BUT BIG mistake!!! the sushi chef comes over to our table and warns us FREAKIN WARNS US and really SCOLDS US that we should be ashamed because we left rice! I ONLY left rice in my soup because I like to eat rice in my soup. it's a Korean thing! and they're korean! The first round of sushi was great. small pieces and little rice. BUT the 2nd round. rice got bigger than the fish AND the slice of fish was thinner. then the 3rd round, Big balls of rice and super razor thin slices... no... SLIVERS Of fish. How do they expect us to eat that much rice towards the end of our meal!? Seriously do they not think!? Never will we return and I will warn everyone I care about to NEVERA Come here, unless they want to be harassed and SCOLDED for leaving rice. it wasn't even that frkn much. those a**hole staff for calling us out like that. OH! Did I mention that the sushi chef especially told us it's because we're KOREAN and he expected us to do that.

One of my favorite AYCE sushi places here in Las Vegas. I've never really had a bad experience here with both the food and service. It would be worthwhile to stop by if you're looking for good sushi, it's located near the Palms hotel and casino on Flamingo road.
Went to have lunch here with a friend and it was my first time doing ayce don't know what she ordered but it was all good

We came here for my boyfriends birthday.  We each got the AYCE sushi.  The AYCE menu was extensive and we each enjoyed every roll and selection that we made.  My boyfriend was really happy that we got to try Uni for the first time here (included on the AYCE menu).  The service was very nice too.  I would definitely recommend to a friend.

Like $27.00 + tax for AYCE.

Tips:
1. Go with at least 3 friends if you can. That way you can share food as a table instead of trying to eat something all by yourself. You can try more this way.
2. Don't order rolls that have 8000 pounds of rice! You'll be full super fast like the rookies at our table.
3. Order everything on the limited menu/special. Make sure you order those things as they are limited for a reason! 
4. Eat the fried shrimp heads! 

Stay away from some things like:
1. The iced tea. It tastes weird and like it's from fountain concentrate, not fresh.
2. The fried calamari. It's fish cake-based, not actually squid.
3. Fried banana ice cream. Not tasty.
4. Green tea mochi. Tastes cheap and actually floral.
5. Ramen. It's a throw away of stomach space and not exactly a ramen shop.

No reservations unless it's a party of 6 or more, so time your trip appropriately.
You get 90 minutes to eat. We were initially worried it would take forever to get food, but our server was the absolute shit! We slammed him with the world's largest order and then told him "we trust your judgment" about anything he wanted to add. Our food came out so fast at 8PM on a Sunday right after we ordered. 

If you want the most chill, AWESOME server, get the guy with sideswept hair. I want to say he's Filipino or SE Asian. (Bro, I'm so sorry if you're not, but everyone there is Asian, so I don't know how to describe you. You deserve big money, and I hope people throw tons of it at you.)

Come eat when you are HUNGRY, and bring fun friends that bring good vibes.
Good until the end, owner rude.. Wouldn't recommend going, bad service. Not coming back.

this used to be my go to spot for sushi until three people close to me (all from different visits) got food poisoning from this place. 

on top of all that, the last time I went the fish weren't fresh at all.  sad....
the uni was borderline gross....

All you can eat sushi? Um yes please! This place was awesome and it was nice to get away from the strip for a little while. Service was great as well. We had an assortment of rolls, orange blossom, lobster crunch, and salmon killer. All of them very flavorful, excellent way to end our Vegas trip. 
Thanks Umiya!
Awesome food for lunch or dinner. This is one place I definitely wouldn't miss every time I come to Vegas. Great food good prices

Wow, this place was amazing.  The servers were super nice, and they check on you every minute or so, so no wait time on service.  The appetizers, sushi, and dessert were delicious.  This was one of the highlights of our Vegas trip.  Can't recommend highly enough.

Service was ok food was horrible had the all you can eat and now I can see why. Old rice, not so fresh fish and it will give runs. Had the worst runs for a couple days. DON'T GO THERE...RUN FAR FAR AWAY

This review is for the food only. It's nice to be off of the strip, and some of the fish was excellent, but I found myself wishing I had spent a little more money and gone somewhere with an excellent offering. The place is clean and the staff are very nice. I did the AYCE lunch special but did not like some of the rolls. When I didn't finish them rolls I was told I would be charged extra to leave them. I ate a few more pieces but really didn't enjoy them. What I did like was their yellowtail sushi and their spicy yellowtail roll. Other than that, I won't be visiting back. :(

This is a different AYCE experience.  We went for dinner and the menu was interesting.  Mini orders of ribeye, katsu, and ramen are available, as well as some specials.  The prices are the same as Goyemon, so if it's crowded there you could hop over here.  I enjoyed the tempura, salmon nigiri, ribeye, katsu, and grilled fish very much.  I was sad that crabmeat (the shredded crab in the california rolls) wasn't available on the nigiri menu.

It is a great stop for AYCE and some other dishes.  I'll be back.

Never realized that there was a hidden gem down the street from my house! Plenty of parking in the plaza, but it has few street lights and looks kind of sketchy from the outside. But never judged a book by its cover because the insides atmosphere is sort of like a club! Good music and dim lighting! I felt super rushed eating because I felt that all the servers were running around. Food came out quickly and dirty plates were taken away promptly. 

I like the appetizer options here as they offered a lot of things you wouldn't normally see in other sushi restaurants, at least none of the ones I have been to! My friends gobbled a plate of shishito peppers (limit one order per person), the plate had quite a few peppers on them. I did not try them but my friends said they're good, and taste like bell peppers.

THE GOOD: 
- oysters (limit one order per person). Quite meaty and clean! I didn't have a mouthful of sand or bits of sand in my mouth after eating it. We were all surprised at how big the oysters were.
- baby octopus skewers. They literally give you a tiny one
- soft shell crab. I was surprised at how good this was! You can literally eat the entire thing without having to spit anything out. We wanted to order more since it's limit one per person I think, but we were saving room for our rolls. 

THE EHH
- chicken skewers look nothing like the picture on the menu. There were hardly any vegetables on the skewer. Maybe one piece of onion or bell pepper to separate the chicken pieces. 
- Ginkgo has a lot of Heath benefits and it came in a bowl with about 10 or so. Tasted sort of like boiled peanuts
- bacon scallops. They gave us 2 pieces and the bacon was too crispy/overdone. 

I'D SKIP
- mussels were overcooked and a bit too chewy IMO. 
- yuzu ceviche (limit one per person): I would not order this again. The fish pieces tasted really off and they were kind of mushy. 
- ribeye was very small. We got 4 small slices and it was over cooked. 

You can't go wrong with any of their rolls but the nigiri had way too much rice. I'm used to 1/3 of the rice they out in the nigiri but the quality of the fish wasn't bad. Our favorite was the eel and salmon belly. 

Their dessert options are kind of limited. They offer tempura ice cream (green tea or vanilla) which is a single scoop of ice cream. It's not very big, so I would recommend not sharing! They also offer different mochi ice cream flavors including red bean, green tea, strawberry and others. And, ice cream scoops as well. 

If the rice ratio is a big deal for you then I wouldn't recommend coming here. But the upside is that they do offer a variety of appetizers and the food comes out super quick! Plus service is great.

Another great experience at this all you can eat sushi place. A little over a mile from our hotel, this little place off the strip is a hidden gem. Very few limitations on the menu for the all you can eat, so you can keep ordering as much of anything if you want. They also offer half rolls, so you're not stuck with a full portion.

I gotta say, this is the best Japanese restaurant in Vegas! So far I came to Umiya twice in the last three weeks and it's very good! They make the food fresh and tasty flavors.

They have many different variety of foods from appetizers, sushi, chicken, beef, desserts, soups, seafood, and much more. This place also have sodas, teas, beer, and wine. Just a heads up, some of the portions are limited to one per person. 

So far, I tried:

Appetizers
- Baked Mussels (MY FAVORITE!)
- Salmon Cheesesticks

Entree
- Teriyaki Chicken
- Chicken Katsu
- BBQ Short Ribs

Sushi
- Smoked Salmon Sashimi
- Spicy Tuna Roll
- Spicy Salmon Roll
- King of Ocean Roll
- Fire Cracker Roll
- Sexy Roll
- Rainbow Roll
- Salsa Dancing Roll
- Sunrise Roll
- Baked Salmon Roll
- Dragon Roll
- Rattle Snake Roll
- Creamy Eel Roll
- Orange Blossom Roll
- Energy Roll
- Banana Roll

Dessert
- Green Tea Moshi
- Vanilla Ice Cream
- Banana Split

If you are around this area, I recommend to try this restaurant! This place may be pricey but worth to try! Don't go to the Japanese buffet around the corner, its the almost the same price as here as well. All the food here are made to order and much fresher here also. All the staff here are friendlier and get your orders correctly!

I would have to crown Umiya as the AYCE sushi joint in Vegas.

Why?

Sushi Nigri is excellent, sweet shrimp included, oysters, sea urchin, fresh sushi, soft shell crab and shrimp tempura.

The only negative is that the rolls are very average. There strength is in there nigiri and sashimi and soft shell crab.

This place used to be called Kaizen and they didn't have the AYCE sushi.  But one Friday night, my wife and I were looking for an AYCE sushi spot and we saw this place and everywhere else was a crazy 1-1.5 hr wait.  So we decided to try the place out.  We immediately took to it because of the atmosphere and it was spacious.  It wasn't crowded nor was the place like most sushi spots where it's small and compact and there's barely any room to walk on. 

The staff was very friendly and warm.  The menu is very extensive! It actually has 4 whole pages of food, including a huge amount of foods that aren't seafood-ish.  I know many people would say, "why go to a sushi spot and not eat seafood or sushi?"  Well some people have something called "allergies" and we don't want them excluded, especially since I have a brother who is allergic to shellfish and a nephew who is allergic to freshwater fish.  So, it was really awesome that they had plenty of great choices for those who cannot enjoy certain aspect of sushi eating.  Including steak, teriyaki, noodles, beef, pork and chicken dishes.  

My favorite is Snow White and the Ono nigiri.  But. their Tuna sashimi w/ AJ sauce is to die for.  My wife loves the oysters and she said that their uni is very fresh.  The food is just all around very good, fresh and well prepared.

We loved the place so much, we went back with our family the next evening.  AND we would definitely be going back again!

We went at around 5pm, there was no wait we were seated right away and the restaurant is very clean, dark lighting.

All the servers and workers greeted us coming in. The whole service experience was excellent ! It wasn't like other AYCE places I have been where we had to wait a long time between every order. 
The server came to check on us very often, and the sushi rolls are served just few minutes every time after we ordered. 

The nigiri rolls were sliced thinner than other places but the fish is definitely very fresh.. and not a lot of rice either!  The special rolls are very delicious too! 
 
Not as many appetizer choices though... 
overall one of the best AYCE sushi places I have been!

I came here with my brother, my son and niece last week some time. Me and my brother have different preferences in places to go for sushi. He named this one and Oyshi. I picked this place because it had a higher rating. Of course he likes to be opposite than me, he thinks Oyshi is better and doesn't believe in ratings lol. I personally love Sushi Hero and their ratings reflect it. I started at Yama on Flamingo, then to Sakana. Anyway, let's talk about Umiya...
I tend to get more of the kitchen stuff now rather than the rolls, and I love the kitchen food here. I always need my fresh oysters, shrimp tempura, seafood salad or some sort, baked mussels and Tako. This place has Fish Katsu and I was like o_O OMG, it was heaven to just have it on the  menu and even a higher place in heaven was the taste. Their Sashimi that you can get in the AYCE was delicious as well. Too bad it was only 1 order per person. 
Now to the "negatives". 
1.They seem to focus too much on making sure you only ordered the "1 order per person" once, that when my brother ordered the 2 sashimi orders (for him and his daughter, I went to order it and she said we already had two orders. I said "we have 4 people". And when my brother ordered the fresh oysters for me, because he doesn't like it, he was worried they would see me eat it. I hope they don't trip about that because we paid for 4 AYCE so no matter who eats the 1 order per person stuff, we can get 4 orders. So don't trip on little things like that for the price we're paying. 
2. I know it was a little busy but if you're gonna put a time limit, you should make sure you're  fully staffed enough so people can get their orders in. There was a point in time neither of us 4 had any food to eat LOL. First world problems, I know..but still...Time is money. 
All in all, I'd go again. I'd probably just sit at a table next time, since I really just like sitting at the bar if we can order directly from the chef. You don't really do that here. Okay bye.

Third time here :) the presentation and service is awesome!!!Our server is very attentive :) The food is great! Love the rib-eye steak. Uni is so fresh and also the oyster!! If you check in you get a free drink!!! I need to come back here more often :)

From just a combination of underwhelming service and mediocre sushi, I feel like this place deserves 3 stars. 
The moment my sister and I entered the restaurant, it was quite busy so none of the servers greeted us. We only got a half hearted greeting from one sushi chef. Then we waited around 5 minutes for a server to get us seated, but we stood at the front counter awkwardly because one server was busy dealing with checks and talking on the walkie.
For the ayce, we didn't even get to look at the menu for 1 minute before the same server came back. He honestly seemed bothered with our presence and all the other servers kept eyeballing our table at first. (??) Throughout our dinner, they didn't come to check up on us to really see how we were doing but it was more like to pick up our empty plates. We were rushed to order more and rushed to finish fast. Not too enjoyable. 

When we got to ordering, the rolls came out very quick and there was one nice server who was good with refilling our water. 
On to the food... the only ones that stuck out to me were the Who's Your Daddy appetizer and the First Kiss roll. The other rolls tasted similar and was quite lacking on the eel sauce for those that we ordered with eel sauce. But then halfway through our dinner, my sister noticed a hair in our soft shell crab roll.... uhh I know damn well that it is not mine nor hers because our hair is pretty long while that one was significantly short. 
Such an inane experience, I won't give this place another chance.

Wow I was so disappointed in this place! It's $24ish for mediocre food. Why does this place have 4.5 stars? This is so inaccurate. The quality of the sashimi was not good at all. This was my last meal in Las Vegas and I regretted going here like crazy. The sushi was not good. I would rather pay full price for good sushi than go to this bad AYCE sushi place. Also, they charge for hot tea? What kind of asian restaurant charges for tea :/ There are so many other places to eat in Vegas DO NOT GO HERE. Waste of your time and stomach space. (Also, my stomach felt kind of uncomfortable afterwards..) I will say that I liked their sweet potato tempura though.

UPDATE:I got food poisoning from this place. DO NOT GO HERE. I basically had stomach flu symptoms and was dry heaving like crazy. Beware of the not fresh food

THIS IS MY FAVORITE SUSHI PLACE IN LAS VEGAS. I've tried almost all of the AYCE sushi places in Vegas and NOTHING beats this place. I don't even have anything else to say except for the fact that I am left speechless (and pregnant with a food baby) after every meal here.

Been to this spot twice and left both times wanting more! The actual inside of te restaurant is so huge! High ceilings, and plenty of tables to build parties. I loved that they decorated for halloween! The food is AYCE and it is good!!! I always go to AYCE for the baked mussels, I love when they have a lot of cheese! This place doesn't put a lot of cheese on them but they are very flavorful! I tried the Yuze Lemonade Tea it is so good! Lots of pulp in the drink. Service is always great! I will be coming back!
Really good sushi for ayce n the srvc here is very quick n friendly. Def will come back for sure

I have dined at Umiya many times. Seems as if every time I come back the quality of the food gets worse and worse. Last night, the rolls that came out were inedible and contained none of the ingredients listed, ALL RICE!!! There are a lot of amazing Japanese restaurants, I do not recommend dining here. Definitely left a sour taste in my mouth after last nights experience!

I love this place once a week maybe two times a week 
Who's judging ;)
I'm here I love this place they always take care of me and the sushi is the realest the cleanest the tastiest and shout out to jay .thug life and everyone working there
The girls are also awesome
Great place to eat alone or with a group
Thank you for your awesomeness 
;)

Although on the expensive side, the sushi here is nice and has pretty good flavour but nothing blows me out of the water. Fan of the French kiss sushi because the mango was an interesting twist and the seared tuna steak with veges was lovely.

Visited this place while in town.  Great all you can eat menu.  Food came out fast.  Lots of different types of sushi on the all you can eat menu.  I came with a large party and the staff treated us well.  I'd visit this place again if in Vegas.

I have no idea where all these good reviews come from because we had a shitty experience. When we first walked in we were not greeted nor asked if we can sign up. 3 people saw us just standing there and would not acknowledge us. Interior was beyond sloppy and their restroom was so dirty. We asked to be seated at the bar and it sucked because you weren't even allowed to order sushi from the chefs. Completely defeats the whole purpose and the bar is so high you can't even see how they make your food. Sushi was good but not great. I mean honestly nothing was great here. Then to put the cherry on top, my boyfriend order ramen before we closed out and it never came. We asked for it twice and nothing. Talk about waiting for over 20 minutes. We paid and left. Never coming back here ever again.

Excellent AYCE Sushi. We sat at the bar & a waitress took our orders. Had Uni with a quail egg.  Yummy. Sweet shrimp was excellent too. The mackerel was very good as was the salmon skin cut roll. For Desert it's pistachio almond ice cream. Everything is really good here. They play nice music too.  Nice experience tonight.

My cousin had the all you can eat and I ordered off the al a carte menu because it was late. I had the teriyaki chicken which came with a side salad. The teriyaki chicken was very average and was mostly mushrooms; the salad was also average and the thick dressing was not very appetizing. I also used my yelp check in offer for a free drink and I chose the hot tea but the waiter forgot to bring it out.
PHENOMENAL CUSTOMER SERVICE !!! !!!   This restaurant is a well oiled machine. The manager and his team knows how to welcome everyone that comes in.  Best Anniversary ever !!! Thanks Umiya !!!

First time here!

We love it! Why you ask???

Food - abundant choices! I love an AYCE with choices in every category...sushi, appetizers, skewers, salads and even dessert!  (ps...my ramen was piping hot and that's a deal breaker for me)

Service - very attentive and polite. Staff is very welcoming.

Totally worth $26! So come hungry people!

Seriously the best sushi outside of Japan, the all you can eat menu is perfect for sampling. Highly recommend this place, the customer service is great, the food is exquisite, and the venue is relaxing.

Came in on a Sunday night and it was jam packed!!  Hostess was super friendly and said wait was about 20min so we asked to sit at the bar (5min wait).  Service was great from the moment we walked in and even tho they were packed everyone was really nice.  Got seated and got drink order right away(16oz draft & glass of white wine fo da wifey).  Sashimi??? for ayce...limited to 1 order but was still ba...bomb!!  Soft shell crab??? for ayce...limited to 1 order but devoured.  Uni, amaebi, salmon belly were all awesome.  Ayce menu was huge from appetizers to sushi to sashimi to custom rolls to hand rolls which were probably the best hand rolls (spicy hamachi, spicy tuna, spicy salmon & yes i ate them all & yes i like to eat)  i've eaten at an ayce or anywhere not ayce to steaks to noodles this place has it all.  There's sumthin' for everyone!  Definitely found a new place for ayce and the reviews are spot on this time.
The food is amazing.  One of the best shrimp tempuras I've ever had. Rolls are tasty and well balanced in flavors.  Rivals amazing food I had in Tokyo. Ambience is chic and trendy.

Came in with a couple of friends and it was super busy! We had to wait a little while for our entire party to get there but the wait wasn't bad at all! Once seated it did take awhile for the server to come to our table but once we did it was fine! I tried to ramen I wasn't a fan of it. Everyone else at the table loved their sushi! I  would definitely come back and try something else!

First time coming to umiya and went solely based off of yelp reviews. Boy am I glad that I ate here! Service was quick and excellent! The choices were endless and the food was extremely delicious. Set and setting was extremely spacious with medium to loud noise. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that is or isn't even in the area!
I've brought 5 people to this place, and each of them have proclaimed it as their new fav sushi place in Vegas. So yeah that's my update.

Great service and even better food!! I had a guy waitress and he was sooooo nice making sure we were okay at all times, with a great sense of humor. For dinner I had a fried Philadelphia roll and a Vegas lasagna.... Their fresh sushi is great too! Not bad for 26$ all you can eat.... Oh the only downfall were the 1$ skewers not so great  everything else was just lovely!

I've been craving AYCE sushi for a while now and decided to try this place out after work because it was open late night and had high reviews on Yelp. 
I'm surprised that this sushi restaurant has such high reviews because compared to other AYCE sushi restaurants like Sakana and Yama Sushi, this is by far the worst AYCE sushi restaurant I've been to in the Las Vegas area. 
First off, the server was extremely rude and rushed us to order right after we sat down and my boyfriend and I didn't even have time to look at the menu. After ordering once, we had to wave for a server to take our orders even though there were only four other parties in the restaurant at the time. 
As for the sushi, the sushi rice was soggy and too wet. It wasn't even the sauce that made it soggy, the rice was probably just cooked with too much water. The salmon nigiri tasted chewy and did not taste fresh at as if it's been frozen for a long time. 
We could tell that the restaurant was very unorganized because we kept receiving appetizers after we received our sushi rolls, which was really weird. 
The only great thing about this restaurant is the amount of items in the menu, there's a lot to choose from ranging from appetizers, soups, salads, poke, and sushi rolls, however everything that my boyfriend and I ordered did not taste as good as we were expecting. I believe it was the bad sushi rice that ruined the sushi rolls for us.

Not bad for $28/person with tax and tip included. We came here right before leaving Vegas for lunch. You cannot order just sashimi though. Just order several orders of the Poke and you can skip the rice! Food came fast and service was good!

Our table of 9 was..... disappointed. 

So we checked in at 7:17p and we didn't have a table until about 8-8:10p.  See, that's not usually a problem since we understand that we're a large party arriving at dinner time so yes, we expected to wait quite a while. But after 40 minutes, we decided to sit inside the restaurant. we noticed that the hostesses has absolutely no idea of seating or planning. An entire table that could comfortably sit 10-12 people were occupied by a couple. One couple. They actually sat one couple down at a table that could easily fit ours. 

Moving on. We ordered (ordering is already a pain since it seems like there's certain people only available to take orders and they seem to disappear as soon as you hold a menu in your hand). throughout our night, the food kept coming out like, in spurts. Like 4 dishes would come out. Then 15 minutes of nothing would come. I ordered nigiri and after 20 minutes, i accepted that it wasn't put in. So I ordered the same thing again and explained the situation to the waitress. After another 20 minutes, it still didn't come. Towards the very end of our meal, all of the nigiri came. Like really? 

Annoyed, My sister's fiancé actually asked a waitress if they have some sort of system or list that they cross off as the food is delivered to our table. She actually said no. Which explains the unpredictable timing of food, delay of food, and just ... it was chaos. 

The food itself was, alright. My sister literally broke out in hives after eating at Umiya. The drive to find an open pharmacy was intense (they all seem to close at 11p by our house). For all parents with a child breaking out in hives: GET BENADRYL. it works faster! Today my sister's doctor said that the food might not have been fresh or the oil clean. 

Our waitress saw 2 little rice pieces of rice (from the nigiri) and she immediately prompted us with a speech about how left over rice will be an extra charge. Wouldn't be a better idea to prompt us towards the END of our meal? Because my dad planned on eating the sushi rice with his soft shell crab... 

I understand that we are a big party. And we always loved coming to Umiya. But the quality and service has been going downhill steadily. It hasn't actually affected us until now.

One of the more solid AYCE sushi restaurants close to the Vegas strip. A block away from the Palms Hotel & Casino. 

Their spicy edamame is one the best in town! Everything on the menu is up to par. From all the rolls to the house salad to the fish katsu. The people there are pretty friendly & very prompt with their service.

Went here with bf on a Monday night. Not a busy night for the restaurant. There were only about 5 to 6 tables occupied with just a couple per table. 

I noticed immediately that the service was a little slow and was a little unorganized. We were seated though immediately but the orders were taken after 15 minutes. I mentioned it was kind of unorganized because after the male server took our orders, after 5 minutes the female server approached our table and asked if our orders were taken.

Now let's rate the food...

I can say the fish quality was good, fish was very fresh and firm (Nigiris).

Grilled seafood was so so... I've eaten better.

Deep fried items were also so so... The soft shell crab that I ordered was drenched in oil. Also they don't put the dipping sauce on the side but they just drizzle it and it makes the dish more wet rather than crispy and light on the outside and moist in the inside

Rolls were okay... I ordered the Tuna Tataki (Rating: 7 out of 10) and Snow White (4 out of 10). 

I can say though that the Seared Tuna with AJ sauce was something different and it was really good. Too bad it's only 1 order per person.

Desserts... Also ordinary and it's one per person too. We tried the mango mochi and tempura ice cream.

Maybe we will be back, I say Goyemon is still the best AYCE in town!

We tried this place for the first time no realizing they had all you can eat. So we tried the all you can eat for I think $24.95. The sushi was fresh and the rolls were yummy. They even had oysters in the half shell on the all you can eat.

Fastest sushi service with the best tasting sushi!! Hidden little gem! If you have not tried this place,you need to go. They have All You Can Eat and a great variety too. My husband loves the Orange Blossom Roll, Touchdown Roll, Fried Pork Belly, Poke, Fried Shrimp Heads, and Sashimi. I'm not one for raw foods so,I usually get the fully cooked ones like the Lisa Lisa Roll which Shrimp Tempura, Avocado,Cucumber,Philly Cheese topped with Crunch and Eel sauce. This place is usually busy round the clock on the major meal times so I would go in between meals in order to get faster service. This place has yet to let me down!!

My friends and I came here one night when the AYCE sushi place we used to go had a wait, so we decided there was no shortage of sushi places to try and yelped and found this one.  AND I'M SO GLAD WE DID!! 

This is one of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas with great prices.  The fish here is always fresh and the service is not bad.  Also, the variety that you get on the menu is unbeatable.  Although there are some items that are only one per person, it is still worth it.  I don't go to Vegas often, but when I do, I'll be sure to return here!

Great sushi joint! We came during a lucky time as there were fewer than usual people at the restaurant (just right when the dinner hours began). Our orders came by really quick. 

I really liked the yuzu seafood ceviche, baby octopus, lobster roll, jalapeño poppers, seared Tuna Sashimi, and the Lisa Lisa roll. There was a large variety of seafood, nigiri, ramen, poke, desserts, and rolls included in the buffet deal. The menu also specifies what's in the rolls and which items are raw for conscience eaters.

Disclaimer: make sure to order what you can eat. They charge extra for leftovers.

I highly recommend this place. There's both quality and quantity for a good price. I'm definitely coming back the next time I'm in Vegas.

This restaurant is the reason that I want to go back to Las Vegas.

I discovered this gem while staying at The Palms a few years ago and have come back during every stay.

I've eaten in some of the best sushi restaurants in New York and this place takes them on nearly every level.  

The staff is amazing.  The prices are great.  The food is outstanding.

This is what, in my mind, a sushi restaurant should be.

Pro-Tip: They have an all you can eat lunch special.  I forget the price, but it's worth it.

Great place to meet up with friends or even for late night dinner. I went to a concert and even had time to go to this place afterwards. They close late and offer good quality sushi! I keep coming back when I'm in Vegas!

Couple day ago we going to all you can eat sushi on flamingo. The price in my pictures and also some foods pic. The foods served very fast and all delicious. About the drink I'm really wanna recommend lychee Sage (sweet and easy for drink)
Also about service the restaurant is great. I'm recommend if your guy fine some all you can eat outside Hotel in Las Vegas.

There is no all you can eat!  Our table just looked like it.  Plus we had a special birthday celebrant who can eat for 5 people and still not look pregnant :P.  Dudes our inside joke - high tens twinny! 

Make sure you come hungry and ask how many pieces for the sushi; so as not to over order cuz they will charge you.  Warning: You will get hawk eyed.  Also, half orders are available!  I dont think they post it.  But this is a great option.

The menu is great.  Nice selections.  It is here I learned I will never have uni again; ever - not even by accident.  Sorry, it wasn't my thing.  Give me the inside of a steamed crab shell well cooked instead, with lemon and tabasco please.

Their main dining area is set up with several large tables, then some along the wall.  There is a sushi bar and liquor bar.  Nothing fancy and no art to admire... except the edible art!  Maybe that's the point?  

Service is good, quick, attentive (don't forget you will be hawk eyed).  Sushi is fresh, some are unique.  There is raw and cooked sushi.  Pricing is $$ - in the range of what to expect for the area.

Yeah, they seem popular.  Just watch the dinner crowd.  You can tell.  A good meal is to be enjoyed here.

One out of my 3 places favorite sushi places. It has cool tables that in American culture kind of look like picnic tables and a screen projector on the wall that projects music videos of popular songs. The food itself is good, all you can eat sushi, my personal favorites include king of the ocean and candy cane. Go give it a try.
Great amazing all you can eat sushi at a reasonable price, Always served w/excellent service!

Not as good as I remember it the first time we came. My brother-in-law & his wife took us here a couple years back when we were visiting. I remembered a short wait time, excellent service & fresh & delicious food. This time we had a lengthy wait time, less than mediocre service & food & sushi especially did not seem as fresh. For a party of 9 we were forced to cram onto a small table & had to wait over 30 mins. to use an additional table even though one was available the whole time. It seemed like the waiters were definitely consumed in the busyness of what was going on in the restaurant & we definitely felt it as we were very rushed. They forgot some of our items toward the end of our night & then ended up bringing them out with our check. They also cleared off the rice & miso soup my niece was working on when she went to the bathroom without asking the remaining party if she was done. Not sure if we'll go again on our next visit to Vegas but good thing Vegas has a wide variety of AYCE sushi spots.

Review number 1000 for Umiya woohoo!

I've been here twice now, and I gotta say that overall this is my second favorite ayce sushi place in Vegas (Sushi-mon on Sahara still being number one on my list). Most ayce sushi places that I know of have a 1 hour time limit, but the time limit here is a generous 90 minutes. $20.95 for lunch (11AM-3PM) and $25.95 for dinner (3PM-Close). They have a broad selection of items from ramen/udon noodles, to grilled skewers, ribeye steak (1 order per person), miso marinated pork belly, and a vast array of nigiri and rolls. Their fish is pretty fresh, and I like how they don't put a lot of rice in their nigiri. However, the service was a bit inconsistent today. One of the servers was really accommodating and on top of our orders, but it seemed like some of the other servers there were trying to rush us out. My buddy was eating his ramen, and even though he wasn't done, they kept trying to take it away lol. Also, he literally asked for his salad like 5 times before it finally came out. Not sure what happened there...

I would say that coming here for lunch is definitely a bargain at $20.95. Even if you're not a huge fan of sushi, they have enough non-sushi items that will compensate for that price.

ITS AYCE - so one must withhold their usual sushi quality expectations. 

But with that said - I haven't been this disappointed with an AYCE sushi restaurant in a long, long time.

The sashimi just was NOT fresh. Whether it was the salmon, tuna, ono, yellowtail, uni, or the sweet shrimp - all you can taste is the FISHINESS of everything. The rice was huge, the quality was poor, and to top it off wreak of fishiness.

After my first round of sashimi, I was so turned off by their nigiri I ended up ordering hot food instead in fear of food poisoning.

The only thing Umiya has going for them is that their service was very attentive. 

But even that was then undid when I had to experience the horrendousness of sitting at the bar and watching their kitchen staff grounding up raw salmon and tuna like it was ground beef. No reputable sushi restaurant should be treating precious sashimi that way.
This place is great. We came in to escape the Super Bowl crowds and had a wonderful meal. I got the shishito peppers, spicy tuna salad, and cucumber roll. Super keto friendly and very delicious.

Covered all the essential elements for me, good space (I hate being cramped with other tables), nice menu selection -something for everyone, good prices and pleasant, attentive service. Had the tempura, it was fresh and wasn't greasy. Also had the spicy salmon roll and chicken teriyaki which was a pleasant suprise, Chicken teriyaki roll was a meal in itself accompanied with a side of chicken teriyaki and vegetables. Not the best ive had but certainly good enough to visit again.

Umiya has a great atmosphere and has the freshest fish in town! Chef Alex picks out the fish everyday himself to ensure the finest quality!  Chef ALEX is the very best!!!!  He creates new sushi rolls all the time and keeps things healthy and fun!!!  I have followed ALEX to every Sushi restaurant, and now since he is owner of Umiya it is my very favorite!!!  It is a place you can trust and will completely enjoy!!!!  lots of love to chef Alex, chef Erik and the gang!!!

Umiya sushi was a great find for AYCE sushi. It's a little outside of the strip, but definitely worth the trip out there. My partner and I walked from the Excalibur thinking it wasn't too far -- we wouldn't recommend doing this, as we walked for over an hour and had to cross the freeway.

Umiya had a great selection of items, and all of their staff are super attentive and friendly. The neat thing is that Umiya lets you do "half-orders" so that you can try a lot of different things. We didn't see any sashimi on the menu, but this was fine for us since we had poke.

Great price point for AYCE -- we really didn't feel like paying premium prices that you'd typically find I the strip. The restaurant itself is quite large, and unfortunately there wasn't a lot of people there when we went on a Tuesday night (unfortunate because it's quite a cool spot). Those that were there -- we think -- are locals, so it's nice to dine where locals dine.

I've been here so many times, I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. I'm not a local but come to Vegas several times a year. This is hands down my favorite AYCE sushi place in the world.. yes I said WORLD. The ambiance is great, service is fantastic, and the food is superb. You can order half rolls and they have oysters and squid. Their fish is always fresh. Their menu has a very good variety of foods. My kids always eat well here too with their selection of noodle soups and ice creams. I also never have to wait too long for a seat either. I can't say enough good things about here. I always leave with a smile. I recently took some friends here and they also left completely satisfied and impressed. If I could give more stars I would.
Omg we ate soooooo much!  It was yummy. Defenately will be returning in the near future.

I have been to a couple of ayce sushi in Vegas.  But hands down this is the best place to go.  The wait time wasn't too bad. $25 was the dinner price!  The place had a fun atmosphere. And the table they had was a good size for ayce.  The menu had a variety and not just sushi and sashimi. They had filet mignon, oyster shooters, ramen, udon, miso soup, and of course all the other sushi you would find at a sushi joint! The fish were fresh and the rolls they made are a good size. They also have a full bar.  Last but not least, they had ice cream and mochi ice cream! I'm a dessert person, so I always make room for dessert! You gotta check out the green tea mochi ice cream! 

The waiters were very friendly and always checked in on you. They always come back to fill up your water.  I would come back again the next time I'm in Vegas. This is my new spot and I'll definitely come by and bring some friends for good times and good eats!

Hands down the most creative and best sushi you can have in Vegas. The staff is friendly and fast with service. Great ambiance and food. Oh the food from nigiri to rolls you can't go wrong oh so good; prepare a designated driver because you will have a food coma! I always start with monkey brain than I ask Andy or Eric to make me something to suit my mood and they never fail! This place is a must go!!!
Best crispy rice with spicy tuna in town.  It's worth doing the AYCE just to order a few of these!

Excellent service, very attentive staff and the food is excellent.
 I come here at least 3 times a month and they never fail to impress. This is the spot where my girlfriend and I call "our place".

The restaurant itself was really nice, they have wooden tables with benches which i thought was pretty neat. Luckily we went on a night it wasnt crazy busy, so service was pretty great. Very attentive and we were able to get our rolls pretty quick. The food itself was good but nothing special you cant find at any other AYCE sushi but no limit on some desserts!

I would say this is a decent AYCE sushi place. The fish was mediocre. There were some that did not taste as freah. The ono definitely did not taste like ono. There was too much rice on the nigiri. Overall decent, definitely have had better.

Nice sized AYCE sushi. No padded seats, but seating was not uncomfortable. Our friend likes his beer in frozen mugs so was disappointed when one was not  offered.  Ladies room was untidy and out of seat covers.

Every bite, with the exception of the tuna poke, was amazingly delicious. We had cucumber salad (different from most), seaweed salad, nigiri, rolls, the tuna sashimi, soft shelled crab, Vegas lasagna roll, riceless rolls (my hubby loved both kinds), etc., etc. All delicious. The bacon wrapped scallop was delicious. I don't think you can go wrong here.

Service was amazingly fast and efficient. Nothing was forgotten. No request was refused with the exception of changing the ingredients in a roll. No substitutions.

Definitely worth a try!

I think this place was great - came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon and they let us order the dinner ayce so we could enjoy the salmon belly, trout, uni, amaebi, and other specials.  Generous portions, food is tasty, service was attentive, and everything came out quickly! Which oddly some reviewers on here said was a bad thing?  And again.... Yes they charge you if you don't finish items... But this is common policy among every single ayce sushi place I have ever been to over the last 15 years.

this place has a great MENU! it puts out some good sushi and sides hands down one of the best! 
its busy so get there early or prepare to wait on weekends .good prices good sake!
The place is clean the food is great everything is done fresh it's hidden away so you have to look for it what is one of the best eats in Las Vegas

You get 90 minutes to eat as much sushi and other types types of Asian foods. The sushi you get to eat is SOOO fresh and made with lots of love. You can actually watch the sushi chefs going to town as they make all the sushi you ask for. This is the perfect place to try the expensive sushi you've been wanting to try but have not been able to. The sashimi was on point. The udon? Delicious. The samgyupsal (pork belly) was ridiculously good. 

Literally one of or possibly the best AYCE sushi places I've had. Will def. be coming back!!!

Such a weird dining experience. Within two minutes of being seated, my boyfriend went to the bathroom and the waitress came over to ask if I was ready to order. I told her I was not and my boyfriend was in the bathroom so she went away and came back another 2 times in the next 2 minutes while I was still sitting by myself. The second my boyfriend came back, before he even cracked the menu, there they were again! Seriously we felt like they were trying to rush us right out. 
Once we ordered, they brought the rolls before the edamame so we told them to skip it since we were already half way done with our sushi anyways and they seemed to not understand why we wouldn't want to eat an appetizer after the main course. The sushi was ok but the pieces of cucumber in the rolls were big chunks, which is weird to me. 
The icing on the cake is when they gave us the check and told us to "take our time." Really? After all that?
Came here a few weeks back, had great sushi. i tried the jalapeño poppers and they were excellent. Although the service wasn't very friendly..

In town for work, and my coworker and I were craving sushi and a lot of it. This place met all expectations and more. The rolls were ridiculously crafted and delicious. Price was average for an All you can eat.

*YELP CHECK IN FOR A FREE SODA (I got a hot tea instead)

Excellent dinner. 

Secret is...come at 4pm, because at 4:05pm (okay, after 5pm) it starts to get crowded pretty quickly. And when that happens, you don't get your food as fast since they have to serve everyone else. 

80% of the menu is good! Did not like the ribeye (one per person) since it was overcooked and tough. My girl loved the pork belly (sizzling oh yeahh) and thankfully it was nicely thin. 

The ceviche was refreshing, the uni NOT good (not sweet/fresh), all the rolls great but beware,  they are filling and you will have leftovers that you must force down. The oysters were also a bit meh. 

A must get also is the soft shell crab! we got more than we should have. 

Great place to dine with a large party (just make a reservation early which they will call to confirm again).

By the time we walked in, it was already midnight, but we felt hungry. We don't know this is a all you can eat sushi restaurant. Well, it is not authentic Japanese sushi, so we just ordered a little bit to eat. But if you like all kind of sushi rolls, you can try. We had the salmon skin salad which was good but way too salty for me, especially on the bottom of the bowl, it's all kind of mixed soy source. The other yellow tail sushi roll, well like I said it is American style to taste of

We came in for my mother's birthday for lunch time. We had 34 in our party with 9 loud kids. ...that's how my family rolls.  Anyhow the bill came out to $700 including tip.  Super worth the price.  The waitresses were super friendly and patient. Great food. We liked all the rolls, especially the baked items. Definitely will be coming back.

It was my first time here. I like how big the restaurant is and the unique tables. I was excited to try a new place. I heard this place was good, read some of the reviews, and was drooling over the photos! The restaurant was not that busy, our rolls came out pretty fast, and they were delicious! I usually stick with ordering the nigiri but I wanted to try some new rolls! I loved how the menu had pictures and the descriptions. The food was great but the experience....not so much...we had to ask several times to get our waters refilled and then when we ordered dessert, the one that we would think took longest to make (tempura ice cream) came out first and all others were forgotten (ice cream and mochi).
I would definitely go back because the food was great and people deserve second chances! Maybe the service will be better next time! 
Oh, and please take out the stupid Harlem shake music video off the loop! It is so annoying! :)

So all in all this place is some bullsh*t. Now I have to come all the way to Vegas from Orange County to get good sushi. Absolutely amazing service the entire time, and food to match. Ordered damn near one of everything on the sushi and nigiri menu and it was ALL amazing. The picnic-table-style tables are an amazing touch, great ambiance, wonderful vibes, really just a gorgeous experience, I will absolutely be bringing friends and family back here on every Vegas run I make from here on out.

fantastic all u can eat 'yummy
first time to been here Super hungry !!!

lot of choices
Ive came here a few times. I love sushi. But the sushi from here just had this weird taste to it. Customer servicd overall is great

My new favorite sushi spot! Came in with a group of people and we all enjoyed the AYCE option. I believe it was $28 or so a person. One roll in particular that stood out was the Banana Roll. It was a basic California roll with a caramelized banana on top. It was absolutely amazing. They have a large selection of beers as well which was awesome.  
They also had no rice sushi rolls wrapped in cucumber. That was delish! The first kiss roll was great as well. 
To end the dinner we had the tempura green ice cream. I can't even deal with how good that was. Can't wait to go back!
LOVE this place !!! They're my new go to whenever I'm craving sushi ! Food is always so fresh and yummy. And the staff is friendly. My favorite is the crazy boy roll :)

Walking in, the decor is appealing, lighting was the perfect not too dark and they sat us in tables off to the side kind of intimate little areas, leaving their long tables for large groups. BTW, I think this would be a good place if you have a big group of friends or family because of their farm tables.

Started w/ house salad- loved it. It had a great sweet/salty, & tangy dressing. Very good portion of fresh mixed greens, juicy tomatoes and avocado slices. Loved the sticks of marinated cucumber throughout.

On to some Grilled Skewers- 
-baby tako (spicy, yummy BBQ like sauce) too bad it was tough, took a lot of chewing :/
-grilled chicken, had some soggy skin that didn't crisp up, unappetizing
-bacon wrapped scallops were great, (crispy, sweet, succulent) of the ones we tried, I would have tripled our scallop order and scrapped the rest. Good to know.

Creamy shrimp comes with a little ketchup dipper and side house salad. Good concept with shrimp wrapped in wonton wrappers & cream cheese, then fried. Unfortunately, it seemed they used pre-cooked shrimp, drying out the shrimp; even cream cheese cannot save rubbery and tough shrimp. Dish has potential, though, if only the shrimp were succulent! I also think the ketchup was a weird sauce choice-  maybe a citrus ginger or one of the sushi sauces. Just not the ketchup.

On to sushi, we went basic. Sometimes when I'm not sure about a restaurant, I start with a spicy tuna roll. Gotta be able to make a great spicy tuna before earning my trust in rolls! Theirs was decent but low on the spice factor IMO and they had decent Philly California roll, as well. A nice bowl of tempura ice cream and that was it folks, we were stuffed. I'll say service was a rollercoaster as bigger groups came in and received more attention, understandable, but still we were sometimes hanging out there in space and sometimes our servers (there were 2 tag-teaming) were on top of it. That's kind of how our food went, too, solid 2.5 overall.
The BEST place to go to for sushi in Vegas. Service was great and food was delicious. Definitely coming back!!
The sushi here is always ultra high quality!!! Very fresh!!! The friendly staff is extra helpful with newcomers to sushi like my In laws from small town Minnesota!!!

This is my favorite sushi spot we have probably come a 100 times every roll is so fresh and delicious. The staff is incredibly nice and on top of everything for you to have a nice relaxing meal. Great price as well a little gem.

It was my first time at this place, and I have to say that I'd definitely come back!

My friends and I went here for an all-you-can-eat lunch. The restaurant is a nice size, and has long tables with benches that can fit up to 8 people. 

The staff is attentive and polite, but let's get to the food...

Yum! We ordered several different rolls, and each one was more beautiful than the last. The crispy rice with spicy tuna was a hit at the table, and I loved the sashimi. 

I look forward to going back soon!

This was formally known as Kan / Kaizen Sushi. It's about $30 for dinner AYCE including tax. The hot tea is $2 each but during their Happy Hour it's buy two drinks get one free, so with four people it came down to $1.25 per. It's located on Flamingo and Arville in the plaza by the Starbucks. 

My friends got here before I did, so they got us all a table, while of course waiting for me. It's a real nice place inside, loved the decor, very simple, elegant, and modern. There weren't that many people there when we were there, maybe around 20-ish people there including us. Service started promising, but as soon as the place started to fill up with only two servers, the service just went downhill. I didn't understand why they didn't have more servers on a Saturday evening during a dinner service. I was a little baffled by that. 

Not sure if this matters, but this place is run by Koreans as is most sushi places in Vegas it seems. Started with the usual, tuna, salmon, and yellowtail. The quality was mediocre, it wasn't that bad but it wasn't good either, they weren't really fresh in my opinion. The tamago and masago were okay as well, the tamago was definitely better than any of the fish. The Ikura, well didn't really look like regular Ikura to me, it was much smaller than normal, and the color was a bit off to me, which goes back to the question of freshness, it wasn't really fresh, as it tasted different from what I'm used to (and I usually order about 20 pieces of Ikura). What really got me was ordering the sweet shrimp, I nearly gagged on this and really felt nauseous eating it. That's a huge no no for me, they poured Ponzu sauce on it what seemed to me they were trying to mask the age of the fish, it was NOT fresh at all. One friend ordered Uni and well the presentation of it was bad, it looked horrible to say the least, and he was very skeptical of tasting it after my reaction with the sweet shrimp. 

My friend got the rib eye and pork belly. They weren't bad according to him and for the pork belly though, it was dripping in oil. Like the plate was saturated with it. Looked good at least, but I wouldn't touch it without at least dabbing it down with a napkin. We also got a first kiss roll since it sounded it, it wasn't too bad, but I'm not usually a fan of rolls in general.

At the end we ordered dessert, two tempura ice cream and two ice cream, one order per person, and waited close to 15 minutes for it, before we cancelled and just left. I don't know what was going on in the kitchen, but it seemed under staffed all around for a Saturday evening. 

The only real good thing I would say on the menu is everything else but the nigiri. They have an extensive AYCE menu, but it'll be a very long time before I come back here, if ever. It's worth a try, and I hope the experience of others are better than mine, but I do have high standards for sushi restaurant in general. It's worth a try if you cannot tell the difference in quality or freshness of fish as some of my friends cannot, but if you get easy queasy from bad fish, I would avoid it at least for now.

Husband and I wanted sushi before heading out to a show. This place was close to the theater. We  fairly early in the evening and were seated immediately. We did not realize it was an AYCE restaurant. Hubby took advantage of that while I just got one roll a la carte.
Rolls came out surprisingly fast. I had the Sweet Roll which was satisfactory. I'd prob have it again if I were in the mood. Hubby had four different rolls, oysters, and dessert. Service was so so. Ambience was not anything too special. We walked out paying less than $50 including tip. Not bad. 
We're not local, so can't say I'd return. But we would tell people to give it a shot.

I come here often and I am never disappointed, whether it be for the ALL YOU CAN EAT or just a salad and a roll they always meet my expectations. The rolls seem pricey, but they are quite big with lots of fish "stuffing." My favorite roll and I recommend this to anyone who loves avocado, spicy tuna or will try just about anything, has got to be the AVOCADO TRAIN. It isn't on the AYCE menu so I'm always torn between my options, either I go with the Roll and salad option or if I want to fish out and do the AYCE. My fave salad is the Spicy Tuna Salad, They add chunks of fresh tuna on a bed of greens with a tangy dressing, quite satisfying and not too heavy. All in all I highly recommend this place. It is small, quite, the staff are friendly and if you get bored with your companionship they have music videos playing on a big screen ;)

Came here for my Bday dinner with the wife. We are from the OC in Cali. Was seated right away at the the bar. Ivan the sushi chef was awesome. He very tentative and help us what is the best sushi on the menu. The other staffs was quick and responded to all our needs. Food and service is a 5's.

Overall a great place to eat but very average. Not one menu item blew me away. This is much more a case of quantity over quality. I would probably go back but there's far better sushi places around such as sen of Japan.
O man this place is amazing. Good food great service. Your order comes out quick and they even do half rolls.

I love sushi, but unable to find a great place until I found this place. The is not just another AYCE, this is the best one with good prices. I have been here several times and every time has been great. I have brought several different friends and they too have loved this place. The cook is also the owner and he takes great pride in his food.I always leave very full and happy. This is a must do AYCE. I will try to upload some pic's next time.

Awesome! The service was super fast and we had 5 people in our group constantly ordering sushi. 
The nigiri was decent in fish to rice ratio. 
The Lisa Lisa roll was sooo good! 
The skewers were my favorite along with the seared tuna sashimi with Aj sauce! Order those and you won't be disappointed! 
I strongly disliked the banana roll, but my boyfriend loved it.
Didn't like sharing our table with strangers... that I would prefer not to do again....
But, I'll be back :)

My family was coming in to town for Christmas, and we decided to have dinner here on Christmas Day. We made a reservation a few weeks in advance.

The interior was very modern, with bench-style seating and pop music videos playing from screens on the wall. It was also definitely on the noisier (but lively) side in terms of atmosphere.

The restaurant was VERY busy that night, and they almost gave up our table (they will only hold for 15 minutes after your reservation time, and your whole party must be present to be seated). Service was friendly, but I don't think food came quite as fast as some other Yelpers have been mentioning in their reviews. In particular, any hot kitchen items (e.g. that required deep-frying or baking) seemed to take a particularly long time to prepare. They also ran out of some "dinner only" items such as uni and even agedashi tofu at one point, which is kind of silly since it was only 7PM and the restaurant is open until 2AM. In addition, the lunch and dinner menus are essentially the same, so to charge several dollars more per person for dinner without having all the dinner items in stock is a bit unfair.

Overall, the food was very tasty, and the menu is extensive. Like another Yelper mentioned, I think they shine more in the appetizer/non-rolls area, as the sushi rolls were not particularly special/memorable. 

They didn't strictly enforce the 90-minute time limit, but did start trying to nudge us along after that time passed (given that there were people waiting for tables). One of the managers wanted to give us the check, but we said we were still waiting for some dessert items. In addition, my mom's boyfriend ended up proposing to her during this meal. That same manager was very honest though, as he came back to explain that they had already added an 18% gratuity since we were a large group and the payer had inadvertently tipped based on the post-gratuity amount.

My aunt and uncle were griping about how this was a Korean-owned Japanese restaurant, but at this point, I'm used to it. There are a ton of Korean-owned Japanese restaurants in many different states, and while they are usually not 100% authentic, they still serve up decent food.

Oh, and if you don't want to opt for all-you-can-eat, there is a regular menu too/you can always order a la carte. However, it is really easy to spend the same amount as AYCE, so you might as well choose AYCE unless you just aren't that hungry.

P.S. Don't forget to utilize the call buttons on the table! We forget they were there.

Just waiting for our food. Told it will be 10 minutes. Still waiting with no update. Foods been sitting there for about ten minutes. Updates would be nice also employee drinks are visible and should not be on the counter. Health department issue as well as unprofessional.
Delicious date spot for lunch. We each had the "two roll lunch specials. " Tried the "snow corn roll" as well as the "orange blossom" yum!

First time trying this Restaurant and the food is lovely, the atmosphere is great but the staff did not seem to know who was doing what! We sat down and a waiter took our drinks order and then maybe 2 minutes later a waitress came over and asked what we wanted. This happened several times over the course of the evening. Not to mention we had to order something's over again because the food never arrived. From what did arrive the cali rolls and the shrimp tempura are to die for! But the Japanese steak looks, smells and tastes like a bad hamburger... So I guess it's hit or miss!

Amazing AYCE sushi and Izakaya buffet a few minutes off the strip. You get 90 minutes to chow down. I recommend prioritizing the daily specials, dinner only items, and the 1-per-person items. 

My favorites were uni (then uni blew away my expectations for buffet uni, which were admittedly very low), salmon belly, raw oysters, seared tuna sashimi, baby octopus, fried crab, and ginko nuts. The hamachi and white tuna nigiri were also great. 

Avoid the poke or anything in the salad section. I would also avoid the ikura (not fresh). 

If you check in on yelp you get a free soda!

Great sushi spot with a lot of unique and non-sushi items for those who don't like raw fish. I never seen gingko on the menu in the ayce option and it was pleasantly roasted. There was so many choices I couldn't even try it all. I would like to try this place again next time I'm in vegas.

Lots of places to choose from but we ended up here to the "all you can eat" sushi in LV.  

This place had a lot of highs and a lot of lows.   After everything was said and done, we left with mixed reviews.    

The good:  
The fried soft shell crab.  Excellent!  Get it!
The oysters.  Fresh shucked and tasty!  Ordered as many as we could.   

The ok:
Udon noodles.  Meh.  

The bad:
The fish......  Ugh.   Metallic tasting and not fresh.  Bad after taste.  The onions were not fresh, dried and dehydrated in the rolls.  

The really bad:
The soups.  Tonkatsu ramen was terrible.   Tasted nothing like tonkatsu and didn't eat it.  
The miso soup was even worse.  Watered down to the point it was not edible.  Almost refused it but decided to just not eat it.   

Overall the highs and lows will prove to be enough to not eat here.   It was not quality at all as far as fish goes.   

Customer service was fast, courteous and friendly.  

Eat at your own risk.    Not recommended.

I'm still fairly new to the Las Vegas are so I am still trying to get aware of all the AYCE sushi bars around here.  This one is at the top of my list so far.  I had gone with a group of my boys from college, trying to satisfy our late night sushi cravings!  We were sat right away and started off ordering the load of nigiri. I think our first order was 10 Hamachi, 5 sake, 5 maguro.  When I go out for sushi I don't mess around! The thing I loved most about this place was that the nigiri came with small portions of the rice and a good sized slice of sashimi on top.  The sake (salmon) was oh so good! melt in your mouth kind of fish.  They also had many great appetizers to choose from my favorite had to be the either the fried soft shell crab and baked mussels, literally heaven!  The staff was great, our waitress was funny and even cracked jokes with us during the night which I always like seeing.  The only con I have about this place is that when i ordered my uni is tasted a little frozen not as fresh as the other places I have around Vegas.  

But for the most part I enjoyed this place very much and will definitely be back for another round at Umiya :)

I'm a fan. I've been here a few times and more often than not, all the food I get is pretty good, if not great (at least for an AYCE place). Their AYCE menu is fairly large. The dinner price is $26.95 and for kids it's about $13.

Most of the nigiri I've tried was good, with standouts being the tuna, super white tuna, sea bream, yellowtail and eel. Other items on their menu that I'm a fan of include their gyoza, the yellowtail lover roll, and crispy rice with spicy tuna. Their oysters and pork belly are decent and worth ordering again.

I wasn't a fan of the seared tuna in AJ sauce or the Hawaiian roll.

The interior is cool with the long communal tables and benches. It also seems to be easier to get a seat than other AYCE places around town. The times I went I've never had to wait, which is perfect when my patience is running low, I'm hungry, and all I want to do is stuff my face.

I went here with some friends for dinner since we were craving for some sushi and thought this would be a good place for that. Out of the few times I have been here for dinner, there has always been a wait so I guess that just shows how popular the place is. 

We ordered a bunch of items, but I would recommend getting the Yuzu Hamachi and the garlic tuna nigiri! Both are really flavorful and delicious. I ended up eating like 4 pieces of each lol! In terms of rolls I would recommend trying the orange blossom roll (it is my favorite at the moment). I really like the citrusy taste along with the crunch from the tempura. I also got to try the ribeye appetizer along with the soft shell crab. My friend got ramen (IDK why he did that), but it tasted okay. I'm pretty sure the vast selection of appetizers you can pick from is just there to bait you, so I would recommend just trying 1 or 2 and focusing most of your energy and stomach space on the sushi! I would also get the 2 cucumber wrapped rolls (I think one is called the Naruto and I forgot the other, but they are listed next to each other). I have always wanted to try the chicken katsu, but I think that would fill me up relatively fast. 

You can also order more than 1 dessert item here so I would recommend the red bean and green tea ice cream scoop. 

I would recommend checking this place out if you want a sushi place that has a decent selection of items that goes beyond sushi. I would give this place 3.5 stars, but since I can't do that, I will be generous and give them 4 stars lol!

OMG THE GRILLED SQUID!!! 
Ok so I came here again but this time to try their entrees and appetizers since I already know that their sushi is extremely fresh and yummy! I ordered grilled squid because I've been looking for a place that has it and cooks it's well. I also ordered their beef teriyaki entree! THE GRILLED SQUID WAS GRILLED TO PERFECTION I swear, it was soooo good and it's pretty big! The beef teriyaki was delicious too!!! I know I sound like I'm exaggerating but it's not my fault that it's so good?! It's actually really really good. I like my beef teriyaki super sweet so it hit the spot for me. 

I got all of this to go so the fact that I'm raving about this at home even after it sat in the car on the way home a bit should tell you guys that it's just perfect. I loooooveee this place man! The consistency of ordering anything here and all of it being so good is what makes this place 100/10!

What separates Umiya from other sushi/Japanese restaurants is that their "All You Can Eat" menu includes choices like (chicken or beef) yakisoba, udon, and small steaks if you'd like to take a break from your sushi marathon. I highly recommend the "Seared Tuna Sashimi in AJ Sauce" appetizer. You're only allowed one order per person for dinner, and I can taste why! 

Desserts are included in AYCE, and the plum wine-flavored ice cream is a MUST. Totally different taste from what it sounds like. 

The casual/cool atmosphere is great for families and parties, and it's convenient location by the strip is perfect before a night out on the town.
This is place is so good, it has delicious and great quality food. It's my favorite sushi place. The service here is amazing and the staff are friendly. The AYCE is the best. 5 stars!

Umiya is absolutely wonderful!! Hands down the best AYCE Japanese place in Vegas, coming from an SF foodie veteran. Their nigiri is fresh, the service is speedy and delightful, the ambiance is both charming and clean, and the pricing is lower than I would expect from the quality of the experience. Try this new gem before sampling  their pricer and more reviewed competition, you won't regret it!

Update: visited again almost a year later, the food is just as good as I remember! The porkbelly is delicious and they have tempura ice cream. Yumm!!!

I ate at this joint three times in 2.5 days. What does that tell you? Although they have AYCE, I didn't have time to sit for 90 minutes and stuff my face. Fresh tasty and quick service. Some of the best Poke I had in a while!

our first time here today. We had the AYCE, lunch is $20.95 and the one thing that really stands out is the variety of their menu. It is rare that you will see an AYCE place lets you order shucked oysters, pork belly dishes, rib eye, and ramen/udon in addition to everything else on the menu.

They also have a large selection of beers but their house sake is tasty! oh not to forget they also had no rice sushi rolls wrapped in cucumber which I love.

Some of the items on an ayce sushi list are sweet shrimp, white tuna!! oysters, ramen, Kalbi, and pork belly dishes. Some of the desserts are Mochi, ice cream, banana splits, all included in the ayce.

 My favorite are Salmon Skin, tempura shrimp, soft shell crab and Snow white rolls and the sushi wrapped with cucumber instead of rice, I forgot the name.

 The staff were nice and the service was great and the food was so fresh and delicious!!  one of my favorite place to add to my list, we will definitely be back.

I came here on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too crowded. 

I like how there's a regular menu and also an ayce. I wasn't super hungry so I ordered the Katsu plate and whatever salad dressing they use it's amazing!! The Katsu was good and had a decent amount of meat. Other places it's all breading. My friends were able to get the ayce which was nice because they were really hungry. 

We got seated immediately and the ayce plates came out really fast! Everything looked so good I was really tempted to try, but I abided by the rules. I asked my friends and they said the quality was really good, but they use a lot of rice. I saw the nigiri and they do use a lot of rice compared to other ayce places (so be careful when ordering too much). 

I definitely want to come back to try the ayce since they had a huge selection of appetizers and rolls.

The guys behind the sushi bar were the best. Or server wasn't friendly at all. My boyfriend ordered a beer and asked for a cold glass she said they didn't have any. The gentleman behind the bar immediately stepped up to get us a cold glass. 
As I will say once again the guys behind the sushi bar are awesome, the pushy woman trying to take our order 3 minutes after we sat down when we hadn't even opened our menu, not so much... 

. Over all good place.
Sitting at the sushi bar is a must!! The sushi is amazing. You have to try the red rock roll!
Best sushi i ever ate in my life. Our server was sweet and helpful. Service was fast too.

Come here to satisfy a sushi craving. I got the $25.95 all you can eat dinner. 

Between me and my two friends, we ordered 37 items. They were all delicious. But don't get the rib eye. 

Finish with ice cream and mochis.

We actually went here twice only because it was close to the hotel and the Thai place next door reeked of deep fried food in a not so good way.

The first time in I went up to the bar to see the fish.  Well they don't display the fish here so no looking at what you're going to order like most sushi places.

One of the sushi chefs yells at me "What do you want sir?"

I asked him "What is fresh tonight"

Him, "EVERTHING IS FRESH!"

Me;  Okay, then what do you recommend? What is the freshest?"

Him:  "EVERTHING IS THE FRESHEST!"

I kind of knew right then that this was not an honest place.

The good:  Tempura, fish katsu, Tuna poke with seaweed salad (excellent!!).  We had this twice and I would get it again.  Salad was fresh and tasty.  Good rice too.

The bad:  the "no-rice" roll with crab was actually Krab (Pollack) and daikon radish and cucumber.  It tasted essentially like daikon radish and the 6 slices were no more than a 1/4 inch thick ($12.00???) We actually sent this back it tasted so bad.

The worst other bad:  Seafood Chirashi:  I've had this dish many many times at other establishments and I always get 10 to 11 different types of raw seafood over rice.    Here I got tomago, tuna, a light fish I could not identify, a single small cooked shrimp, salmon and tobiko.  The fish was sliced very thin to make it appear like more was there.

Half the bowl was covered with shredded radish as filler.  What a joke.

I could see straight away that the tuna was bad (dark and sagging), one sniff and I moved it to the side.  Next I smell the light colored fish and it seems okay so I try it and nope, its bad too.  Also warm!!  Had to spit it out type of bad.

I had to send the whole dish back and ordered the fish katsu again which was excellent.

They did not charge for the Chirashi but they did not own up to the fact that the fish was bad.

I know they will read this and think I am full of it but seriously guys I've been eating and MAKING sushi for 30 years.  Also, just read the reviews where people claim food poisoning from your fish.  I am sure it is true.

Lastly, quit bribing people to give you 5-star reviews.  It looks really bad.

This place was great  staff very friendly service was fast, food is great they have an all you can eat menu and a lot of selection on it we ate our share and was stuffed!  Will send all our friends there if they are visiting Las Vegas.
Love all of the sushi here!! Especially, the spicy tuna salad, it was so so good. and ya fish is fresh.

I'm not sure why the reviews on this place is rated so highly...

I came here this past weekend after a long trafficy drive from LA. I called Umiya Sushi on the way there and ask how long the wait it would be for 2 people. They told me it was around 15-20 minutes. I didn't mind and I was hungry so we drove here anyway. It was about 3/4 full and we got seated fairly quickly (didn't end up waiting 15-20 min). 

We decided to just go with AYCE and not the a la carte menu because we thought it would be around the same price. I do understand they have a 90 minute time limit for dining in. To be honest, I usually don't take that long to eat as long as the food comes out in a decent time period. They were very pushy and I felt very rushed while eating. I had not even been there for 30 minutes and at least 3 people came by and kept trying to get us to order more food. I see their tricks...order fast, fill up on rice, gtfo quicker. No thanks. Just wanted to enjoy my sushi.

Their fish was decent but man...they put so much rice on their rolls. Ive been to places back in LA where they aren't trying to rob you of your money by giving you 5:1 rice to fish ratio. 

Also, one of the servers put down a half order of sunrise roll. The sunrise roll consisted  of: 

Inside: spicy crab 
Top: salmon, avocado, green onion
Sauce: Spicy ponzu

As soon as he placed it down, he told his manager (might possibly be the owner too) and said the avocado looked a little off and brown... Manager came by, inspected the roll in front of us and told us the avocado looked bad and then said he would make us a new one. Why would you even place the sushi down in the first place if it looks bad? It made me feel more uneasy when he came over and inspected it and then told us it looked bad. 

I guess.....Thanks for not letting us eat bad avocado, but no thanks for making me not want to eat it at all, even if it was a new one.

I think its safe to say I wont be returning here...
Good place to dine, a la cartel sushi rolls were a bit too wet sitting in sauce but they were very tasty.
Omg... I love this place. Unlimited buffet sushi. Chief Adam has very sushi skill in this restaurants and he is super nice and funny.

The buffet ("all you can eat") here is ok. Just ok, not great. Tons of sushi... and it's deceptively filling. They also have some one order items like raw oysters that you can get with the "all you can eat" deal. 

The highlight here... and what you wouldn't expect... is the fried rice. Yes, the fried rice. The chicken fried rice was really really delicious. Great flavor, and the chicken was fried on the outside. I cannot express how delicious the fried rice is. It makes no sense but it just is.
