I also would have to point out that this place is most likely not run by Japanese people. They hand you the bill before all the food on the table is gone which is less than cordial. No Japanese restaurant run by actual Japanese people would ever think of treating a customer that way.

I had a good experience here; nothing to complain about! Good food and good service. AND a free sake when you check in on Yelp.. that won me over. I was with a large group of 10 and the waiters/waitresses were very patient and accommodating. It was a Saturday afternoon and was not busy so the food came out shortly. 

I thought the AYCE menu had a great variety (ribeye steak, chicken katsu, and fresh oysters all included). Only the uni is offered for dinner price/upgrade for +$2.

I have been going to umiya for many years since it was kaizen which was also an ayce kaizen . I'm sad to say it's gone tragically downhill from the glory days . I still go back occasionally because I live a block away but it's definitely not in the top tier of ayce's in the city anymore . The standard garlic tuna is still good and my favorite roll is the orange blossom . I also have to get the spicy octopus nigiri which is tasty . 

Overall they need a revamp and a refresh . They also need to get new physical menus for they are pretty dirty and falling apart . 

I wish for the day where they were like they used to be .

Fresh sushi.   Can I say more.   You will get your money's worth for $27 with the All You Can Eat.    It is an extensive menu.  We were more than pleased with the quality of the fish for their Nigiri.  Their hot items were as equally delicious.  Tasty secret sauces made certain sushi and hot dishes even more appealing to the palette.  

Arrived early for dinner on Valentine's Day so it was still rather quiet.  Servers were pleasant and attentive.  Sushi owner and chefs were a ham.
Food is good. This time the sushi had too much rice. Got the chocolate and strawberry mochi and it was dry. This is the second time. Funny thing is the waitress said it just came in....

I have already told every single soul I know about this place - I wouldn't say the fish was the freshest that I have ever had, or that the quality was too good to be true, BUT for the price of $26 pp, the food they delivered was definitely worth the price.  We were a party of 6, got to make reservation and was seated right when we got there.  Service was quite swift , we were very cooperative by writing down all we wanted in the first round, and the food came with no problem.  The second round took a bit more effort, we did the same and ordered with a piece of paper that we had written down but the food never came, and then with a bit of struggle, we got a little more than half of what we ordered. We were full by that time, so didn't even bother asking about it anyways.  Uni was good, amaebi was quite fresh, and best of all - they didn't make mega-sushi like a lot of the other sushi joints in US.  Most of the food was pretty good, the rice was decently made, not bad.  
I think I will definitely come back again, and try the dishes that we ordered but never came..lol

Probably somewhere between 3.5 to 4 stars.  

Its located off the strip, but you could uber/lyft here as its just a few miles away.  

For a AYCE place, its relatively small, mostly long benches in the middle, and some smaller seating around the sides of the restaurant.  

Price for AYCE is very reasonable at $26, considering its triple that price in vegas buffets i would say the price is excellent.  

In terms of food selection, its pretty deep in addition to sushi, there is grilled skewers, fresh seafood, and good dessert options.  

Overall quality of the food was good to excellent.  We enjoyed everything we tried and the staff was very attentive and friendly.  

If your looking for a place off the strip at a good value, this place is worth checking out.  It gets pretty busy at night though so you may wait for a little.  Would definitely recommend this place.

Been here once a couple of years and thought the food and service was outstanding! For an AYCE place, the food was brought out as quickly as we ordered them. 

Was so happy to come back again and fill my belly with delicious sushi. This time around, the food was still really good and didn't take too long to get to our tables after we ordered. Service was different this time around.. Seemed like our server's mind was somewhere else because we had to repeat our orders several times for her to hear us and write it down. Everybody that dropped off our dishes was really friendly and helpful. 


The restaurant itself is really spacious, so it makes it ideal for larger groups and there are plenty of regular tables for smaller parties.
Very good fresh sushi for " all you can eat sushi. " sushi are fresh , customer service is great, and price is reasonable. I would recommend to people when they come to Vegas. Five stars!!!!

Fantastic service! They barely let your plate or cup get empty before they take it away. You don't need to ask for refills, they will top you off before you even think of it. The food is pretty good. I like the hand rolls the most. They were loaded with fish and a fair amount of rice (good ratio). I also liked the fried rice with spicy tuna. $30 is not bad for all you can eat dinner. They had good variety of rolls and even steak for those of that don't want all raw fish. Good sized picnic like tables hold a lot of the dishes as they come flying out of the sushi bar. I was impressed at the speed of the orders coming out. All freshly made. The rice was still warm in the hand rolls.  I would give more like 3-3.5 stars for the taste of the food. But the service really makes this place hard to dislike.

My favorite sushi place in las vegas. ! Isnt it amazing that they are very new sushi reataurant has lots of compliments ! I love their appetizers and sushi. 

All staffs are very friendly and nice. They are even humorous lol

I would love to go back to this place and eat sushi again.

This place was so awesome! A little bit of a wait but totally worth it! I didn't know Vegas had good sushi  I totally loved everything I ate... especially Yuzu ceviche was memorable. I'm sure I'll be back!

I lived in California for my entire life up until about 18 months ago. It was difficult to find bad sushi in California so I was a bit spoiled when I came to Nevada. I'd try new sushi restaurants with friends who raved about the sushi and I found it to be mediocre. Not bad but not as good as the sushi I was used to in California.

I went through about 7 sushi restaurants before trying Umiya and was thrilled when I finally found it because I knew I had finally found my sushi spot in Vegas. This is the only place I go now. Staff is pretty friendly and the service is good.
Fresh food, awesome service. Best AYCE sushi I ever had. Wish we had this in Cali. Even the kids loved it! Definitely recommend.

This place was probably my favorite sushi restaurant in vegas. They had such great unlimited sushi for great prices. Salmon belly and uni were so fresh! Never been to a place with such a good food and fast service. The servers were really nice too. We got full within 20 minutes of entering the restaurant since the food were served so quick. My boyfriend and I were really satisfied.

Every so often, yelp lets you down.  Today was one of those days.  Without the invention of mayonnaise, this place could not stay in business.  This place reminds me of dollar tree or any discount store.  The selection of items is overwhelming, but there's nothing really of quality or substance.  

The rolls doused with mayo were fine; however, if you are used to fresh nigiri, this is definitely not the place for you.  There are many ayce sushi bars with much fresher fish.  I understand this is not fine dining, but at this price point, there are many other places to choose from.

Only reason this got 3 stars was because the food was good. Customer service was disappointing. Was there for about 2 hours and for one drink refill, took 20 minutes to bring out each dish. If looking for great food I would recommended but if u want the service, I would hit elsewhere

Umiya Sushi is our second favorite sushi place.

My partner is a very, VERY picky eater when it comes to sushi, and this restaurant is the spot for her!

She had no complaints about any of the food, and I agree! I like the rib-eye and how they serve it, soo cute :D

All we can say is that the quality is great and so is the service :)
Service is on point. Food is hot and fast and for ayce great portions, not too filling. Will come back for more!
First time here and I love it. Food is fast, seating is fast and the waiters checked in on my tablet a good amount of time. I definitely recommend this place!!!

There are a lot of other AYCE options in the area so next time I'm definitely going to try another place out to see how it is. I'm iffy about coming back here mainly because the service just wasn't good. I know that service can be of less quality when a restaurant is busy but in my case I came at an off hour and only a few tables were full. 

The food is good enough for me to come back - the nigiri is of good quality but it can be a hit or miss sometimes you'll get a good cut of fish and other times it won't be as good as another. The tuna poke is also good. 

One thing a server said with a sort of attitude when I ordered 10 orders of a nigiri was "it's 20 pieces, are you sure you're going to eat all that?" I don't think he realized it was going to be split between my friend and I so he thought I was going to eat it on my own and that's kind of rude to say??? I mean I can read the menu so I know what I'm getting myself into and if I can't eat it all then I'm going to pay for it lol 

Another thing is that when you try to flag down a server it seems like they either can't see you or they ignore you. Now I work as a server in the food industry as well and if I were to not be paying more attention to the restaurant patrons my boss would be so pissed and yet these servers are walking around not aware of things half the time. 

I think an experience here is a hit or miss for the most part since I've read several other reviews that say negatory things about the service here as well. Come with caution.
Best ayce sushi restaurant in town ! chef alex makes the best sushi, I dont even have to order. He already knows what I like and prepares it for me when he sees me walking in. 5 stars all the way

I love sushi ! And after trying lots and lots of sushi places this is my favorite  ! Everything is delicious and fresh . And their menu has so many different rolls , it's amazing . The atmosphere is always energetic and they are always busy . The servers are always nice and professional , every time I was there I liked how I was served . I like their bar also, it's something original from other sushi places. So give it a try , I promise you will love it !
They are awesome there food there service is unbelievable you order sushi in just couple minutes you get your food ready to go will come back again............................

So yummy. I always fill up on the soup and veggies, but Umiya is our date night ! I love the AYCE sushi. The service can be slow sometimes , but always friendly and anyone will help you, not just your server. Now I'm craving sushi!

TLDR: AYCE (90 minute time limit) and lunch specials available; yelp check-in deal; hit-or-miss service

My friend and I like to venture over to Umiya when we're looking for a decent meal. They have the standard AYCE prices with dinner specials available such as salmon kama or a specialty appetizer item. Their lunch specials are pretty decent and filling if you're looking for something to take home or if you just want an entree. We like to check-in and get a free soda or iced green tea (the real deal and not the Coca-Cola one). 

One thing that this location offers is the super white tuna or ono. I've been noticing that some restaurants are choosing not to carry this item, due to a supplier issue, but I'm happy to enjoy it at this location. Is it true super white? Who knows, but it sure tastes like it. They have interesting dessert-style specialty rolls which contain fruit and eel sauce. If you're getting AYCE, you might as well split a half roll.

We've come here a couple of times and it's safe to say that service depends on the moon and the stars, the Dow Jones, or the shape of the clouds because I don't get it. Whether busy or slow, the service can be super quick or patiently long and I'm just talking about placing an order, not to receive the food. I often have to ask for refills and usually have to flag someone down to get something. Myabe this speaks for the lack of adequate staffing. Who knows? Either way the food is pretty good.

Note: They're offering free mugs for posting of reviews. Will this lead to an oversampling of 5-star reviews? Probably. Did I get a cup for this? Not yet, but who doesn't want a free cup?
Great place for "all you can eat"!  Fast service.  Everything I've gotten was yummy.  Check this place out!
This place was great .. Service was fast, food was great and they had a huge menu for ayce!!

Sorry after eating at many many of the all you can eat sushi places in town, I feel like this place is just not as good. 

Came on a weekday night and the restaurant was not very busy so we got a seat right away. I do have to say that the service is very good and at any point when our drinks were low they would come refill it without us asking. That is always nice and a change from most of the other sushi joint. 

There were a few creative appetizer items such as the monkey bring, which was decent but over fried. We did order a bunch of nigiri sushi and for the most part the rice was huge and the piece of fish was very small. Generally I would say the ratio is terrible compared to many of the other places in town. I do like that they have a variety of other items on the menu there appetizer menu is quite extensive, and they have 5 different skewers as well. The quality of fish was decent, but we did order the salmon belly special item and it tasted very weird.

I would say overall a decent experience, but the rice ratio really made this place rather disappointing.

If you haven't tried umiya sushi yet, then your missing out some of the freshest cut of fish in town!! Service is great and the the sushi is premium for the price!! Your choice of a le carte or all you can eat....which I recommend! So if you haven't yet just do it's worth It!

Love this sushi spot! One of the best AYCE sushi places in the valley. The service is fast and the sushi is quite fresh. Personally I think it is better then some of the sushi spots on Las Vegas blvd. If prices are 20 dollars for lunch and lunch goes from 11-3 and dinner is 25 dollars and that goes from 3-2am!!!! Not too much difference in the food from lunch to dinner so if you can go for lunch to get the cheaper option I suggest it

"LISTEN" UP! Why do we use Yelp??  To find the best food/deal/experience...right?!  Simply put...This is THE PLACE. Ignore the bad reviews.  Haters are always haters.  

Atmosphere: Big screen TVs, good music, upscale (not typical home in the wall place...very nice "nightlife" decor). 

The comments about attentive, awesome service....CORRECT

Food/Fish/Portions Quality: Outstanding (Try the Lobster Roll, Las Vegas, Baked Mussels, Octopus, Salmon & if course...the Tuna) BTW...The chef dropped me a few pieces of Toro just to show how legit everything really is.  

Poke is BANGIN & Seaweed Salad is fresh.  

Sake & Beer: About 10-12 solid brands (sake) & all Asia beers. 

I humbly consider myself a sushi expert with 400-500 sittings globally (yeah..avg 2x month x 20 years), as well as the son of a famous chef....(growing up in a kitchen has its benefits...later in life) 

If you've read this much....stop & start driving to Umiya.  You'll be writing a review after you recover from the awesome meal your about to experience.  

Cheers!

The only other time I've cried at a restaurant was when I hit my foot on a barstool at Hooter's - I fractured two toes and ended up with a deformed foot because I neglected to follow up with the proper medical precessional. The second time, I had Umiya's phenomenally varied and scrumptious AYCE menu, priced well within the range of a pillow, assuming that the only pillows you buy cost $20.99.

Super bummed about this place. We got here around 530pm - not super busy and the wait staff was super attentive. We put in our order for the first round of food and it's now 701pm and we will haven't received items from the first round. About 45 minutes ago, we put in an order for a second round, and we haven't received any of that order. We've called different wait staff over during the whole time to ask where our food was and nothing ever came. Not quite sure what happened... If I had the luck of carrying cash, I would have dropped some on the table and walked out. Not sure our absence would have even been noticed. 

My husband and I were so hopeful for this place. The food is to die for - if you don't mind waiting an hour an a half to get it. Unfortunately, my husband and I will never be returning. I don't even think we got our ACYE money's worth either, because we filled up on our beer while waiting for food. What a shame.
Really yummy sushi options and good happy hour prices! I will update this review further after a second visit.

Visited this place a couple nights ago with some friends. Nothing too special and their sushi is not bad. Quality is what you would expect for an average ayce sushi place. Overall the experience was average and satisfying.

Went here last night with a group of friends for a going away dinner for a coworker. The moment we sat down the servers assisted us right away considering that it was busy. Do keep in mind that they will not seat any party that is incomplete, everyone in your party needs to be present upon being seated. 

This review is a combination of my last visit a year ago and recently. Both times I came here was in a group of friends/coworkers. The cool thing about this place is the communial seating arrangement with outdoor picnic tables and chairs with an industrial like ceiling. Great when dinning with a group of friends because they are able to accommodate sizable groups. One group had 14ppl, another table had 12ppl and there was a mixed amount of 6-8ppl at other tables during our visit.

Our small group of 4ppl went with the AYCE menu with the exception of 1, who opted to order individual items. This place is a good option to introduce someone who is not to familiar with AYCE and Japanese food.

Some of the few items we enjoyed:
-Baked Green Mussels-Fresh and seasoned just right with the a good amount of cheese. "Oceany" taste according to two of my friends.

-Hawaiian & Firecracker roll was really good and left a lasting impression, considering a few of us who don't do Nigiri.

-Tempura Ice Cream & Mochi Ice Cream was good.

In my personal opinion, I would given this place 3.5 stars because their Nigiri didn't have a fresh consistent taste with a few a bit dry ones but there were times it was good. Since Im biased with Nigiri opposed to rolls.

The reason for my 4 star rating is based on the attentive service, because there isn't really a set server. More of a group of servers working as a team. We had a few order takers, food runners, bussers and the manager occasionally checking up on us. The great thing our group appreciated was that they were able to split the check in 4 individual checks, which made it easier to pay with less confusion. This option is not common in many Asian restaraunts.

This was our third time here, it is the place super busy because of all you can eat with cheaper price and another is the sushi roll very special much better than others. We spent $74 for my hole family plus $20tip it was worth. We are generous people the tip alway good for each time of course the service must be good, highly recommend! Happy new year!
great variety on the menu. Service was quick and friendly. Brought our friends here for their first time and they love it!! Hint: Check in on Yelp for a free soda.

Tried a different sushi place with my wife from our usual sushi spot and it did not disappoint us. Umiya Sushi is really good, it's clean and the staff is friendly. The waitress even gave us a sample of their import sake. There was a lot to choose from the menu and the food was delicious we were very satisfied. 

We sat at the bar and boy it had space compared to the usual bar tables where everybody touched elbows. I felt closer to the sushi making experience and had room for all my orders. It was not overcrowded at all here and easy to get around.  The vibe was great, good lighting and the music wasn't too loud and overbearing. My wife and I had a great time. 

Service was super fast and We got our orders right on time ! Excellent service from the staff I give this place 
Two thumbs up

What a great place! The staff was very attentive! You taste the freshness of the food! they have an all you can eat option, for those that were looking for a spot near the strip, this is a great option!

Orange blossom roll and super white tuna nigiri was sooo good! Came during lunch, not too many people. Only 20$! But didn't come with uni. They're pretty strict about not finishing your food unlike Sushimon or SushiKaya. They play music videos on a projection and I thought that was pretty cool.

Wow impressed with this place!!!  You have to try the Seared Tuna Sashimi in AJ sauce and the seared tuna collar!!!  Melts in your mouth. The atmosphere is nice and seating area is huge.  Definitely recommend this joint to sushi lovers... 

Gotta try the plum wine ice cream.  Amazing!!

Staff is awesome everyone is on top of keeping food and drink on the table. Food is awesome I personally am not that much a seafood person so when I do eat it I'm very picky and this is my go to spot. Flavors are very clean and fresh. Love this place.

I have to say for $27 I was not expecting what I got.
I am an Executive Chef and I was really impressed by the freshness of the Sushi.
We went on a Wednesday nite and everyone knows that the WEEKENDS are the best times to eat fresh Sushi.

We sat right at the counter and I can spot fresh gleaming fish when I see it .
After I saw a few orders of fresh fish go out and they looked delicious, I decided to give it a try.

I started with the halibut, next the tuna, then the salmon, then the albacore.
I really was totally impressed and the place wasn't that busy.

Then I went for the kill, pork belly, rib-eye steak,  squid,baby octopus,fresh oysters.
I downed a bottle of saki and some beer, took a little breather.

For my final finally I had bacon wrapped scallops,flamingo rolls.
I had the lobster roll and it had nice chunks of lobster that you could really taste.

I wanted to try some of the nice desserts that I saw, but I was just to full, and I don't believe in wasting good food.

I am very picky about what I eat and I have to say everything was great.
overall this is a great place and I hope they do well.
I left a good tip also.

I will be back next week and so will my friends
Anyone who complains about this place for the price and variety, are just some unhappy souls.
I looked at some of the stupid remarks of others and for some reason they don't realize what their getting for $27.00 .
On the strip I would have paid $150 or more for all this.

So for all the cheap complainers, don't expect Wagyu Filet and Australian Lobster when your paying McDonalds prices.

Some of these people think they are Anthony Bourdain.
Learn to enjoy life , eat drink , be merry , leave a nice tip, and don't sweat the small stuff.
Most small businesses really bust their but to survive.
So be nice and be fair, before you go on a bashing mission.
They are trying hard. And I wish them well. Fish needs to be fresher. Guess I'm spoiled living in Hawaii...

So I actually want to give this place 3.5 stars...but alas I have no such option.

Why?! Do you the...oh so inquisitive minds, observantly inquire...well...something fishy going on with the rice. (Pardon the pun...I know, I know...corny)

Sushi rice is supposed to be big round sticky pressed vinegared grains of rice...well specifically Japanese White rice AKA "Shari or Sushi-Meshi"...basically something that specifically complements Sashimi turning it into Nigiri. (Can you tell I really, really, really like Sushi?) I'm not sure what this place uses...but the rice turns out strange. 

The cuts of fish over the Nigiri are actually very good...fresh, perfectly proportioned over small servings of rice. But the rice itself is either not done correctly or it is not the right type of grain. I just tastes odd...like an inexperienced Sushi chef made it. One of the other mishaps here was the Rib-Eye I ordered. i requested medium rare, but got it medium...to well. There was nothing rare about it...no pink at all. 

Other that that...hands down this is one of the better AYCE places I had the pleasure of dining at. I ordered a fairly long list of items...a bit tedious to list here, so I will only put what I thought was outstanding...but feel free to take a look at a pic of the bill I posted. The Sweet shrimp was very impressive! One of the best I had, considering this is coming from an AYCE restaurant. Succulent, meaty and actually sweet. They even asked me if i wanted the heads fried separately...bonus points! 

The service here was very good, I was frequently checked upon, my Tea was refilled regularly and the waitresses were polite and courteous without being overbearing. I came here on a late afternoon, around 4:15, so I might have beaten the crowds...well actually I did, because there were only five other people in the restaurant...so maybe that might have been a factor to consider. All the food came out rather quickly. I was impressed at the promptness my orders were filled.

I will return to try this place again...

This is an updated review. I remember this place to be so good. So my family was in town and we decided to go there. What a mistake. First of all the place was dead and now I know why the quality of fish is not what it used to be. The rolls weren't as good as I remember it. The service was horrible and the waitress had an attitude so did the waiter. With so many other sushi places to choose from sorry to say I won't be back!

I have been to Umiya... probably about 10 times, sometimes even twice a week. For someone like my sister and I who work til 10 or 11pm, a spot that opens late into the night is perfect and apparently it's hard to find in a 24 hour city like this one. 

I like Umiya for one thing and one thing only: their sushi and quality of fish. Most of the rolls that I've tried are pretty damn good. (Salmon killer; orange blossom, and although this roll was my absolute all time favorite, they must have tweaked something because it just doesn't taste the same; snow white; rattlesnake) The nigiri is composed well in terms of the ratio of rice to fish. The quality of their ingredients are fresh--with the exception of avocados perhaps being too fresh since it was nearing raw in my Monkey Brain. Oh man, with an abundance of ginger flowing with my nigiri and rolls, I'm a girl in heaven after a long day at work!

The only thing that holds me back from a 5 star rating is the service. To pick on the nitty gritty stuff, even though the servers know my sister and I their greeting is always the same. (I work in the service industry as a waitress and I can't say that I'm the best in my field but 8 out of 10 customers complement me on my service and I can say with confidence that 100% of the returning customers like to be recognized.) Whether they are busy or not, they rarely check up on my table and we always have to ask for attention. Even when they drop off our orders they never seem to ask if everything is alright and if we need something. I hope that they realize quickly that service is just as important as food for a business and regroup the way they serve customers. 

Other than the service, a must try sushi joint! :)

Second time here..and hands down the best all you can eat sushi! it's great they have a special board that you can order (one time) definitely recommend this place after you're hungry for late night sushi!

The sushi quality was decent but the service was TRASH. I had AYCE and paid the full amount - so I expected to eat all I could eat. Although it seemed like every time I wanted to order another round, the waitresses were PISSED. As if they wanted us to stop eating. Definitely NOT coming back here again because I'm a huge fan of great customer service. It really ruins the mood of the night.

While I had a good first meal at Umiya on my birthday, a return visit without all the hoopla was way more disappointing than anticipated. First, there was an unusual wait with others being seated before us without any explanation. After we were finally the last party seated, I realized that the AYCE did not apply to the salmon belly, which was a daily special (which is not the case at Goyemon). 

Some of the dishes I enjoyed included the daily special yuzu hamachi, sweet shrimp, grilled mackerel, uni, and the AJ (seared tuna sashimi in sauce). Some of the many missteps include the service which forgot to place our initial orders and then failed to apologize or acknowledge it, the soft-shell crab, and the unforgivable spicy tuna nachos. There was no flow to the ordering and our server even tried to take a second order without us having received the first. The only special item that Umiya has over the other sushi buffets is the soft shell crab and perhaps the rib-eye steak. But, with the multitude of AYCE sushi buffets available in Vegas, I can't see myself coming back for another disappointing meal.

This is def one of the top tier ayce sushi restaurants in vegas. The menu is much larger than the other ayce places. Has everything from rolls to fresh seafood and even rice and noodle options. The restaurant itself has a good atmosphere is very spacious. The servers are nice and everyone of course greets you as you walk in the door. It may be hard to miss if you arnt familiar with the area so major landmarks are palms place and loose caboose. Don't pass up on trying this sushi restaurant, it is about as fresh as you are going to get for only $20 at lunch and $25 at dinner.

For an all you an eat sushi place for 25 (dinner) the quality and speed of service was amazing! Even the nigiri sashimi had only a little bit of rice, not like cheap places that try to fill your stomach up with rice, not fish.

Awesome place for sushi! Went here with my boyfriend for dinner and we did the AYCE sushi. This is to me a much better deal than ordering sushi dishes seperate. The price is good too, under $30! Our meal includes options of appetizers, salads, soups, sushi, hot meal and even desserts! Try the lynchee grapefruit drink its refreshing and delicious. Look forward to eating here again.

Amazing service and lovely staff! The food was delicious and the place looked very clean. If you are looking for an upbeat place and great service, this is the place to go! All the sushi you could ever want and the fried ice cream is to die for!

It's not too often I get to give 5 star reviews for excellent food and service, but this place topped it.  I ordered the Downtown California kimchi combination and all of it was excellent.  The soup was not too spicy and brothy with plenty of chunks of Tofo.

My main course was a salad, Teriyaki Chicken, and California roll sushi.  The California sushi roll had advocaco, crab meet, white rice, cheese, and cucumber for that extra crunch in your mouth!  Teriyaki chicken was served with mixed vegetables and a little too much onion, but hey I couldn't taste the onion so kudos for that!

For dessert had the green tea mochi ice cream...yummy!!!

Pretty delicious ! Adorable little small plates ! Fast and friendly ! Took my cousin and she goes like once a week now lol. Don't order more than you can eat or your ass will get charged extra lol and no you can't have a box !!! Jk but reaLly it's great fresh sushi and I love the appetizers .

I usually am very picky with sushi restaurants but boy is this place the best in town! None of the other places iv been to compare to Umiya. Sushi always taste fresh and the size of rice underneath the fish is perfect! Not huge so you can enjoy eating the fish. So glad we tried this restaurant especially because i was hesitant! I will say that the mochi ice cream they served me wasn't good I'm pretty sure it was old or something because I grew up eating it and never has it tasted that horrible.

I was staying at Gold Coast and was craving AYCE sushi.  Goyemon always has a bit of a line, and my old locals spot Naka was too far a drive.  Yelp rated Umiya well so I thought I'd give it a shot.

The layout of this place is amazing, and it should fit a lot of people even if it gets popular.  Here's hoping this place picks up, because it was dead when I went.

No complaints about the AYCE really, other than the limitations on quantity of certain items.  They even had similar unique appetizers to Goyemon, including crispy rice spicy tuna and pork belly.

My friend was a non-sushi eater and seemed pleased with the steak options on the AYCE menu, so that's also a major plus.  Oh, and this is probably the closest AYCE to the strip, which can be a HUGE plus.  I'll be back.

Service was pretty bad. Both our first time today, only 2 tables filled at 11:05 when we arrived, took way too long to be greeted and asked for drinks to where we almost just left..Pros though food arrived quick and was Excellent! The oysters were perfect, each order was awesome. 

Cons Server asked multiple times in a 10 minute window if everything's ok which was unnecessary, but then was Unseen the rest of the 25 minutes..we both needed refills, waited forever not wanting to press their Call-button on the table but decided to..made eye contact tried to get attention few times,..still nothing..waited pressed again..5 mins, nothing. Finally came up asked if ready for more or desserts said no we wanted drinks while back and rang the button thing twice in 10 mins dont think ours works. They got our check and card fast though! Probably wont return
We love going here, the fish is fresh and good. Their service is great for the first 2 orders. But after that, I feel like they lack on checking on you. Other than that this place is awesome!!
Good Ayce in Vegas. Service is fantastic . I would stay away from the grilled stuff and go straight for the sushi. Soft shell crab, mussels and the nigiri are good choices

Last night we went here and we ordered King ocean of roll this should be my favorite food just $11 for a order because of that we ordered 2 more , many young people work here don't forget to tip well for them because they really work hard highly recommended
Quick seating and amazing AYCA.  The waiter was responsive with our needs.  The serving sizes were full and well money spent.

I was so wanting to fall in love with this place, quality of the fish was ok..... from all the reviews I had high hopes.... food was ok but could have been better, I enjoyed the orange blossom roll like others recommended and the banana, very different, pork belly was overcooked, ribeye steak was 4 little sliced pieces that was kind of bland overall I would give them another try to see how other rolls taste but would not be my first choice

Got to admit I am big fan of this place, good sushi and probably one of the best AYCE places in Vegas, can't beat it. We usually go to the other AYCE places prior to finding this jem,  when visiting Vegas, but not any more this will be our go to place from now on! Solid food, not bad freshness level at all, you are not going to get Jiro quality but pretty decent for a AYCE place.

It's hard to find affordable, quality sushi places in Vegas. This place delivered. The roll cuts were thinner than I was used to, but they were neatly made and sooooo delicious. Our bill only came out to like $37 between the two of us. We got the miso soup and some other stuff too. We were way impressed. We're going to be coming back when we stay at the Palms Place again next year. It was packed here too, and we had to wait. That's another indication that this might be a favorite by people in the area.

This is my NEW go to sushi joint :) I love this place. If I could change anything, I would make the "screaming O salad" not 1 per order in AYCE. This salad is one of the reasons I started coming here! Also, I would put some Cajun albacore nigiri on the menu. But hey, I love this place the way it is. It's sometimes crowded which is a good thing because it means other people like it too. Most of the time it's not crowded which is awesome too because...NO WAIT WOOOO! The service is awesome, they're always on top of things and the guys behind the sushi bar are funny. It's a pretty clean environment from what I've seen and they have all "A" grades from the health department posted up front. That means a lot to me! Awesome. Keep it up umiya :)

Used to be my favorite place but not anymore , The people work there is so rude when you eat they  stand around and glance  at you check on you see if you waste the rice , when we left me and my wife have to find the restroom, you can find better food somewhere else , don't come there if you have a baby and you try to bring a baby food or doesn't matter any kind of food for the baby they won't let you in , doesn't matter if you tell them your baby have to eat if the baby not eating you guy can't eat. They say sorry you have to go cant stay there with outside food baby

Wonderfully deliciously awesome!!!!! Dropped in for lunch and coworking, and got in before the lunch rush in case there's one of those on a weekday. 

I had the most excellent and memorable bento box special that I've ever had - the pre-meal miso soup was well paced, like a minute after I ordered, a dramatic pause, then the main course bento box came rolling out. There are actually 8 types of bento boxes, and I got the 4-piece sushi & chicken teriyaki. 

What made this bento box the bestest was the chicken teriyaki specially prepared with artfully cut carrots, zucchini, mushroom, broccoli, onions, in a savory sauce. And the tempura had 5 or 6 pieces, usual fare plus a bonus gyoza! Salad and sushi were very good, no extra descriptive words necessary. Very enjoyable all around, and the waitress checked on how I was doing 5 or 6 times, very kind and attentive. 

The decor and ambiance neatly minimalistic with wooden tables and benches, sushi bar, and 2 side box rooms for a little more privacy. And with a Starbucks next door, the wifi signal is strong enough for me to hangout here a bit longer and cowork. Sweetness!

They have an all you can eat option that is truly worth going there for.
This place is a local favorite and I am so glad we have friends in LV that showed us this place.  The all you can eat option isn't mass produced sushi that circulates on a conveyor belt or train.  It's all made on demand when you order it.  I really love the place for this.  The sushi is good but not phenomenal.  I have had better sushi but for the price and being in America and not being just crazy expensive this place is a place I do go out of the way to go to when I'm in LV.

Went here for the second time and this time wasn't as good as the first time.  Didn't have to wait for a table since we were there early around 5ish pm.  The services were fast, meaning they got the orders out fast and cleaning up the plates right when we got done, since they wanted to have table for the next guests.  The staffs were friendly and nice.  Overall this place was not bad.  All you can eat Lunch price $21 & Dinner $26 (around that price).

All you can eat sushi ! I like the size of the  Nigiri Sushi. Just like the same size in Japan. It won't be too big. Fish is fresh. You can order Sea Urchin and fresh Oyster (limited 1 per person). They have tempura ice cream and Michu ice creams as well. I will come back here again when I come to visit LV next time! Also great customer service! (Note: Time limit is 90 minutes) You can get a free soda when you check in from Yelps. $$25.95/person @ dinner.
It was really great sushi! The Unagi, tuna, and other nigiri pieces were amazing. Had pork belly and green tea fried ice cream that was perfectly refreshing. Will stop by Everytime I'm in Vegas.

This place is really great when it comes to AYCE sushi. It's not too pricey per head and the quality of sushi is good. One thing that is a downfall is the service isn't exceptional in terms of being attentive to their customers. We had to wait almost 15 minutes for just one plate, yes it's understandable that they probably have lots of orders but they had 5+ sushi chefs. Other than that, this place is great and I would definitely come again. My favorite rolls: Banana roll (if you're a banana lover, if not-stay away!) Red Rock is also really delicious. The Yakisoba was yummy and I also loved the touchdown roll is a must every time!

Amazing service, food, and value!  This has got to be one of the best AYCE sushi restaurant that we've tried in Vegas.  I was pleasantly surprised with how good the service was.  We didn't feel rushed at all and the servers kept offering to take more orders for us.  The food came to us so fast and we didn't have to wait more than 5 mins the whole night on a Saturday.  We will definitely come back!

The best selling point of this AYCE sushi spot is the addition $10 cost for all you can drink draft beers and house sake.  But other than that, this is a really solid spot.  

Another thing Umiya did right being "new" is adopting what's good and getting rid of what didn't work.  Umiya is not totally new, it was the former Kaizen Fusion.  But with the name change it severs any affiliation with the other Kaizen.. except the sushi names have been kept the same.  

The only times I come in is during their slow hours and before dinner service.  Because it's slow, service has been great.  I sit up right at the bar and get even better/faster service.  Any time you can order straight to the Chef, that's how you should do it.  Trust me it works, I've done it at Honey Salt.  If you come in during lunch like me it's not worth upgrading to dinner price for the Uni/Ama ebi/Seared tuna sashimi.  

There were some good items and some AYCE grade sushi, neither is bad.  If you know what to look for then ask for it, more likely than not they'll have it or he'll lie and say he doesn't.  Some of the few items I asked for was salmon belly, fresh wasabi, yellowtail belly, etc.  They had some of these items but not advertised anywhere, so ask. 

When you come in, order everything you can order one item of which includes:  Baby Octopus, Gingko (if you know herbal medical properties or take vitamins then order it, if not, don't), pork belly, oysters.  Ask for specialty fishes, every time I have come in there hasn't been one but keep asking.  Uni was good, ama ebi I was a little disappointed in especially the pre-prepped head/deep fried antennas.  

The ice cream was good and I confirmed it by ordering a second but different flavor.  The waitress gave me a hard time about getting another even though I told her I'd pay for another, separate it on a different check if she needed, there was no language barrier here and I knew I only get one per AYCE.

The best sushi AYCE in Las Vegas!
As a photographer I do a lot of meeting and this is has always been the first place to go with my future clients :)

Service is great, all the food is fresh and the restaurant has a amazing atmosphere! ENJOY!
First timer. Prompt and good service. Enjoyed the large tables to fit all our orders. Recommend salmon belly, yuzu hamachi, and garlic tuna.

By far the best AYCE sushi place for $20 lunch/$25 dinner and service is great! Quality taste and lovely presentation. Three of us completely devoured 6 specialty rolls and 3 more plates of nigiri... Even the staff were impressed, and it was amazing. Super satisfying but not to the point you're super stuffed, it was just perfect.

Our go-to place for AYCE sushi lunch now. Love this place.

AYCE sushi places have four criteria that I judge them on: their appetizers, their nigiri, their rolls, and how good their servers are. I don't have a favorite place, but I do have places I like to go depending on what I'm craving. This is definitely an appetizer place for me. That means their rolls and nigiri were just like everyone else, but they had a lot of unique appetizers that I liked that they carried or that I RE-ordered. I have to say that their uni was an honorable mention though.

So Umiya is right off the strip and just south of China Town so it's a pretty popular place. They have bar seating, some booths, and communal looking seats in the middle. 

Most sushi places like this are gunna be very similar so I won't go into much detail. Price was just like everywhere else give or take a buck. 

My main draw here was I loved how fast service was here. There are multiple servers bringing by orders and taking away plates. I eat a lot and my bar area never seemed too crowded because the servers were around constantly. Also many AYCE sushi places seem to come around less after an order or two, but they were constantly asking if we wanted to order more.

The space was nice, everything we ordered was good, and the staff was nice. Couldn't complain one bit.

Let me just start off by saying: I got food poisoning here.

I came on Tuesday afternoon right at opening for their all you can eat lunch special. I ordered a bunch of different Nigiri, two raw oysters, soft shell crab, a baked avocado mayo dish and miso soup. The nigiri fish cuts were wimpy and there was way too much rice. But overall the food tasted decently good and the service was great. 

But unfortunately...About 24 hours later I started feeling super nauseous and threw up throughout the afternoon and evening. I could barely sleep that night. 

You've been warned.
I had a blast devouring fresh sushi at this place. With their creative sushi preparation style and impeccable service, no doubt locals frequent here.
Not as good as I expected. Too many rice on the rolls  it'll make you feel full a lot faster

Previously Kan Sushi, Umiya is a new sushi joint out here that's actually close to the strip.  

This was Chad S's UYE and I couldn't resist the combination of meeting new Yelpers and eating sushi.  When it comes to this place, it's all about AYCE.  I'm one of those guys that can eat a ton, so AYCE is never a bad choice.  As for the food, I got so much of it that it's tough for me to remember, but I'll try.

-Yellowtail and Tuna Nigiri:  Small, but since it's AYCE it wasn't an issue. Tasty, fresh, and the texture was just right. Believe me, I've had some stale dry nigiri before.  My favorite Yellowtail is still at Kaizen off Paradise.

-Katsu Chicken:  Not bad, just a little greasy.  Still fresh and crunchy.  Tasted perfect with their chicken fried rice.

-Chicken Fried Rice:  Thick pieces of chicken mixed with their fried rice.  If it's not sushi to come here for, then it's their fried rice.

-Ramen (miso):  Just okay, but it's also one of my first ramens.  Not much to compare against. I didn't think it was bad, but others have stated that Chinatown has better.

-Tempura Shrimp Hand Roll:  I use to be a western roll type of person. Now it's all about Nigiri, Shashimi, and Hand Rolls.  Still got a yum yum type hand roll and it didn't disappoint.  Again, small but it's ACYE.

-Tempura Ice Cream:  Not a dessert person, but couldn't resist on this visit.  This was pretty good too. 

Service wasn't bad considering that our group was fairly big.  Between all the food request from other Yelpers, the fact it was Friday night, and because this location was close to the strip..I felt that the service was decent. 

Overall, I will be back.  There's a ton of other sushi joints out here in Vegas.  But this one is little closer to the strip, which makes it a good stop when out of town friends/family are in the sushi mood. 

Thanks to Chad S. for setting this up.  Got to meet some Yelp friends that I've never met in person.  Also was able to hang out with some Yelpers that still are the coolest peeps around. New Yelper Alicia R (Terri R's twin) was in attendance. She ended up being my run/walk buddy for the next day's Color Run 5K.  Good thing because I thought I would be the only walker at this event.
First time here and we will be coming back soon! All you can eat menu has a ton of options. Portions were great and quality was superb!

Right when you step in you will notice lots of picnic style seating. Personally I thought it was pretty cool looking but once you're seated with people around it is hard to get out  to use restroom. The place has some pretty dim lighting which didn't bother me so much just a bit dark. Our server was cool recommend us what to try which I thought was great being a first timer..

Food overall GREAT! As you can see in a photo I posted after I ate with the family and friends, that we enjoy our ayce. We ate everything and it was all great. It's pretty late at night now while typing this so I'll update this when I can. 

Do I recommend this place?
YES I DO RECOMMEND ALL OF YOU READING THIS TO CHECK THIS PLACE OUT AND TRY THREE TIMES IF YOU'RE ONE OF THE NEGATIVE PEOPLE.

Unreal FANTASTIC!!  We have already been here 4 times on our last Vegas trips. While the tables at this place could use a huge upgrade(picnic tables, really?) the service and sushi are amazing!  This is without a doubt the hidden jewel near the strip in Vegas! The AYCE menu is not only huge, but delicious! Amazing rolls and nigiri abound! The fried lobster roll is to die for!! I would have to list the entire menu on things we liked. We tried almost everything , including the baby octopus~ yummy!! Love their skewers and miso too! Their house saki is not bad and beer prices are good. It is the best $25.95 you will ever spend. We priced what our sushi and drinks would have cost at the Luxor or Caesars and we were approaching $240 at each. We spent $72 plus tip here and it was much more fun and much better!! Sit at the bar where chefs like Michael show you what service is really about. We could not love a place more and would highly recommend Umiya!! Thank you Umiya for making our last trip memorable.
My favorite AYCE sushi spot in Las Vegas.  Service is always great and the food can't be beat.  It's near the strip without the inflated strip prices. And they're open late night. This place RULES!
I eat here no less than 3-4 times a week no joke. Great for a quick sushi role for $5 or their all you can eat is everything!

So I came here with my friend over the weekend. After looking at their menu, I proceeded to ask if they were affiliated with Sumo Sushi and the waitress said yes. 

The environment was lovely and just love all the bench seating. The service was great until after we got our desserts. No refilling of water and they weren't anywhere to be found. 

The food was okay, nothing great. They made their rolls really weird is all I can say. For instance, philly roll, instead of putting everything inside the roll like its suppose to be, the salmon was on top and it just made it taste a bit off. Their poke tasted pretty horrible. It didn't seem like nice big chunk of smooth tuna, instead it was grainy like. The hand roll was just filled with rice, just way too much.

Overall, I didn't enjoy myself. I definitely would not be coming back at all. I prefer Sumo Sushi I/II instead.

I come here for lunch a lot and I really appreciate the variety of lunch special options that make it easy to not spend too much and not get bored eating the same things all the time.  The sushi isn't always the best but it is still a good deal and I really like all the bento box options that they have.  The pick-2 and pick 3 roll options really keep it interesting.
Bang for your buck! Definitely try this one away from your hotel. You will be surprised. Especially the service of the staffs was stellar.

Went here with the hubby and a couple of friends. Not the best that we have had but not the worst either. Service was mediocre, we had several different people come to our table, it was not like when you have 1 person designated to you so they know what you ordered, food came out very slowly, we had to ask 3 times about the fried shrimp heads to the sweet shrimp sushi that was long gone. 3 different people told us it is coming, when it came it was cold, like it was sitting. Oh well, on to the rest of the food.....if it is on the specials board, you need to try the salmon belly nigiri and yuzu hamachi. The rolls were ok, and the hot and cold apps are the norm of what you get at other AYCE suchi places. We may give this place another chance but there are other AYCE sushi places out there that are better.

Nom nom nom! Officially my favorite AYCE sushi place...too bad it's all the way in Las Vegas :/

Let me start off by saying that the service was spectacular...stellar...mindblowingly good! Not only was the staff incredibly helpful and on point, but even the chef/owner came out to make our experience that much better. He personally recommended most of the dishes that we had that night and made quite a few of them himself, even throwing a few lessons on fish quality and freshness our way.

I wish I could remember what we had that night, but unfortunately I have no recollection of the names. I do suggest trying the dishes on their "Specials" board...they were all fantastic. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on their menu. Everything was fresh and had a unique twist to regular dishes.

Located a few minutes away from the Palms and like 10 minutes off the Strip, but it is 100% worth the drive. Very reasonably priced as well.

I came here all the time and eat no rice roll "tuna naruto " I always change the cucumber to rice paper, this time the chef decide to bring me
The same roll just to add there rice when I don't eat rice and without even telling me!!! When I told them that I don't eat rice and I always change the roll like that and always get it, this On my way! He decided that he can't make it so what kind of chef is it that can't make it. Besides that I order miso soup but they always forget to bring it!! Very bed service!!!!!

A popular recent discussion in Yelp Talk of Las Vegas has been about overrated businesses. Well, count me in as puzzled at the 4.5 star average rating of this restaurant.

I first tried Umiya Sushi back when I was frequently exploring different all-you-can-eat sushi restaurants. Although I did have a positive impression at the time, it ended up being a one-and-done visit until tonight because it wasn't nearly as good as other AYCE sushi spots. My group's options were more limited late at night though, and we settled on one of the closer ones.

There are certainly some positives this meal. Some of the highlights from my first visit were also standouts on this trip. I enjoyed the tuna sashimi with AJ sauce and the baked New Zealand mussels as much as any AYCE appetizer. The oysters were pretty fresh and decently sized. The fish katsu was a surprise hit with tender fish, a crunchy fried exterior, and just the right amount of sauce.

Tsubugai (whelk) was on the one-per-person specials menu. It was a first-time nigiri for me, and the flavor and chewiness was great. Unagi was spectacular, with a bit of extra caramelization than usual that gave texture and flavor. Yuzu hamachi (yelllowtail with citrus) and garlic tuna (albeit more sweet than garlicky) were also nice. The uni was above average in an AYCE context and had little of that "dirty seawater" issue that often plagues AYCE uni.

The rolls that I tasted weren't too bad either. Yellowtail Lovers with hamachi and spicy hamachi, and both of the no-rice rolls. I would have gone for more, but we were all getting pretty full

The list of letdowns is too long though. Soft-shell crab was fine, especially with soy sauce, but the shell was just a bit too hard and persisted while chewing (note: photo omitted due to low quality). Salmon was bland in all versions: salmon nigiri, salmon belly nigiri, and salmon kama. The kama was overcooked and dry as well. We have not been AYCE friends for a little bit too long, sadly. Screaming o salad was actually nice, but I only found three relatively thin slices of tuna in the huge bed of salad. You can't skimp like that on a one-per-person order.

Super white tuna nigiri was also boring. I do prefer unsauced ono, but this version was bland. I think this was also the nigiri that had a few hard grains of rice, which is rarely ever seen even with the lower standards of AYCE sushi. Amaebi (sweet shrimp) had the right texture but was also bland. The crispy rice with spicy tuna was one of the more boring versions that I've had. The grilled mackerel was also on the dry side. And both the green tea and plum wine ice cream scoops were a little icy and just seemed like another off-balance way to end the dinner (although the mango mochi was fine, probably because it's the standard packaged stuff).

The biggest lowlight was the mixed karai. My friend's bowl looked tempting with its assortment of fish, but I got the impression that my bowl was made wholly of thin discarded pieces and/or low-quality cuts. It was a chore to eat it, especially one of the big chunks of tuna. I found myself dipping the fish in soy sauce or leftover sauce from one of the no-rice rolls. I can't remember having a worse mixed seafood salad in town.

Service issues were again present. They somehow missed giving us the uni on the first order and we had to re-request it. Perhaps they gave it to another table? The servers seemed to constantly bring out superfluous items, forcing us to tell them that we hadn't ordered whatever it was. I just don't run into these issues with table dining at another AYCE sushi restaurants, so it's telling that it's happened 2 out of 2 times here.

Umiya is a passable AYCE sushi restaurant if your options are limited or if you're hanging out in the vicinity (such as the Strip or one of the Flamingo Rd casinos), but I really wouldn't mind staying away for another three years. There are simply far better options in the genre.

I love this place!! This is the only sushi place I would go to for all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas. The waiter and waitresses are always super friendly. The menu isn't overwhelming and has lots of pictures! It is all you can eat! It is timed from the time you put in your order. You get 90 minutes to order all you can eat. Best thing about this place is that you can order half rolls. I totally take advantage of this because I get to try every roll on the menu. They have some very unique sushi, And they even have steak to order (one order of steak per person). 

This place has a dim light ambience. Great date place. Also great for a group of friends! 

It is $20.95 for all you can eat lunch. (From open til 3 pm), and $25.95 for all you can eat for dinner. (From 3 pm til closing).

By far, the best AYCE sushi I've ever had. We tried JJANGA previously and prefer this place. The quality of the sushi was much better and had more nonsushi options. Their sushi options even includes uni (limited)! Worth every penny ($25)! I can't wait to come back here again :)) 

NB free soda/tea with check in (perperson) and $10 extra for AYCD

Awesome place.   Came here on a whim and we loved it.   Ordered the Philadelphia Roll,  Agedashi Tofu,  and sparkling Sake.   Great service,  great food,  and the atmosphere was trendy yet traditional.

Worst service ever.
The fish is NOT fresh, okay some places aren't fresh but AT LEAST THEY TASTE GOOD. 
LOTS AND LOTS OF RICE in their sushi.
The servers don't want to be there and don't know how to handle large groups.
Overall, I would never return.

This restaurant was amazing!! We got the all you can eat for $25.95 and it was way beyond worth it.  the dragon roll was sweet and crispy, and the fish tasted very fresh.  we were so stuffed after eating, and the dessert was really great! I would recommend this restaurant so much!! Sadly, we do not live near here, or I would come very often! The waiters and waitresses were so polite and nice, it made me feel very welcome. The meal left me so delighted. Everything was cooked perfectly.  this is a great restaurant, worthy of five stars.  I am lucky to eat at this restaurant!!

Great food and great atmosphere!! 
The service was excellent and also servers were very attentive. Sushi presentation was phenomenal and also tasted really good. Will be back here again!! 

All you can eat sushi price is perfect and includes appetizers and dessert.
Great place. Great prices and really great guys at the sushi bar! I don't leave many reviews but this place fully deserves it! Great job, we will be back for sure!

You get what you paid for, with that being said, why would u come to an all you can eat sushi joint?

The good thing is, they have a very extensive menu, the place was well decorated and service was exceptional the night I came here.

Now the bad side, all the rolls/sushi is about 70% rice and 30% fish, fine I get that this is AYCE but the quality of the raw stuff is beyond bad, the sweet shrimp and oyster literally made me wanna puke, call me harsh but I'm from LA and my taste buds are spoiled.

The rice was hard and they give u plenty of that, I was also informed that if we left out any rice we would be charged, but after a few sushis I almost didn't give a shit cause it was so bad

My suggestions, stay away from the sushi or rolls, or anything with rice in them 

For $26 per person u might as well suck it up and go to a real buffet. 

If u must come, order yakitori, meat or the appetizer dishes, they're quite good.

I found this place a bit ago and after my second trip I am now getting to reviewing it!  I used to think I wasn't into AYCE sushi but more and more good places are opening up, it is no longer sushi waiting too long sitting in the little fridge by the unfriendly guys in front getting old before it's served sushi.

So I guess with this, yet another good AYCE, I'm into it! 

When you walk in you are greeted with the usual loud "Konnichiwa!!!"  They have a nice area with tables in a kind of tented areas off to the sides, a large bar to watch the chefs and lots and lots of a picnic kind of tables all throughout.  Both times we were here there were men from Japan drinking their butts off hanging in the restaurant so if from the fish capital of the world love it why can't we?! 

The AYCE menu is huge, the first trip we came with his mom and dad who were in town.  She eats nothing raw, so I put my preferences aside and we order cooked food.  In most cases I am left with the everlasting want for sushi until we head back to one, in this case I left happy and satisfied.  All of the cooked rolls and food were nummy!  Next trip was with people who eat it all, so we did.  As mentioned earlier they have a 90 minute limit ( I was done way before, but for you men or heavy eaters out there! ) My boyfriend and his friends enjoyed it all, no I truly mean it all! ;) lol  The staff was nice and fast the entire time and even though the guys ate a TON of food they never made us feel bad.  

The quality of fish:  Good, in lines with some of the other top AYCE places in town, not as good as some of the best non AYCE places in town but what can you expect.

Next AYCE night I will be back great service and great food!
Came here several times and this restaurant was always good but tonight I don't know wtf happened with the rice

All you can eat sushi! This place is so good and so worth it! The price for the quality of the all you can eat sushi is MUST GO TO THIS PLACE TO EAT! All the sushi we ordered was fantastic, I didn't have one bad roll. The oysters were really good as well! I definitely love that they had unlimited seaweed salad! At first when we got here we were worried about the 90 minute time limit but we chowed down ALOT of food in like 30 mins and got full fast so don't worry about the time limit and really enjoy each dish you order! This is a must go to place if you are in Vegas and a huge fan of sushi! I will definitely be coming back my next trip to Vegas!
The rolls are so good! we did the ala carte option and it was a better deal than all you can eat. Definitely check it out.

Omg the best AYCE sushi in town for real.

Taste/service/price/location  everything is absolutely the best!!

Love this place!!! Will come back for sure!

Not as disappointed or frustrated as last time, but still not on close to my go to for sushi. 

Highlights-
Baked Mussels
Lobster on Sushi

Low lights 
Sushi still fell apart
1 Nochi 

Freshness was average, which really is not saying much since I went on a Friday afternoon after lunch rush. Should have been really fresh. This place does have some different select on the appetizer portion of the menu, but like some of my faves from other place on the roll side. 

Last but not least service was really attentive. But I was one of like 3 people in the place so you should expect that. 

Middle of the road at best in my opinion. I won't automatically so no the next time someone brings this page up but will still try to go someone where else if possible.

This place was absolutely amazing! Hands down best AYCE sushi in Vegas! I was absolutely in love with the Salmon Belly Nigiri! So fresh.
Don't forget to try the Mochi! I loved the green tea one!

Came to visit this place because it was recommended. I will no longer be be visiting because of the horrible customer service.  At our arrival the waitress took our order and was rushing us to decide on the all you can eat. Needless to say we had to order our food three times before any food was even brought out, obviously not complete.  Sums it up don't go there!

Best Sushi Place in town at the moment on 06/15/17.

This location has the fastest service with almost never a wait.  It has the freshest fish off the strip right now!  The open seating is great and I love the large wooden tables here.  

The AYCE dinner menu is awesome and often includes salmon belly and other great bites.   The Garlic Ponzu sauce here is to die for and I use it on almost all my rolls.   The baked green muscles are great and all the fish comes out at the right temperature which is not always the case here in Las Vegas because it is a desert!  

The fast service here and water refills really separate this place apart from the rest!  Keep up the good work!

Notes:  This location actually gives you a receipt with every item you ate even if it's AYCE.  I enjoy this because I can look back and see if it was worth the AYCE and I can see what we enjoy eating the most!  It's really amazing sushi.  The last time I was here I ate around 120$ if I was to eat a la cart!

* Update 01/15/18:  This location remains my favorite Las Vegas Sushi Restaurant!

My boyfriend and I were craving sushi for lunch yesterday so I yelped this restaurant and saw a couple of pictures. Since we liked how clean the place looked, we decided to give it a try. 

We sat down right away. The restaurant offers "all you can eat" sushi. My boyfriend obviously took the challenge. 

We sat at the bar and we were able to order quickly. I was able to customize my roll. Chef Alex was extremely nice and suggested different rolls to my boyfriend. He liked every single one. He was extremely nice to us and very friendly. Made us feel like a valued regular customer even though it was our first time we ever visited that restaurant. 

Chef Alex personally introduced himself as the owner of the restaurant and he invited us to try another of his signature rolls for the next time. 

We recommend this restaurant and we're definitely going back since the service was outstanding and the prices were not bad either!

Usually when a place advertises AYCE, they're usually either sacrificing quality or service. This is not the case at Umiya.

I went there last night and the service was fantastic. The server was at our table at regular intervals to check on us and was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. She also made suggestions based on our tastes that were spot on.

The menu is incredible. Appetizers, salads, soups, ramen and steak (yes, steak) were all available on the $26 AYCE menu as well as sushi and nigiri. The food is high quality, fresh, and the chefs were willing to tweak their rolls according to my very picky (I prefer selective) taste.

We were there kind of later (12am-1:30am--they close at 2am) but not once felt a rush to leave or pressure from the staff.

The Umiya experience was amazing and I'll definitely be back. This is probably my new favorite sushi joint.

My girlfriend and I went here for the first time on new years eve... we've been back about 7 times since. We love everything about Umiya. The food is fresh and delicious. The service is always ready and polite. The food is consistently delicious. Highly recommend.
Awesome sushi! From out of town. They really take pride in their customer service and you can totally tell. Deff recommend it to anyone that loves Sushi!!!
Hands down best AYCE sushi I ever had. And I'm from socal, we got literally thousands of sushi joints.

This place certainly beats the AYCE where I'm from. Everything is made to order and I love how you can get the rolls in half. I'm not so crazy about the sushi but I love how we can get a taste of what's in their menu.

The portions given are perfect and me and my friend love their cute poke salad. Very well marinated and with a cute side of seaweed salad it's the one thing she craves about and she doesn't even like raw sushi. 

Customer service was quick and attentive. The atmosphere was a dim setting reminds me of a sports bar. This place does get crowded in the evening.

If you're looking for a place for all you can eat with a large selection of appetizers (what I mostly order), yakatoris, ramen/udon, Japanese entree dishes, nigiri, or sushi. This is your place. I love how it's different from a buffet. You get a variety of Japanese cuisine all made to order.

However, their are certain items in the menu that are only one order per person. And it's usually my favorites. I can understand why it's only allowed 1 per order.

Chef Alex made my late night dinner an amazing experience.  I was lucky enough to go on a Monday night where it wasn't too busy and where i was able to sit alone at the sushi bar.  The fact that it wasn't busy allowed the chef to make me their favorite rolls.  I always asked for chef's choice for nigiri.  Since, it was my first time at this establishment, I asked the chef to just order me anything.  First order by the chef was Tuna Sashimi in special AJ sauce (WOW, sauce was freaking incredible!), baked mussells were good, crispy lobster roll was really good, and I couldn't forget the ocean  salmon nigiri which was so buttery.  The latter was probably the highlight of my meal. Don't forget to order the Soft shell crab appetizer, the batter was so good!  Service was excellent.  One of the best AYCE sushi I ever had.

Our favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. They keep improving and adding new items to their AYCE menu even though they have always been great. Their food is consistently fresh, tasty, comes out quickly. Their service is super fast. This restaurant has the most extensive and creative menu with oysters and many sashimi options. There is not a single thing I would want them to change. To us, no AYCE (and even many of a la carte) restaurants in town come even close. It's perfect as is.

My wife and I were looking for a good sushi place to have dinner. Using Yelp we found Umiya near our hotel. We decided to give this place a try based on the reviews. 
The place was not very busy for dinner during the weeknight. Jay and Krystal was our servers that night and they did a wonderful job of taking our orders and refilling our drinks. We never had to ask for refills they just knew when we needed it. They are very friendly and accommodating. 
We went for all you can eat buffet style. For dinner it was 26.95 per person vs. 22.95 for lunch. The only difference is that for dinner you can order one Uni, sweet shrimp, and some tuna dish. But honestly not worth the extra four dollars you have to pay unless you can not make it for lunch or you love Uni. The food for a buffet was good and reasonable fresh. (I mean we are out in a dessert LOL). We enjoyed all the dishes except for Uni (not a fan of the slimmy sea creature=P_) and the Ginkgo (some kind of fried beans). The rolls were big and very filling. I would recommend to order one roll at a time and try lots of appetizers and udon/ ramen dish. This way you will not fill up on the rolls without getting the chance to try the other dishes.
I would recommend this place.

It is our first time visiting this AYCE Sushi restaurant on a friend's recommendation and based on service alone, I would have rated 1-star but gave it 2-stars for the average sushi.

The sushi nigiri is decent with good ratio between rice and fish (the fish were a tad dry, but I'll stop nitpicking). Miso soup is something I usually order FIRST from sushi restos but would totally avoid it here -- instant miso packets bought from a supermarket tastes way better! And the sad part is it's the first thing we ordered but had to keep asking for its whereabouts a few times before it was delivered. We also tried their tuna poke and fresh oysters which were excellent but then let down by the heavily breaded soft shell crab and sour-tasting calamari. And don't get me started on how awful the spicy tuna roll is, it's a simple dish that should be the least hardest to screw up on.

The service we received was sub par to put it kindly. Maybe we arrived after lunch rush hour and everyone is dead tired but I'm making excuses to understand why the wait staff sucked. Our inattentive waitresses (yes that's plural) often neglected us and kept "forgetting" simple requests like napkins, soy sauce, wasabi and then (almost) tossing in orders on our table as they flew by.

On a larger scale, it became increasingly annoying when we kept getting wrong orders and repeatedly had to ask for and follow up our sushi orders which we eventually gave up on and decided to move on and just pay our bill. In Las Vegas where there's lots of choices, including good AYCE sushi joints, Umiya will not be one of them.

I can overlook mediocre food, even bad food, but crappy service is unforgivable especially if the price point is higher than better places. At least I can tell my friend we tried the place and it was 'okay' at best.

Tonight was my first night having dinner at Umiya which my friend brought me to who is a regular there. The food was amazing!!!! Such good quality and great miso soup. They had the best sushi rolls I've ever had at an all you can eat. But due to the lack of customer service Amy had I will not be dining there again if she serves me. I will make sure she does not serve me. Everyone else who serves there is beyond nice and welcoming and accommodating. I don't know what Amy's deal was but I was very bothered and disturbed by her service. I did not take it up with a manager but next time I will.  3 stars because Amy is rude. Would of been 5.

Umiya is pretty good. I would say there is definitely some items on the menu I would stay away from, but there are plenty of things to eat for plenty of palates. 

The service was a little slow and I was annoyed the the service buttons don't work, but otherwise it was a very positive experience and would return to this location.
Loved the Ono and yellowtail. Reasonably priced for the quality. Friendly and efficient staff. Recommended!

Overall this was a great ayce sushi experience as I am a avid sushi eater along with my girlfriend. Its the little things that count and Umiya acomplished those on my checklist. The main dish that was really different and outsanding to me was their monkey brain, the deep fried avocado is so rich and fatty. Having oysters on your ayce is always a plus. I enjoyed most of the garnishes along side the sushi. 

Thumbs up definitively.

Go hungry and order AYCE!!!

Though the sushi is decent, this place is better suited for the cooked entrees. 

I always get the squid appetizer; usually four portions. Great Korean dishes.

I do enjoy sushi, but confess there are a few places in LV that do it a little better.

No complaints on the service, but you do get better served when you sit at the sushi bar. 

A good place for a date, and certainly, a good value to take visitors.

This place is so busy yet we got our food on time. The customer service here is awesome! We didn't get ignored and all workers made sure we enjoyed our food and that everything's okay. Thank you Umiya for having such great, happy and fast workers!

Fresh seafood, great service and good ayce prices! We sat at the bar, stuffed ourselves and enjoyed every part of this place and the excellent service! If you are looking for a place with great ayce sushi, check this place out!

One of the best AYCE sushi places we've tried! The pork belly and calamari tempura were delicious, as were the specialty rolls, but my favorites by far were the ahi poke and the monkey brains (avocado stuffed with spicy tuna and fried tempura style) - to die for! Be warned that this place is pretty small and fills up quickly, so get there before 6 to avoid the crowd...

My star rating is not due to the food. We had AYCE sushi and it was very good. Fish tasted fresh and there was a lot of choices. Price was reasonable. Restaurant was clean and the ambiance was enjoyable. The problem was the service was painfully slow. It took 45 mins after ordering to get our first roll. There is a 90 min time limit on AYCE. Getting our check dropped off and picked up also took WAY too long. I might come back if I have a lot of time to kill.

Pretty shocking that I'm giving this place a 2 stars rating. I've been told by several people that this AYCE sushi joint is amazing and better than a lot of other AYCE sushi restaurant. I came here with my family on a Saturday night a little over an hour before they closed. We got menus and started going through it then a server (male) came over to our table and said "what would you guys want to drink, I'm only taking drinks order!". At that moment I felt we were being rushed and probably had pissed off that server for the fact that we came in 1 hour before they were closed. An hour is actually plenty of time to give your customers a full service dining experience without rushing them, I know because I'm a long time server myself at a full service sushi restaurant. I get it when customers come in late but thats a con when you work in this restaurant industry. After that server took our drinks order a new server came and took care of us the rest of the time. Overall, food was definitely better than all the AYCE sushi joints i've been too. But service left me feeling like I was not welcomed. I would probably recommend not coming here 1.5 hours before they close.

Tried for the first tome. venue is spacious, ample parking and great service! wide selection of food they even have rib eye, pork belly which are gread addition to the menu. price for lunch is only $20.99.awesome deal!!! food is fresh. definitely, a must place to visit.

Solid Sushi Place!!!
