Ordered to go from Yelp/GrubHub - so easy!

Packaging was great - all the condiments and even some pretty flowers (only complaint no vent for fried food so a little soggy)

Sashimi was fresh love! (5/5)

Rolls flamingo and Rattle Snake - both good not top much rice (4/5)

Crispy Soft Shell Crab 5 good pieces on top of mashed sweet potato (4/5)

Inside was nice lots of tv and modern hip vibe to it.
Best SUSHI SERVICE around. My family all had the AYCE and from start to finish AWESOME.
One of my favorite sushi places. Staff is very friendly, the food is amazing, and the prices are really good! I recommend everyone to come here to satisfy their sushi craving.

Great food ! Eric the chef was amazing ! He answered all of our questions with a smile and was more than happy to help us! Also my cup was never empty, bussers did an amazing job refilling my cup ! (That helps with spicy sushi) this cali native that just moved to vegas will continue to come to umiya for my sushi needs!

I dunno why people kept come in and it has such high rank. Honestly I didn't been to too much sushi place but I still can taste what good and bad is. Unfortunately I didn't taste anything in this place can makes me a way back except the tempera ice cream which I had for years in Manhattan. Otherwise everything I ordered tasted just not the way it should. The place style kind like American style not authentic sushi house.

This place is so so for the food. I just went here for lunch, and it was about 23 dollars for AYCE.

If you like rolls and nigiri for AYCE, it's just ok, not that great. For nigiri, a couple of my tuna and albacore orders didn't look that fresh. They don't have a huge selection of rolls, but they're still ok.

If you like AYCE for the non sushi selection, they have pretty good stuff. I really like their grilled salmon and this tofu dish. I actually really enjoyed the tuna poke. I did like that they had more variety for their ice cream mochis than other sushi restaurants.

As for the ambiance and the customer service, It was pretty good! The decor is pleasant and modern looking. Our waitress was very nice, polite, and attentive too. 

Overall, this place is alright, but it's not my favorite. The good thing about this place, though, is if you check in on yelp, you get a free soda or small sake!
Fresh sushi and great service! I had a big party and the staff was very accommodating.

AYCE sushi! It's been a few years since we've been back to Vegas, and we wanted to find a good sushi spot, and I think we may have. For us the sushi rolls were good, but not great. The nigiri however was actually perfect! The ratio of rice to fish was perfect. The rice was perfect, not too dry or wet. The fish tasted fresh and not too small or large. The cut of fish was great. I'm a sucker for sushi spots with "super white" and was not disappointed! The appetizers were really good for us. I had the Monkey brains and was very impressed.
Dessert was on spot too. We had the deep fried ice cream, which was prefect and the mochi ice cream. The mochi wasn't  your normal mochi you can pick up at Trader Joe's either. My only complaint was you could only have one order  of mochi per person. :( 
The service was good. We were the only ones there at first because we came in pretty early for dinner. We had one incident where they sent our deep fried ice cream to another table, but overall we would come back!

Surprisingly good AYCE sushi hole-in-the-wall. Very accommodating service. Nice selection and very fresh tasting fish. The meat dishes I tried were not nearly as good as the seafood though. Stick with the fish.

Yelped sushi restaurants and found this awesome place. Went there thinking we were going to spend at least a bill for lunch but to my husband and my surprise it was all you can eat. Coming from Hawaii but currently living in Utah, we were craving fresh fish and usually all you can eat sushi isn't never good but Umiya is phenomenal. Fresh and wide variety of rolls and nigiri, appetizers and cooked dishes for a super deal of less than $21 per person at lunch. We leave tomorrow back to Utah and we are dining there again for lunch tomorrow. Service was good and fast even when it was packed with a line out the door.

So bad , so bad. Saw the high review and brought my team here and decided to go for AYCE. The moment we stared ordering, the waitress reminded us twice about how we must finish every grain of rice or we will be charged. Fine, we got it. Then she came back five minutes later, warned us one more time how we must finish every grain of rice or we will be charged. We were like... Huh? Really? We barely started eating. Then food started coming, and other older Korean waitress started coming to us to SERIOUSLY remind us of NOT leaving any rice on the table OR they will CHARGE US!! She literally stayed at the table for 30 seconds to advocate this rule. At this point, we were very irritated and we actually tried eating as much rice as we could as they put so much rice on every roll :((  

Food was very good, service overall was attentive. 

But, BE AWARE OF the two Korean ladies that will NOT stop harassing you if you are the only table there. Don't go too early. 

Be rice lover too !!
Great food, sushi and decor was good.  Skewers and appetizers were kind of small, but the sushi was appetizing.  Service was ok, but the sushi was good regardless. I would return for more.

Ate here in Sept 2014, all you can eat was really good and I didn't really feel that it was overloaded with rice. I ate 5 rolls to get my money's worth and the rolls were awesome. Wish there was something similar out here.

It was July 4, I got off work and was craving Yaki Udon and was trying to find a place that was still open past 10pm and ran into this place which is 5 minutes from my apartment. I ordered a Yaki Udon to go with beef and it was really good! It came in a cute plastic bowl to go. There was plenty of beef and the Udon noodle was perfect. I would definitely try to come back here to try other dishes but I am so happy I found a Yaki Udon dish here and it's delicious !  :-) thanks. Umiya Sushi! Made my night.


I came back here to try the all you can eat for lunch and it was good. Fish could be fresher but the appetizers and other small dishes were great.

This is our FAV Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas. So much food selection at a great price! Who does not LOVE all you can eat AYCE sushi!!! Bring your friends, this is one of those places that you keep coming back to because its just awesome! Great Food & Service, Dont miss out on trying this place out.

If you're hangry af & need sushi fix, this is the place to be! It will overfill your stomachs with the good good :)

PRICE:
- $25.95 for dinner AYCE
- Half price for children up to 7 yo

FOOD:
- They have pretty much every type of fish available including uni & fresh oysters. But for items like these there is a limit to your order (ex.1 order of uni per person)
- Plenty of appetizers available including miso soup, ceviche, baked mussels, seaweed salad, gyoza, spicy tuna on crispy rice & soft shell crab
- Full 2 pages of rolls if you're not much of a sushi person
- Wrap up your raw meal with some meat (teriyaki, rib-eye) and noodles (udon, ramen) 
- And don't forget... ICE CREAM! From tempura ice cream to mochi ice cream (1 per person) like o m g pls don't miss out on this! 
- Some of my favorites were fresh oysters, soft shell crab, garlic tuna, uni, eel, mackerel, and mochi ice cream!

SERVICE/ETC:
- I wouldn't say the staff is welcoming/nice, but they're quick and do what needs to be done.
- No limit on "rounds" just keep ordering! 
- Love the ambience inside: open & modern space with slightly dim lights. And there's a full bar!

As you already know, AYCE doesn't offer the best quality of food. But for such cheap price, food here is not bad AT ALL! I was surprised at how fresh some of the fish were. Definitely coming back on my next visit!

Las Vegas, you've spoiled me. AYCE everywhere. Why I haven't gained any pounds since I've been here beats me.

The interior is large, dark and earthy. Sitting at the bar, you get a feel for the chefs and their sushi-styling. I mainly ordered nigiri and side dishes from the kitchen. The ratio of fish-to-rice was decent enough, however I felt that the rice was over seasoned to the point that it hindered the delicate nature of some of the fish. My friend seemed to like it though. For the side dishes, the servers helped us as best as they could. I went through most items, requesting gluten-free if possible so that my friend could try.

The chefs were very accommodating for my gluten-free friend. They even checked all their ingredients / packaging for hidden wheat. It was then that we all found out that the masago unfortunately had wheat in it.
Great sushi and service! Was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and selection of the ayce menu. One of the best all you can eat sushi spots I've been to. Would definitely come back.

So my boyfriend and i came to here the other night. It wasn't too busy, probably because it was a Wednesday. The hostess greeted us, she was very nice and friendly. The food was delicious! I loved everything I had ! And the best part was the service. Everyone helps each other out so you're constantly getting attention. They were all so nice and friendly. I will definitely be coming back !!
Average sushi place. Nothing fancy. Ambiance is ok but we don't come here to eat the ambiance right

Pretty happy with this place. We went with a friend that knows one of the chef so they asked us what types of fish we like & they made us special dishes with our favorite fishes.

Food came out quickly & service was great too. Have been back here a few times & can't say too much bad about this place.

This place is great! They have the best Laguna Rolls and Miso soup. 
The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. The atmosphere is nice.
exceptional sushi and service!! lots of delicious veggie options. a must visit in sin city.

Our party of 19 walked in here without knowing it's a AYCE restaurant! They have adequate space and tables that can be combined into one for big parties.

Having a party with the majority of them being visitor from Japan, I was really curious as to what they think of this place.

For about $26 per person, other than alcoholic beverages and specialty drinks, we got to order from a huge menu of all you can eat sushi rolls with certain dishes limited to a single serving per person. The caveat is that you must eat everything you order or get penalized.

Everyone was tired and quite famished so we happily ordered and consumed an assortment cold and hot sushi rolls along with certain specialties like grilled steak, uni, poke, etc.

"the quality is okay but you really can't beat the price for the amount of sushi you get." one of my Japanese cohorts commented. 

I agree completely.
AMAZING! Must go place when I'm in town, varieties of food, drink and others.
Baby Eric was bomb!!! He has excellent customer service and was very fast :) we will come back for sure.. Try the orange blossom.
Amazzzing ! My mom & i got the all you can eat sushi and it was so good and fast. It was pretty packed on a Saturday at 5:30 ish pm!

I found this place by accident.  Of course YELPED it and lots of good reviews....so I recommended it to my friends who was visiting from the Bay Area.  I was searching for a place with a good size menu for AYCE lunch and they have succeeded and brought it!!!!!!

Too much good things to say about this place.  Great service, fast in clearing the plates so it does not take up room on your table, servers with smiles on their face, 
All I could say is TRY THIS PLACE AND YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.

(Read all the way to the end! Saved the best for last!)

We visited Umiya for a late lunch AYCE, Tues. around 2:30 and there was only one other group seated, so virtually we had the whole huge open place to ourselves. (Liked that!) Once seated, it took her about ten minutes to come by and take our first order. I'll say only one thing about the service and that it was chilly but businesslike: take order, bring order, clear plates, take order, bring order -no eye contact, no smile, and no re-filling of beverages unless we requested. It is what it is. I can usually warm up any chilly server, but not this one! Might try sitting at the bar next time so as to not be 100% reliant on the server. 

Nonetheless, the food was pretty spectacular. If you're familiar with the AYCE sushi scene in Vegas, you get a little hard to impress after a short time. This was a happy surprise and I'm delighted to be impressed after so long... 

The menu was indeed very extensive. I'm sure you could visit many multiple times and never duplicate, yet leave full and happily satisfied. Since it was our trial run, I took some tips from previous yelpers... 
1. Screaming O salad: did not like this - it was like a mayonaise soup. Steer clear if you don't like a heavy-handed dose of the stuff. 90% mayo, coating of thick mayo on top, three thin slices of ahi underneath, and some lettuce swimming in the watery mayo soup at the bottom of the bowl. Now we know...
2. The snow white roll and orange blossom roll were FRIKKIN AMAZING. Snow white roll -each individual piece of the roll is ever so slightly grilled, so it has a whisp of a smokey flavor. My little tastebuds were freaking out. Insanely good, and so different! Orange blossom roll was also enjoyably different.
3. Red Rock roll - kind of forgettable, but I do remember thinking, "ugh, more mayonaise?"
4. Rib eye steak - was just ok. 
5. Now, there's one thing on the menu we discovered this day I would place in the "EXQUISITE" category. The bacon wrapped scallop skewer. O. M. G. These tiny little gems come two (ONLY TWO?) to a skewer. Just trust me -you're going to want a few of these. I popped the first one in my mouth, and just had to sit there for a moment-what was this? Sweet, salty, chewy, fluffy... what? I just stared at my pal across the table. No words. Eyeballs scanned the restaurant for next closest waitress/server. "Yes, another one of these, please?" I forced my now-stuffed table-mate to try one because they are that good. Crack. Bacon-wrapped-scallop CRACK. 
6. Mango mochi for dessert. Couldn't hold a candle to the sweet candied bacon wrapped goodness I just described.

Few little notes:
- I could imagine a full house, with such a big open space and all hard surfaces would get pretty obnoxiously loud. Prepare, and time your dining session if that would bother you.  
-They charge $2 for green tea. This really chapped the hide of my dining partner. He was personally affronted -like they were charging for breathing air. Again, so now you know. 
- Service with a little charm doesn't cost anything, but apparently its not a priority here. Ok, got it. (The food outshines this aspect of Umiya.)

Overall: excellent and delightfully impressed, will be back, again at an "off" hour.

(Let me know if you like those bacon-crack-skewers, too!)

We stumbled upon this location tucked in a shopping plaza off of Flamingo and Arville, across from Palms Hotel and Casino. 

Is there anything better than taking a chance on a restaurant and finding a hidden gem that could become an absolutely favorite?!?!

By far one of the largest AYCE menu selections. Although some of the selections are a 1x order only it's an absolute must try! 

The staff was friendly and attentive. When my gf and I ordered the food came out rather quickly. The seafood salad was absolutely yummy!

The decor is beautifully understated. Long tables with wooden benches. Not the average sushi spot with tables. Great place for groups! 

$25.99 for an AYCE. After dinner for two and two drinks we walked out completely stuffed with sushi and mochi ice cream about an hour and a half later bringing our total to $62.59.

The lunch AYCE is amazing! For only like $20 they have such a wide variety from appetizers, ramen, nigiri, rolls, and so much more! The sushi came very fast and the service was great. Some of the "non-sushi" items we tried were rib-eye steak, bacon and scallop, oysters, soft-shell crab...amazing!

If you love sushi, do yourself a favor and come here!!! 
number one reason: ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI! (Need I say more?)
Reason two: service is fast and attentive! 
Reason three: sushi rolls come out clean and pleasing to look at(that's if you have enough time to look at it before you dig in) 
Reason four: oh, so affordable. 
Only downer, is the desert, but it's included in the all you can eat price, so just stop at an ice cream parlor after dinner and pull be set. 

Overview AAAAH-MAZING Japanese restaurant. 
Will definitely be back. 
Lei
One word, spectacular! The all you can eat sushi might be the best deal in America let alone Las Vegas. If you are hungry head down to Umiya and you will not regret it, guaranteed.

Finding this place was very refreshing!  Food was great compared to any other sushi I have had in Vegas. Favorites are first kiss, Orange blossom and snow white. I love how you can order half rolls to see what you like. Sgreat experience!

A coworker came here at the beginning of the week and recommended it- I'm so glad, it was delicious!

The sushi at our hotel so overpriced- $18-21 for one roll, which isn't even that good.

Umiya's all you can eat sushi is only $26 and you can even order normally expensive things like uni (only once though) and they're fresh and delicious. The waiters are nice and responsive. This is a really great all you can eat sushi place, definitely worth a trip from wherever you're staying on the strip.

Decided to eat here actually order to go California roll,shrimp tempura roll,was ok .the softshell crab roll and calamari roll were rolled horrible very loose falling apart,very little rice bland taste ,overall dissatisfied.

Great food! Great service!

The selection of fish and dishes are amazing.  I wanted to order everything off the menu but my stomach just couldn't take it. I will definitely be coming back here for more abuse to my stomach.
Totally worth the price, and really fresh Nigiri. The special rolls were unique and delicious and the service was great. I'd definitely eat here again!

4 star food, 2 star service. Server did not speak good English and was able to take down our orders okay enough but certainly wasn't helpful with anything above the bare minimum. Also a busboy spilled soup all over my girlfriend's shoes and clothing due to mishandling of dishes. He did grab napkins and cloths and try to help but obviously the damage was already done. 

Food was very good but there are still plenty of better sushi places in Vegas. Value is pretty good and I like the all you can eat concept but given the lacking service I can't see myself returning anytime soon.

After a day of exploring the strip we decided to come here for dinner. It was about 9 or 10pm and the resturant was still packed, since we had a big group we had to wait about 10-15 minutes for  a table which wasn't a big deal. We did the AYCE for $25/person. There were so many option we decided to stick to the nigiris appetizers and etc. stayed away from the rolls because we knew it was gonna make us full faster. My absolute favorite thing from here was the oysters, grilled squid and seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce! I will come back whenever I'm back in town! 

The only thing that grossed me out was when they brought me my water there were chunks of rice I my cup.... And when we tried to pay with a debit card they said that it didn't work and we had to pay with cash..

Great food! The All You Can Eat menu is excellent, very wide variety. You will not leave hungry for sure. 
There are so many dishes to choose from that we will have to go back to try some new ones soon.
I used to go to sushi kaya but umiya has better customer service and better service means better sushi. One of my go to spots for sushi.
Best sushi I've ever had. Also the ice-cream included in the all-you-can-eat stuff is the perfect finish for a nice dinner.

This place is booming with regulars. $25 for AYCE sushi , rolls and cooked stuff. Well it's not 100% AYCE, some items you can only order once and those are the good items. Each sushi is thinly cut but at least the rice isn't overly too much. I wish the rice had more vinegar in it and softer. The sushi rice was cold and tasteless. 

Service was pretty much on top of things and orders were made quite fast. There were like six Korean guys behind the counter making every sushi order. 

The place had TV's so you can be in there watching the game. They give you 90 minutes to eat as much as possible. 

For the bang for the buck it's cheaper than the casinos and they have a good variety of items to eat.

My boyfriend and I found this gem one night while we were craving sushi. It's THE best sushi! They have a variety of rolls and they're open later than most places. The waiters and waitresses are super attentive and are always available if you have any questions and they very openly suggest rolls that they like if you're new to the place. We are definitely looking forward to becoming regulars!!
Great late night spot or whenever. Very reasonable prices and fresh seafood. Loved it & will be back again.

Best sushi on the strip!!! You cannot beat this price for aces! Their ace menu is almost identical to their reg menu! It is so awesome. There is such a variety. The tables are family style... and the waiters are not set to any specific table! They all help which makes for a super fast service and is super efficient. The sushi is delicious as is there other food. They have a great desert choice. This is a MUST stop whenever we go to Vegas. It's about a mile off the strip, they have great hours, and definitely needs to be on your list of places to eat at when in the area!

The second you step into the restaurant, you are greeted by everyone. Seating does not take long, and it's a great place for big groups to eat together. Food was brought out quickly, and they all tasted good. Overall it was a great experience. Special thanks to Ashley for helping us.

We love sushi and for AYCE Umiya is the best.  They have a great selection of specialty rolls, fresh fish and a large number of appetizers.  The service is always fast and friendly.

BTW the restaurant is pretty large and so it can accommodate a lot of people, not like other AYCE places that have a small dining areas and make you wait in line for hours.

This place was good. They do have a 1 1/2 hour time limit on the AYCE but I was full way before that time hit. 

I liked almost all the dishes that came out, but I wouldn't waste your time on the steak. It looked pretty, but tasted just ok. 
My favorites were a Creamy shrimp fried appetizer and the First Kiss. Both delish!  Oh yeah, and a lobster dish which I tasted off someone else's plate. Yum!

Also, we came with a large group and had to sit at their bigger tables, which have horrible no-back bench seating.  If you come with up to 4 people, they have normal comfortable chairs at their smaller tables. 
I would come again, but with a smaller group so I could sit comfortable.

Yeaaaa!!!! We accidentally ran across this place while trying to find another sushi place down the street. We were so tired of looking and we were famished so stopped in here for AYCE. Great choice!!! Fresh, huge rolls. I told sushi chef I like yellowtail and he made me a special sashimi plate, YEAAAA!!! Everything was delicious, great service. Definitely will be back.

They don't have the option for baked salmon roll , They say it won't be cooked if the fish will be inside the roll, Only on top of the roll. What the hell? So bake the salmon before and put it in the sushi before you roll it! 
So unprofessional.
The rice was so dry and hard, it made all the sushi hard to eat. Rice lacks viniger flavor and didn't lmtaste like sushi rice.The appetizer was good.

I recently found another GEM!

UMIYA SUSHI has a very welcoming atmosphere.  The staff works in tandum to unsure excellent customer service.. 

The food was fresh, scrumptious and well-prepared!  

If you are a sushi enthusiast I would definatley recommend eating here be it lunch or dinner you will be happy you did.  

Thank you for commitment to quality food and exceptional service!
Quality sushi and great variety. Menu is much more than just sushi i like the variety that they have. Price is definitely reasonable for AYCE.

I had heard about Umiya Sushi and wanted to go. After finally seeing lives videos and pictures from my friends SnapChats I thought is was best to go ASAP!!! 
I dragged my boyfriend from his comfy nest and persuaded him to join. He and I both have great places we enjoy sushi and Kaya is one of them. (One of the best in Las Vegas) After trying Umiya it has immediately become my favorite. Although the service and dining experience as a whole is very very fast, I enjoyed the food and the attentive service. The types of rolls were damn near specialty and all looked so amazing!!! You know when you try "All You Can Eat" just to try bits and pieces everything and share? Well, we ordered doubles of the same thing and literally stuff our faces! And everything was unique and tasty! It was a taste bud overload! I don't remember much of the names of rolls but my favorite was the roll with the lightly fried banana on top. Like, who thinks of that?! It was delicious!!! I ordered it twice!!! From now on I will recommend Umiya over Kaya, but both are unique in their own ways. I lean more towards Umiya since they have an edge. A very sharp one atm.
great sushi..really fresh and peapole are nice.   we are regulars here all the time.       try the lobster crunch roll! (:

This. Place. ROCKS! 

The little known secret about AYCE sushi joints in Vegas is that most of them have marginal sushi. Maybe that's why they don't care how much you eat because they aren't spending for the best quality or hiring great sushi chefs. So I was a little skeptical when I left the gym and decided that if there was ever a time to give it a shot it was when I was carb depleted and starving. :) 

One fantastic thing about Umiya is that they let you order half rolls which gives you a chance to try a lot of different options. Let's just say that I took full advantage of this option! The big winners for me were AJ Tuna (unreal!), Orange Blossom (love the sauce), Yum Yum Crab Roll (perfectly named), Spicy Tataki Roll, Vegas Lasagna and Crunch Lobster Roll. 

Another thing that led to the 5 Stars was the service. Friendly, prompt and they kept the food coming without much of a wait at all. Some AYCE waiters/waitresses act like you are stealing food from their children's mouths every time you order another item (OK, maybe only like they have to pay for it personally but you get the point). Not this place. They would have just kept it coming but everyone has their limit and I tapped out full, satisfied and happy that I found this place. And all for $26! Cannot beat that price for the quality of this food, volume of choices and awesome service. Bring your appetite but leave your AMEX Black Card at home!

For all you can eat sushi, definitely the quality of the food over exceeded my expectations. The only downside to this whole experience was that they never told us (until we finished eating and asked for the check) that they charged extra for the plates we didn't eat! How convenient of them to tell their costumers by the end of the meal.

Simply amazing all around!

Service: Food gets out to you quickly, all servers were very attentive and friendly 

Environment: Clean, nice moody atmosphere and large tables for bigger group

Food: The all you can eat deal for $25 (dinner) is the best deal!!!! Come hungry because you can have all types of sushi including traditional rolls, sashimi, specialty rolls and hand rolls. In addition, you can also get rib eye steak (1 time), pork belly, udon, skewers, salads, veggies, desserts, appetizer and entree type of meals. This is not a buffet, you order from a large ayce menu. All the food that my large group had was great and we are absolutely coming back for more!!!!!

I love this place!

Probably one of the best sushi places I've been to. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We came in at 1 am on a Monday night so service was fast. The sushi was very fresh, of good quality, and absolutely delicious! I am very pick when it comes to sushi and it really impressed me. I will definitely go back the next time I come to the area!

This place was good. The wait time and wait staff was also good. They seemed a little under staffed because when we went it was a little busy but it felt like the two servers that were there were constantly running around in circles and it was kind of hard to track them down at some points. They were very friendly though! As for the food, the fish was okay. It didn't taste very fresh and I tasted a sort of sweetness to the fish that threw me off, but it wasn't terrible, just not what I was expecting. Everything tasted sweet to me, especially the spicy tuna dishes that we ordered. Great price for all you can eat sushi though and lots of roll, appetizer, and nigiri choices which was nice! I'd give this place another shot if I came back to town.

I have never been a AYCE sushi joint that pumped out the sushi so fast.  I went on a Friday night where they were busy and they had 6 sushi chefs working and plenty of waiters.  I barely got the last piece of sushi off my plate before it was whisked away by a server.  Service was truly excellent.

Stand out items were the oysters and orgasm salad.  Cuts of fish were sloppy and a bit small for the nigiri, but the rolls were pretty good.  But damn, that bench seating is even more uncomfortable than it looks.

Horrible service!!! Walked out before we were even seated.  Seriously disappointed.  The hostess and one server were incredibly rude to us.  We weren't even acknowledged while standing at the host stand for FIVE MINUTES straight and we were the only ones there.... oh and by the way, he hostess was standing right in front of us.  Seriously annoyed.
This place is the place to go for ayce sushi. It may get busy from time to time but the wait is worth it. Fresh sushi at its best!
The sushi was good and you get fast service when you sit at the sushi bar.  I went there while on a business trip by myself and it good that they do half rolls.  You can fill up fast.

$25 all you can eat sushi is pretty good deal.
You can have 2 pieces of Amaebi which was pretty huge size and 2 pieces of Uni. Thats $15 if you order regular sushi already.

Fish are pretty good. Wish they could offer some sashimi because you just dont wanna eat nigiri all the time. Like my bro doesn't like to eat rice and wanna stay in shape, he only ate fish and waitress said he couldnt do that, but my bro just wanna pay extra because he really didnt wanna eat rice. Not that he wanted wasted food. Hope they could understand that. 

They have very big menu, so there are a lot of options for you. You can have 2 pieces of fresh oyster too
 
Soft shell crab is available,  but it has too much tempura mix on it. not that crispy. 

$25 is not expensive for that many options. Vegas just have so many good restaurants and good price. Wish they could open some in Bay Area

There are days I find myself just west of the strip, and when I do, I've found a great place for sushi.  As with most of the AYCE sushi places I've tried, the chefs and staff are great here.  What makes it stand out is the flavors of their rolls and sauces to go with the rolls.  The fish is fresh and flavorful.  Umiya is priced right, in a great location, near the Palms, Rio, and Gold Coast, and when I'm in that area, craving sushi, this place is sure to be on the top of my list.  

One of the best parts about Umiya is the selection.  They have a wide variety of rolls, and so many delicious options.  If only I had known about it sooner, when I used to stay at the Rio.  The price is typical of most of the other AYCE sushi places, and it's a great choice for tourists and locals alike.  I still have my favorite on the other side of town, but I'll be back here.

If you love spicy mayo and a shitton of sauce all over your sushi, this place is for you.  The special "rolls" (and I say rolls in quotes because it comes out in two pieces) all pretty much taste the same.

Also, don't bother ordering the steak, unless you need to strength train your jaws.

The plain ol sushi is decent. But considering that this is the only thing worth eating, I'd consider this place a bit on the pricier side for what you get.

Sushi samurai says no, thank you!

My number 1 favorite AYCE Sushi restaurant. I went there for my mom's Birthday last year, and last month for my Birthday. I was tired of trying all of the AYCE restaurant, because of poor services, and bad qualities. My parents love Japanese food, but they dislike eating raw. This restaurant is perfect for them.There are so many cook dishes for my parents, and they are delicious. I also invited my friends and their family. They all had a blast, and enjoy every moment of it.
My experience here is my go to for sushi! I love this place  the staff always friendly and there saba sashimi amazing as always!!! If you haven't been here your missing out so come!

I would have given this place 5 stars but I had to stop at 4  because the bathroom was totally disgusting. 

Other than that the food was very impressive and the calamari was to die for. 

The food and the service were both fast we didn't have any problems the whole night.

We ate tons of sushi and it all tasted fresh there was really nothing to complain about other than the bathroom. 

I would definitely recommend this place

Glad I found this place on Instagram! Me and my friends came here after cruising around Fremont St. after midnight. They open until 2am, so my first impression would be that the food won't be fresh and that they would be rushing us to get out of there, lack of service. I was totally wrong!! We came and opt for the AYCE and the owner (I think) said they stopped taking orders around 1:20am so we were okay with that. We were seated and I ordered whatever that caught my attention to ensure I got to try everything before the cut off time. Everything was made to order and served in little platters one by one and everything was delicious!! They limit certain dishes to one at a time which is good because I would've just ordered probably 3 plates of everything because my eyes are bigger than my stomach! They have ramen, steak, teriyaki, nigiri, tempura, appetizers, dessert, grilled fish, etc! It's about $27 per person after tax and it is definitely worth it. Also, free soda with Yelp check in. Everything was nice, hot and fresh except for the uni, which was so bad you can see it in the color but it was okay because it was near closing so I skipped it. I especially like the fresh oysters and the spicy tuna over crispy rice! Felt bad I couldn't finish some items because I was so full and I read that if you don't finish your food, you will be charged for it! I got scared so I forced myself to it but the owner was really nice, she brought out the check and didn't charge us for it and not only did her and her employees didn't make us feel rushed or bad we came in late but they were really friendly! I definitely recommend this place to my friends and I will of course be back!

Our umiya experience was delightful. I had the vegetarian options and couldn't have been happier. The place is located off the strip across from Palms Place. But don't be fooled, it's worth dropping in on if your in the neighborhood. Prices are fair, and the staff is super nice. Clean inside and always busy. We will be back again!

It was my first time visiting this restaurant and I left with a smile. My friends and I decided to check this place out and ordered all-you-can eat lunch buffet. Restaurant is quite spacious and tables can fit up to 8 people. Service is good and staff is attentive to refill our drinks before it runs out. 

Tips: The sushi roll comes in a half portion, give yourself an opportunity to try other things in the menu. If you couldn't finish it, they are very strict on charging you for what you did not finish.

Husband and I decided to try Umiya for a lunch date before a movie. We don't live on that side of town so I googled sushi places in the zip code of the theater and Umiya came up with great reviews. 

We were seated promptly after walking in however it took about 10 minutes before someone offered drinks or a menu. Once we had menus several people stopped in a 3 minute span to ask if we wanted to order. 

They were prompt in getting rolls and nigiri out. As far as the nigiri it was reallllly good. They werent overly thick or large pieces. I also had a screaming O salad with tuna and it was delicious. The spicy garlic Edamame was cold and tasted like it was tossed in just sriracha with no garlic.  The rolls left a little to be desired.they tasted alright.  They were not very neat. What I mean is they were messy. One roll we ordered kept coming unrolled when we would use the chopstick to grab a piece. One roll had an excess of crunch on top. I'm all for crunch I really am but it went everywhere, I have never had crunch on a Japanese lasagna either. There wasn't anything special about the sauces on top (if any.) mostly just straight sriracha or eel sauce. One roll came out to us with no sauce but the description had a ponzu sauce and spicy mayo so we couldn't tell if it was even the right roll. Now I know you're thinking well did you tell someone. We tried. After several failed attempts we just ate it. One thing I really liked was they offer macarons! My husband loves mochi, I do not so when I saw chocolate macorons I was pretty excited and they were good! Another odd thing was our table was not level. It kept wobbling back and forth which is slightly irritating while eating. 

Recap: nigiri was great (salmon,tuna, yellow tail and red snapper) the rolls were meh but they weren't awful. The wobbling table was irritating and it seemed either every waiter showed up in 2 minutes to ask if you wanted to order or they disappeared for 10 minutes all together.
Dishes came pretty slow but the taste and service were great! best value in Vegas.

Been here several times.  Each time, the service, food selection, and inclusion of desert make this place a great place for AYCE sushi.  Includes my favorite uni, soda, and dessert.  Don't come here if you are on a diet or trying to avoid carbs.  Heaven for AYCE searchers.

Originally wanted Goyemon but didn't like 1 hr wait so came here instead.  I gota say I was not disappointed.   The specials of the day were ocean trout and salmon belly.  Both were pretty good but I wished they had a bit more specials.  What really earned them the 4 stars from me was the ama ebi.  They used some FAT ASS ebi and it was great.  Having some good quality and perfectly fried soft shell crab didn't hurt either.

absolutely loved this place. all the rolls were great, the yum yum crab we had seconds. also loved the ahi tuna. personally I would avoid the Uni (sea urchin) not a fan of that one.
staff friendly and attentive.

This place kicks ass! There are a lot of hidden gems throughout Las Vegas that serve great food off-the-strip. This is one of my favorites.

Although it's AYCE, you order a la carte instead of going down a buffet line. The price is reasonable and the selection is very large.

One of the best deals in Vegas. 

Getting there from the strip: If you don't want to pay for a tax, get on the Gold Coast shuttle from Bally's to Gold Coast. The restaurant is  a 1/3 mile walk down W Flamingo.
Plain and simple tasty sushi, good service, reasonable price and good atmosphere. Do yourself a favor, adventure off the Strip and get to Umiya!

This place is more like 4.5 stars, which is well worth a visit every time I crave sushi when I'm in Vegas!

Came here last week with a bachelorette party of 8. They seated half of the party that showed up first so I guess you don't need everyone to be there to get seated (and I think we had reservations). 3 out of 8 girls did not get the AYCE (1.5hr time limit) and those girls regretted big time! I was definitely NOT one of the 3 girls. It was an easy pick to do AYCE sushi for the price (about $30/person including a drink, tax, and tip) which was a good deal to me! 

What's better is the selection of food. You honestly want to eat so much from their menu, but you can't because your belly won't be able to take it. Choose wisely also because they supposedly charge you for any leftover food. In terms of taste, everything was tasty. I don't think I was disappointed with any of the items and when sharing with 4 other girls I honestly got to try so many food choices! After paying I totally remember that desserts come with AYCE, but the girls and I were ready to leave so we asked for our green tea ice cream in cups and the staff absolutely accommodated us and even gave us big scoops of ice cream! Yay! 

The only reason this establishment did not get a perfect rating from me was because after we got our drinks, our initial waitress never came back to us. It took 10-15 minutes to actually flag down another waitress just to start our first order of AYCE. The second waitress was helpful though. Overall, great choice for AYCE sushi! Will be back when I visit sin city again which I hope will be soon! =D

I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone.  The only thing good about this restaurant is the service and the speed of it.  The food on the other hand is the WORST sushi I have ever had.  I read the reviews and thought it would be nice to try a new spot, what an awful waste of a day off.  I'm sorry to rip into this place, but I hope they read this. The oysters (which are my favorite thing to eat) were so bad I couldn't eat more than one.  It tasted so fishy and awful compared to the number of oysters I've had in my life.  The yellowfin tuna was like dull brown yellow with a fishy taste as well.  We were told if we didn't finish food from our all you can eat that we would be charged. Never have I ever left food because I didn't like it, until last night.  Soho blows this place away on a whole new level.  If you want a descent priced all you can eat sushi, I recommend GOYMON, and it's not that far.  Goymon's service sucks but the food at least taste better. If you want sushi that actually taste like SUSHI and FRESH fish go to SOHO, the M, Naked FISH, anywhere but this place.
Yummy sushi buffet a bit off the strip. Great service and worth the trip! Will come again!

My friends and I were in Vegas for the week and were craving sushi. We didn't want to pay a ridiculous amount of money like you I would on the strip, so our friend told us about this place and said it was BOMB! It was pretty packed when we got there so I'm guessing everyone had the same idea as us. 

All you can eat sushi?... but lets just all take a minute to appreciate those 5 words  I feel like sometimes when I eat raw seafood, I get a little picky and concerned if the quality is gonna be good... but OMG the food was so good! The fish looked fresh and everything came out in a timely matter. I didn't think we could eat so much sushi!! 

They give you a time limit of an hour and a half, which is more than enough time to eat as much as you want. They also have desserts! Alcohol and tea cost extra. Some items on the menu are limited to one per customer. + The menu has a lot of pictures and tells you exactly what's in it.

I suggest going with a group of people so that way you can eat a little bit of everything. Or if you're super hungry, you can just go by yourself. Either way, it's so worth it! Another suggestion is to order as you go. If you don't end up eating everything, they will charge you extra. So it's better to just order a few things at a time so you know you can finish everything. Think I ended up paying only ~$30 (take in mind I ate like 4 rolls, an udon, steak, 3 appetizers, and dessert). I usually pay that much, if not more, for like 3 sushi rolls at other places. 

Definitely a must eat place if you love sushi and are super hungry! I was very impressed by how much food my friends and I consumed! I left feeling so food drunk  I will be back next time I'm in Vegas

The food is exceptional along with the service!
Didn't really know what was good so just asked the waiters to serve what they recommend and wasn't disappointed. The rolls, nigiri, skewers were all very delicious without having a lot of rice in their nigiri like most sushi restaurants.

Great atmosphere and energy. Food is just fantastic. There seriously wasnt a single thing which I didn't think was above par. Even the draft Ashai was perfectly chilled. Will come here everything in town.

One of the only ayce restaurants that has earned a spot on my short list. Great variety, some unique rolls, and the fish was solid. Service was fast and friendly. 

I hate to leave such a short and vague review, but this place is really good and nobody wants to read my waxing poetic about hamachi. 

Go. Enjoy. Go back. Enjoy again.
I've tried different sushi place in Vegas and Umiya is one of my sushi fixed to go to. Would recommend my family and friends to this place.  The environment is a fun family friendly..

First impressions are important. And right as I walked in, the atmosphere was great. Sleek, modern look with a Japanese twist. Now, for the food and menu. AYCE dinner is $27. Couple bucks more than the typical sushi place. But well worth it. Variety and size of the menu is more than enough. There's plenty of fun rolls and also a excellent selection of the more traditional nigiri style. I've been here more than once and each time is does not disappoint. I def recommend this place to everyone. This place has never been a let down.

Food was awesome but customer service was horrible. I ordered to rolls once I was done my plate was picked up. Everyone around me ordered 2-3 times while I was ignored. I wait 15 mins to get somebody's attention. I got up and went to pay. I explained to the lady at the register that I was ignored all she said sorry did you want to take your dessert to go. Very unhappy and frankly disappointed because I had a hard day and getting sushi was my "treat". It just made my day worse.

One of the best AYCE experiences in Vegas. They have great service despite the fact they operate as an AYCE place. Their drinks were delicious and would definitely take the wait staff's recommendations for their most popular rolls.
This is not bad for AYCE place very fresh Uni and belly salmon was good had Unagi also not bad at all good eats for it's price.

Great sushi place if you're in Vegas. Good price and all you can eat for a reasonable price. A must see place to go. The sushi is excellent and so is the steak. Great service as well. Great ambience and waitresses.

Best AYCE sushi restaurant I've been to and really a great price point. 

We feared the long lines and wait we had read about in other reviews and when we called they warned of a 1-2 hour wait. However, when we arrived we were seated in mere minutes.

The fish quality and really food quality overall is pretty surprisingly good for AYCE. One thing that really stands out is the variety of their menu. It is rare that an AYCE place lets you order shucked oysters, rib eye, and ramen/udon in addition to everything else on the menu.

Service is also tremendous here. They gave us a wrong order or an extra portion but quickly remedied the issue. They are also constantly available to take your orders and the food comes out so fast. 

The Yelp-check-in deals gets you a free drink which is always nice. Overall, I remember the yellowtail and albacore being especially impressive. The rice to fish ratio is definitely in the customer's favor. Easily my new favorite AYCE place in Vegas.

I've been to a lot of restaurants and this ayce is not one I would return to.  We came here after deciding not to spend $55 per person at a different buffet because we had a vegetarian and non-seafood eater in the group.  Well.. this place was clearly a mistake.

This place charges for anything you don't eat.. and boy, are they strict.  My hungry friend accidentally ordered a lot of items because she was super hungry.  Well, instead of bringing it out in waves so perhaps we could cancel some of our orders when we realized the sheer volume.. they just brought everything out within the span of 3 minutes.  Yes, our ENTIRE table was full of food.  Did the waitress warn us or did they tell us about their policy (which is printed in their menu)?  Nope.. they knew this would happen.  In fact, after all the food came out.. a male waiter came to our table to let us know they would charge us.. then as we looked at the TON of rice they put on everything (which is how they get you.. with that much rice, you really can't eat that much more than two orders.. why don't they try to make the proportions smaller so nobody really wastes food), they sent this waitress to our table to lecture us like children.  Never in ALL THE RESTAURANTS I HAVE BEEN TO HAS THIS EVER HAPPENED.  That alone will get me to go to the six hundred other restaurants in Vegas.  It was rude and completely unnecessary.  

Oh and when we were talking about how this service was terrible where none of the waitstaff was anywhere nearby.. they magically appeared and seemed to know what we discussed.  For sure.. they have microphones at the tables so watch out.. the food police will be on you.

They overcharged us $20.  Dinner is $25.  If you were to truly finish all the rice for whatever you order, you'll probably be only able to order 3 items so they will make money off of you one way (the dinner buffet cost) or other (charge you for not finishing your food).  The food was okay.. a lot of it was standard.  Soft shell crab, uni, and sweet shrimp were good.  I wouldn't say anything stood out except the fact that the food came out within the span of 3 minutes so I would suspect they either have 10 chefs working in parallel OR that a lot of their stuff is made in advance which makes me question their freshness.

Still.. the lecturing that I got from this waitstaff is something I will never forget.  Learn how to be in the service industry or risk all your customers never returning.

Plenty of sushi rolls to choose from and sashimi seemed pretty fresh. Some ordered lunch special and one ordered from the AYCE menu which has everything from sushi, appetizers, grilled items, desserts and drinks (90min time limit which is good as they take a while at times to fulfill your order). Good for groups with plenty parking.

The food is good, service was fast but I had found a hair in my food and I didn't even get an apology.. nothing. I work in the food industry and I know that's a big deal to us if this were to happen. 

They do kind of hound you if you don't get all you can eat, and somebody else at your table does.. I wasn't going to share or anything, I just wasn't as hungry and wanted one roll.. they proceeded to tell me they're going to be keeping an eye on me to make sure I wasn't eating off of anybody plate, and that they will charge me if I do..

Been here twice .. Love the food , love the servers .. Today I ate at the sushi bar .. The sushi chefs are awesome !!!!! A reason why I gave it 4 stars .. I felt rushed . I've never felt like that at any other AYCE restaurant . They kept asking me if I wanted dessert when I still had sushi in front of me . 

OTHER THAN THAT.. Food comes out quick. Sushi chefs and servers were attentive .

This is probably one of my favorite AYCE spots in Vegas and I have tried almost all there is to offer. It's open til late, they have half-orders (which I think is AWESOME) amazing service and great music. The place being as popular and busy as it is, it surprises me every time that our food always gets to us so efficiently. I'm talking about ALL of your food on your table in less than 10 mins after you order kind of efficient. Empty plates are always cleared away, drinks refilled without you even knowing. This is what you call attentiveness! I don't know how they do it!! Sushi Chef Lee was amazing! Thank you Umiya for bringing great sushi to Vegas!

I have eaten at this sushi restaurant which is Formaly Kaizen
It's located across the street from the palms I even found an episode of wife swap in this restaurant actually wasn't me it was my nanny bringing the other wife into it and I know that the restaurant owners and staff were very helpful with the producers I have eaten here so many times with my friends that I can't even count this particular sushi bar offers or you can eat lunch for I think $22 for lunch and 25 for dinner and it comes with a special menu if you don't finish your food they charge you but that's never happened to me ever always had good service here places 
Cleanliness
 I've never seen it as busy as the other Kaizen 
on flamingo and Hyndman I believe that ones open much later definitely try the Japanese lasagna is a must and so is the snow corn roll but you must order it with sway paper and get the garlic out of mummy so great I do not eat a lot of raw fish but I've seen my friends order 10 to 15 different roles in front of me that presentation wise they look amazing but I'm very picky with sushi I like mine cooked and fattening
My son will even eat here because he loves their Bento box
Out of all the times that I have been here I've never been disappointed
If you are a tourist looking for sushi and you are staying either at the Rio or the palms this is a nice little local spot it even in walking distance if you must but it's in a shady little strip mall.

So it's valentines day the day we went & every where was crazy packed. But unmiya was the one sushi place that didn't have a waiting list. So we went for it. 

We usually go to goyemon but it's always super busy and this place is just as good as goyemon ! 

The restaurant ambience is nice. Very chill and relaxing. Not to dark not to bright. We got seated at the bar. The servers are really friendly. 

The sushi is all fresh. We did AYCE and ordered nigiri and other rolls which were all good and fresh. 

The sushi chefs were friendly also and always asked us if we needed anything else. 

5/5

After visiting local AYCE Sushi places in Vegas. I had to try as much around here as I can. I came here a week ago. The NBA finals and EDC weekend was around too. I sat at the bar. Order the available nigris they had. Ranging from classic tuna to sweet shrimp. I also had the rolls, which they can do half order. The waiting staff is very attentive. The busser do ask if you are satisfied or need any assistance.  

As much I enjoyed eating from it. There are a few things that bothered me:

- I had ordered Uni and had a shell piece in. It was quite noticeable. 
- I had a order that I waited longer than usual. Turns out it was given to the person next to me
- One of the roll I received was cold. A tempura based one. 

The service was exceptional fare for both ends of the house. I was very pleased with most of the items and selection and as well expectation. The only criticism I have if the chefs could be more wary of the food they produce and given to. I had the courtesy of sitting near the Expo/Lead cook. The available of items is exceptionally. If it weren't for the quality and the front of the house's good management, I would had a worse outlook on Umiya.

I would come back again. If I'm back in town.

The service is very fast and friendly. Sushi is okay but it will not be one of my go to's. the rice is a lot. The fish is ok but not as fresh as the ones I am accustomed to. For the area it's prob among the better ones. I tried to try a bit of everything but it's just not enough to get me back. The fried shrimp heads were harder than I wanted.
Yum. Big portions, fresh sushi, and great service. The free drink with the yelp check-in is a fun perk.
Hands down, one of my favorite sushi places in the city! Staff is wonderful! I'm a regular and pop in 2-4 times a month. I've never been dissatisfied. I love showing this restaurant off to my friends

This place is amazing! If you are craving all you can eat sushi that's good quality AND have hot dishes, this is your place! It's not too far from the strip.

No need for a long review for this one, just come try this place out :) I can't even list out everything I've tried but they were all delicious, especially for the price! I really enjoyed their grilled squid and def will be back.

The ambiance was pretty nice. I like that it's an open picnic style seating.

First off, customer service was on point. The waiters/waitresses were on point with the water and checking back with you.

Went with a group and did the AYCE. The menu was really large and had a pretty good variety - even for non-sushi eaters like myself. My other half loves sushi so he was all over it. In his opinion the sushi was on point.

$26 is well worth it since you can order a variety of things.
the sushi was just aiight. The specials were good tho. I don't recommend eating the deep fried oyster or the uuni. The unagi was good since it was baked.

I'm going to keep it brief: I'm a sushi/sashimi fanatic, and this is hands down one of the best places in Vegas!!! Super tasty, great prices (I do AYCE every time, only way to go), fantastic staff, great ambiance/restaurant design, and everything tastes fantastic.  I come here about 1-2 times a month and have never had a bad experience! Umiya rocks!!! They get pretty busy on the weekends, its best to make a reso for large parties.  It's a must try place!
My favorite all time AYCE. Place is so busy , but service is fast and up beat with a full bar
AYCE sushi! Dinner start at 1500. Close by the strip. Our favs Uni, hamachi, super white, soft shell crab, yuzu cerviche, yellowtail, Masago, ikura. Fresh! Friendly and prompt!

I  always go here whenever I'm in town. The sushi is fresh, the prices are standard, the customer service is good, and the atmosphere Is great! Come check it out. Random yet delicious dish was the gingko. Definitely try that one! All sushi rolls were delicious so...get em all!

My friends and I came here celebrating my friends 21st birthday. They are open late at night. We ate here around midnight.

When you walk in the atmosphere is a very Japanese semi outdoor picnic feel. The lighting is dim and the decorations makes it feel you're really in japan. The tables are very large and enough to order plenty of food.

I started with their spicy tuna salad and it had a lot of flavor and different types of fishes mix with it. My friends and I ordered several specials orders such as the Hawaiian roll, firecracker and all the dishes was delicious.

The staff was very friendly and the sushi chefs surprisingly made our food very fast even if though it was busy.

Thank you and we will be back!

This is the best all you can eat sushi I've had in the states! The lunch pricing is reasonable and the menu has many delicious items. I really enjoyed the sushi here every time I came here. Good get served pretty fast after you order, so overall the experience here is great!
Best All-you-can-eat sushi place I've been to. Worths every dime of $25 dinner price. Just order all of the one-time only food items and you can't go wrong.

Was going to give this place a really good review and five star. But they lost two stars due to the bad experience on my second visit. The first visit was perfect. A friend was at running a booth at CES so i took him to this place. Just the two of us. Perfect! Good was great. The waitresses was very attentive to our needs. Cool. So 7 days later when my friend's last day at CES. We decided to go here as a group with my family and his family plus a friend. Total 6 of us. Bad! Service was horrible. It seemed as though they wanted us to hurry up and eat and leave. The table next to us cam it after us and they were given more attention than our table. My friends wife ask for low sodium soy sauce. They charged us $1.50. Not a big deal but i dont recall regular soy sauce and low sodium soy sauce were much different in price at the market. After our dinner we were charged a service fee. Which most of the time i would give more. But this time I didn't the server deserve what any tip. Her service was horrible. So my suggestion is dont go here if you have a big group.  Food is good not going to lie. I will be back but not as a big group

It was little hard to find this place we were at the right parking lot but we couldn't see the sign(Actually there's no sign yet only little banner saying UMIYA all you can eat sushi coming soon) so we used my navigation on my smartphone. But we ended up at the same parking lot as first time???
This time we paid more attention, UMIYA is right next door of Starbucks. It looks small from outside but inside is very modern and upscale looking.
I was very surprised by the quality of foods for AYCE sushi place. Food was fantastic, me and my husband was so busy to eat to take any pictures. When we realized we were only able to take two pictures. We really liked everything we ordered. Orange blossom roll, The bacon wrapped scallop skewer, Marinated Pork Belly, Baby Octopus skewer, Fresh Oyster, Crunch lobster Roll( plenty of real lobster)....I can't remember any more but all was so good. 
I highly recommend this place to anyone love sushi but don't eat AYCE sushi because the poor quality of food @most of AYCE sushi places. 
UMIYA is Only High Quality AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas. 
I can't wait for next time.

They have really bad service I asked to sit at the sushi bar and then they sat me at a table with four sits when it was just me and another person. They had multiple parties of 4 and personal I feel maybe they should of sat the one of the parties of 4 before they sat me.
My hubby and i ate AYCE. Portion was small to good to taste lots of dishes. Sushi was fresh and price was reasonable.

It's all you can eat, but you have to read the fine print. There are certain items you can only eat 1 order of, and some of them only available at dinner. The rolls are pretty good, but they will definitely fill you up. I rarely even dipped the rolls in soy sauce since they already put their special sauces all over. I thought the appetizers were actually the best thing on the menu. Poke, seafood ceviche, seared tuna, oysters, and the fried soft shell crab were my favorites on the dinner menu. Don't forget to eat dessert! They have mochi ice cream, which can be kind of hard. Maybe they could defrost it a little? Overall pretty great.
Really quick service. Food variety is decent and flavor is good. My favorite are unagi nigiri, baked mussels and rib eye steak. Also, it's the cheapest sushi buffet ever!
This place is delicious, sweet shrimp, super white tuna, uni, sea bream, scallop, octopus.... SOLD!u

Came in on Saturday night and ended up with food poisoning- both me and my husband. Usually love this place, but with the pre cut fish they have lying around not on ice might have something to do with it
The dessert are all you can eat too!!! Had a great meal and great experience. Love the AYCE lunch and dinner here.
Really good sushi. . They greet you right as you enter the restaurant.. great  staff you have to try the  banana roll mmmmmmm delicious!!
Very good ayce.  Small portions so you can try everything. Plus, the whole menu is on ayce not just some select list of rolls. Really great place!

Can I start out by saying that it's been a long time since I left a restaurant feeling more than satisfied about their customer service game?  This wait staff is COMPLETELY on point.  
You have one designated waiter/waitress that is incredibly attentive as to when you need to order, what you need, etc.  But you also have the ENTIRE wait staff coming to check up on you to make sure everything is going well.  I don't think I've gone more than 5 minutes without someone asking me if I need a refill, need to order anything, or if everything is good so far.  It might sound annoying, but it really isn't.  They do it so casually, it doesn't even bother your meal.  I am completely loyal to this place now specifically because of how AMAZING their staff is.  Also!  My waitress was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu.  She picked out two great rolls for me when I asked which one she thinks I should get.  She took her time to go through all of the options for me and made sure that I would love it.     

Food portion:  I really LOVE their meal portion for AYCE.  You get one complete roll, but the rolls aren't fat.  They're cute size.  So you don't feel overwhelmed with one roll.  This is great with AYCE, that means you can order a lot more rolls and still be able to eat them all.  There isn't a lot of rice on their sushi, which gives you room to eat a lot more.  

If you see my past Sushi reviews, I tend to lose loyalty if the service is terrible.  Needless to say, this place has gotten my loyalty and I will definitely be back.  How I know that this service isn't a fluke:  I overheard an experienced waiter teach a new waiter to make sure to always be attentive to all of the tables.  Not just his, but all of them.  I heard him go over how if you see a dirty plate, you take it away immediately.  You make sure you go around and ask if everyone is doing okay.  Refill their drinks, etc.  That's how I know that they take their customer service serious and that this isn't a once in a full moon service.  This is type of service that they strive for.  And they're damn great at it.

Best AYCE. Definitely recommend this place if you're hungry. You can get half orders of rolls which makes it easy to try a variety. I really like the Japanese lasagna. It spoke to my soul it was that good!!!!!!! I'm so happy it was right next to our hotel. Amazing fast service and the garlic edamame was great too.

This is one of the best AYCE sushi places I've ever been to! They have good customer service and the place is really kid friendly. All of our dishes were above our expectations and their sushi was super fresh! The prices were fair for all the food and dessert we got. The place is authentic, yet very hip and plays good music. I really recommend coming here!

It's very delicious. The best sushi in Vegas. Honestly the Nigiri here beats out the others. Like the fish is so good that you wouldn't need any sauce to go along with it. Don't miss out on one of the best in Vegas.

Ordered the monkey brain appetizer which was pretty good.  The spicy tuna roll which as ok.  The spicy salmon roll which was above average and the kiss of fire which was outstanding.  Good atmosphere.  Service was quick and polite.  Deserving of good reviews.  Only reason for not five stars was that the spicy tuna roll fell apart
Fish didn't taste fresh. Service from waitress was awful, but the waitstaff that filled waters and ran the food was very good. Won't be returning or recommending.

This place was really good but surprisingly not busy. Service was great on a Saturday night with my HOTT Date..check-in with yelp and get free sake.  servings were big and bench seating was new.  Place is designed for huge parties...reminds me of the Hofbraus but Asian version.

This place is awesome blossom!  I really liked the variety they had to offer.  Most decent AYCE sushi places I have been to only have a few non sushi items.  This is a place that I can take friends who do not enjoy sushi.  They can still eat a lot of food and get their money's worth too while I gorge on sushi.  It has something for everyone.  I would have given it 5 stars if the service was not so slow toward the middle/end.  I feel like they purposely slowed down on making our orders at the end because we were eating so much.  The slow service was in reference to the cooks/sushi chefs only.  The waiter and waitresses were all sweet and attentive.

My husband, 11 year old daughter and I had been told this was the best in town and I am sad to say I disagree. We ordered ala cart instead of the AYCA option because we didn't figure we would eat $75 worth. Maybe if a person was there for quantity instead of quality rolls I would have given it more stars. 
Our server did a good job checking on us. The fish was not very fresh tasting and everything had  a strong rice vinegar taste to it. The only spice I really tasted with sriracha. There was nothing "fancy" such as sesame seeds on top of the spicy tuna etc. I felt it was a pump it out and get it to the table kind of place.

Wow. Just wow.

AYCE sushi, and lots more. Their AYCE menu is enormous. The sushi is phenomenal. The staff is courteous and attentive. It is rare to find a gem this nice. 

Literally everything I tried was amazing. You cannot go wrong by stopping in here for lunch or dinner. The atmosphere is very chill, and slightly upscale, so perfect for a night out with the significant (or insignificant) other.

I'm a believer, the price is very reasonable and the quality of the food is very good.  My one negative comment is they only had two waitresses when we were there so it's a bit hard to get your follow up orders in but other than that it's a place worth going back to.
This restaurant is the best AYCE I would go in Vegas.  Who says you need to pay $50+ and wait 2+ hrs in line to get a decent meal!?

Awesome service! Me and my friends came to celebrate  a friends birthday and we were happily welcome by miss Ashley. She quickly and kindly answered our questions about the menu. I am willing to make another visit to this restaurant. The food is very fresh and high quality. Food comes quickly! Awesome service once again! Will come back for future business meetings.

Just try to bring the point that the fish/rice ratio is way off.
As others said, there are places with only 1/3 of rice portion.
Also, their rice is horrible. Maybe just bad luck for me.
Fish are decent fresh. Service is good.  Price is decent.
Rolls and izakaya is good.

The food is amazing here! I always come here and the food never fails to be non amazing. Screaming Orgasam is phenomenal and the tuna poke is great. Service is always on point. Waiters are all very attentive.
Enjoyed the AYCE. Fairly priced. Friendly staff. Great menu.
I really enjoyed their sushi. When i went there at 9:00 PM, this place was packed.. But still they brought sushi really fast.. All the sushi i ordered tasted really good and fresh..

My friends and I read the yelp reviews so we were so eager to try it.  We went last night with hungry stomachs and boy, were we disappointed or what? I don't know if we went in on a bad day or what happened. Most of their nigiri were unbelievable bad. Tuna, salmon, super white tuna, sweet shrimp and uni. None of them I would eat another piece. I refused to eat the uni because the color was brownish looking, very scary. I mentioned that to the waiter and explained it to her the reason I could not eat it. Another waiter came and explained to me the head chef has told him that's how the uni looking like recently. He came and showed me the entire piece to prove that they weren't giving me the old ones. I appreciated they took time and explained. However, I would still not eat it since it looked really awful. 
However their rolls and cooked stuff were not so bad. The only thing I would eat from the place is hamachi kama( the yellowtail collar) , that was pretty good and most of the ayce places don't include that. 
The service was not bad considered we had 11 people and that's the reason I gave two stars. If it weren't for the service, I would have given one star. Won't be returning anytime soon.

Over-all experience I would rate 3.5~ 

Called ahead to see if Goyemon had a wait and they did so we ended up at Umiya~
I didn't know it was Korean owned until the server started speaking to us in Korean haha awesome~ The place is a nice size, looks modern & is clean with a few flat screens and k pop music playing in the backround.. reminds me of the Korean bars in LA with their wooden tables (some people might not like the bench seating but at least you're not forced to share a table with strangers..) but they also have a few regular tables towards the back.. 
Our server was friendly and fast.. 

We both did the AYCE dinner ($26.96) 
and started off with:
-tuna poke salad (1/pp)- good chunks of tuna, nice marinade and not too much salad
-seared salmon salad (1/pp)- I liked the salmon quality and it came on a bed of greens & daikon
-salmon skin salad- I wish the salmon skin was crispier
-raw oyster (2pieces/pp)- wasn't the best quality but better than Hikari's 
-seared tuna sashimi with AJ sauce (2pieces/pp)- good quality I liked the sauce it was creamy & tangy
-agedashi tofu- yummy
-softshell crab- these were HUGE 
-monkey brain- spicy tuna stuffed avocado.. it's deep-fried but doesn't mention that on the menu
-grilled yellowtail- was kind of dry and they were out of salmon & yellowtail collar

Then we got assorted nigiri:
-quality- ok...it's not that it was bad but the fish quality was just not all there for me.. Some things like the ikura tasted SUPER fishy and the coloring on some of the fish like the tuna was dull and not appetizing.. Also they charge extra for quail egg and soy paper even when you do AYCE.. They don't have fresh scallops on the menu :( What I did LOVE was their fish to rice ratio.. they give you very little rice.. YAY ;]]] 

I also noticed some things we ordered never made it to the table like baby octopus skewers, pork belly, fried shrimp heads.. So there must have been some miscommunication with the kitchen.. 

Like I said over-all experience was a 3.5... I think I will come back for a lunch bento box or back if they did some Happy Hour prices on their apps and rolls but maybe not for AYCE.. well not until they step up their fish quality game haha ~ 

HOT TIP: ask about their drink specials.. it seems they always have some sort of promotion going on!
High quality, delicious sushi. Easily among the best in town, plus an optional all you can eat menu that doesn't sacrifice quality means this place cannot be beaten, in my opinion.

I've been coming here for 3 years. Hands down best service best sushi in Vegas. Both ref menu and ayce are sick menus. Love that it's close to home and love that they treat me more like a friend than a customer. Quick delicious and a great atmosphere.  yassssssss
One of the best sushi places in town with great workers and staff. Really good selection and lots to try.

First time trying an AYCE sushi spot in Vegas and definitely gals we found this spot! Rolls are tasty, large selection BC they do have a FULL menu to choose from unlike other places that have limited Options. Staff was friendly an of Def coming back!!!

One of the better AYCE sushi spots I've been to since I've been living in Vegas. Lacks variety in main components but overall enough options to get your money's worth. I can usually eat 4-5 rolls in a sitting plus small dishes so I've been able to try just about everything, also due to sharing with friends. Would recommend this spot to anyone who wants to play it safe and have a non-bland dining experience. Would give a 3 star but this place beats many other AYCE.

This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places. If you've never had a roll with banana, you MUST try the Banana Roll! Get a Red Rock Roll and an order of pork belly with some yellowtail nigiri, and you're good to go! The happy hour is amazing... Only $20.95 for all you can eat... What?!! Can't beat that. :-)

This place is such a gem. I have been in many sushi restaurants in Europe and US and this restaurant on the top of my list for daily sushi meal. It's not upscale fancy-shmancy restaurant but this is affordable decent place for casual sushi. 
First I want to point that sushi doesn't fall apart! This is important because many sushi restaurants think that clients are idiots and don't care about that. Quality of rice and preparation is important. And also to eat whole sushi that doesn't fall apart much convenient. 
Second they have big menu and my favorite sushi with unagi which is rare. Fish is really fresh there and it's great fusion of American-Japanese sushi.

Umiya Sushi was a great dining experience. Umiya is a fairly good size sushi restaurant with beautiful decorations. We were greeted warmly and with a smile which is always a good start to your meal. They have picnic tables in the larger eating areas for those large groups coming for good sushi. With smaller tables scattered about the main dining floor is not to cluttered. We were lucky we got to sit towards the back in one of there rooms that was portioned off by curtains. Our section had two tables it was perfect. We arrived at 6:30 and it was not crazy busy on Saturday, but it got busier when we left at 8. Our waitress was a very polite young lady who took care of us really well. My apologies I for got her name.  
The sushi was delicious, period! AYCE for $26 was a great deal. You are always kinda skeptical when you see AYCE sushi for such a great price. We were happily surprised with the quality and portions. Most of our meal we did the half portions which is a good option if you want to try a little bit of everything. After our waitress took our drink orders it was on. Mom & Steph ordered the yuzu drink and loved it so much. We started our first round off with 2 orders of monkey brains, 2 orders of Japanese lasagne, 4 orders yellow tail, 2 orders unagi, 1 order spicy scallop. All was amazing! Portions and sushi on the smaller side but good cause you can eat all kinds of different types of sushi. Second round was more Japanese lasagne 2, 4 yellow tail, 2 maguro, one order each of the rice-less sushi which was different but good, crunchy scallop roll 1. Third round was more yellowtail, maguro, mom got an udon and that was it. We threw in the towel. An amazing meal and a wonderful dining experience. Thank you to the staff at Umiya Sushi on flamingo! We will definitely be back.
Just went here for lunch and it was amazing! Good prices, sushi was delicious, and they had mochi dessert!
I loooooove this place. Best rolls, fresh fish, good service. It's definitely a hidden gem. Love love love it. I tell everyone about this place.

Umiya Sushi offers a good selection of All You Can Eat Japanese style dishes cooked to appeal to the American palate (and, given the AYCE option, American meal sizes, too.) Dimwits who deign to dine here with the expectation of "real sushi, like you get in Japan" are doomed to some much-deserved disappointment. This humble, happy restaurant offers fast and friendly service with a good selection of dishes prepared both quickly and well. We're glad we found it, and would happily return if we found ourselves in the area again.

This may be the worst sushi I've ever had.  We stupidly decided to stop here to get a small amount of sushi to hold us over until a late dinner.  The California rolls were hot and gooey, the avocado was dark brown, it smelled horrible.  The tuna had a metallic, terrible taste.  I didn't venture any further after eating those two pieces.

This is the first AYCE sushi place I've tried in Vegas.  It's a bit off the strip but well worth it if you don't feel like pigging out on a buffet or spending $$$$ on a fancy meal.  There's a lot of variety on their menu.  Most AYCE places in So Cal have a few appetizer choices and then nigiri and rolls.  Umiya has a ton of appetizers, salad options and some yakitori as well.
