The sushi is pretty fresh as well.  The only thing I didn't like was the nigiri had a bit too much rice. Also, if you check in on yelp, you get a free soda.

Visiting from California and didn't want to spend a fortune on good sushi. Also didn't want to deal with the chaos of going to the strip. So we decided to yelp a sushi place and give this place a try. Delicious is all we can say. Will definitely eat here over other sushi places from now on when in Vegas.   Give this place a try you won't be disappointed. All the food is fresh.
This place is delish. Got the sashimi lunch special. Great food for a good price. Service is great, too. Nice presentation. Love the inside decor as well.

I would actually rate this place with three stars but the service actually made me add another.

I've dined here on several occasions and each time was because I was REALLY HUNGRY and wasn't feeling the wait at either Goyemon or Sushi Koma during prime times (around 7pm) of the night. This place can really turn and burn- and for an AYCE restaurant? I'm quite impressed.

The quality of the food wasn't there for me. The first couple of bites after coping with starvation is good but it's sad to realize that you're judgement will drastically change once you're 30% full. The menu is more extensive than most AYCE restaurants but I guess that's why you're getting mediocre quality dealing with the amount of overhead this place carries. The fresh oysters? Probably my favorite part of the place but it limits one time order per diner. Bummer, really.

The service really stood out for me. The staff didn't mind how busy it was and was heavily focused on attending to our every need. Water refills, clearing empty plates off the table, letting our server know that we wanted to order more; their teamwork have earned their high tip since working at an AYCE restaurant can seem annoying.

The best part? Food will literally come out the minute after you order. I'm not sure if this is a good or bad thing but it was definitely good since we were hungry. If I'm ever on a time restraint, I'll come back. If I'm looking for quality vs. quantity, I won't. This place has its perks though.

The best all you can eat sushi in town. 2 hours for $25. The fish is fresh and the chefs are creative. The ambience is laid back. You can beat this place for its price and quality. It's my go to spot in Vegas.

We came here with a group of 9. A few of us had maybe 2 spoon fulls of left overs when we were done eating the "all you can eat sushi." 3 people had 2 bites of salad. One had a bite of rice left. One person had a spoon full of soup at the bottom of her bowl. When we were done the server came over & told us if we didn't finish those last bites of our food they would have to charge extra to the whole table. Really? What if we didn't like the food? You would still make us eat it? Then the server didn't know how to ring up the bill & tried charging us extra anyway. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone! It's like a prison camp where they are constantly watching us eat and checking our plates as they take each one away! Not a good way to keep customers coming back. Oh and they put extra rice in every sushi roll to get you full faster...
UMIYA ROCKS!!!!!! I'm a Sushi Connoisseur & this is Absolutely Heaven on Earth...Perfection!!!

4.5-star?  Either I went on the wrong night or Umiya Sushi isn't as good as it's advertised on here.  I ordered an assortment of sushi and non-sushi items and I can't say any one of them stood out.  Everything did have a common theme and it's that NOTHING was fresh.  The white tuna and the sweet shrimp had this fishy (old) odor emanating from them and the other fish were sticky, kind of like when you sweat and it dries on your skin.

Overall, not worth the price or the quality.  I understand that Las Vegas isn't exactly near the ocean so the fish is probably sent in frozen but everything just tasted like it was on the verge of going rotten.  The staff kept messing up our order and the table next to us had to tell the waiter/waitress several times that they didn't order something that they brought over.  Not to mention, the staff were a bit rude in trying to rush us out after less than 1 hour into our meal just because people were waiting and we weren't even close to reaching their self imposed 2 hour limit.  When they start suggesting that you order ice cream, that their hint for you to GTFO. 

Needless to say, I'm definitely not coming back.

This is one of the most amazing sushi buffets that I've ever been to. 

The menu has a huge variety of sushi (maki, nigiri,and special rolls) as well as other japanese appetizers and entrees (udon, ramen, and meats). You order everything off of the menu and it's freshly made at the bar and brought out to you. The 2 hour time limit seems a little rushed, but we came at a late hour (around 11:00pm on a weekday) and the waiters were very attentive in taking orders and food came out almost instantly. There are a few items marked on the menu that you can only order one serving of, but everything else is fair game for as many orders as you want. If you're feeling overwhelmed by the size of the menu, I'd recommend focusing on these marked items first - I tried almost all of them and they were unusual and among the best stuff I ate all night.

We went there the first time last night. Family of 6 adults and two kids. I find a wet piece paper inside my Kakai salad. After that we have 5 of us all have diarrhea last night to this morning. I don't think their food are fresh. My stomach been upsetting since last night and this morning. Spend over $200 there. Not worth it at all. Very Bad choice. Sure we will not come back this place ever again.
Great service and reasonable price sushi tasted fresh and rice wasn't hard have came here plenty of times and will continue the trend :)

Had the spicy edamame, the screamo salad, and the katsu roll washed down with a Sapporo. Everything was delicious! This is a great place to bring a group of people. They do an all u can eat sushi deal for $25! It's open til 2am so it's perfect for parties or a nightcap.

Umiya is one of the top three AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  Their sushi is fresh, the specialty rolls are unique, and their service is quick.  It also helps that they have a large seating area so there is never a wait here.

Excellent food and service!  We love the sushi here the best from any other places we have been!  For AYCE- this is the freshest and best! Great atmosphere and great service!   Owner Alex is always so nice! Along w all the other sushi men

Living in Dayton, OH, sushi, for the wife and me, is a definite no-go.  As a result, we decided to try to get our fill of sushi while in town.  Everyone likely has opinions on the merits of AYCE sushi concept.  However, for us, the tastebuds want what the tastebuds want.  Looking for a place we hadn't previously tried, we went to Umiya Sushi for its AYCE lunch on a Friday.  Located in a strip mall on W. Flamingo just past the Palms, Umiya Sushi offered a decent price ($20.95/person for lunch) for its AYCE sushi.  We sat at the sushi bar in the dimly lit restaurant.  I found the selection offered to be merely average and of seeming lesser quality/freshness (the poké comes immediately to mind) compared to other AYCE sushi places we've been to in Las Vegas.  Service was hit or miss, too, as items that we ordered were forgotten and only delivered after we asked about them or were simply forgotten and we didn't feel the need to inquire about the forgotten item since we had other places to be and things to do.  Umiya Sushi was merely average, at best, and easily the most forgettable meal we had while we were in town.  Call it 2.5 stars, rounded up to 3.

AMAZING! We came here on a Saturday night & we did have to wait 30 minutes but the hostess took my phone number and called when my table was ready. The rolls were delicious! We had the king of the ocean, kiss of fire, first kiss and red rock roll. We really could not pick which one was the best because they all tasted amazing! the service was great and everyone was super friendly. I would recommend to call and make a reservation to avoid waiting.
A great sushi spot with reasonable price, you can't beat all-you-can-eat for $21....the food came fast and servers were nice and friendly :)

This place has such delicious and really unique specialty rolls! It is all you can eat sushi and for dinner it costs around $26 which is pretty standard.  

My favorite roll I had was the Hawaiian roll. It has garlic albacore which I couldn't recommend more! It's amazing but it's sadly the only specialty roll with it and I wanted more! They also had delicious tempura ice cream for dessert. I also had the green valley roll which was ok. 

The reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because even though the food was really good, the service wasn't. We were there for 2.5 hours total and they completely forgot about 2 of the rolls that i ordered and the rest of the food took an extremely long time to hit the table. It was busy and I'm a server so I understand but they were so hard to track down to order from or ask for anything that I just said forget it. I didn't really feel like I got my $26 worth but I'm not so full that I hate myself so it's a partial win lol

Overall I'd probably come back for lunch when it's (hopefully) not so busy and a little cheaper.

Fried ice cream is on point ! 
Sushi was eh. Another place that packs the rolls with 87% rice.

Sushi was almost tasteless. I wouldn't be able to rave about anything other than the fried ice cream

Best service hands down! I've ate at almost every mainstream sushi spot in vegas and normally they're kinda rude. This place is incredible. The employees literally run for you everywhere. Your drink stays topped off and every server helps you regardless who your waiter is. The sushi is at your table before you can even remember what you've ordered. This place rocks!

Was in LV recently on business and did not visit a buffet (Bacchanal, Wicked spoon etc) for the first time ever. I visited this place and Carson Kitchen based on Yelp reviews. 

I ended eating here on back to back nights once with colleagues and once all by my lonesome. 

I'm giving this a coveted 5 star rating because:
Service (5 stars + )  was spectacular-  Best service I've had at a sushi restaurant EVER. 
Menu (5 stars) - Lots of options for rolls and nigiri for AYCE. 
Taste (4.25 stars) - Was very good not spectacular, but the service and price (only $25 for AYCE) 
Ambiance (5 stars) - Super cool/chill venue with sports on and friendly waiters.
Found this place on recommendations from friends. Went here a couple times and loved it. The customer service is on point and the food taste great! Worth a try!

There's many AYCE in town and you gotta standout to get noticed. A few things going for them off the bat - right by the strip ( off Flamingo in the strip mall by the Palms casino) so easy for industry folks and tourist to hit up, it's nicely decorated, open late until 2am daily and the menu selection is large and offering unique items other spots do not in terms of appetizers. Probably a good place to take folks who aren't sushi people when you want to eat sushi yet try to still meet them halfway. 

Appetizers 
Screaming O Salad - seared salmon (or tuna - your choice) with spicy ponzu, mayo, shredded daikon, mixed greens - decent but I think I prefer without the greens which is how most places do it.
Oysters - it was a  briny varietal probably from SoCal waters so I'm not a fan.
Tuna sashimi w/ AJ sauce - good but only 2pcs 
Grilled Yellowtail collar - awesome! one of my favorite things, but most places you can only order one whereas there isn't a order limit here! 
Soft Shell Crab - another favorite and theirs were lightly battered but crisp and with a tiny bit of Japanese mustard sauce on top. 
Bacon wrapped scallop skewer - reminds me of bacon wrapped dates as the sauce had that similar sweet flavor about it 
spicy rice cake skewer - crisp outside and chewy inside, the way I prefer my dokbokki
Crispy rice with spicy tuna - these were large compared to other places and came 4 to a order! 
Pork belly - pretty good and base. It's thin slices and grilled like KBBQ, not roasted in a big hunk and then sliced.

Nigiri 
There are daily specials so ask a server or look at the small glowing board on the left wall of the sushi bar. The specials today were sea bream which was fresh and really good, spanish mackerel which was decent though I thought maybe the sauce was slightly too sweet for it, giant clam which was crunchy in a surprising way and I like the thin slice of nori on it.
Super white - pretty fresh here! 
Seared Salmon - more like peppered style than a fresh torch like some bars do. I liked it and enjoyed the flavor of the pepper and ponzu sauce. 
Peppered Albacore - this was good, but thought the seared salmon was better.
Yellowtail - this was just OK, had a different flavor about it. Don't know how to describe, just different and the BF didn't like it. 
Tuna - acceptable level of freshness, but nothing outstanding. 
Masago - good, but I don't know when masago is ever bad. 
Uni - pretty fresh and was sweet so I was pleased.
Mackerel - not a salty nor vinegary brine to this so I wonder if it was cured at all? It was fresh though, but not what I'm accustomed to. 

Sushi 
Snow White - this is the BFs favorite roll elsewhere and I think it's better made here. It's spicy diced up soft shell crab, avocado topped with super white tuna that's been torched and then Japanese mustard sauce. 
Salmon Skin Hand Roll - it wasn't crispy enough so it wasn't too pleasing to have a few bites with chewy skin bits. 

Rice to fish ratio here was very good, more fish than there is rice for sure. No roll half orders except for one per person here. Like always, stuff like uni and specials are one per person as well. 

Dessert is included. and we got a mochi and a tempura green ice cream.

Service 
The service was very nice. We had a male server that checked on us and was super friendly explaining everything. We also had a female server that took our initial orders and also often brought us plates. The sushi bar was also friendly and asked if everything was tasting right and how was our experience at the end of the meal. It's evident that they do care about the customer, which is hugely appreciated by me. 

I don't think they have a stamp card, at least non was offered to us.

Overall, this was a solid inaugural visit. I think it has a lot of good things going for it so I'm sure I'll be back. I don't think it tops my favorite spot, but I think it's good to put into the rotation.

I've eaten at many a sushi places, and umiya is just not one of my favorites. For me, it just wasn't good and it wasn't appetizing whatsoever! 

Ambiance: 3 - nice looking place with a fun atmosphere and giant tables to fill with sushi. So basically umiya is really nice for group dinners and sushi dates, etc. 

Service: 2 - They were really great people with nice personalities, but our service was pretty terrible. They had a big group walk in on them and they couldn't really handle the rest of the restaurant. Food came really slow, and we were still pretty hungry afterwards. 

Food: 1 - If you would like to dine here, I suggest the garlic tuna nigiri and the soft shell crab appetizer. Those were the only 2 things out of the menu that I liked. 

Food took a long time to come to our table, so dishes that were supposed to be warm were cold and cold dishes were warm. But even then it didn't really taste great for me, so I still stick by to my 2 recommendations above. Have a good time dining, but I probably won't come back!

The best part of their AYCE sushi is that nothing is forbidden like certain sushi places. It's a free-for-all with a few "one item per customer" which was reasonable.

I'm not a big fan of rolls but their banana roll was amusing. I believe it is my had avocado, shrimp tempura, and a sweet piece of banana on top. And the usual sushi rice of course.

Their oysters were alright, not too bad but definitely need more lemon and sauce. Some were a little bit fishy though. Bigger than regular oysters FYI.

Poke salad was pretty good, but the cerviche was okay. Nothing to write home about. People were also raving about the seared sashimi but I thought it was alright. 

To end the night, the pineapple sherbet and pistachio almond ice cream were the best finishing touches on a quite satisfying meal.

The staff was also super nice, fast, and hard-working. Bless them cuz it was packed on Christmas day. About an hour wait at 6:30 pm. Would definitely recommend when you need that sushi fix.

This place has good sushi but I mainly come for their appetizers. I usually come for the all you can eat (AYCE) for 25.95 after 3pm. They have a good selection of rolls, but I don't think they are to die for. A lot of their rolls come with the sauce on the side instead which would make them taste a little better. I feel that more often than not, I feel unsatisfied after ordering roll than I do at other places. The service is great though and they are always quick and respectful. I like the ahi tuna selections and the dynamite is my favorite appetizer.

Came here on a Friday night and there was no wait which was great! The service is one of the best i've ever had throughout my meal.  I'm not sure if this is just a Socal thing which is where I am from, but usually for AYCE sushi they limit you to the number of rounds you can order sushi but at this restaurant there were no limits for number of rounds which was great because it took off the pressure for what to order.  There was a variety of things to chose from other than sushi like tempura, udon, chicken, etc.  All the food tasted very fresh and I like that it comes in small portions as well.  You can also order the rolls in half rolls if you want to be able to try more rolls without getting full as quickly.  Would definitively recommend to anyone looking to satisfy their sushi craving and its nice that it's so close to the strip!

Super great Sushi place with all you can eat option. Reasonably priced. Seems everything in the menu is available. Everything we ate was fabulous. Went on New Year's Day so it was very busy. Anxious to return when it is less busy.

Everything was awesome! White tuna, hamachi, salmon, al tuna, salmon Kama, soft shell crab, salmon skin salad, pork belly, agedashi tofu, rib eye steak, fresh oyster,...the list goes on and on! 

The restaurant is nicely put together...very modern and clean.  Service was very very good.  Friendly and attentive.  We were so impressed that we happily tipped 25 %.  

The only thing that has room for improvement was the grilled hamachi but it was still edible.  The thing I wish would be different is that they would stop charging for hot tea and soft drinks... :-/

Regardless of the minor things I mentioned here.  Umiya blows Yama and Kaya away, BIG TIME!!!!   Unlike these two...The service here at Umiya is excellent!

I would def go back! 

Keep up the good work!

Wow. Thank you yelpers! After your recommendations we ventured off the strip and tried this place! Never had AYCE sushi before, and now Im wondering if we have these in Texas. 
They explain the rules up front: 90 minutes, items with a 1 you can only order once per person, if there's a D it's dinner only, and if you leave too much behind you will pay extra! Knowing that...we started!
Major pro: for the sushi rolls you can do a half order! This is awesome! It allowed us to experience so much more! So here is what we ordered:
Tuna poke- tender, favorable, delicious 
Miso ramen- eh. Not the star of the party. Tasted like packaged ramen. 
Pork belly- YUMMY! Flavorable, crisp, delicious! 
Yum yum roll- this was my favorite! So much flavor!
Vegas lasagna- again delicious! Excellent blend of flavors
Shrimp lover roll- basic but good 
Rattlesnake roll- this was my least favorite roll. It wasn't bad, but I could do without it 
Banana roll- this was surprisingly good. The sweet of the banana and the savary of the crab inside was a good pairing 
Green chili tempura roll- I didn't taste green chili. This is another roll I could do without. It wasn't bad, it was just ok
Fresh n easy roll- wrapped in cucumber and no rice, it was good! I liked it! 

I'm leaving here about 10 lbs heavier but it was worth it! If you're visiting Vegas come here. You won't be disappointed!

Another AYCE sushi buffet in Las Vegas.  Once you try a handful of them, you start seeing the qualities that are different from the rest.  

First of all, the location of the restaurant is very convenient and it's in a good area, near the Palms Casino on Flamingo only a 10 minute drive from the Strip.

Secondly, the service is very fast and efficient.  The Manager is constantly walking around to make sure that all of your orders are completed.  He even followed up on a few orders that was missed and heard him in the radio to his staff to hurry up the order (in Korean, watching Korean soap operas are paying off).

Third of all, the restaurant is spacious and has feels even bigger with very high ceilings.  The tables are quite large, enough to hold all of the food you will soon order. 

The sushi is not bad, nothing really stands out from other AYCE sushi places and are pretty much on par in terms of quality and selection.

Definitely one of the AYCE sushi places to try.

Umiya is my current go-to spot for AYCE. Its pretty, modern looking and well-decorated. High ceilings, good lighting, and a screen playing music videos of everything from Rihanna to Girls Generation. Everything you want in a sushi spot! *kidding*

I usually only order nigiri + appetizers. They have nice cuts of fish which so far, have always been fresh. Rice is solid. However, if you're a roll person, my friend ordered a few which were pretty delicious. Their appetizer menu is larger than most. I would say it's comparable to that of OYSHI. My favorites being the spicy garlic edamame and spicy tuna crispy rice. 

Service has always been up to par. The servers are generally friendly and attentive. It's never so crazy busy in there that you feel as though you're ignored and can't put an order in.

Note: Last call is at 1:30am. No AYCE after 1:00am, just a la carte. They also have a sushi chef which has a THUG LIFE tattoo. Because that is absolutely relevant.

First of all, I have heard this place have a great sushi. 
Unfortunately, this was my first experience with Umiya. I was so disappointed of this place service. 
We were seated right after came in, but it took 30mins for the sever asked us about ANY drink while any others, who came after us, were even eating the food already. We ordered only 3 TIMES with all you can eat. Between we were waiting for order. It look the ridiculous wait like 20mins each time to have their attention. 

Food was great, came fast, and delightful. 
But, too long to wait for sever and any attention!
Nobody paid attention at ALL. I would rather spend 40$ on other sushi place.

We found this place thru yelp and we made a reservation before it opened to celebrate my friend's birthday. We were impressed with the prompt service. The unagi was  superb, the soft shell crab was great, the mackerel was perfectly cooked, and the sushi were fresh. The restaurant has a nice modern feel with long wooden tables good for big groups. Most of all, we are glad for the outstanding customer service, particularly to Santiago who was very attentive and Taylor who made the celebration memorable. We are definitely coming back! Highly recommended place!

Awesome place. Sushi is fresh uni is also. Great service. Awesome sushi rows. Mussels are good also. The place is open till 2pm. Last all you can eat is at 130pm. Appetizers are good. I will recommend this place to anybody and it close to the strip to.

My father-in-law said this was the best all you can eat sushi restaurant in Las Vegas that he'd had.. The fish was fresh, especially the uni and the oysters. Nice ambiance too. The udon was great, nice and chewy. Also highly recommend the salmon skin salad; skip the baked salmon role. Otherwise, delicious.

I guess I'll save a 1 star sushi review for when I walk out of a place projectile vomiting but Umiya was as close to the bottom as you can get.

Sat at the bar and the workers were nonstop talking to each other in Korean which is cool, but they completely ignored us the entire time and I felt like I was annoying them  to interject an order. It was like we weren't even there.

Now to the food. TOO MUCH SAUCE!

My first roll came drenched in this oily sauce where I couldn't even pick up a piece of the roll without it crumbling. The rice was cold and hard and just horrible. My girlfriend tried one piece and didn't even want to finish it with me.

I ordered another roll after that and asked the guy if he could put the sauce on the side. 
He called the order out to someone else and the thing came drenched in this oily nasty sauce AGAIN where you can't even taste what fish you are having...couldn't tell if it was red snapper or tuna or salmon. 

Pissed me off that he totally ignored my request for sauce on the side.

I ordered another roll...told him PLEASE NO SAUCE.

He calls out the order to have one of his friends make it...and how does it come?

COMPLETELY SOAKED in sauce a third time. My girlfriend who hated the sauce, just ate ramen and was disgusted by the whole experience.

I've been to many AYCE joints that try to pull a little fusion with these different sauces, some creamy, some spicy, some whatever in an attempt to try and compliment the roll (so I'm not a total sauce Nazi)...but this place DESTROYS it's sushi with this nasty oily sauce that doesn't compliment the sushi whatsoever and makes it unbearable to finish. 

This was my worst AYCE sushi experience in Vegas to date. 

Get your act together, listen to your customers...and give a shit about their requests. 

Your sauce is effing gross. I didn't come to eat half a bottle of oil based Ken's salad dressing.

I feel that it's only fair to factor in that this place is "all you can eat". Once you do that, there is only one reaction to this place: absolute delight at finding something that is off-the-charts better than anyone has a right to expect it to be.

The nigiri is pretty good (better than most AYCE places) but it's the endless stream of delicious goodies from the kitchen that you will never find at other AYCE places. The cheese salmon sticks, the pork belly, the soft-shell crab -- they nailed all of these, and kept them coming with great service and a friendly attitude.

Very, very impressive.
Horrible, rude waiters. Especially Danny. I'm in awe. Rolling his eyes at customers and arguing with them to no end. Will not come back
We have been here for around 3 years, it was super busy for each time we came, but we have never had disappointed, the service was good of course we tip good also, highly recommend.

I didn't think I would find THE BEST sushi restaurant I've ever ate at. I'm usually super picky about sushi but oh man has this place have me hooked! They have such unique sushi combinations that really amazed me. I've tried so many different restaurants in Vegas and this is by far THE best place. 
     To start off the pricing is just like other AYCE sushi places - $25.00 using yelp you also get a free soda! 
      The staffs gotta be the best as well since you basically don't get one specific server and all the servers work together which isn't something you'll see everyday. They had a really large number of staff which makes it so much more efficient! All the staffs are super super friendly and surprisingly knows the menu by heart and knows what they have in the sushi and what not (really trained). I still can't wrap my head around at the fact that the sushi was so fresh and extraordinarily and that the staffs service was amazing. 
    The banana roll was my favorite - a great example
Of whacky unique flavors that works so well together. You also get ramen/udon to choose from and some yummy appetizers! Mushroom boy was really strange and good too! I'll def be coming back here this is such a good professional place and the food is literally to die for! Thank you!!!!

If this was a review on just the food then I would give 5 stars.  My guest and I had AYCE dinner.  The oyster, baked squid, mussels and other were great, the saki was perfect, wish could order more of the oysters.  You are limited to one order per person for AYCE, but I understand.  
However if I would rate the service I would give a 2 star.  The greeter was the best but once we sat down the server was pushy to get or our order in and then after placing 2 sets of order we felt that they were rushing us out.  We ordered desert and saki then after saki they brought our bill.  I paid it but stayed for 2 more hours catching up with an old friend.  We were going to order more saki but decided that since they pushed us to close our bill we wont.  Sorry but u could have had a 5 star and more of our money...

**Food was... just okay. 
 - Soft shell crab was... not great. 
 - Fish size: small
 - Fish freshness: good.

**Money: 
 - Cheap
 - $25 all you can eat... 
 - Comes out to $80 for 2 persons with a 1L beer, martini, and tea. 

**Service
 - Awesome. 
 - We went at night (10.30pm), and had 3 people running around serving and helping. 

Will be coming back in I'm in the hood and am starving.

Was told about this place from the most reliable food connoisseur I know in this town... Brad B. (his review is below).  Once he told me that he thought that this was better than the place that we normally endulge, the hubby and I knew that we had to check it out. Both times that we've been the sushi has been amazing, the staff has been extremely friendly, and most impressive, **high** quality AYCE sushi bar, which didn't exist until now. Has definitely become a top pick on our list for sushi night choices.
Was in town for the weekend and took my friends here. I was raving about place to my friends and was disappointed with portion and quality today. Very sad.

Too much rice :( made it harder to enjoy the sushi.

But overall a great experience. Not surprising everything they serve is frozen but I prefer that for food safety reasons. Tried nearly every raw fish but only thing I would avoid is the mackerel. It needed more acid, it's a very oily fish. 

My biggest problem was the warm oysters. Not feeling sick yet. 

Also try the yuzu! Ceviche is a nice touch
Sushi was great and tasted fresh. Service was exceptional even though they had a party they don't quit. I'm definitely coming back for another lunch. Loved this place!

I am very impressed with the quality and selections for the ALL You can eat menu.  So far for the Law Vegas area, this is by far the best.  The service is fantastic...    
Advice:  They will not sit your party unless everyone is present and I don't blame them....

This one totally surprised me- in the best way possible. Everything we ordered was awesome! I really don't have one negative thing to say. The only thing I'm sorry (but not really that sorry) about is that I didn't take any pics to share on this review.. But next time though. 

I love AYCE ______. Especially sushi. We ordered a variety of stuff, as we always do, to try to taste a little of everything. Gotta get some stuff from the kitchen, some cut and hand rolls, nigiri/sashimi. To be honest, I forgot some of the names of the things we ordered, but I'll do my best to describe them.

First off, everything nigiri is excellent. Tuna, salmon, red snapper, smoked salmon- I'm going through withdrawals as I write this. Gotta add some healthy to it, so I always order a veggie roll. Awesome. Hand rolls were great too.

The crispy rice with spicy tuna is delish! Pork belly, bacon wrapped scallops, monkey brains were surprisingly good- fried avocado stuffed with spicy tuna. 

Service was absolutely excellent as well. We sat at the bar and the sushi chefs were friendly, fast and made great rolls. The waitresses were actually the ones who took our orders and our plates away as soon as we were done with them. 

All in all, it was a great experience. I can't wait to go back for dinner service to try the uni and a few other things that were exclusively on the dinner AYCE.
Delicious food, great service and affordable price. The kids LOVED it! This is officially our new favorite sushi place in Vegas.

Really enjoyed dining here... Last minute selection and glad the experience turned out great. Quick service, lively environment and good sushi. Came on a Friday night and had a good amount of people without a wait. Waitress was very attentive as she refilled food and drinks rather quickly once empty. Can't go wrong with AYCE! Overall, I would recommend this place!

Finally, a good AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.  There seem to be countless really retched ayce sushi restaurants but this one, in the area was hands down the best.  Maybe it was the overwhelmingly bad competition, but this place was actually quite good, not just for an ayce.  This place has tons of special rolls, and non sushi choices all included, along with desserts.  Unfortunately, I found this late in my Las Vegas stay for the summer and only got to go once, but will definitely go back next trip out.
Very Good Sushi & I highly recommend the All You Can Eat for $25.95 (Dinner), best Sushi in Town!!!

Made a reservation on Monday to eat her on Wednesday with a party of 12.  Found this place on Yelp while looking for places to eat while traveling to Vegas with a bunch of friends.  Upon arriving, our table was ready for us and we were able to start ordering as soon as we sat down (we were all very hungry from our flight and a day of walking the strip waiting for our rooms to be ready).  If you're coming here to expect a sushi meal from Tsukiji Fish Market, you'll definitely be disappointed.. but if you come expecting to be full, have decent AYCE sushi for an amazing price.. you'll be very pleased.  All of us left with full and satisfied stomachs.  You can't beat it for the price and I love that they take reservations.  I will definitely be back when traveling back to Vegas.  **Get the oysters & the uni.. and take your friend's order if they pass on it ;)

On our last visit to Vegas, we knew we had to stop by Umiya yet again and this time we were pleasantly surprised to learn they they offer half rolls... !!! Which greatly comes in handy if you get the "All You Can Eat " option, and want to try a variety of rolls, without worrying about getting too full to finish them all..

Came here for the 1st time with my father.  Service, price and atmosphere were all great.  I highly recommend the firecracker roll.   We also had Uni and some sashimi.  Everything was great.  #sushi #sashimi #lasvegas

All you can eat buffet. But be careful, you have to finish what you order!
They will charge you for whatever is not finished.  

We went with a group of 10. We had a whole table to ourselves and it wasn't very busy. We probably arrived there around 8pm. 

We ordered a couple things at first so we can all share, but as we went along, we ordered more, which was perfect.  The different sushi rolls were really cool and really good! I got the Snow White, spicy octopus (2 pieces) and a number of others I can't remember. but Snow White was realllly good. The First Kiss sushi roll was also delicious.  

I got the passion fruit saketini. It was good but it was really sweet and you can barely taste the alcohol. I would recommend getting the lychee saketini or ordering the buy 2 get 1 free beer (Asee, I think it was). 

The udon noodle soup was a little sweet as well. But the soup was good to have with all the sushi. Jalepeno poppers was amazing and it wasn't spicy. 

We also got the Japanese Lasagna sushi. it was odd, there was cheese, sauces, and panko (i think it was) on top. A whole mixture of flavors. it was kinda odd, weird, okay tasting. I'd say try it..but don't let it get too cold or else you won't want to finish it. 

Unfortunately, they don't have sashimi. :(  I really wanted that with the spicy red pepper sauce (choh goh chi jang).  But they do have 

I gave it 3 stars because they charge you for whatever is not finished.  :(  lol but the servers were really nice, really friendly and helpful.

Normally, I love this place but the last time I went it took FOREVER for our food to come out and not only that, but the service was very rude as well. Not sure what happened, but we won't be returning.
Awesome lunch spot. Enjoyed all the selections. The price can't be beat for fresh sushi. I will definitely come back.

We were greeted at the door by a tall, friendly man which I later learned was the owner.  We sat at the sushi bar and were given menus and he explained the AYCE menu to us.  There is a huge selection of cooked items like baked mussels, calamari, chicken or beef skewers, etc, edamame, soups, etc. They offer a fes salads, nigri and pages of rolls.  Some items, like Uni will be limited to 1 order pp.  We had a delicious roll wrapped in cucumber which is a rare find on an AYCE menu as is Uni. We had tuna, albacore, yellowtail, salmon, octopus, seared albacore and halibut sushi (like 4 pieces pp of each) the poke which is served with seaweed salad, the spicy tuna on crispy rice and a few other items.  Nice option is certain rolls can be made 1/2 order.  For me, the pieces of fish were very long and super thin, while fresh I do prefer a fuller piece of fish but with AYCE I guess they figure you will just order more pieces.  They do use very little rice which is so nice.  Large, open restaurant very friendly staff and a super clean restroom.
I've been looking for a good sushi place lately in Las Vegas, but Umiya Sushi satisfied my cravings for so many weeks. This place has all my favorites (including Uni/Sea Urchin).
Went when I was in Vegas. Omg the eel sauce on one of he rolls I ordered was amazing !!! The environment is super relaxed overall a really great spot !
This is the review for AYCE. If you go there for AYCE, I would say it's totally worth the bank of the buck. Food is ok. This is the place I will go for quantity not quality.

This is my favorite sushi restaurant ever! Some of the staff isn't very friendly but the deliciousness in the food makes up for it. Waiters are nice, the only ones I've encountered who are rude are the ones who sit you down. Over all I would recommend it! Don't forget to get some spicy edamame! It's the best! I would say ignore the rude staff and enjoy the AYCE!!

Disappointed. I followed the recommendation of fellow Yelpers to this spot in search of great sushi in Vegas - after going here I am 100% certain that anyone who says this is good sushi has 100% never had good sushi. 

While we were settling in, one of the sushi rollers dropped off a salmon sashimi salad in front of us which we thought was complementary, as in our past experience at sushi joints sitting at the bar sometimes yields tasting plates on the house. Well, apparently this was not meant for us. When our server came back to take our order, a man whom I can only assume to be the owner or manager started yelling, asking if we ordered the tiny salad in front of us. I said no. And he began to yell at the workers behind the counter. It was very strange and uncomfortable. I finished the rest of the salad, which ended up being the best thing we ate. 

Our plate of sashimi was made and given to us by the same man, who dropped the plate and then quickly picked something off a piece of tuna before saying, "ok it's good." Not very reassuring... All the fish - salmon, tuna, and super white tuna, left a strange after taste that was off putting. Doesn't need to be said, but not a good sign when eating raw fish. 

Lychee martini tasted of straight lychee juice with a splash of saki and had whole ice cubes floating in it. Rolls were reasonably priced and large in size, but again, I just didn't feel the fish tasted all that fresh, and even the avocado on them looked past its prime. 

Service is a mess and food nor drinks make up for it. Would not go back or recommend. Shout out to the sushi roller though. He was really friendly and cool.

Great service , fast and friendly,   Sushi rolls were all excellent, my favorite was Touchdown, but the Dragon roll was very tasty as well as the Sunrise, the rolls were Firm and a pleasure to eat , none of them fell apart when picked up with the chop sticks.
This was a birthday treat for me , and I am sure we will be back.
YESSSSS!! Bomb AYCE sushi in Las Vegas, and worth the wait! I love the baked rolls and salmon belly. Service is good, everyone works fast and food comes out right away.

Super hungry in Vegas. Took a chance and stopped by the UMIYA Modern Japanese restaurant. Absolutely amazing! Great atmosphere, great food, friendly service and reasonable prices. Has the all you could eat. Winning!!! All the way!
Loved the variety on their menu and the decor...service could've been better but overall, my tummy was happy. :)

I really liked this sushi restaurant. My friend and i were so happy to see a sushi restaurant open on a sunday so late so we decided to give it a try and i'm glad we did! the nigiri sushi had barely any rice which is so rare to find at an all you can eat location. Fish was fresh, rolls were great and the dessert was fab.

This is your average sushi place. The quality of the food is okay although certain items are good, like the fish nigiri. The order of the food that comes out can be drastically improved. For example, I ordered a miso soup and a salad and they both came almost near the end. If you go during peak hours, expect to wait with slow service.
amazing!!! my husband and i came here once, i didnt know we could get a reservation by calling in! which was good bc it was jam packed! such tasty food
Delicious sushi. ALL YOU CAN EAT is the way to go. Friendly staff, clean dinning area,descent prices, nice settings and yum, yum, yum!

During my time in Vegas, I came here after finding this as the closest yelp listing for buffets to where we were staying at. I believe it was $22 per person for AYCE. Service was good and the hosts were very attentive to us. 

When the first 5 rolls we ordered came out, I immediately stuffed my face with food as fast as I could. I think that wasn't a good idea because by the time we got to the last 3-4 plates, I was just eating the rolls in avoidance of getting charged, and everything just started to not taste pleasant anymore. But at least we managed to try 16 different rolls off the menu. 
Word of advice: Order half rolls!!!! Gives you the opportunity to taste different things off the menu and knit pick which ones are your favorites. I think my favorite rolls had to be the sunset roll, shrimp tempura roll, and Snow White roll. on the other hand, I really liked the chicken katsu roll. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely hit this place up again if I'm ever craving for sushi.

5 stars!!!! Had a group of 8 and they were able to accommodate us without having to split us up into separate tables. The service was great and quick. The food was delicious. Unlimited order of salmon belly so that was a super plus for me! This is probably one of the best AYCE sushi place I've ever been to. They don't go buy rounds so that was pretty awesome too! Oh btw unlimited ice cream too. They had so many options to choose from. Also they let you do half orders on the rolls so you have the options to try more rolls! Definitely will come back here!

We did the All You Can Eat, which was a super good deal for dinner! They had options like uni, soft shell crab, sweet shrimp, hamachi (it was out), and was all super fresh! Very fast service and a great place to hang out with a group of friends!
This place is Tuna-tabulous!! But for real some of the best sushi I've ever had. Get the poke for sure. All of the rolls i tried were fantastic. Recommended for sure.
Service was great. The chicken teriyaki was perfect and the crunch lobster rolls were amazing. Glad we came in. Whenever I'm in Vegas again I will definitely be coming back.

Managers attention!


very aggressive attitude from waiters 

 Some food taste expired, (fish in seafood ceviche spoiled,  cucumber wrap is a week old )


This place use to be good, This time food was garbage and waiters were very rude.

Great sushi find! I was staying at the palms and it was right across the street   Perfect way to start my day off with a lot of energy. The rattle snake roll and baby lobster roll is the bomb diggity!!!  Great service and quickly serviced.

Umiya is not easy to find.  The neon signage says Kan Sushi.  They play K-pop videos.  AYCE price is typical - about $27/person.  The place was pretty empty on the Friday night we went...not a good sign.

The rolls we got were good: Sunrise, Sunset, Salsa Dancing and Snow White.  I also liked the pork belly, ribeye steak and the fact that they have skewers as part of AYCE.

What I didn't like and have had better in other sushi restaurants: lobster crunch, super white tuna and green tea ice cream.  The langoustine on the lobster crunch tasted too briny.  The super white tuna was rubbery and didn't taste fresh.  The green tea ice cream tasted like medicine.  It reminded me of the time I ate green tea ice cream I had in the freezer for a year.

This place is good for cooked food.  Sushi...not so much.

This is an all-you-can-eat place not that far off the strip and is super busy. The wait staff were quite attentive however, and brought our orders quickly. The seating is somewhat uncomfortable, with rustic picnic style tables and benches. Being so busy, the noise level is also quite high. Lots of items to choose from on the all you can eat menu and it is reasonably priced. Be sure you make a reservation as we had a group of six on Wednesday night and there was a wait for those who did not have reservations. If you're in the mood for all you can eat sushi, this is a good selection, but I recommend you bring your own seat cushion.

Well this is my first time trying this place and the food was good but the service was horrible. Sat at the bar and could not order any sushi from the chefs. Our servers were unorganized and rarely came to see if my girlfriend and i needed anything. Last thing i ordered was ramen to test it out, waited 25 min it never came so we left.

I recently went to Vegas for vacation and tell me why my local friends all wanted to eat here. If theres one thing you can count on is that Vegas locals know their sushi. I ate at Umiya Sushi Twice! 

Umiya has a great AYCE sushi menu and is open late. Everything i ordered was amazing! Its located off the strip so i would say its decently priced, Dinner $25.95 (3pm -closing)  Its awesome because if you do a Yelp Check in you can even receive a Free Gift- an umiya sushi mug.

Must trys:
Lycheetini 
Monkey brain
Japanese lasagna
You must eat here! All you can eat sushi... So impressed with this place.. And I'm part Asian so that's gotta have some weight, right!?

Delicious as usual ! The mussels were amazing as was the banana roll and dragon roll . I love the Lisa Lisa and Yum Yum roll and the scallops. Service a little slow at the end and we couldn't stick around for tempura green tea ice cream  , but that's okay , I still love it here l. Soft shell crabs are amazing !! 
Today was just as great as any other ! I love the spicy edamame, scallop Rolls, mussels, and tofu. Great service, food and value !

Best bang for your buck here!! Only $25 for all you can eat, which includes items that are not usually on an ayce sushi list, such as sweet shrimp (limited to one order per person, but that's still pretty darn good, in my opinion). They even have ramen, Kalbi, oysters, and pork belly dishes too! The servers were nice and quick, so that's also a plus. They also don't leave out any of your orders like some ayce places do either. Top your meal off with some dessert (Mochi, ice cream, banana splits, included in the ayce), and you're set.

+fresh sushi 
+includes items not normally on an ayce sushi menu
+nice, quick, and attentive staff

-a little far from the strip. If you taxi'd there, you would have to walk to the Palms(about a 5min walk)to catch a ride back.

My boyfriend and I were looking up sushi places back at the hotel and decided to go to this one because of the high reviews. I've never been to an all you can eat sushi place before, but I've had some real good high quality sushi and a lot of yelpers said they have fresh sushi; so I had to give them a try.

It was near midnight and there were a few groups. We didn't have to wait, we sat at the sushi bar. I was real excited for the AYCE menu. We ordered a variety of sushi and sushi rolls. The sushi didn't taste fresh and the rice was hard and dry. It tasted as if they used regular rice instead of sushi rice. The sushi rolls were nothing spectacular. They were very simple and was not worth it.

I don't think I do very well at AYCEs. I was expecting really fresh fish, but they didn't deliver on quality. I'm beginning to think Las Vegas restaurants are overhyped. I've been to a few with high reviews, but they've only disappointed.

For the same price I could eat a simpler, but fresher sushi meal elsewhere. Our server was friendly and attentive, but the sushi chefs looked arrogant and rude. They didn't talk to us much and we ordered some sushi rolls from them, but they didn't seem happy and even frowned as us. 

For some reason, I don't usually give second chances if my experience was horrible, but I want to come back when I'm in town; so I can see what this place has to offer. Perhaps it was a mishap, perhaps they do suck. Only a second visit will tell.
Me and my wife love this place good serves great food and awesome price. All you can eat menu with tones of options.. We coming twice a week. The best place in town.

Great place! Did the AYCE and it was actually pretty awesome. I never expect the best quality from a concept like this but everything was excellent. 

We got:
Poke- probably some of the best I've had 
tuna and eel nigiri- both great 
Vegas lasagna-very rich and filling but super good
Soft shell crab roll- so good we order a second 
Banana roll- Cali roll with fried bananas on top. Was ok, nothing special.
Spicy tataki- really good, not too spicy
Kiss of fire- t'was ok
Fresh and easy- it was good but didn't like the yum yum sauce. It was a little too sweet 
? Naruto- can't remember the first part of the name but it was very good! 

Overall we loved it. I liked all the rolls but I just wanted to highlight rolls I didn't think were all that and the ones I thought were worth a recommendation.

Down in Vegas for a family reunion and found this place.  It is now our goto sushi place!  Fast and friendly  (once you're seated).  Try everything it's great!  Love the tuna poke and unagi...  so yummy yummy
Food was ok but service was horrible we waited 40 minutes to get a sushi roll. We also ordered a scallop hand roll and it was mostly rice, imitation crab and 2 or 3 scallops

This place is stressful. Yes, you heard that right... STRESSFUL! Read on for more...

I was really looking forward to visiting this place due to its high ratings. So, when my sushi-loving brother came to town, I decided to take  him there. Big mistake. The staff was rude, the food was rushed, and good flavors were nowhere to be found.

There was no greeting when we walked in, and all the person at the check-in desk said was "you are going to have to wait, ok?" After waiting for about 10 minutes (mind you, we had reservations), the same rude server walked us over to our table and sat us down. No interest in knowing if it was our first time, nothing... he just left. Once our waiter knew some of us were not doing AYCE, every server became obsessed wanting to know why that was the case. They repeated the AYCE no-sharing rules several times, despite everyone understanding we could not share the food.

Most dishes were wrong and bland, with the servers dropping off dishes we hadn't ordered and then running off to waiting other tables. We then had to flag down any of the servers running by to take the unwanted food away. I get they were busy, but the way the staff was literally running around and essentially plopping food on the table and leaving, made for an unnecessarily awful ambiance.

I will not be coming to back to this place. Ever.

I came here probably every other weekend when I lived by the palms and whenever I am on that side of town I deeply consider it for the AYCE sushi. Dragon rolls, Catarpillars, and yuzu are king! The environment is usually pretty quiet although they do like their pop music playing softly over the speakers. The chefs are very nice and will gladly explain each dish, although the last time I went the waiter was abit rude(hence not 5*) but it was not enough to ruin my day, and certainly will not stop me from coming back!!

I tried Umiya during my recent visit to Vegas since it was close to my hotel. The restaurant is about a mile off the strip, across the street from Palms Place.

Upon entering, the sushi chefs shout out 'Hello' and 'Welcome' greetings in Korean. In the background, there are TVs with PSY music videos playing on repeat (Gangnam style and Gentleman). Kind of strange to be in a Korean environment while eating Japanese sushi, but if you focus on the food, the awkwardness can be filtered out.

Umiya carries a similar menu to other Vegas AYCE sushi restaurants. For example, tuna, albacore, super white tuna, salmon, yellowtail, halibut, red snapper, shrimp, eel, mackerel, etc are on the sushi list. However, Umiya distinguishes itself from the pack by offering premium sushi. There are 3 daily specials of high quality fish. During my visit, they were spanish mackerel, giant clam, and striped bass. Sometimes, the specials may include sea bream and giant scallop. These varieties are rarely found in common AYCE sushi lists. On top of that, there were oysters, uni, and ama-ebi. All of the premium and special items have a limit of 1 order, but it was not really enforced since order forms and records were not used. 

The oysters, uni, spanish mackerel, and halibut were my favorites. The quality and freshness of the fish were invariably excellent. Fish were cut thick, characteristic of the Korean preference. Unfortunately, the presentation was sometimes poor. Sauces were overapplied to the fish at times, resulting in sauce overflowing onto the plate and rice. A carefully-crafted piece of nigiri should not have ponzu or soy sauce staining the rice before it reaches the consumer. This is a common occurrence in Korean sushi restaurants.

Organization was another issue that I encountered. Umiya did not utilize order forms at the bar. Each customer is expected to order in front of a chef. Unfortunately, the chefs could not handle large orders. I tried making 10 orders at once but he was overwhelmed and could only remember 4 to 6 at a time. When the restaurant filled up halfway during our meal, I was neglected for over 30 minutes in favor of the new diners. An order form might be useful for Umiya to implement in the future.

Aside from the aforementioned issues, Umiya is still phenomenal for the price. $25 for unlimited decent seafood with premium options is an exceptional deal. This is perfect for those who are hungry, seeking a budget sushi restaurant in Vegas, and can sacrifice a little bit of quality. I am already anticipating a visit to Umiya during my next visit to Vegas.

I went in at 12:30am and was starving. I opted for the all you can eat. This was near by 5 minutes from the strip few blocks near the Palms casino. The fish to rice ratio was decent not the best I've had at a ayce sushi but not the worst. I tend to order mostly nigiri when I go and avoid mostly rolls. The freshness of the fish was pretty good and the appetizers were also good especially the fried soft shell crab, too bad it was limit one. 

They're open till 2am but last call is 1am for all you can eat. It's a decent size restaurant and service was good. Time limit 1 1/2 hour.

My only complaint and the reason they didn't receive 5 stars is they limit certain appetizers and the black board specials to 1 per person. At some ayce sushi places in Vegas they do not limit you.

I give them credit for how diligent the crew was and how accommodating towards our big party, but I did not really enjoy the food. Our group ordered a plethora of items and came across a few that even caught our attention. I prefer to stick to nigiri, but had a few pieces of the rolls. 

If based on service alone, it would have been a four star experience even with all of the chaos. The whole group works in a restaurant and know how strenuous a group of twenty can be. They were great on that end.
It was good grade of sushi as all you can eat.  Most of nigiri were flesh and sauce on roll was yummy that my friend said.  Sever were very friendly and nice, we sat fancy booth, we all enjoyed.
The best sushi in Vegas , all you can eat almost all the roll  quality and fresh good service no despond : ) enjoy

This place was a great place to.go 

Recently for my last three visit for dinner, servers are now got faul mouth on them disturbing customer with their inappropriate jokes, orders are missing and taking to.long 

And the worst part serving old fish specially tuna, tuna is now oxidize and not red any more like has a slimmy feel to the mouth 

Its a shame restaurant like this so good doesnt hold its standard ! Spimple standards

This ayce sushi place is 5 stars, both food quality and service. The grilled squid and the spicy dip is really good. If you're big on rolls, green chili and first kiss rolls are good too. The salmon salad are great appetizers to start your meal. Seafoods are fresh, sauces are tasty. Service is above average.

Arrived here at 12:30 AM & starving. Last call for their all you can eat sushi was 1:30 AM and an hour was more than enough time to get our sushi craving satisfied. They played catchy pop music both in English & Japanese and that was fun. Their decor was what interest me the most as it wasn't the typical sushi restaurant with basic seating. You just gotta see it for yourself. Awesome! We were able to order half rolls on ALMOST everything on the menu, which gave us the opportunity to try basically everything. We ordered 3-4 rolls at a time to keep a steady pace, and we received our orders within 5 minutes. I'm only giving 4 stars simply because we also ordered soup midway into our visit & we asked for it probably 3 times. They just kept forgetting about it. All in all though, I would come again.

Super place
All you can eat by ordering what you want off a menu. Quality sushi rolls and agedashi tofu and poke and oysters we loved  as my kids even sampled it. Rated one of the best meals I've had all year and I'm from California!
Wonderful all-you-can-eat menu! Food's taste and presentation is up to standard... 10/10!

Great A.Y.C.E. sushi in a strip mall not far from the strip. Everything's included but there are some items you can only get one per person. The Snow White was excellent. Ask the server for suggestions. They were well versed on the menu and made great suggestions. We also likes that they were open at 3 for a late lunch. A lot of sushi places close between lunch and dinner, not this one. Cucumber salad was bland. Sushi chefs didn't make a lot of eye contact even with us sitting at the sushi bar. But all and all great really good.

We've been coming to this place three years in a row. We come to Vegas once a year for work. This is (was) our favorite Japanese place here. The food is good. We had the bad luck to sit at the sushi bar aa usual but being served by a really mean Mexican guy (we are Mexican by the way). Rude. It ruined all our experience. We will try to eat there next time, but if this guy is around we will skip the place forever. A whole year waiting to eat here and it was a really bad experience.

Sushi is really good here but the reason for 2 stars is because I had to wait almost 20 min to take my order then another 20 min for my food not to mention almost half an hour for ice cream really? I really wanted to give them 2 stars but gave them 3  because my gf felt bad  I understand they were busy but super slow .....waiter hardly checked on us as well and they kept forgeting our order

I've searched all around Las Vegas for a really good AYCE sushi place and finally I have found you. great sushi + great prices! 4 stars because the oyster are questionable. very good Yum Yum in my Tum tum!
The food was delicious and served quickly. The staff are really nice and very accommodating.

Wife had a craving so we looked up AYCE sushi joint during our stay here.  Came in on a Friday afternoon for their lunch special ($20.95/pp) and half off for our kids.  Totally worth it!!

The hostess, waiter, and entire crew was friendly and super attentative.  3-4 members constantly swarm our table taking empty plates away immediately and replacing them with more deliciousness.   So much to try and all came out perfect.  I felt a little guilty with the wife constantly ordering and requesting stuff, but the crew was quick and courteous. This is now our favorite AYCE sushi joint!!  Even beating out all our other favorites in the OC (CA).  Nice job guys!
Sushi rolls were old and bland.  Nigiri were ok. I dont know how people rated this place so high. Our waiters were nice and fast with our order tho.
Food was amazing! I'm from California and I've yet to find a great ayce around my area in oc. So I got excited when a friend recommended this place to me. It didn't disappoint.

I must to come here like 80time with my girls place is super cute it's one of those places that makes you feel like your in Japan so cute always pack wait time is always like 20min but worth your time.
I'm too lazy to write this review, so I'm gonna ask my wife what she thinks. She said, "I'd give it a 3. It's toooo mayonnaiseEEE!  It's a little too expensive. It's aiiiiight."

I have been here twice the first time was kind of rush because I only had less than an hour to eat (lunch break) therefore all four of us were rushing to eat.  The service wasn't there to help us meet the time.  Missing a lot of kitchen items we ordered.  The second time last Thursday 10/15 I returned I loved it.  The variety of sushi and many items on the dinner menu I loved for AYCE.  I don't eat much but I love their AYCE.  Anyone loves AYCE.  Or don't love AYCE try it too because the price isn't bad at all.  Give them a try!! The rolls options are there! Kitchen food and sashimi options, yum yum yum!! Uni and oyster are part of dinner deal too.

In this city of sushi bars galore, finding a good one can be tough. In the past, I had two favorites. One of which (whose name I can't even remember) was in The Lakes area and closed many years ago. The other one, Kobe, I have since moved too far away from to justify making the hike for AYCE lunch. For all I know, it could end up being dinner by the time I get there from where I currently live. 

So, the hunt began for me to find a new sushi joint. I've heard many sing the praises of Yama. I wasn't impressed. Sushi-Mon? Overrated. Ra Sushi? Decent rolls, obnoxiously clubby and trendy atmosphere coupled with high prices and the lack of AYCE. I learned that many of the no-name joints where the main sign literally just says "sushi" are like that for a reason. Sushi 21 was my main go-to for a while, and it was pretty decent, but that's it. Nothing mind-blowing. Eager to have sushi but wanting something mind-blowing, I was led to try this place.

Yes. This place is pretty mind-blowing indeed. It actually blows my prior two faves out of the water.

Located in a strip mall that appears to be slowly becoming Little Tokyo due to all the Japanese-related businesses popping up, it is a space that is fairly large but still maintains a degree of intimacy. The music is noticeable, but not TOO noticeable. The servers are attentive and friendly. 

As for the menu? Probably the most extensive AYCE menu I've ever seen. For starters (no pun intended), the list of appetizers is so long that it takes up a whole page. I've never seen that before. There's also some very creative rolls indeed. A chicken katsu roll? Again: Mind. Blown.

Everything came out quite fast, with the pork belly being sizzling hot and the right balance of tough and tender. The chicken katsu being tiny in the most satisfying way possible. Their eel sauce was off the chain. The lobster roll was a bit messy, but that's easily forgiven. I mean, it's chunk lobster meat after all. 

The Final Verdict:

Pros:
Great ambiance and dining setting.
Large AYCE menu at a decent price (20.95 for Lunch)
Copious amounts of appetizers on the AYCE menu.
Fresh, flavorful and creative rolls.

Cons:
Messy lobster roll....but this is minor. 
Yum-yum sauce and japanese-style mayo seemed to be everywhere.

Suggestions:
Lay off the Japanese mayo please.

Return Factor: 10/10. Already planning on it.

BAD SERVICE. We called ahead to see what the waiting time was like. Woman was quick and snappy and hung up before we could ask another question. My boyfriend and I go anyways and it takes a while to get seated. Not bad, we expected as much. 

We got waters and lay down our first round of orders. This was okay, but after this service slowed down. I was feeling a little sick soon after and this might've been because of the quality of food. 

We'd be constantly overlooked and ignored and we were in the middle of the restaurant! I'd watch other tables get serviced except for us. Service is just bad. They let people wait up front when there are clearly tables empty and ready to go. They say AYCE can only last 90 minutes, but we can't help how long we stay when no one takes our orders! 

This was our second time eating here and service was still just as poor(first time was a few months ago). Bathrooms were dirty as well. Food was good for the most part, just bad service.

So we go back to Umiya one more time after our bad experience last time. We mostly went back because of our favorite waitress (Jeanie) who always provides the best service and knows our order before we go.  We were going go stop coming here after the issues we had but we literally stayed for now because of Jeanie and the relationship we built with her. She makes us feel at home. 

I told her about our issue last time with not being able to get our favorite roll that we have gotten for the past year. She was very surprised and went up to the chefs and they made us two of them on the spot. Hopefully our bad experience last time was just a new waitress in a bad mood or some kind of confusion (although I dont see how it could have been confusion) Hopefully we dont run into another weird situation.
Stumbled upon this place since we had a two hour wait at Kaya and needed to eat ASAP! Definitely RECOMMEND this place for beginners to advanced sushi lovers!

This was an excellent meal.  3 in our part and we actually ate 18 rolls.  All rolls were great with the exception of the Hawaiian roll.  Not sure what was wrong but it was bad, really bad.

Restaurant was super busy, however service was excellent and we really didn't have to wait long for any of the rolls.  

If in Vegas and you would like a good AYCE sushi please give them a try.

Always stop by Umiya every time we're at Las Vegas. A must restaurant to visit when in Vegas. Great place for fresh sushi with great service. Staff are always helpful and smiling. Love the place. Can never get enough of the place.

I would give this restaurant 0 star if I can! Bad bad bad service. none of the food really stood out....we  3 girls went to eat. The YOUNG manager charged us 10 dollars with 3 rice left over. If only 3 dollars we would pay. ALSO he had really bad attitude and threaten us that he would call police if we don't pay the 10 dollars....... At the end he throw the check on the table. We were really scare that he would punch us to face at the moment..... Never come bk to this place...

One of the best all you can eat sushi places!  2 stars off for spilling food on the customers.  Seriously, who passes dishes over people's heads? 

Otherwise selection is great and the quality is not bad at all.  And plus they don't make you wait for a long time for the neXt order.

I am reviewing as I'm eating...nom..nom..nom. Why? Umiya event. Show them a review that you're happy and get a Umiya mug. Well, I'm beyond happy! The sushi was 4/5 but the service was above and beyond spectacular, 6/5! So many staff members checking on you and your drinks. Keep the Asahi coming. 

As for the speed of the food coming to your table, wow, blazing fast! Ok, we orders A LOT OF food and thought it would take a while. Nope. Super fast. Thank goodness because the wait was about 40 mins. Well worth it. Talk about hard to find good AYCE sushi places. None exist in Seattle. Sorry Todai but you weren't that good even when you were open. So, next time I'm in Vegas and craving sushi, here we come Umiya!

Last two times we went service has gotten really poor and portions are less with more rice percentage. Music was too loud and staff appeared more concerned about each other (continuously gathering together) laughing, talking, difficult to get their attention but great they all are so happy to get paid to have fun together. Used to think was a pretty good place, but last time one of the sushi servings the fish was clearly spoiled (strong ammonia smell and slimy) we returned it and no one even said sorry or offered any accommodation for that. Serving spoiled raw fish at a sushi restaurant is very serious, disappointing the staff does not realize that.

The fried soft shell crab was super tasty and the oysters were nice and fresh. However, their sushi rolls left a lot to be desired. This will hit the spot if you have a sushi craving, but don't expect amazing food.

Yuuuuum!  This is our go-to place for sushi every time we visit Vegas. The seafood is always fresh. Love the Uni and the oysters. Too bad there's only one order per person.  Can't beat the price for the quality of AYCE sushi you get here.  Make sure you make reservations and a yelp check in gives you a free soda.

This was the first time I walked into a sushi spot where we didn't get no "irrashaimase", sushi chefs all looking down, host's back facing us. When he did turn around it was to ask how many in our party. I normally don't prefer taking the whole crew out for an AYCE sushi, but on this night we did. It wasn't as busy when we entered in comparison to when we left. We were able to get seated pretty quick. The tables are more of picnic style seating where their tables are connected so be prepared to share another end with another couple/family.

Since the whole crew was present, that meant a highchair was needed. I quickly made a mental note to never bring the babies with me when coming here because the highchair is seated at the end of the table where they have this button system...which of course any curious toddler/baby turn into gumby just to press those buttons. Which....gets pretty annoying because the button isn't something you can move off. Therefore, you have to scootch the highchair more towards the corner of the table giving your kid an awkward seating and the potential to slam his/her face on that corner because he/she is throwing a fit over not being able to reach the button. Sigh.

Anyway, they have quite a selection for their AYCE. I found Umiya to be pretty good. I loved how their rolls/nigiris weren't rice/sauce overloaded. No fishy flavors which is a great thing! I personally ordered/tried their garlic tuna nigiri, crispy rice with spicy tuna, salmon lovers roll, vegetable tempura (a brocolli, zucchini, carrot), spicy garlic edamame (which wasn't spicy at all), spicy tuna toll, and their ribeye steak (which is like 4slices of steak served alone). The only thing I didn't really care for was their garlic edamame. I love edamame, didn't love it here. 

The husband had uni, ebi, fried shrimp heads, salmon belly, yuzu yellowtail, unagi, tuna, salmon, and aji. Don't even get me started on the quantities. Lol. He thought they were all pretty good. Typical.

Anyway, they clearly have a system. Water was quickly refilled, plates were quickly cleaned off, service wasn't neglectful at all...out of all the sushi spots we have ever been to...I swear it felt like 5mins after we ordered...we were getting our orders. I connected my eyebrows a few times upon getting our orders because the turn around was ridiculously quick! At this point...it was busy so getting our orders quick and it being busy...that was quite impressive. I looked back at the chefs a couple times convinced there was an octopus working. 

Even though we didn't get the greeting upon entering, my husband never getting his masago and me having to remind the waitress of an order and reminding one of the wait helps of the fork he was supposed to bring...we gave it a 4 because despite it all...thought our experience was pretty deserving of a 4. 

We'd come here again but I don't think this place is as kid-friendly especially if you have one needing to be in a high chair and that damn button system thing. Okay, so the button is to call your waiter over, red button is for your check, and I completely forgot what the other colored button was for but I believe it's for drinks. 

Definitely worth a try if you are looking to try a new spot. I'd say slip bringing the kids in so you can thoroughly bask in the ambiance and enjoy. But if you do bring the kids...highchairs have working buckles! For AYCE...kids ages 3-7 are 12.95 (half-off). Children 8 and up are full price. For desserts...their ice cream are unlimited except for the mochi. 1 each per person.

Enjoy!

They were absolutely amazing, there service was absolutely awesome. They were so helpful and patient. They made sure you had food in front of you and also made sure your food got to you quickly. The food was absolutely delicious

We've tried jjanga and tomo, and Umiya is our favorite out of the three. They have the best tuna and Uni, which are two of our favorite dishes.

They don't have as much as Korean food as tomo, and you have to get nigiri instead of sashimi. But the quality of the dishes (baby octopus, hot appetizers, the tuna and uni mentioned above) are definitely tops in this game.

One other really amazing thing is the speed - waiters are literally flying around and we got our food super fast.

They give you 90min instead of Jjanga's 60min so that's a win too!
Amazing service and such good variety and food!  So fun too as it was our Dad's 70th and the Mochi balls were delish!

It's pretty close to 3.75 stars.  

They offer a few dishes most AYCE sushi joints don't like ribeye Big Wong style, fresh oysters,  and kushiyaki (meat on a stick) options like bacon wrapped scallops.  It's actually a good place to bring that one friend who dislikes sushi.  I also like the all you can drink beer/wine/sake option for $10 more but they said they're going to change it next month.  Ummm....why??  

This location used to be Kaizen and you can definitely tell from the look of the place.  Interesting mix of old and modern and the long tables definitely encourage groups to stay a while.  We sat at the bar to pick the chefs brain on recommendations.  The whole staff was Korean.  Not too much of a big deal for me.  

Sushi standouts were the halibut and super white tuna nigiri.  The chef, Alex, said it was the freshest fish they had and it was great.  There were a ton of great options if you like cream cheese, rolls deep fried or something in unagi sauce.  I am not one of those people but knock yourself out a la Drago vs Creed if you are.  Basic rolls were fine and the freshness was acceptable.    

I was really intrigued that they offered both miso and tonkotsu ramen.  I just HAD to try half a bowl of tonkotsu made by Koreans.  The noodles, broth and 2 big pieces of pork belly were pretty good but it wasn't exactly Japanese ramen.  Koramen?  Alex took pride in the fact he made the broth from scratch as he should..it was tasty but not Japanese by any means.  

Service was definitely on top of things.  There were 3 waiters checking on us throughout the meal and earned their gratuity.
The food here is amazing sushi  is very good if you're staying at palms place and you love sushi this is across  the street come over you will not regret it

My bff took me to this place and I must say, it's a pretty good place. Only down fall is that they are always busy and sometimes they forgot a few items that we had ordered. Other than that, everything was good. Of course this won't be my last visit.

the "all you can eat" at umiya is superb!!!... a lot of great tasting selections at a very reasonable price... I've been loyal to another sushi place for the last 5 years and I think now I've got a new all you can eat sushi spot... service was very accomodating and friendly, food was great and ambiance was relaxing... will definitely recommend this place to family and friends!!!

Went to umiya  with a a 8top and man the waitress and waiters was on point! Really fast pace worker over here! and good sushi! The quality sushi is fresh. I would recommend the miso ramen, garlic ahi, and the sweet shrimp nigiri. I personally didn't like the rib eye because they over cooked mines when I ask for med rare. Other than that I wish they didn't walk away when I try to order a drink.

I absolutely love this place.. there is a small amount of AYCE in town that never disappoint and this is definitely one of them. I started coming here few years back, and it wasn't busy and now they are always packed,but still the wait is never too long and customer service is great. The food is absolutely amazing, always fresh and comes out fairly fast. I highly recommend this place.

Been here twice during my visit to Vegas.

My brother got the All You Can Eat, I got California roll with brown rice, and chicken teriyaki, and hubby got the beef teriyaki. Chicken teriyaki was mediocre at best. Dark meat and SUPER fatty chicken. I will pass next time. Hubby said beef teriyaki was good. Brother's pieces of sushi came in two pieces, the shrimp option looked pathetic. 

There is a good chance I will come back since it's pretty close to the strip, and prices are good for it being Vegas. But I'll stick with just sushi next time.
This place was really good.  Great food. Good price. Trust the reviews. Place fills up quick so hurry over.

I didn't go for the all-you-can eat but had the yellowtail ponzu with jalapeños; lemon tako; Uni and masago sushi and two yakatori skewers for $60. For what it was it was pricey and the yakatori was weak. Over-cooked and smeared in teriyaki sauce to make it palatable. 

I have to admit I expected better or more affordable. If you got the dough to blow for mediocre sushi then go for it. It was my bad. I was in a bind and needed to eat ASAP. 

I probably would either go to a more affordable place or go high-end. This middle of the road gets you crushed.

Best AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas. High quality and mostly everything on the menu is AYCE. Wide variety of food such as oysters, appetizers, ramen, udon, nigiri, and sushi rolls. Food comes out quickly. Ice cream including tempura ice cream included.
