Family just went out for all you can eat sushi at Umiya.  Amazing selection and it included everything on the menu. Even dessert.  My two grandsons also came and they had plenty of options and finished off with a banana split.  Doesn't get much better than that.  

Service was outstanding and food was brought out very fast.  They had sushi bar seating, a small bar in another corner and plenty of tables.  Seemed like larger parties similar to our 6 people.  

Give it a try.  You won't go away hungry!

Best sushi in town, Alaskan roll, kiss of fire, Edamame , beer, tequila. All you can eat sushi is the bomb! 
Excellent service, good atmosphere, can't wait to come back. The garlic edamame is amazing! You won't find a better spot!

Love love love Umiya. It's always busy, but if you have a party of 6 or more you can make a reservation. We come here regularly for the AYCE sushi even though we live in Henderson. The seating is spread out, long picnic tables and some smaller tables in the back. Not as cramped as some of the other sushi spots in town. 

Sometimes it can be a little slow to get your first order in, but once it's in they are good about coming around often to ask if you need anything. Sometimes we have the same wait person and sometimes several come around. They are always pleasant no matter how busy it is. 

Good menu, favorites are the green valley roll and kiss of fire. If you don't like the crab with mayo like us you can say no crab and they are very good about that. 

For dessert ask to hear the sorbet flavors, these are new and not on the menu. Raspberry is my favorite!

Remember the scene in When Harry Met Sally where Meg Ryan is in the restaurant and she acts out the orgasm? Thats how my friends and I felt when we opened up and saw the all you can eat menu at Umiya in Las Vegas!! The price is amazing and the food  exquisite!  Creamy agedashi tofu that melts in your mouth and tuna poke that make me want to poke you (hahaha)! Where else can you find a roll with high self esteem ("I love my ass roll")? Bottom line: skip the strip and eat here for good quality Japanese food that will make you feel like you are sitting at a Tokyo table.
Hidden jewel just off the strip. Great selection on AYCE, will be back every time we're in town!
Good service good food! we did the AYCE and loved the riceless roll. Wine is expensive.

Staying in the Vegas strip, I was craving something more authentic and affordable and less touristy as the typical strip food. Went to Yelp and discovered this place, Went here for the lunch buffet. For around $20 I Was pleasantly surprised. They not only had sushi, but also pork belly, poke(one time order) salads, etc. another good thing is that the rolls are offered as half rolls. This made it easier to try various rolls. From rainbow rolls, to tempura rolls, to scallop rolls, if you can name it, it was probably there. One thing is They do charge for food that is uneaten/ wasted but I didn't have that problem. I plan to visit when I am in town. It was well worth the lyft ride there.

My favorite sushi place to go! They have a lot of options and you won't be disappointed. All the staff there are very friendly and they all acknowledge you and make you feel welcomed. The price for all you can eat is very reasonable. My favorites are the Shrimp Killer & the Rattlesnake Roll. I recommend coming here for sushi. This is the only place I'll go
Anytime I go out to eat sushi I definitely go here it's so delicious and the service there is amazing always making sure my table is good with refills and our orders.

I decided to try this place on the suggestion of my boyfriend. We've both never been, but he wanted to try it after a somewhat disappointing sushi experience on The Strip. This place is delicious! They have all you can eat for $25 for dinner and the menu didn't disappoint. It was a little busy, but we just sat at the bar and still got great service. 

I recommend the salsa dancing roll. They're nigiri is real good too.

Walking into this place I see "all you can eat" signs and then am presented with an "all you can eat menu" and a la carte. Looking at both menus ,most everything I would've tried on the a la carte was on the "all you can eat" so I went for it. And boy was I not disappointed. They have rules about the "all you can eat" menu. Some are 1 order person, some are one piece, etc. we orders the tuna poke, excellent , fresh and succulent , nicely spiced. Followed by oysters - fresh and tasty. Then onto the hamachi- 2 stars, Saba -3 stars and unagi-4 stars. For hot plates, we had the grilled Mackerel -5 stars and chicken skewers- 3 stars. We also orders the baked mussels which was meh. We ended this meal with plum ice cream -3 stars and mango mochi- 4 stars. All this was $21. Spectacular! We also got some hot sake to compliment the meal.  The service was excellent. Once u order, they leave a call button on your table and the servers were very responsive.  Will definitely come back here. It's off the strip about a 6 min cab ride.

This place is the $%#! 
Where do I even start? The prices are right, the food is great, the waiters and waitresses do work; what more can I say?

At around 25 dollars per person, you can get unlimited sushi (Hand rolls, nigiri, special rolls, appetizers, and even dessert! The tempura and the fried soft shell crab was amazing! I just kept it coming. The only thing I didn't really liek was their rib-eye (which you can only get one time) but hey, it's a sushi restaurant; If you want good steak, you wouldn't choose to eat here anyways. I loved the garlic tuna nigiri, and and the salmon belly nigiri. I also loved the pork belly appetizer. 

I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant during future visits to vegas.

I love this place! All of the staff are walking around and attending to everyone so you don't have to wait for your server to come around if you need anything, you could ask anyone.

We opted for the AYCE dinner which has a good sized menu to choose from (4 pages) plus dessert, came out to $60 for two people. Great price for great quality food.

I rarely ever eat raw food besides tuna, and even then I can't stomach too much of it. However, this place changed my mind. I started with their spicy tuna salad (delicious!) and got hooked. Pretty much everything I ordered after that had spicy tuna in it!

We also ordered crunchy lobster roll, oysters, tuna naruto, red mountain, baby octopus, shrimp tempura, crispy rice with spicy tuna, and king of the ocean. Everything tasted great, no complaints from me or my boyfriend, we loved everything.

TIP: most rolls can be ordered half sized so that you don't get full from one roll and you can try a variety of menu items. (5 or 6 piece rolls and the whole deep fried rolls can't be half sized)

Overall, great experience and will definitely return when I'm in town! If only they would open a location closer to home (;

Let me preface by saying that I am not a sushi snob. I have been to dozens of sushi spots, and only one has been disappointing in terms of actual taste. Most sushi places tastes the same to me. So my criterion for good sushi is predicated heavily on atmosphere, service, and deals. On that note, this place was up to par with all three of my criteria. 

It's a pretty place; modern, open, and stylish. It was dinner time and there weren't many people in there -- although, it was a Tuesday night. I like a social atmosphere, so being one of the few groups there was a downer. 

The service was great, outgoing, and very accommodating. They even let us order one last roll out of the 90-minute AYCE limitation. One of the best parts of Umiya is the full bar, a rarity in sushi places. 

The deals were the best part. Very competitive AYCE prices. Also, there were great sake deals with buy two, get one free (we had nine in total). 

All in all, Umiya was a solid place which was perfect for a date.

Still my favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas. My partner is from the Bay Area, CA and was blown away by the quality of meat from this place and the abundant selection of sushi rolls to choose from. We came around 7pm and waited about 15 minutes, we had a huge table to ourselves so that was a plus!

Tip- they no longer offer their Yelp offer of free soda with a Checkin, wish they would make note of that on here.
The best place I've been to soo far i go here often with my boyfriend and we get the all you can eat and it's worth every penny

All you can eat sushi!? That sounded awesome ! When we got there , we got seated immediately with our reservations for 14 people. It was right before it got crowded too. 
We ordered a bunch of stuff and they came out relatively quick. However, the fish didn't seem to taste that fresh and it was alright...
The fried appetizers weren't very appealing either. It seemed soggy almost. 
They also ran out of tea cups for some of us .. So we couldn't get tea .. Not til the end . 

I don't recommend the tempura ice cream.. It tasted so odd... And the ice cream was so bitter.. Not in a good way either.

Started off with the miso soup, edamame, mussels, and seaweed salad; these were all good in my opinion.

Sushi:
Snow White
Shrimp lover
Yellowtail lover
Firecracker

These rolls were alright, they overloaded on the sauce. I also had the octopus and surf clam nigiri, the rice on there was not what is expected of sushi rice it tasted rather old.

Coffee Mochi for dessert was yummy.
 
Service was great, very attentive.

Great appetizers!   Tuna poke salad super good!  Their rice less roles are also unique and I was apprehensive about the cucumber wrapping, but it complimented it well.   

Lunch All you can eat is only $20.95 and is from 12- 3pm.  Service was prompt and they refilled or waters regularly.   I would come back again.

I been to umiya for second time already and this place never disappoints me. This restaurant serves the most freshest uni nigiri in town. To stand corrected all the nigiri fish are fresh here !!! I love the location of this place Becuase it's close to my house. Customer service is always  great to us would definetly visit again with a whole group of friends and recommend this place. Also it's a plus here when you write a review you get a free mug !!!! There you go yelpers.

Found this place for dinner via Yelp during my recent trip to Vegas. I ordered the AYCE option at a value of $25. My daughter had Yakisoba Udon. Sushi is very small but again, it's AYCE so you just have to order more. They let you do one order of Poke (and some other specialties). Atmosphere was cool. Will be back!

I went to Las Vegas many time and bored at the buffets in the casino.  My friend told me about this place, so we went there and tried.  Food and price are good.  Honestly, we had the best meal here at Umiya Sushi for the whole trip.  Kids was enjoying the food too.

For an AYCE spot for sushi this is my go to spot. For the usual price of around $21 for lunch and $26 a person for dinner that gives you access to almost their entire menu. This place gives you quality hand rolled to order sushi, with a casual yet elegant ambience with soft lighting and modern decor, topped off with one of the best customer service in the industry! Fast premium service paired with quality fresh sushi is a perfect combination for a nice date night. $66 including tip for a date night with my lady is awesome! Highly recommended!

I had a great experience at this restaurant. All of the waiters help each other out so you are never waiting for them to come by. The entire staff was friendly. The food was great and came out very quickly. They have a huge selection to choose from and reasonably priced.

LOVE this AYCE sushi place! Just went with my best friend & it was our first time. We love nigiri & theirs is pretty fresh. Very attentive waiters/waitresses & they actually wait until you're somewhat finished before serving your other dishes. 

Overall very good! I highly recommend them for all those AYCE lovers out there.

Keep coming back here because it's the best.  Always have my date nights or girls night out here. You can always count on a good table without a wait and good service from everyone.  The food is fabulous, always fresh and tasty. Unfortunately they added some new rules that limit the AYCE but it's nothing big worth mentioning.  
Always recommend this place to everyone. Will definitely be returning again and again.
Best sushi I've had by far.. The yum yum crab roll is fire!! Not bad for all you can eat, great service and great atmosphere, even my daughters loved it!

I have been to at least 5 AYCE sushi spots in Las Vegas and this place is by far the best. They have a large menu of not just sushi, but with items like ramen, soft shell crab, oysters, and ribeye, etc. The service here is spot on. They all wear walkie talkies so communication between the workers is instant. Also, the price is reasonable. I take all my friends that visits Las Vegas here and everyone loves it.

What can I say. This place ROCKS ! Probably the VERY BEST AYCE SUSHI in Vegas. You will not beat their variety and selection of dishes anywhere in Vegas for All You Can Eat. The quality is A+. The service is excellent and the chefs have a great turn around time rate on orders. If it is a packed house you will still get your orders in a timely manner. The Passion Fruit Iced Tea is delicious too. This raises the bar on AYCE Sushi and it is my Go To place for AYCE. Highest Recommendation.

This place is seriously so AMAZING!!! I live 25 minutes away & I drive all the way over here all the time!! Best all you can eat sushi staff is so friendly & fast. Friday & Saturday's do get busy but the longest I've ever waited was like 10
Minutes!

Went here for lunch.  The food was good, the prices were fantastic and the serving size was perfect. We were in a rush and I wished I had more time.  I ordered the Korean BBQ ribs Bento lunch, and I loved everything except the ribs.  The table also ordered Beef Teriyaki, California Rolls, Chicken fried rice, and one other roll.  The staff are pleasant, helpful and very attentive.  I can hardly wait till next year to go back and try all you can eat $20 for 90 min.

Competition is tough if you're looking to open a sushi joint in Vegas, not to mention an AYCE one. I've been to great places and to pretty unsatisfying ones; Umiya sits somewhere in the awkward middle, dangling towards the unsatisfying.

I'll be brief because this place was not very memorable.

The Good:
Decor (Very nicely decorated, lots of space and table room)
Salmon nigiri
Ika Nigiri
Yelp check-in = free drink

The Bad:
Service (No one even looked me in the eye, let alone acted friendly, aside from the lone waitress)
Yellowtail (Not horrible, but probably one of the worst I've had in Vegas)
Ikura (Noticeably small and tasted kind of funky)
Charge for hot tea

The Okay:
Everything else we ate (all nigiri, mochi ice cream)
Presentation (ex: tuna poke was haphazardly piled onto the place with seaweed salad, looked unappealing, bad cuts of fish)

Fresh oysters offered only for dinner even though it's not indicated on the menu like other dinner-only items. All specials only for dinner as well.

All you can eat quality sushi!  Good place for the family. . . We took the kids and they loved it.  Service was fast and very good. The best service I've had anywhere in a while.  

Food tasted great. A few recommendations: crispy rice, yellow tail, Alaskan roll, salmon skin hand roll, strawberry sake, and pineapple ice cream. Overall, good experience.

This location used to be Kaizen and they changed ownership some while ago.  I'll come her for late night sushi and do a la carte sometimes instead of the ayce.  The ayce is standard like most other places in Las Vegas and reasonably priced.  Pretty good selection of appetizers, rolls and nigiri for the ayce will make sure you get full.  Must haves include the salmon belly, Yuzu yellowtail and whatever specials they have for the day which is written on the wall board.  The restaurant is quite spacious and the picnic bench style tables are great for groups.  Usually I'll sit at the bar or one of the tables that are more private.  Ambience is very casual and energetic with music videos playing on a projector screen centered in the restaurant.  TVs located behind the sushi bar usually show sports center which is great to eat sushi and watch sports to me.
I will NEVER return to this place. The service was bad and I got sick and ended up in the hospital for 3 days.  I ordered the seared tuna. It tasted funny. About 30 hours later, in the hospital.

Eh. What can I say? Just a sub par AYCE sushi restaurant. Everything that was ordered seemed rushed and slop. Nigiri- maguro, hamachi, ono were all cut thinly and uneven, as if cut with an old knife. The tako was clearly over boiled and fishy which suggests it was cooked, frozen, then thawed again. All skewers were overly sauced taking out any flavor of being grilled. Miso soup was warm by the time we got it and lacked any seaweed or tofu. We did order one maki, a cucumber wrap instead of nori. That roll actually turned out to be quite refreshing and fun.

The wait staff seemed like they wanted us out quickly as they insisted on picking up the bill 3 times prior to us finishing our rock hard mochi ice cream. Pretty persistent on us leaving considering there was only 3 tables dining at 930pm on a Sunday night.

I don't know if I'd come back here. Though I'm not a fan of most AYCE sushi joints, I'd suggest Oyshi over here any day.

One of the largest menus I've ever seen. Everything I tried was excellent. I plan to return next week when I get into town.

So I just came back and ordered their No Money No Honey & Peter Pan Rolls. Both are excellent. So happy to be back. I highly reccommend eating here! Great food, great service, every came out super fast.
Best sushi in town, this time I had the Rice cake and spicy salmon roll, it was very good as usual. The service is fast and pleasant, definitely I will visit again soon.

We went in on a Sunday evening for dinner. The food was good. Definitely felt like there could have been much less rice on the Sushi. This is key when wasting food, including rice, will cost you. Still thought it was worth it. $26 per person for all you can eat sushi sounded scary. I mean 2 specialty rolls cost that. However the quality was actually good. I'd recommend this place.

Arrice at the restaurant around 11:30pm(July 2,2017) and leave around 12:50am on July 3 2017!!!

Worst service (water and ice tea was never REFILLED, constantly keep on reminding the server where is our order)  and food preparation (everything tasted horrible and take minimum 20mins per order!!!) Soft shell crab roll was oily and shaggy, seafood dynamite scallop taste BAD, other sushi rolls we ordered wasn't up to standard all taste old, not fresh and also our rolls order keep taking forever to get to our table we keep on reminding the several different servers about our food order. 

SIMPLY THE WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD DINING HERE AT UMIYA!!!

Came back the next few hours later around 7pm (on July 3 2017) talked to the manager he took me to the back and I explain everything and he simply said I will talk to the owner and send me off my way. He took down my phone number and name but the manager or the owner never called me back with the follow!!! 

I WILL NEVER EVER EAT HERE EVER AGAIN THE WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD THIS IS SIMPLY RIDICILIOUS!!!

When you arrive at a restaurant during prime lunchtime and see more staff then customers you should turn around and leave and that is what I wish I had done at Umiya Sushi yesterday!! What a major disappointment this place was. Service was terrible; we had to ask for someone to take our order because the staff was busy chatting. We had to ask for our drinks twice. The teriyaki beef was so tough that I couldn't chew it. I ordered scallop & bacon skewers and got shrimp and bacon instead. Several dishes ordered we didn't get and got tired of trying to wave somebody down to ask for them finally just giving up. Sauces are thick and mayo based with zero flavor. Spicy tuna is NOT spicy. My friend who loves AYCE sushi places said it was the worst one she had ever been to so I guess that says it all !!!

OMG ! ! ! The best sushi that I have ever had in my entire life!!!! All you can eat $35 :D
No place in the world can bring you the entire ocean like this place can, everything is delicious and they're dessert "Mochi" will make any athlete forget there own figure when they taste just one... So good you'll forget your abbs!!! Everything was amazing, we laughed, we ate, we walked out like two happy Buddhas ;-)))

Finding a good sushi can a little difficult but when we got to this place we sat down right away the server acknowledged us right away. Some of the rice on some of the rolls were falling apart but other than that the taste was great I would definitely be coming back here not to mention the staff was great too!
Nice spot with a good sushi. I ordered sushi for four people to go and paid around 45 dollars. I got huge pack of sushi and it was enough for big party. Thank you

$26.95 for dinner. Hot tea is $2. There's buy two drinks get one free during their 4pm-2am happy hour. 

Service seemed promising at first but as soon as they got busy for the dinner rush, it went downhill FAST. They should have staffed better on a Saturday evening, and dinner for that matter. 

The place is run by Koreans by the looks of it (if it matters to any of you). The tuna, salmon, and yellowtail were actually pretty good, IMO. Uni and sweet shrimp were pretty awful.  I didn't try the sweet shrimp nor uni personally but my friend wanted to gag on the sweet shrimp. I liked the tamago and masago. For dessert, they have tempura ice cream, regular ice cream, mochi ice cream, and banana split. Didn't get my spicy tuna salad either :(.

It took awhile to order when it got busy so it also took awhile to get our orders. We even ordered dessert (1 item per person) but never ended up getting them cause it took too long so we just left. We had already paid by then.

To sum it all up, for the price and my first experience, I will most likely not be coming back. I didn't try any of the rolls personally since I can only eat so much in one sitting. I think the sushi itself wasn't too shabby (for the ones that I tried) but the overall experience was just bleh. Hence the 3 stars as opposed to 2.

Their AYCE menu is pretty extensive, though. So if you can eat a lot, you can try a whole bunch of shiznits. Like pork belly, ribs, skewers, and salads among other things. I wouldn't say to not give it a chance, but just saying my first experience didn't make me keen on going back.

Super disappointed.  The food is really good, but we went for All-You-Can-Eat dinner.  There were 4 of us, and we ordered 5 rolls, but in the hour and 15 minutes after that, the waitress never came back to take our order.  We had to leave, so we paid $25.00 each for a total of 5 sushi rolls and 2 bowls of miso soup.  Very disappointing!  We could have gone elsewhere and paid half that ($114 plus tip) for 5 sushi rolls.

It's a shame, because I enjoyed the food, but I was extremely frustrated to pay so much for so little.

We arrived around 6:30pm and were immediately greeted and seated upon arrival. We chose to sit at the sushi bar. The customer service is exceptional! They are very attentive and friendly. The service and food is very fast. The fish is fresh. Best dish is the tuna tataki with AJ sauce. The Bunny blueberry sake is delicious. They do charge additional for fresh wasabi, but it is well worth it. Thank you Umiya! We will definitely return! New fav sushi restaurant!

Honestly the sushi here is not that great compared to other AYCE places in Vegas. Sushi twister is still my go to spot, but its a bit far from the strip, about 20 minutes out. Ive been here 3 times now and sadly the best part of this place is their hot dishes. Bacon scallops are delicious, even though they are the sizs of a nickle. The sushi was a huge disappointment my last visit a couple of days ago. Like alot of other reviews say, the fish just doesnt taste that fresh like its been sitting at room temp for too long. And the unagi is a bit on the rubbery side compared to good fresh and properly grilled unagi that is flaky and delicious. The salmon belly honestly had a sour aftertaste which totally ruined my appetite for raw fish from this place. The salmon roe is way saltier and fishier than at sushi twister.
Probably wont be back for a while. I also find it funny that all the employees yell japanese greetings even though they are all korean but thats beside the point. All the sushi chefs are young korean dudes, and you can tell they dont put enough pride into their sushi here.. the taste just isnt nearly as good as the competition.

This is the best A.Y.C.E. SUSHI I have ever eaten. anywhere.  in any country. The service is outstanding the quality is impeccable we felt so comfortable here. Never waited a minute for anything. 
This is a must go!!!!! Thank you Umiya

I have been here multiple times now and it's always the same amazing quality. I bring people for all you can eat for lunch and also have been here for dinner. My favorite appetizer is the monkey brains. Avocado stuffed with spicy tuna then tempura fried. Amazing!! Every roll I have tried is amazing and I'm slowly trying every one on the menu!! This is now my favorite sushi spot in town!

****DO NOT EVER GO HERE**** I don't care how good the pictures look or how many good reviews it has. We ate here Friday night, April 24, 2015 and I am extremely SICK. I've been in the bathroom expelling for 2 days. The fish was old and under temperature. This restaurant is FILTHY AND NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN.  I've read some other reviewers who've experienced the same as me!!! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

Quality was great. And food selection was awesome.  The only issue I would have is that they urge half price for a three year old whonomlyneats miso soup and rice.  Ridiculous.  Makes me not want to go back. Ugh.

This is a wonderful establishment for a Japanese AYCE restaurant.  The staff here were not only quick with all the orders but they were also very warm and welcoming. This is my first review of a restaurant. I felt that it needed to be recognized for the great service. 

The food is made freshly  as you order. I normally do not like eating at an AYCE restaurant but I was in Vegas so we had to check one out. I was curious but reluctant at first however I was pleasantly surprised when the first orders of food came out.

If you're in town and have a big appetite for good Japanese food then drop on by whether it is in the middle of the day or late into the night. Highly recommend it!

I really don't get all of the great reviews for this place - this wasn't the worst sushi I've ever had, but it comes pretty close to the bottom of the list. If it matters to you, this is a very Korean sushi place, not Japanese run - complete with K-pop videos and a particularly cute flower boy (pretty) waiter who looked straight out of my Korean dramas. 

Service was very friendly and since it was empty, the food came out ridiculously fast. This is normally a positive, except that in this case, speed meant careless and sloppy sushi. I got mostly nigiri and everything seemed pretty fresh, but the rice was borderline hard, and the nori was coming off nigiri and hand rolls. My friend's fancy rolls were ok, but drowned in way too much sauce. 

One of the daily specials was ocean trout, which I've never tried before, but now LOVE - it's really similar to salmon, but better somehow... Spicy tuna on crispy rice was the only other thing I'd say was good. They didn't have a few of the sides pictured on yelp like the fish collar, and nothing that we tried was really above mediocre. 

Rib eye was half well done, half rare. Japanese hamburg steak (like salisbury steak) was ok, but weird to serve it without rice. Ika yaki grilled squid was rubbery but not bad. Poor grilled baby octopus skewer was just cooked to hell, but I liked the kochujang sauce. Teri chicken was a big bowl of chicken w/ lots of stir fried veggies, friend said it was ok. Soft shell crab tasted like old oil. Pork belly was soft, but not much flavor. Seared tuna with AJ sauce (whatever that is) was a mess, but tasted ok. Uni was sweet and better than some other ayce places. Spicy scallop wasn't spicy at all, and was barely even scallop - it was mostly mildly spicy imitation crab. 

We mostly came here because of positive yelp reviews, along with some miscommunication on which sushi place a friend had recommended (we found out later that she wasn't talking about Umiya). Unless I came to stalk the cute Korean waiter, I won't be back. I always forget to abide by the rule where if a sushi place has majority non-Asian customers, you should just leave. Every single crappy sushi place I've been to, I look around before we leave and it's a lot of non-Asians enjoying an awesome california roll. Racist to say...sure, but it's been true so far at least in my experience.
Fist of all you have to finish everything at the all you can eat part or you have to pay for it...I mean what the heck is that...well I paid but never again!

Best Sushi ever a most have while I  Vegas... wow it was a real treat!!! Found it by chance only .7 miles from the Rio and truly enjoy it, you can tell is a locals favorite... great service and menu amazing variety of food and excellent freshness and flavors

This place has a good idea of fun rolls but is super anal strict of sharing. Came with friends with hopes of a good meal, but it was hard to enjoy it with the servers watching us like hawks thinking we were sharing! They even threatened to charge us extra in the middle of our meal...and when I say threaten, I mean, they were mean in the way they informed us. Trust us, the joint was not that great for us to be lying about sharing. We couldn't get out of there quick enough. 

If you're looking for all you can eat sushi, you're safer in going to Bacchanal for all you can eat sushi without the harassment of staff giving you the stank eye.

Ok.... As a business owner I'm telling you up front to take my review with a grain of salt.  Here's why.  

#1  It's a Wednesday that I'm writing this review.  I know many sushi restaurants don't carry their freshest stuff on Wednesday's but that it comes in for the weekends.  I get it.

#2 After coming here did I find out it's an "all you can eat" kinda place.

With that as a preamble here's my review.

At roughly $26 per person for all you can eat ... I mean ... what do you expect really?  Top shelf uni?  Top shelf ... anything?  In any case when I see 4.5 stars on Yelp where I come from (New York) I expect buttery toro, perfect texture uni ... so creamy, baby yellowtail, king salmon, kunomoto oyster, live scallop ... if  you've ever eaten top shelf YOU KNOW EXACTLY WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT.  Apparently 4.5 stars in Las Vegas is NOT THE SAME as 4.5 stars in New York.  THAT'S FOR SURE.

Did they have uni? Yes. It was so mushy though and two of the four pieces were various colors ... :-/  

The ikura (salmon roe) was rubbery. The true test of fresh salmon roe is that it POPS in your mouth.  That is 4.5-5 star quality.  Is it just me or do people in Las Vegas don't know great sushi?  Did I catch them on a bad night?  IDK... I've been here to Raku twice and both times during the week it was off the hook and met my expectations.

To it's credit ... the staff was very helpful and the service was FAST.  I love fast service. 

With regards to the food ... large quantities at cheap prices always seems good but if you've ever really experienced top shelf sushi/sashimi and you're looking for that here... uh uh.

You've seen what I said regarding the uni and ikura.  To it's credit the yellow tail was very good as were the two special rolls we ordered which were the salmon everything kinda roll and the yellow tail lover roll.  See ... when you go to any sushi restaurant you'll always find the best "flavor" in special rolls where they can cover up the freshness that you would otherwise find in their sashimi dishes and when you order the "all you can eat" you are prevented from ordering sashimi.  :-/  THAT'S BECAUSE they want you to fill up on the rice.  As a business owner I get it ... it makes sense. ;)  But if you are a true sushi connoisseur ... homey don't play dat. By the waiters suggestion I did order the oysters and to their credit they were really good but were they "great"?  Sorry.  I like my oysters ice cold.  Call me a sushi snob but I like my raw fish fresh and cold.

So ... my recommendations for a person coming here.

If your sushi habits are to have all you can eat on a budget ... this is the place for you. $26 per person... you can't beat it.

If however you are a sushi snob like I am and you've been spoiled with the likes of top shelf raw fish ... don't bother coming here while in Vegas.  Face the facts ... you've going to have to bite the bullet and check out some of the higher end places.  

I'm willing to come back here on a weekend and see if I'm wrong but ... we'll see. Till then ... no more than 2 stars.

Came here with three other people at like 2pm on a Saturday. We were seated pretty quickly after like 15 minutes of waiting. Once we got seated, my boyfriend and I checked in on Yelp with the waitress to get our free sodas but our 2 other friends were still logging into their accounts. 

They apparently switched waitresses on our table and another girl came; with whom my other 2 friends showed their Yelp checkin. My boyfriend and I told our new waitress that we had already checked in with a different waitress. No big deal. 

However, halfway through our meal, our waitress came back and gave us problems for not checking in with her on Yelp and asked who we had checked in with and whatnot. 

...it's a free soda...it's not a big deal...relax lady. 

Anyways, staff was overall a little rude and unhappy the whole time. The food was okay but the service could definitely be better.

Very tasty food, some items are very unique compare to the other sushi buffet I have been too. Some items are limited to one per person, but I would prefer this then they lower the quality to match the cost. Definitely worth a visit.

Best all you can eat sushi in Vegas BY FAR! Service was great, rolls were amazing and for $20.95 for lunch you can't beat it! Our newest favorite hidden gem in Vegas! Can't believe we hadn't heard of this place before! definitely recommending to everyone I know!

Service was outstanding. Food was above average and for AYCE, it was very good.

We had a reservation for 18 and there was no wait at all for us, even though the place was packed. They had 3 long tables waiting for us. Awesome. 

Our waiter Tony took control right away and sectioned us into 3 groups of 6. He started getting orders for each group and he did not miss one order. 

We ordered do much food, these are the highlights:
The Best:
*Tsubu Gai (giant clams) super tender and clean tasting.
*Yuzu Hamachi - Yuzu definitely elevated the freshness of the hamachi. 
*Salmon Belly - yum
*Uni - creamy goodness. 
*Fresh Oyster - I had 6 of these by myself YUM! 
*Bacon & Scallop Skewer - small, but wow was it good. 

The Good:
*Tuna Pokè
*Marinated Pork Belly
*Rib Eye Steak
*Baked Mussels
*Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream 

The Bad:
None

Price was reasonable. Comparable to other AYCE I've been to. 

Tip: free soda with Yelp Check in. 

Our last family dinner on this LV trip turned out to be the best. They accommodated a big group and provided good food and excellent service. Go try them out, it's definitely worth a visit =)

When I heard all you can eat, I was already game. But when I heard all you can eat sushi, I was even more intrigued. As my first time visiting the city of excess, I was super stoked to eat to excess from one of Vegas' many bountiful buffets. But what's this you say?! There's actually a restaurant that lets you eat as much sushi to heart's content at a capped cost? Don't mind if I do!

Not only was the service eager to please and friendly, but the options were as plentiful as the portions. I tried some grilled peppers, tempura jalapeno peppers with cream cheese and tuna, wonderful, spicy yellow tail roll, and melt-in-your mouth yellow tail sushi nigiri. The most unique element was that you had the option to roll your sushi in brown rice instead of white - not healthier but a whole new texture, too!
Let me tell you so amazing for great large parties they def know how to serve you well and it's always a ball coming to them I swear I have another great sushi place I love to death
Great selection of food. All you can eat has a great selection of delicious rolls and other type of dishes you can order from. Courteous  servers it was a great place to eat sushi

Just came from here and the customer service earns it 4 stars from me.  Alex, the sushi, chef was very nice and engaging.  He asked me my name and where I was from and honestly made it seem like he would like my repeat business.  I felt very welcome and he seemed genuine.
When I come back to town this will be the first AYCE sushi place that I will hit.  The waiter and waitresses were nice, some of the kitchen items came out slow, but I was kept entertained.  Alex explained to me and another customer some of the ins and outs of fish mongering.  He also fixed us two special nagiris. I am now a fan of the Ono! 
If you read this, thank you Alex and staff for a wonderful meal experience.

LOVE LOVE LOVE AYCE SUSHI!

Every time I come to Vegas I have to try a AYCE place. This place is kinda small and the wait can take a while but it is worth it. 

The service is exceptional as well. I had a check in on yelp for a free soda so I took advantage of that.

I love uni and I am glad that they include that as part of the AYCE dinner. They limit you to 2 orders per person. BUT in each order is 2 pieces not one!! Their fresh fish such as tuna, salmon and yellow tail nigiri is soo good as well!

They say they have a 90 minute time limit, but they do not really enforce it. 

They have such a huge selection and i was not dissapointed. The ambiance was lit as well! they have music videos and hip hop playing. Such a good vibe.

I will definitely come back here again!

I am a newb in the sushi world, but my fiancé and his best friend are experts. We have a usual AYCE sushi place, but by complete accident, we found this place.

They have entree stuff listed with the AYCE menu such as steak and chicken, which is great. Also, they have ramen.

The appetizers included in the AYCE are more than the typical gyoza. I had a "Who's Your Daddy", a fried ball of shrimp and other stuff. Delicious. The spicy rice cake on a skewer? Must have for anyone that likes spice.

The huge negative here? The kitchen time is absolutely horrible. Throughout the whole time, the food coming out was pretty slow. But towards the end, I ordered one last order of tempura shrimp and a spicy rice cake skewer. Our friend ordered dessert, and my fiancé wanted to wait for me to get my order before placing our dessert order. For the scoops of ice cream that our friend ordered, it took at least 20-25 minutes. My food never came out. We asked about it, and they apologized and said the kitchen claims it's coming. We had to be somewhere in the next 20 minutes, so we left without my last order. Our friend did let us try some of her plum wine ice cream, though, and it is a MUST. I don't care if you hate plums or wine. You have to try this.

The quality of sushi you get for all you can eat at a $25 dinner price tag is superb. To say the service is prompt would be an understatement. Sushi chefs are all really cool guys. The entire menu is included in all you can eat. The atmosphere and decor is modern and has a great vibe. I honestly don't what else you could ask for. Love this place!
Excellent service. A+ food all you can eat. Awsome place. Will come back again. They welcome everyone in and say thank you on the way out.

Top notch service and top notch food and variety! We ate here for three nights in a row and wish they open one in our home city in Texas.
This is awesome!!!!

Usually this is my go to AYCE sushi spot, but the service has definitely gone down from the multiple times i've been here. My party and I ordered around 12:45pm ((and keep in mind that this is not the usual busy hours)), they brought out all the appetizers after 40+ minutes and we just wondered why our nigiri and rolls didn't come out shortly after. Come to find out that our server didn't put in our order, which she didn't apologize or even try to compensate for our forgotten order that we had to wait 40 minutes for. Instead another server decided to charge us for not eating a small portion of rice.

On top of that, usually when ordering nigiri the rice is half the size of the fish but it seems that they're choosing to up the size of the rice so that you get full faster :(

You definitely won't catch me eating AYCE sushi anymore, Island Sushi is the move!

This is MY place!!! I freaking love it! When I'm wanting to eat sushi this is always my go to. Every time I have gone I leave happy and sooo full. Nice place and the staff are always friendly. Food doesn't take long either! Definitely recommend this place

All you can eat. Off the strip. 

All you can eat option for $26 a person, with terms. You have to eat the rice, or you will be charged. You have to eat everything you order, or you will be charged. There are items that can only be ordered one per person. Sashimi is not available. 

The all you can eat menu is large, lots of appetizer, nigiri and roll options. The menu goes beyond sushi, we did not look at that part. Nigiri pieces are small. Tuna poke is good. We enjoyed all of the rolls we ordered, trying a variety. 

Communal large tables and benches where you share the table with others. Makes it very accommodating for large parties of people. 

Service is fantastic. There are plenty of servers working, walking around refilling water and clearing plates. Not once was our section of the table cluttered. We had more than one server taking our order as well. The food comes out fast.

Was in Vegas came this place all you can eat sushi it was great except for oyster shooters not that great but the rest and the bill was awesome I believe for each person from 12 to 2 o'clock I'm assuming it's happy hour I don't remember but it was great definitely go there again again.

In most AYCE sushi restaurants, the quality of the fish can be sub-par. I admit I was skeptical at first but Umiya came highly recommended from a foodie and it blew my mind!

I don't know if I have any favorite dishes since everything was so good! The albacore melts in my mouth, the oysters were refreshing, the unagi was decadent. 

The yuzu drink was wonderful too!

Lunch was $21 and dinner is $26. SUCH A STEAL! Will definitely be returning on an empty stomach.

Here I thought maybe there is some magic sauce to make  a quality sushi at a cheap price. But what you pay is really what you get. The sushi from this place is flavorless and paper thin. The sushi rice should be seasoned with sugar and vinegar, but these have no seasoning and no shine. 

Come here for the quantity not quality.

This sushi place has been one of my favorites ever since I started eating it. They give you full or half rolls and the customer service is amazing. Rolls come out quick and are always fresh and they give you very large cuts of fish in your sushi. I've been to other places where the wait time is 45+ minutes but this place always treats you like family. Highly recommend!

I love it here! The sushi is so good and there's a huge variety of food to order from on the menu. They are a bit strict though.... The waiter said we had to finish a dish (salad) but he would make an exception just that one time, although there was barely anything left.

While on vacation this past weekend in Vegas we were craving for some sushi but didn't want to eat on the strip. Not much places are opened after 12am but we came across this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. They offer an large all you can eat menu but we decide to do a la carte since we weren't that hungry and we didn't want to eat too much that late. Everything we had were pretty good. Would definitely come back during our next trip to Vegas when we want some sushi

Came here for Mother's Day expecting it's gonna  be packed but the wait wasn't that bad. Had a good time with friends, service was really good and fast too. Looove the "mixed karai!" Also really like the idea of the "tech buzzer" on the table. Thank you for for the wonderful food.
Banana Rolls are my favorite! Service is good! Four stars coz they messed up with our orders!

Best sushi in town in my opinion. I tried a lot of places but Umiya has more of a selection for their AYCE. Service is okay, can be improved but the food makes up for it. Their baked sushi is by far one of the best in town. Try the japanese roll next time you guys stop by, deinitely one of my favorites.
Nice menu for lunch and dinner ayce. Their fish wasn't very fresh and rolls were way saucy. However , I did like the service.
This is now.....after one time....my new favorite sushi joint in Vegas. ACYE sushi at a great price. Flavors kick our previous favorite  sushi place out of the water.

This place is delicious, it has a wide selection of flavorful specialty sushirolls, with cucumber options, also their stuffed tuna jalapeño poppers are delicious! so many scrumptious appetizers and rolls it's hard to chose which to try! love that they have a cucumber wrapped roll option, and multiple salmon and tuna rolls which are my favorite. It is a bit pricier than other AYCE spots, however the rolls are usually worth it.

First time trying Umiya and it was a hit and miss in one seating. I would say the best thing would be their appetizers because they're all so yummy ! I really liked their baked mussels and their bacon wrapped scallops. Also their tuna poke is probably the best around since I'm really picky about what I like ! I tried their oysters and they're really fresh and taste so good !

Moving onto the main course, the AYCE sushi ! I love love love sushi, but it was just alright to me. I had really high expectations, but I was disappointed /: everything tasted so bland and simple, not much flavor to them. And although they had a wide selection, I didn't find anything interesting to try out. Probably the good ones were the spicy rolls, but I didn't try since I wasn't feeling something HOT. Ohwells.... Oh ! And they burnt my rice when making their baked rolls, so be aware !!!!

Overall, I love their appetizer selection. The AYCE was fresh, but not enough flavor to satisfy. And dessert was good, but their tempura part of the tempura ice cream was not good at all for me. 

Not sure if I'll come back /: sorry, I'll be taking my money elsewhere.

I came here for the all you can eat sushi lunch one time. It wasn't super busy which is nice cause sometimes then it's hard to get service if it's to busy. Sucks that some of the menu items are you can only have one per person, and then can't order anymore like the oysters, and some of the other items on the menu. Next time I think I will come with another person, or only get the smaller items cause some of the main rolls you could not get a half order and I was like dang it, almost to much. Mostly cause I usually just want 2 pieces of something then I want to try something else. Unless it was really good then I want to get more. My fav thing I tried here was... the raw oysters, and the baby scallops. I didn't get to find any of the main rolls that I liked alot cause some of the rolls I ordered where the ones you can't order half order with.
